name: Make-A-Wish UK
missionStatement: Make-A-Wish UK create life-changing wishes that restore the childhood that critical illness often takes away, bringing light and joy to children and their loved ones at the darkest of times. However, we can’t currently be that light for everyone. Your generous support helps us step that much closer to achieve our ambition, to grant a wish for every eligible child. Together we have the power to light up the darkness.

name: Adopt-A-Child
missionStatement:
Adopt-A-Child is a Christian Sponsorship programme working hand in hand with sponsors across the world to provide food, medical and dental care, pastoral and practical care, a spiritual hope and a future for thousands of under-privileged children in Guatemala and Albania.
Together we are Changing the World... One Child at a Time.
description: Changing the World .... One Child at a Time

name: Give a Dog a Home
missionStatement: Re homing abandoned dogs from abroad with the help of our small group of fosterers.
description: Help us rescue and re home more abandoned dogs

name: Feed The Hungry UK
missionStatement: We are feeding children living in poverty in 21 countries through our Every Child Every Day programme. We can feed a child for 4 pound a month or 48 pound a year. We also respond with Disaster Relief at global events that occur. We encourage sustainable farming. We send clothing aid out to refugees as well as hygiene and dignity packs. We run food packing and clothing events and engage volunteers in this.
description: Help feed children a meal by donating through our every child every day programme

name: A Better Life Dog Rescue
missionStatement:
TO RELIVE THE SUFFERING OF DOGS IN NEED OF CARE AND ATTENTION AND IN PARTICULAR TO PROVIDE AND MAINTAIN RESCUE HOMES OR OTHER FACILITIES FOR THE RECEPTION, CARE AND TREATMENT OF SUCH ANIMALS;
TO PROMOTE HUMANE BEHAVIOUR TOWARDS ANIMALS IN BY PROVIDING APPROPRIATE CARE, PROTECTION, TREATMENT AND SECURITY FOR DOGS WHICH ARE IN NEED OF CARE AND ATTENTION BY REASON OF SICKNESS, MALTREATMENT, POOR CIRCUMSTANCES OR ILL USAGE
description: Help to give a dog a new life

name: A Little Gesture A Great Help
missionStatement:
Our mission: Promote the improvement of living conditions for underprivileged children and their families in Mozambique 
Theory of Change: We believe that access to education and nutrition, in a healthy and dignified environment, will help children and young people from Mozambique break the cycle of poverty
description: Your Little Gesture counts - break child poverty in Mozambique!

name: 1 DOG AT A TIME RESCUE UK
missionStatement: Stray dogs in Romania lead hard, terrified and frequently short lives trying to survive on the streets where they face starvation and cruelty.  Often abandoned in remote places, they are left to die of hunger or untreated illness.  We rescue these dogs, and take them to our shelter 'Happy Tails' where they are given medical care, food, warmth, and where they feel loved and safe, generally for the first time in their lives.   We then care for them until loving forever homes can be found for them in the UK.
description: Please help us save a furry life, and turn despair to loving care

name: 2 Wish Upon A Star
missionStatement: 2 Wish Upon A Star provides bereavement support for families who have suddenly and traumatically lost a child or young adult aged 25 years and under.  Charity Number 1168140.
description: We provide support for bereaved families to cope with the sudden loss of a child.

name: Little Hearts Matter
missionStatement: Little Hearts Matter offers support and information to the children, and their families, born with only half of their heart and works to raise awareness of the needs of all those affected by these incurable conditions.
description: Help support families through every step of their half a heart journey

name: A Second Chance Rescue
missionStatement: We are a non profit organisation who takes in and rehome unwanted and abandoned dogs.
description: we are completely self funded and run entirely by dedicated volunteers

name: A Child Of Mine
missionStatement:
A Child of Mine supports families and works alongside healthcare professionals when a child has died.

We provide confidential emotional support, practical information and guidance to families, and provide training and education for professionals.  We also provide several groups for parents and both younger and older children who have lost a sibling.  These groups provide a safe, friendly environment where they can meet others who understand.
description: Help us to make a difference

name: A Rocha International
missionStatement:
A Rocha is a Christian organization engaging communities in nature conservation. 

Working in 20 countries, our projects focus on scientific research, community-based conservation, environmental education and theological training.
description: Support community conservation projects around the world

name: When You Wish Upon A Star
missionStatement: When You Wish Upon a Star aims to grants the Wishes of children living with a life threatening illness from to the age of 4 to 16 years across the UK
description: Your support will help create magical memories for very sick children

name: African Children's Educational Trust (A-CET)
missionStatement: A-CET the small dynamic independent registered charity with minimal overheads run since 1993 by dedicated, experienced professional volunteers supporting work in Ethiopia. We fund high impact targeted community-led school building & furnishing projects providing places for over 10,000 students from Grade 1 up to Grade 10. Our long-term full scholarship support programme assists the severely disadvantaged, disabled, orphans or abandoned youngsters through education to lead brighter self-supporting lives.
description: Help us educate Ethiopians so that they can develop Ethiopia

name: A One Parrot rescue
missionStatement: To promote humane behaviour towards birds by providing appropriate care, protection, treatment and security for birds, in particular parrots and parakeets and birds of prey which are in need of care and attention by reason of sickness, maltreatment, poor circumstances or ill usage and to educate the public in matters pertaining to bird welfare in general and the prevention of cruelty and suffering among birds
description: Help Us Make The Difference

name: Spread a Smile
missionStatement: Our mission at Spread a Smile is to brighten the days of seriously ill children and teenagers in hospital by taking teams of entertainers into paediatric and adolescent wards. We take magicians, musicians, fairies, poets, singers, face painters, artists and two Pet Therapy dogs into Great Ormond Street Hospital, University College Hospital, The Royal London and St. Mary's, to bring much-needed joy, light and laughter to these courageous children and teenagers.
description: Brighten the days of seriously ill children and teenagers in hospital

name: Starlight Children's Foundation
missionStatement: Starlight Children's Foundation is the national children's charity that exists to preserve childhood throughout serious illness. We do this through our hospital play and distraction services, wish granting and Starlight escape programme. We help children and their families to escape the routine and reality of treatment
description: Donate to help seriously ill children experience childhood as it should be

name: Action for A-T
missionStatement: Action for A-T raises money for medical research to find a cure or medical advancement that will enable children who suffer with Ataxia-Telangiectasia (A-T) to live a longer and healthier life. Please visit our website at www.actionforAt.org for more information.
description: "Funding Research, Finding Hope" for families and children living with A-T

name: Life For A Kid Foundation
missionStatement: Life For a Kid was set up in March 2009 with the aim of helping children under the age of 16 by offering funds and equipment to help them lead a better life and to also help children who require life saving or life changing operations.
description: Support and Promote Autism, Special Eductional Needs

name: Help for Heroes
missionStatement: Help for Heroes was founded in 2007 to provide direct, practical support for wounded, injured and sick Veterans, Servicemen and Women and their loved ones.  Show them your support by buying and selling on eBay.
description: Give now to support a wounded soldier.

name: YMCA Doncaster
missionStatement:
We're an independent charity, bringing together local people and organisations to support young lives in Doncaster.

We focus on meeting the needs of the town's most vulnerable young people, and the core of our work is in providing support with finding a home and leading a responsible adult life. Our priority is our Supported Accommodation for 30 young people who would otherwise be homeless.
description: Every penny raised supports young lives in Doncaster.

name: The Guide Dogs for the Blind Association
missionStatement:
Guide Dogs exists to provide life-changing services to the 360,000 people who are registered blind or partially sighted, and the two million people in the UK living with sight loss. 
We are best known for our world-famous guide dogs, but our work now encompasses so much more. In recent years, we have expanded our services beyond our dogs to help thousands of people with different needs lead confident, independent and fulfilling lives.
description: Donate now to help train a puppy to become a guide dog.

name: Give A Dog A Bone
missionStatement:
By offering every household easy access to free public furniture-collection services the CIO actively facilitates resource recovery and waste management with respect to household items and furniture that are recyclable and therefore can be reused.

By recirculating reusable household items at a discount to low-income and benefit claiming residents the CIO actively addresses wealth disparities within communities with a view to relieving social poverty.
description: Community Recycling with Give a Dog a Bone

name: L & A dog rescue
missionStatement: We are a dorset based animal rescue dedicated to the rescue of sick, injured and abandoned animals with in the UK.  We rehabilitate and then rehome to suitable homes. We never put a animal down enless for the health and wellbeing of the animal.
description: every bid will save a life

name: A Mile in Her Shoes
missionStatement: We want to see a world where women recovering from homelessness or affected by multiple disadvantages are helped to find their feet. We help develop inclusive communities where women can feel good about themselves through running-related fun and fitness, bringing them together to enjoy the physical, mental and social benefits.
description: Help homeless women change their lives with running and fitness

name: 4 Steps To A Smile
missionStatement: We aim to help disadvantaged children and adults. Anyone that has suffered domestic violence and unhealthy relationships.
description: People helping People

name: Give a Kidney - one's enough
missionStatement:
Give a Kidney was set up in 2011 to promote non-directed (altruistic) living kidney donation. The founding members include 10 people who each gave a kidney to a stranger. Most people have two kidneys, but you only need one to live a healthy life. 

The statistics are shocking: around 250 people in need of a kidney die each year - that's almost one every day - and around 5,000 people are on the NHS waiting list for a kidney transplant. 

Our mission is "no waiting for a transplant for want of a kidney."
description: Help us save lives by raising awareness of non-directed altruistic living kidney donation.

name: Horsham Matters
missionStatement: Horsham Matters seeks to develop, commission and deliver services that enable the churches of Horsham District to offer practical support, demonstrating God's love and concern for local residents to show that Horsham matters.
description: Horsham Matters Ltd is a social enterprise set up by Horsham Churches Together (HCT) whose

name: Great Ormond Street International Promotions Ltd
missionStatement: Every day brings new challenges at Great Ormond Street Hospital (GOSH). Every day, 619 children and young people from across the UK arrive. Every day, doctors and nurses battle the most complex illnesses, and the brightest minds come together to achieve pioneering medical breakthroughs. And every day is a chance for you to make a difference. This extraordinary hospital has always depended on charitable support to give seriously  ill children the best chance to fulfil their potential.
description: A better future for seriously ill children starts here.

name: A-T Society
missionStatement: Ataxia-Telangiectasia is a rare genetic life-limiting condition. The A-T Society offers essential information, equipment, support and research to help everyone affected by A-T live their life to the fullest.
description: Make a real difference to the lives of people living with A-T in the UK and worldwide

name: Christadelphian Meal-a-Day Fund
missionStatement: Christadelphian Meal-a-Day supports sustainable down to earth projects that focus on supporting vulnerable children, the provision of clean water, agricultural skills, basic health care and education and a meal a day.
description: Christadelphian Meal-a-day UK currently works mostly in Africa and also in E Europe

name: Team Hill Charitable Trust
missionStatement: Team Hill Charitable Trust is a Charity set up to 'Make a Difference' in the world - raising money through a variety of Challenges and social events - to inspire others and to support local people and good causes and projects in Uganda providing homes, health care and education for children and young people. #TEAMHILL #MAKINGADIFFERENCE #WORKINGTOGETHER
description: Team Hill Charitable Trust’s mission is to 'Make a Difference' in the world.

name: Comic Relief
missionStatement: Our vision is to create a just world free from poverty. We’re doing this by funding and investing in amazing organisations across the UK and around the world. We fund a huge variety of organisations, each one working to tackle the key issues of our time. For more information visit https://www.comicrelief.com/what-we-do
description: Help create a just world free from poverty

name: Dogs Trust
missionStatement: Dogs Trust is working towards the day when all dogs can enjoy a happy life, free from the threat of unecessary destruction.
description: Give a happy home to an abandoned dog: donate to the Dogs Trust.

name: Trust PA Spinal Injury
missionStatement:
Trust PA works to fund development life-changing Repair Treatments Spinal Cord  Injury Paralysis for men women and children
FACTS Daily in UK 3 more are paralysed in broken neck or back accidents with average age just 19yrs 75% male & over half involve vehicles.  Latest science reveals brilliant new advances to restore their function movement and independence The project needs continued work & finance  to complete trials for NHS Clinics Help us fund TrustPA`s important aims in P-A`s memory www.trustpa.org
description: MissionTrust PA to help bring real life-changing repair for those living with SI paralysis

name: A Breath for Life Children's Charity
missionStatement: A Breath for Life Children's Charity provides affordable hyperbaric oxygen therapy for children with profound neurological problems. We are welcome adults with chronic, long term, neurological problems including stroke, multiple sclerosis, Lyme disease and fibromyalgia.
description: Our Unit is no larger than a double garage. Toilet facility is an outside porta cabin. We

name: Hearing Dogs for Deaf People
missionStatement: Hearing Dogs for Deaf People trains dogs to respond to important sounds and danger signals such as the doorbell alarm clock and smoke alarm. Hearing dogs provide confidence, companionship and reduce the feeling of isolation that deafness can cause.
description: A hearing dog enables a deaf person to live a confident and independent life.

name: Bethany City Church
missionStatement: Independant evangelical church seeking to reach the people of the north east of England from social action work, with asylum seekers, a lunch club for the elderly, youth activities, a drop in Foodbank cafe operating daily, and a kitchen drop in for people in need
description: help us reach the hard to reach in Sunderland, Tyne & Wear

name: Prostate Cancer UK
missionStatement: Prostate Cancer UK is here to stop prostate cancer being a killer. One man dies from prostate cancer every in the hour in the UK and deaths from prostate cancer are set to soar over the next decade. By finding better tests, better treatments, better prevention and better support we aim to dramatically reduce the number of men dying from prostate cancer.
description: Help us stop prostate cancer being a killer

name: Giveadogabone... and an animal a home
missionStatement: Give a Dog a Bone is a young, unique and award winning charity, supporting the over 60s to afford a rescue pet companion - tackling loneliness for the individual and homelessness for the animal.
description: Please consider supporting our cause as it tackles two of societies problems

name: a spell for the unwell
missionStatement: We help financially and emotionally help young adults aged 16 to 50 through chronic and terminal illnesses to improve their quality of living and make sure they know they are not alone.
description: Financially and emotionally helping young adults with chronic and terminal illness

name: A Stroke of Luck
missionStatement:
We provide stroke survivors with access to fitness and wellbeing experts to aid their recovery and rehabilitation, leading them to live a fulfilled life - one they never thought they might achieve.

But we don't stop there. We don't forget about the friends and family who are vital to the rehabilitation of stroke survivors. We understand they need support and guidance too. Our founder is a stroke survivor and he's passionate about supporting fellow survivors and helping their nearest and dearest.
description: Provide Stroke survivors with the opportunity to access PTs to aid their recovery.

name: A.P.P.L.E.
missionStatement:
We support children and young people (aged 8-18) living in disadvantaged circumstances or experiencing difficulties in their lives by providing free, open access recreational, educational and creative activities in out of school hours. Through our activities and the space we create our young people gain life and work skills, confidence and resourcefulness. 
For a full picture of what we do visit our website 
www.apple-play.com
description: Funding helps us provide positive, confidence building  activities for young people

name: Help a Hound
missionStatement: We rehome retired racing greyhounds and ex working dogs. We have kennels to care for these wonderful dogs who we find loving retirement homes for.
description: Your donations buy food and vet bills. which keeps the chairty running. thank you!

name: Mind (NAMH)
missionStatement: We are Mind, the mental health charity. We are here to make sure anyone with a mental health problem has somewhere to turn for advice and support.
description: No one should have to face a mental health problem alone.

name: Cystic Fibrosis Trust
missionStatement: The Cystic Fibrosis Trust is the only UK-wide charity dedicated to fighting for a life unlimited by cystic fibrosis (CF) for everyone affected by the condition. Since we started in 1964 we have dedicated ourselves to promoting excellence in research and clinical care, as well as providing practical support and advice to people with CF and their families. Our mission is to create a world where being born with CF no longer means a life-long struggle.
description: Donate £3 to help fight for a life unlimited by cystic fibrosis

name: Share A Star
missionStatement:
The charity revolves around helping seriously unwell under 21 year old's. We bring back the sparkle in very ill children's lives, by creating magical moments, through our variety of projects that we run. Our main gift is that of a completely handmade and unique holding star, designed and created specially for each youngster because every young person fighting for their lives is a star. 

We also organise outing together with Oakley's Outings!

www.shareastar.org
description: Bring Back The Sparkle

name: Willow Foundation
missionStatement: Willow is the only national charity working with seriously ill 16 to 40 year olds to fulfil uplifting and unforgettable Special Days. Each day is a life-affirming experience that can lift spirits, reunify families and be a source of strength when it is needed most.
description: Donate £2 to fund a special day out for a seriously ill young person

name: Save The Children Fund
missionStatement:
Save the Children believes every child deserves a future. In the UK and around the world, we give children a healthy start in life, the opportunity to learn and protection from harm. We do whatever it takes for children - every day and in times of crisis - transforming their lives and the future we share.
Registered Charity England & Wales 213890. Scotland SC039570.
description: Donate to Save the Children and start making a big difference today

name: RNLI
missionStatement: The RNLI is a registered charity that saves lives at sea. It provides, on call, a 24-hour lifeboat search and rescue service to 100 miles out from the coast of the United Kingdom and Republic of Ireland and a beach lifeguard service on over 200 beaches in England. The RNLI continues to rely on voluntary contributions and legacies for its income.
description: Donate now to help save a life at sea with RNLI Lifeboats and Lifeguards

name: Making A Difference Maidstone
missionStatement: Further supporting those homeless, in addiction, socially isolated/disadvantaged & in crisis in Maidstone, Kent.
description: Help to Make a Difference to those homeless & isolated in Maidstone

name: Tools With A Mission
missionStatement:
Our mission is to collect unwanted tools, refurbish them, sort them into trade kits and send them across the world.  We send around 22 containers filled with over 300 tonnes of tools a year.

We want to support local people supporting their own communities through livelihood creating projects.  We believe there is dignity through work and the ability to provide for yourself and your family.  We believe entire communities can be transformed through training and the provision of tools and equipment.

name: Civil Aid Voluntary Rescue Association (CAVRA).
missionStatement:
1)  CAVRA is one of scores of Independent Lifeboats around the coast of the UK?
2) Since its inception in 1998, CAVRA has been available to assist during:-
Searches for Missing Persons, on Land and Sea.
During Weather related incidents such as Storms, Floods, Snow, Drought etc.
Also we assist other emergency services with Civil Contingencies.
description: To help,protect and save lives

name: UK Friends of Freddie Krivine LTD
missionStatement: Creates awareness of and raises money for the Freddie Krivine Foundation in Israel which provides tennis playing opportunites for both Israeli and Israeli Arab children
description: Help young children develop through sport

name: Claire House Shops Ltd
missionStatement: We care for children 0 - 23 years with life threatening or life limiting conditions and their families from Merseyside, Cheshire, North Wales and the Isle of Man.  Children's hospices are dedicated to enhancing the quality of life, providing specialist respite, palliative, terminal and bereavement care.
description: Help us make a difference !

name: Centrepoint
missionStatement: Centrepoint is the UK's leading charity for homeless young people. It supports more than 10,000 homeless 16-25 year olds into a home and a job every year.
description: Centrepoint give homeless young people a future

name: Amnesty International UK Section Charitable Trust
missionStatement: We are ordinary people from across the world standing up for humanity and human rights. Our purpose it to protect individuals wherever justice, fairness, freedom and truth are denied.
description: Help protect human rights to create a safer, more just world

name: Wouldn't Change A Thing
missionStatement: Making negative perceptions of Down syndrome a thing of the past and helping to change the future for children and young people with the condition.
description: Help us to help make the world a better place for people with Down syndrome

name: A&A Services westmidlands
missionStatement: THE RELIEF OF THOSE IN NEED, BY REASON OF YOUTH, AGE, ILL-HEALTH, DISABILITY, FINANCIAL HARDSHIP OR OTHER DISADVANTAGE, IN WALSALL, IN PARTICULAR BY PROVIDING ITEMS AND SERVICES TO INDIVIDUALS IN NEED.
description: We provide a service for the elderley and homeless we support them in there everyday life

name: German Shepherd Rescue Elite Limited
missionStatement:
To rescue, care for, shelter and where
practical and appropriate to re-home primarily German Shepherd Dogs or cross-breeds,which
have been abandoned, neglected, ill treated or are otherwise in need of such assistance; To
advance the public's education in matters of animal welfare and the prevention of cruelty
towards animals; To advance the public's education in matters of responsible ownership;
description: Help a German Shepherd get a second chance!

name: Miriam J Goodman
missionStatement: We serve the communities of northern Israel, providing compassionate care without regard to one's ethnicity, religion or economic background. We give Funds to build a new protected underground emergency department in the Bnai Zion Medical Center in Haifa, Israel.
description: We must be prepared to help others

name: Action Against Hunger
missionStatement: Action Against Hunger is a global humanitarian organisation that takes decisive action against the causes and effects of hunger. In 2016, Action Against Hunger's global network helped over 14 million people in over 50 countries worldwide, saving the lives of malnourished children and providing communities with sustainable access to safe water and good nutrition.
description: Help feed a hungry child today.

name: The United Kingdom Committee for UNICEF
missionStatement: Unicef is the world's leading organisation working for children. Unicef works in partnership with families, local communities, partners and governments in over 190 countries to help every child realise their full potential.  Registered charity 1072612 (England and Wales) and SC043677 (Scotland). We promise to keep your details safe and we’ll never sell or swap your information with any other organisation.
description: Supporting UNICEF today could change a child's life forever.

name: Youth With A Mission Urban Key London
missionStatement: Activities include homeless outreach, international outreach, bible and missions training, children and youth work, counselling, community development, leadership training, social justice advocacy and reconciliation. We are a christian charity with the purpose of knowing God and making God known through training and community service.
description: We are hoping to expand our mission by renting a new, larger property.

name: Jo's Cervical Cancer Trust
missionStatement: Jo's Cervical Cancer Trust is the only UK charity dedicated to women affected by cervical cancer and cervical abnormalities. We offer information, support and friendship to women of all ages 24 hours a day to ensure they never feel alone on their journey. We provide comprehensive, easy to understand information and also help women get in contact with each other and share stories and tips on how to make it through some of the tough times.
description: support a woman fighting cervical cancer

name: Yorkshire Cat Rescue
missionStatement: Yorkshire Cat Rescue offers a rehoming service to unwanted cats and kittens in Yorkshire.  It has a no-kill policy and neuters all cats and kittens before they are rehomed.  Yorkshire Cat Rescue relies on donations and fundraising to raise money to help the cats and kittens in need.
description: Help us save the life of a starving baby kitten

name: Its-a-copout
missionStatement: LifeBoxuk is a new start up project created by lee williamson in august 2017, were s brand new charity in the process of registering as a fully fledged charity, our aim is donate LifeBox care packages and survival packages to the homeless of Peterborough and the surrounding areas, the charity was set up through personal experiences of being homeless and living in both a hostel and ymca facility, were offering basic admin help to the homeless and small care packages (lifeBoxes) containing basic supplies.
description: To bring hope and sense of purpose to the homeless of peterborough and surrounding areas

name: Just be a Child
missionStatement:
JBAC inspires Kenyan children to read by building community libraries from converted shipping containers.
1,000 children benefit from each of our libraries. They have access to over 5,000 books.
6,000 pupils across 21 schools nearest to each of our libraries benefit from textbooks and storybooks. Orphanages, organisations, schools, libraries and other projects from further afield are given books every time we import our library.
10,000 children and adults benefit from every one of our libraries.
description: Build a library with us. Place a book in a Kenyan child's hand. Donate to us.

name: Sponsor a sibling
missionStatement:
Sponsor a sibling was created in 2016 to support the siblings of children with life limiting and life threatening conditions and also bereaved siblings smile.
This is done by providing various gifts, awards, keepsake packs and much needed free of charge holidays in our Super Sibling caravan.
Sponsor a sibling is managed by volunteers in our homes so every penny donated goes towards making our inspirational siblings smile. 
Please help if you can.
description: You can help us to make our Super Siblings smile by giving a small donation

name: The Royal Marsden Cancer Charity
missionStatement:
The Royal Marsden Cancer Charity raises money solely to support The Royal Marsden, a world-leading cancer centre. We ensure our nurses, doctors and research teams can provide the very best care and develop life-saving treatments, which are used across the UK and around the world. 

From funding state-of-the-art equipment and groundbreaking research, to creating the very best patient environments, we will never stop looking for ways to improve the lives of people affected by cancer.
description: For a future beyond cancer

name: RSPCA Chiltern Branch
missionStatement:
We rehabilitate & re-home animals rescued by the inspectorate & within our local area of Buckingham, Aylesbury & Dacorum.

We're run by volunteers dedicated to ending the suffering of & cruelty towards animals.

We are publicly funded & rely on your generosity to carry out this work.

Please help us provide Safety, Stability, Love & Care for the forgotten, the abused & the unwanted. Because of you we can give them a fresh start with a forever home & bright future they deserve. We Thankyou
description: We might not be able to change an animals past, but we can certainly change their future!

name: Rainbow Trust Childrens Charity
missionStatement: Rainbow Trust Children's Charity supports families who have a child with a life threatening or terminal illness.  Their Family Support Workers become a trusted part of the family providing help wherever and whenever it is needed, without fail.  They can be the difference between coping with the serious illness of your child, and your family falling apart.
description: Help support a family with  terminally ill child.

name: A Child Of Mine
missionStatement:
A Child of Mine supports families and works alongside healthcare professionals when a child has died.

We provide confidential emotional support, practical information and guidance to families, and provide training and education for professionals.  We also provide several groups for parents and both younger and older children who have lost a sibling.  These groups provide a safe, friendly environment where they can meet others who understand.
description: Help us to make a difference

name: Spanish Stray Dogs UK
missionStatement:
We search for kind, caring, patient forever families in the UK to adopt Spanish Stray dogs that have been rescued from the streets of Spain.  These dogs have mostly known sadness, cruelty and have only known a life of neglect and abuse.  If you would like to offer one of our dogs a home please contact us.  Since 2012 we have helped many hundreds of Spanish Stray Dogs find forever homes in the UK.        

We care for around 300 dogs a month and believe one man's trash is another mans treasure.
description: Hundreds of stray, abandoned and neglected street dogs from Spain need your support.

name: Chinese Orphans Assistance Team (COAT) UK
missionStatement: We provide care for disabled abandoned children in Henan province central China. We care for 45+ children and employ a similar number of local people to care for these children. The needs of these children range from mild to severe and/or multiple disabilities. Our funds mainly come from Australia, UK and America. We rely on individuals sponsoring a child and or a staff member. A small part of our funds come from government.
description: We provide love, care and education to disabled children in China.

name: The National Association for Bikers with a Disability
missionStatement:
The NABD provide support & adaption grants to disabled bikers, through accident or illness, to enable them to get back on two or three wheels.
Our aim is to ensure that people with disabilities have access to the freedom and independence of motorcycling irrespective of whether they have a long history of motorcycling or are coming into the world of motorcycling for the first time.
The main aim of the NABD is to ensure that when it comes to motorcycling, a disability should not be a handicap.
description: Over 11,000 bikers back on the road since 1991. Let's give freedom back to some more!

name: Unique - Rare Chromosome Disorder Support Group
missionStatement: Unique aims to provide links between families whose children have similar clinical and/or practical problems caused by rare chromosome disorders. Unique aims to raise awareness of rare chromosome disorders, their high incidence and significance and works closely with professional contacts.
description: Unique is a charity providing help and info to families with a member who is affected

name: The Cure Parkinson's Trust
missionStatement:
The Cure Parkinson's Trust is a patient-led charity which funds ground-breaking research driving towards a cure for Parkinson's disease. 

Our innovative scientists are pioneering new methods which have the potential to stop, halt or even reverse Parkinson's. 

By supporting our work you are giving those living with Parkinson's hope of a better future.
description: Help us find a cure for Parkinson's disease

name: 4louis
missionStatement: we provide memory boxes and other items free of charge to hospitals across the UK for parents who suffer the trauma of miscarriage, stillbirth and infant loss
description: help a bereaved family create memories

name: Anti-Slavery International
missionStatement:
Anti-Slavery International, founded in 1839, is committed to eliminating all forms of slavery throughout the world by investigating and exposing current cases of slavery, campaigning for its eradication, supporting the initiatives of local organisations to secure the freedom of those in slavery or vulnerable to it, and pressing for more effective implementation of national and international laws against slavery.
For further information visit www.antislavery.org
description: For a world free from slavery

name: Orangutan Foundation
missionStatement: The Orangutan Foundation is the foremost orangutan conservation organisation. We are saving Asia's critically endangered great ape by protecting their tropical forest habitat, working with local communities and promoting research and education.
description: SUPPORT A FUTURE FOR ORANGUTANS, FORESTS AND PEOPLE

name: The Fellowship of St Nicholas
missionStatement: FSN needs your help. A local charity supporting children, young people and families across Hastings, St Leonards and surrounding areas offering a wide range of opportunities to build resilience, health and wellbeing. FSN aims to offer free services to local children, young people and families who often due a range of family circumstances and difficulties, find themselves in need of a little extra help. As a local charity, FSN are dependent on donations, grants and the goodwill of supporters.
description: A local charity supporting children, young people and families.

name: Safe and Sound Pound Dogs
missionStatement:
Safe and Sound is a registered charity on the front line of UK death row dog rescue: we specialise in short term crisis management and trouble-shooting for abandoned dogs at imminent risk of harm. 

Primarily an emergency relief rescue, we concentrate on addressing immediate welfare issues: this includes providing emergency accommodation, urgent veterinary care, safe transportation and behavioural support/rehabilitation. 

Each year, we prevent the unnecessary  destruction of around 250 stray dogs.
description: Give a deathrow dog a future by supporting Safe and Sound

name: Birmingham Children's Hospital Chariy
missionStatement: Birmingham Children's Hospital provides a wide range of health services to children and adolescents from across the UK. The Hospital has an international reputation in areas such as liver transplantation, cardiac surgery and neonatal surgery.  Pioneering developments include the first ever successful paediatric triple transplant and a system which provides image-guided surgery for children with brain tumours.	Donations are used to support the continuation of this important work.
description: Help us to give a child in hospital the best possible experience

name: Help a Child Africa
missionStatement: Our charity has been providing support for children in Liberia since 2006. We are currently funding around 100 children in a school in Grand Cess, Liberia and some students in college.
description: Help us to send more children to school, and together we can fight poverty with education

name: Wing and a Prayer, Wild Bird and Owl Haven
missionStatement: Wing and a Prayer, Wild Bird and Owl Haven is a registered charity that offers sanctuary to injured wild birds and owls.
description: Please help us care for, feed and house our sanctuary birds by donating to our charity

name: Waggy Tails Rescue Ltd
missionStatement: The Charity was started in 1994 to save the lives of abandoned and unwanted dogs. We never destroy a healthy dog. We look after sick and elderly dogs in permanent foster homes. We do everything we can to rehabilitate dogs and rehome tham to happy, loving homes. We also offer advice on pet problems.
description: Give a dog a chance of a happy new life

name: Barking Mad Dog Rescue
missionStatement:
Barking Mad Dog Rescue is a UK based charity which provides food, veterinary support and where appropriate finds adoptive homes for the dogs in our shelters in eastern Romania. With an average of 600 dogs to care for, plus several hundred others that we donate food for, fundraising is ongoing and essential. 
Dogs in Romania are some of the most persecuted in Europe. We routinely pick up dogs who are victims of abuse or road accidents. Every dog matters.
description: Please feed a dog today, reach out and save a life. www.barkingmaddogrescue.co.uk

name: A Call To Action (ACTA)
missionStatement: We are a group of Catholics, some of whom are ordained, brought together by our love of Christ's Church and our anxiety about its future. Still inspired by the Second Vatican Council, we want to contribute fully to the life of our Church so that we may be a more effective sign of the Kingdom of God. To do this, we believe that an atmosphere of openness and dialogue both with each other and with our church leadership needs developing. Accordingly, we aim to supply channels of free and frank communication.
description: Help us create free and frank communication for all.

name: Harvest Of Grace Trinity Centre
missionStatement: Harvest of Grace Trinity Centre is a charity that supports the homeless and vulnerable people A place of change where holistic support is offered Our soup kitchen is dedicated to serving Gods precious poor and homeless Preparing and serving free breakfast hot lunch and providing a take out bag with a sandwich and other goodies for later in the day We support and empower all disadvantaged young people rough sleepers destitute refugees and vulnerable older people in the community
description: TRANSFORMING HOMELESS AND REFUGEE LIVES

name: Acorns Children's Hospice Trust
missionStatement: Acorns Children's Hospice provide care, support, fun and laughter for life limited or life threatened children and their families. We understand that family time is precious when a child's life is limited and we support families in any way we can to create lasting memories.
description: Help make a difference to local life limited children and their families.

name: The AADC Research Trust
missionStatement: The Charity Provides support around the world for children (and their families) suffering from AADC Deficiency a genetically inherited Neurological condition which inhibits the production of neurotransmitters, and causes devastating life limiting symptoms We promote understanding of the condition to facilitate optimum drug therapy and correct diagnosis, We are funding research into AADC Deficiency and clinical trials of Brain delivered gene therapy.
description: Make a rare child healthy

name: The Shark Trust
missionStatement: The Shark Trust is the UK charity dedicated to safeguarding the future of shark though positive change. We  achieve this though science, education, influence and action.
description: A positive future for sharks

name: The Children's Society
missionStatement: Every young person should have the support they need in order to enjoy a safe, happy childhood. That's why we run services and campaigns that make children's lives better and change the systems that are placing them in danger. The Children's Society is bringing hope back to children's lives.
description: Donate now to protect a child in danger

name: MCH Psychological Services t/a Minds Matter & Isle Listen
missionStatement: MCH Psychological Services is a Manx mental health charity - through our Minds Matter and Isle Listen initiatives we provide psychological support for people living with life-changing conditions, and early intervention and prevention approaches to improve mental health and wellbeing on the island
description: We at Isle Listen and Minds Matter work to support mental wellbeing on the Island.

name: The Just a Drop Appeal
missionStatement:
Just a Drop brings sustainable clean water, 
sanitation and hygiene projects to communities, 
transforming lives.
description: Providing clean water, sanitation and safe hygiene projects globally

name: The Give A Duck Foundation
missionStatement: We offer play therapy for children undergoing cancer treatment.
description: Children can't fight cancer alone!

name: Painted Wolf Foundation
missionStatement: The aim of the Painted Wolf Foundation is to raise awareness about this much threatened and ignored species and support organisations that conserve painted wolves in the field. The painted wolf is also known as the wild dog and painted dog. With only 6500 left in the world, the threat of extinction is real. Yet there is so much we can do now to save them from the brink if we have the resources. Our mission is to raise awareness and funds to keep the painted wolves with us for a long time to come.
description: Your support will directly help the survival of the remarkable painted wolf.

name: Children of Watamu (UK reg charity 1098731)
missionStatement:
Children of Watamu Happy House provides a home for up to 100 children, from background of tragedy and despair, in Watamu, Kenya.  While giving them a real family home it also provides them with an education in its schools which are second to none.  The schools, with state of the art computer suite, science lab and library, also educated children from the local community.
The charity depends entirely on donations, fundraising, and its child sponsor scheme
description: Sponsor a child, transform a life

name: Sea Shepherd UK Trading ltd
missionStatement: Sea Shepherd UK is a registered marine wildlife conservation charity. Our mission is to end the destruction of habitat and slaughter of wildlife around the UK's coastline and world's oceans in order to conserve and protect ecosystems and species.
description: Sea Shepherd UK is a direct action marine conservation charity (CC registration 1110501)

name: Axis Educational Trust
missionStatement: Founded in 1994, Axis Educational Trust is a registered charity which aims to provide high quality, coordinated affordable supplementary education to primary and secondary school pupils in the UK.
description: Support a disadvantaged child's extended learning!

name: Inter City Camp Trust
missionStatement: WE PROVIDE HOLIDAYS FOR CHILDREN FROM iNNER CITY AREAS OF THE UK WHEN THEIR PARENTS CANNOT AFFORD THE FULL COST - MANY OF THEM COME FROM VERY STRESSFUL HOME SITUATIONS - ALL OUR STAFF ARE VOLUNTEERS AND ARE ENHANCED DBS CHECKED AND GIVEN TRAINING AND SUPPPORT IN THEIR WORK WITH US
description: Please help us to subsidise a Holiday for children from Inner City areas of the UK

name: Amanat Charity Trust
missionStatement: Ummah Welfare Trust (UWT) is a UK registered international relief and development charity. Established in the year 2001, UWT operates in over twenty countries across Africa, Asia, Europe and the Middle East. UWT aims to relieve the suffering of the poor and alleviate poverty across the world. UWT is fully committed to a 100% donations policy. There is no deduction for administration or fundraising purposes.
description: Donate to UWT now to help the needy without a single penny being deducted for admin

name: Women for Women International
missionStatement: Women for Women International invests where inequality is greatest by helping women who are forgotten - the women survivors of war an conflict. In Afghanistan, Bosnia and Herzegovina, the DRC, Iraq, Kosovo, Nigeria, Rwanda and South Sudan, women learn skills to rebuild their lives through our Stronger Women, Stronger Nations programme. They form support networks, learn to earn an income and save, and gain knowledge and resources about health and their rights. UK Charity Registration Number 1115109.
description: Help a woman survivor of war rebuild her life.

name: Eudaimonia T/A Affordable Foods
missionStatement:
Super Kitchens are social eating spaces where people come together at mealtimes to enjoy a great, affordable, planet-saving meal that comes
with a side-order of community, connection and conversation. We set up shared social eating spaces, that run on perfectly edible and in-date surplus food generated by the food industry. We have a positive story based on the principles of plenty for all and everyone is welcome. Our model is simple to understand, replicable and scalable.
description: Super Kitchen helps address social isolation & poverty whilst building community cohesion.

name: Once Upon A Smile
missionStatement: Once Upon a Smile provide emotional and practical support to bereaved families to enable them to adjust to a new life without their loved one. Our charity offers a variety of support to families through such a difficult time, not only are we unique in this way but we also tailor the support we provide to families to fit their individual needs.
description: Once Upon a Smile provide a safe environment for children to express feelings & emotions

name: World Child Cancer UK
missionStatement: World Child Cancer gives children in low- and middle-income countries the opportunity to access trained medics, medication and support to give them the very best chance of survival. We also support children's families and raise awareness of childhood cancer in low- and middle-income countries.
description: Just £50 could pay for a round of life-saving chemotherapy for a child in Ghana.

name: Whale and Dolphin Conservation
missionStatement: WDC, Whale and Dolphin Conservation (formerly WDCS) is the leading global charity dedicated to the conservation and protection of whales and dolphins. We defend these remarkable creatures against the many threats they face through campaigns, lobbying, advising governments, conservation projects, field research and rescue. Our vision is a world where every whale and dolphin is safe and free.
description: A World Where Every Whale and Dolphin is Safe and Free

name: YOUTH WITH A MISSION Harpenden
missionStatement: YWAM
description: YWAM Harpenden

name: Adopt A Child Education Project
missionStatement: AACEPT supports education provision in The Gambia so children's lives can be transformed by achieving their educational goals
description: Your support will transform the lives of children in The Gambia through education

name: Fibromyalgia Action UK
missionStatement: Fibromyalgia Action UK is a registered charity run primarily by unpaid volunteers. The majority of volunteers are also fibromyalgia sufferers who work extremely hard, despite their condition, in order to forward the cause of fibromyalgia.  FMA UK was established in order to provide information and support to sufferers and their families. In addition, the Association provides medical information for professionals and operates a national helpline.
description: Help us to send an info pack to a fibro sufferer

name: PennyAppeal.org
missionStatement: The Penny Appeal way of doing charity is simple - we take small change and make a BIG difference with it! Our unique approach makes charitable giving affordable and rewardable, and allows us to transform lives in ways that cost you just a few pennies each day.
description: We take small change and make a BIG difference with it!

name: Brain Tumour Research
missionStatement: Brain Tumour Research is dedicated to raising funds for continuous and sustainable scientific research into brain tumours, and we are a leading voice calling for greater support and action for research into what scientists are calling the last battleground against cancer.
description: We are building a network of experts in sustainable brain tumour research.

name: One Step At A Time
missionStatement: We are a charity that provides support to vulnerable children and their communities in Northern Uganda.  We deliver immediate and lasting improvements by working together with local communities, families, government and other organisations for a more fulfilling and sustainable life for everyone. We are a small charity that makes a big difference where it really matters. As we are managed by volunteers our overheads are tiny so most of the money raised goes directly to those people who need it.
description: Sponsoring a child can change a life and bring hope and comfort where none existed

name: DIAL A RIDE (DENBIGHSHIRE) LTD
missionStatement: Dial A Ride Denbighshire are a not for profit community transport charity that provide fully accessible transport to members of the local community and surrounding areas that are unable to access public transport through disability, vulnerability, impairment, rural isolation or through  no fault of their own. A service to assist with everyday living and enabling people to attend medical appointments, go shopping, attend social groups or even visit friends and family, promoting social inclusion.
description: A not for profit charrity that rely on donations and funding to provide services that help

name: Have A Heart Foundation
missionStatement: We exist to help provide life-saving equipment in the community. We supply defibrillators and deliver essential CPR and AED training to all forms of public and private places including sports clubs, offices, hospitals, and schools.
description: Please donate, it may help save a life. It could be you or a loved one that needs help.

name: SPANA
missionStatement: SPANA (Society for the Protection of Animals Abroad) is committed to alleviating the suffering of working animals in some of the world's poorest communities across the developing world, where people still rely on their animals for survival. We provide free, immediate veterinary treatment as well as an extensive education programme teaching owners and children how to better care for and respect their animals.
description: Give a brighter future to working animals and the people who depend on them

name: MuffinPug Rescue
missionStatement:
MuffinPug Rescue is based in the UK, actively rescuing pugs and pug crosses in need wherever they may be. We seek to end the suffering of pugs being exploited or neglected, and spay, neuter and promote healthy living for rescue pugs with our wonderful network of Fairy PugMothers and Fathers. 

Working closely with other animal welfare organisations, MuffinPug Rescue is a proactive advocate for the voiceless and exploited.
description: Changing the world, one pug at a time!

name: Symphony Consort
missionStatement: We build platforms and create spaces for people to become all that God has called them to be
description: Your support will enable us to give higher, serve lower and love wider

name: The Swanage Pier Trust
missionStatement:
The preservation of Swanage Pier for the benefit of the residents and visitors to the town of Swanage.
The pier is one of a few reaming constructed of timber in 1895 and is Grade 2 Listed
description: Help to preserve Swanage Pier, one of a few remaining timber built piers in the country

name: SLOW
missionStatement: SLOW - Surviving the Loss of your World - is an award-winning charity run by bereaved parents providing support for bereaved parents and their children.   The charity is based in London and runs over 90 support groups every year in Islington and Streatham, offering a place of refuge for parents that have lost a child.   SLOW is an important part of supporting local people through daily life and the group is open to all who have suffered the devastating loss of a child.
description: Please help bereaved parents that have suffered the devastating loss of a child

name: Wimbledon Greyhound Welfare
description: Help retired greyhounds to find a new life after the track.

name: Yorkshire Air Ambulance
missionStatement: The Yorkshire Air Ambulance is a life-saving rapid response emergency service 365 days a year to 5 million people across 4 million acres of Yorkshire.
description: It costs 12,000 pounds a day to keep both of Yorkshire Air Ambulance's in the air

name: Pug Dog Welfare & Rescue Association
missionStatement: PDWRA is a registered charity in the UK number 276067.  Strict rules are followed regarding the welfare, rescue and rehoming of all pugs.  No profits are made and everyone gives their time and talents freely. In 2018 for the first time ever more than 350 pugs were surrendered to PDWRA for rehoming a lot needing vet care.
description: Our Vet bills exceeded a hundred thousand pounds last year and are growing.

name: The Hibbs Lupus Trust
missionStatement:
The Hibbs Lupus Trust improves the lives of people affected by lupus. 
We support people affected by lupus to make sure that no one faces lupus alone.
We're a dedicated team whose own lives have been affected by lupus.
description: Raising awareness is a way of life.

name: African Forest Elephant Foundation
missionStatement: The African Forest Elephant Foundation is UK registered charity working to induce an international shift in elephant conservation that highlights the fast decline toward extinction of the forgotten forest elephants in Central Africa and aims to preserve their place, along with that of their forest habitat, into the future.
description: Help secure a future for Africa’s forgotten forest elephants and their natural habitat.

name: Rescue Remedies Dog Rescue
missionStatement: Rescue Remedies is a home based Dog Rescue run entirely by volunteers. Most of the dogs taken in are from pounds and would have been put to sleep otherwise. The dogs are either fostered in homes or boarded in private kennels until forever homes are found for them.
description: Rescue Remedies is a Registered Charity We save dogs from Council pounds/homes and rehome

name: Shelter, National Campaign for Homeless People Limited
missionStatement: We help over a million people a year struggling with bad housing or homelessness, and we campaign to prevent it in the first place. We're here so no one has to fight bad housing or homelessness on their own.
description: Help make sure no child wakes up homeless.

name: HELP FOR NEPAL
missionStatement: HELP FOR NEPAL is a Registered Charity (1186858). Our main area of interest will be in Nepal.  With your support we aim to reach those people in Nepal, who desperately need basic medical screening and medical care.  With your support we aim to reach those people who are still far away from basic needs like food, clothing and shelter.  With your support we aim to reach those children who are still studying under temporary shelter.
description: Help us to provide basic medical care, education and create a Poverty free society

name: SurvivorsUK
missionStatement: At SurvivorsUK we know male sexual abuse has a profound impact on those who experience it and can deeply affect men's mental health and relationships. But we are here to help sexually abused men and their friends & family, no matter when the abuse happened. We are here to support, challenge, build.
description: Give a little to make a big impact in someone else's life.

name: R.I.O.T. REVIVAL IN OUR TOWN
missionStatement:
Mission Statement

Our mission is to benefit the inhabitants of Dundrum by providing a welcoming community facility considering all ages, gender, race, political, and religious beliefs thus challenging the social normalities of Northern Ireland. We will provide an environment where people can learn from each other through various forms of social education and support with the goal to improve the life of the community.
description: Some of our goals include a play park and a multifunctional sports area

name: Mission Aviation Fellowship UK
missionStatement: MAF believes that no one should be isolated from help and hope. That's why we fly aircraft in 26 developing countries to reach the world's forgotten people - those living out of sight, out of mind and out of hope. Partnering with 1,500 relief and mission groups, out pilots take off or land every 4 minutes to transport essential medical care, food, water, relief teams and church workers to those in desperate need. We're about transforming lives. MAF is flying for life.
description: Be a life-transformer, help us reach thousands of impoverished people in remote places.

name: The Born Free Foundation Limited
missionStatement:
We work tirelessly to ensure that all wild animals, whether living in captivity or in the wild, are treated with compassion and respect and are able to live their lives according to their needs. 

As a leading wildlife charity, we oppose the exploitation of wild animals in captivity and campaign to keep them where they belong - in the wild.
description: Please donate and help us provide a better future for wild animals.

name: A Time Ltd
missionStatement:
TO RELIEVE PERSONS SUFFERING FROM INFERTILITY OR FERTILITY PROBLEMS, IN PARTICULAR BY
A) THE PROVISION OF INFORMATION, ADVICE AND SUPPORT, IN PARTICULAR THROUGH THE PROVISION OF A SUPPORT GROUP
B) THE PROVISION OF A HELP-LINE
C) THE PROVISION OF A PERIODIC MAGAZINE
D) THE PROVISION OF A WEBSITE AND OTHER RESOURCES FOR INFORMATION, GUIDANCE AND EDUCATIONAL MATERIALS
E) REFERRING BENEFICIARIES TO RELEVANT MEDICAL ASSISTANCE AND ADVICE
description: Help people in need

name: Child Poverty Action Group
missionStatement: Child Poverty Action Group works on behalf of the one in four children in the UK growing up in poverty. Our goal is a society where no family goes hungry, and every child has a fair chance in life. We campaign for policies that will end UK child poverty for good. We provide training, advice and information to help hard-up families get the financial support they need. We also carry out high profile legal work to establish and protect families' rights.
description: Give now to stop UK children going hungry and ensure they have a fair chance in life

name: Katharine House Hospice
missionStatement: We are a local hospice, supporting the people of Stafford and surrounding areas.
description: We are a local hospice, supporting the people of Stafford and surrounding areas.

name: Romanian Rescue Appeal
missionStatement: We are a UK registered charitable organisation who's focus is to rescue stray dogs in Romania. We rescue street dogs and dogs from deplorable conditions in government-run shelters. We currently have 800 dogs in our care, at two rescue centres in the town of Tecuci in Romania's Galati region, and just over 100 in foster care in Romania. We have so far rehomed some 900 dogs, mainly to the UK but also across Europe, including Scandinavia, since Romanian Rescue Appeal (RRA) was established in January 2014
description: Please have a look at our Facebook pages to find out more or get involved

name: Millie's Trust
missionStatement: Millie's Trust has been established following the loss of our daughter Millie in a choking incident at nursery in October 2012. As parents of a child ourselves we believe that everyone should have access to First Aid Training no matter what their situation in life is. We aim to make First Aid Training readily available for minimal costs and in as many places as possible. Please use our contact form and we will get back to you as soon as possible.
description: To help save a life!

name: Christchurch Community Partnership
missionStatement:
Our vision is to be the centre of excellence for coordinating charitable activity in Christchurch, with a view to building, promoting and maintaining a community that is inclusive, supportive and caring. By improving the health and well-being of its resident and working in partnership with other organisations we strive to:
- Reduce social isolation by reintegrating those affected back into the community.
- Build and maintain a Dementia Friendly Community.
description: Building a Dementia Friendly Community and Driving down Social Isolation

name: Project AWARE Foundation (INTL)
missionStatement: Project AWARE Foundation is a global movement of scuba divers protecting the ocean planet - one dive at a time. Focused on the critical issues of Sharks in Peril and Marine Debris, Project AWARE empowers thousands of divers in more than 180 countries to work together for a clean, healthy and abundant ocean planet. Project AWARE Foundations is a registered non-profit organization.
description: Protecting the Ocean Planet - One Dive at a Time

name: Tiny Tickers
missionStatement:
Tiny Tickers helps babies with congenital heart disease (CHD), their families and the health professionals who look after them. We want every baby with a serious heart condition to have the best chance of survival and quality of life.

A baby is born with a serious heart condition every 2 hrs in the UK and despite CHD being one of the biggest killers of infants in the UK, only around half of congenital heart defects are picked up during routine prenatal scanning. 

www.tinytickers.org
description: Help us to give babies with serious heart conditions a better start in life.

name: Just One Ocean
missionStatement: Just One Ocean is a UK registered conservation charity. We support scientific research and raise awareness of ocean issues that affect us all.  Our vision is to be a part of the solution to ensure that we protect the ocean for future generations.
description: Help us to protect the ocean for future generations - make a donation today

name: The Fragile X Society
missionStatement: The Fragile X Society has a unique mission - to improve the quality of life of all people affected by fragile X syndrome by providing mutual support and information to fragile X families, raising awareness and understanding of fragile X and encouraging research into all aspects of the syndrome.
description: Learning disability is a cinderella area and we need your help to help those with fragileX

name: The Amber Trust
missionStatement: The Amber Trust Music Awards and Family Music Services aim to nurture musical talent in children and young people who are blind or partially sighted, by enabling them to access and develop through music.
description: Music is not just a pastime, it's a lifeline

name: Bowel & Cancer Research
missionStatement:
We look forward to a day when no one will die of bowel cancer or have to live with chronic bowel disease.
To bring this day closer, we invest in the best science across the UK and encourage our next generation of research experts by supporting a dedicated PhD programme. We believe that we make research better when we involve the public in all its aspects, so we have a unique programme called People and Research Together.
We also run campaigns to build understanding and awareness of bowel conditions.
description: Create a future free from bowel cancer and chronic bowel conditions. Invest in research.

name: World Animal Friends
missionStatement: We raise funds to help homeless cats and dogs abroad. We provide food, shelter, vaccinations, veterinary treatment and neutering.
description: Please be a friend to homeless animals

name: KIDSCAPE
missionStatement:
6% of children in the UK experience bullying every day. 

Kidscape works directly with children and families experiencing bullying, across the UK. We provide workshops for children and their families, teaching confidence and assertiveness skills to tackle a bullying situation. We provide practical support and telephone advice to parents and carers worried about bullying situations. We also train professionals in how to challenge and prevent bullying. 

We are with you.
description: Help Kidscape give a bullied child their life back

name: Charcot-Marie-Tooth UK
missionStatement: We support people from all over the UK who are affected by Charcot-Marie-Tooth disease, a rare neurological condition, affecting 1 in 2500 of the population.  This condition is incurable and progressive, causing disability of varying degrees.
description: help us raise funds to find a cure to put an end of CMT,

name: Heartline Families
missionStatement: The mission of Heartline Families is to improve the lives of children with heart conditions and their families by offering them support, information and contact with other families in the same or similar circumstances.
description: Help support Children with a Heart Condition and their Family

name: Care4Calais
missionStatement: Care4Calais is a volunteer-run charity delivering essential aid and support to refugees living in the worst conditions across Northern France, Belgium and Italy. We believe in a fair and tolerant British society and advocate for a welcoming and inclusive attitude towards refugees. Operating year round from Calais, our focus is to provide warm clothing, bedding, food and medical assistance to people in desperate need.
description: Please help us now by making a donation. 100% of your donation will support the refugees.

name: Hourglass (Safer Ageing)
missionStatement: We are Hourglass - formerly Action on Elder Abuse - the voice for older people at risk. We provide a Helpline and programmes to deliver direct support to victims and survivors of abuse. We campaign to stop harm of older people and to create an environment where safer ageing is guaranteed for all.
description: Support us to give older people a fighting chance against abuse.

name: King's College Hospital Charity
missionStatement: King's College Hospital Charity is dedicated to supporting life-changing care for patients at Kings College Hospital NHS Foundation Trust.  We help make the best care possible by raising money for cutting edge equipment and facilities, innovative research, pioneering treatment and improving the working environment for staff.
description: We fund projects to deliver a better experience for patients, their families & friends.

name: Lewa Wildlife Conservancy UK
missionStatement: The Lewa Wildlife Conservancy in Kenya works as a catalyst and model for the conservation of wildlife and its habitat. It does this through the protection and management of species, the initiation and support of community conservation and development programmes, and the education of neighbouring areas in the value of wildlife.
description: A Catalyst for Conservation

name: Glasgow City Mission
missionStatement: At Glasgow City Mission we work with people who are homeless. We help them improve their situations and move forwards with their life. We do this through services such as an evening drop-in, lunch clubs, jobs clubs, classes in, for example, computing, literacy & numeracy, art and cookery. We also have a Child and Family Centre which works with children and their carers in Govan. We do all of this as Christians passionate about the people that look to us for help.
description: Make a difference in the lives of those who are homeless

name: WORLDWIDE CANCER RESEARCH
missionStatement: Worldwide Cancer Research exists to help save lives that are currently being lost to cancer. We fund the very best cancer research projects, wherever in the world they happen to be.
description: We are a charity which funds research into any type of cancer anywhere in the world.

name: Afr.i.can Help
missionStatement: Afr.i.can.help was set up by, well, just me, as a platform for a life of missionary work, just beginning! My wife, two kids and I visited Uganda, raising 1500 pounds for a school freely educating 1000 kids who could not otherwise afford schooling. We took a trip to Kos, sending 105 tents & 270 sleeping bags to refugees in Athens for winter. Our base is now Spain, where we live as a missionary family. God is our director, we follow His lead. Such a privilege to help. So, where to go from here?
description: You'll never appreciate how much you have, until you help someone with nothing.

name: Rewilding Britain
missionStatement: Rewilding Britain's vision is to see rewilding flourishing across Britain, reconnecting us with the natural world, sustaining communities and tackling the extinction crisis and climate emergency.  Rewilding Britain champions rewilding and shares its expertise with anyone interested in putting it into practice, it influences policy and legislation, it helps get locally-led initiatives off the ground and it connects people and organisations, creating a broad network of rewilders and supporters.
description: Make a donation and help us create a different future for Britain's natural world.

name: Hospiscare
missionStatement: If you live in Exeter, Mid or East Devon, Hospiscare is your local adult hospice charity. Should you or a loved one need care for any type of terminal illness, our professional team of doctors and nurses are here to help. Our services are provided irrespective of race, religion, age, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, mental or physical disability, diagnosis or place of national origin.
description: Help us care for local people diagnosed with a terminal illness

name: Masonic Charitable Foundation
missionStatement: The Masonic Charitable Foundation (MCF) helps vulnerable and disadvantaged people to live happy, fulfilling lives and participate actively in society through grants to local and national charities, and partnerships with leading organisations in the sector.
description: We support 500 local and national charities every year at a cost of 5.5 million pounds.

name: Soi Dog Foundation
missionStatement: Soi Dog Foundation works to improve the welfare of dogs and cats in Asia, resulting in better lives for both the animal and human communities, to create a society without homeless animals, and to ultimately end animal cruelty.
description: Help end Asia's cruel dog meat trade

name: The Buddy Bag Foundation
missionStatement: We supply Buddy Bags to children who find themselves in emergency care after a traumatic incident. Imagine a child having to leave everything they own and everyone they know after fleeing violent situations at home. A Buddy Bag is a backpack that contains all the essential items a child needs. They include toiletries, pyjamas, socks and underwear and also include comfort items such as a book and a teddy bear. By providing these kids with a few essentials we can help make the transition a little easier.
description: Making a real difference to children at a time of fleeing domestic violence.

name: Racehorse Relief
missionStatement: We rehabilitate, retrain and rehome former racehorses. Giving them a second career once their racing days are over.
description: Helping ex-racehorses find a new career.

name: Holmes Chapel Music Society
missionStatement: A charity, formed in 1972, with the aim of bringing the highest standard of musical performance to Cheshire.
description: The Society requests sponsorship of a concert, or of a work to be performed at a concert.

name: Child Brain Injury Trust
missionStatement:
When a child acquires a brain injury it can have a devastating affect on all the family.  Every year thousands of families are left without any support and often feel alone with nowhere to turn to.
We are here to support families and professionals working with children and young people who find themselves in need of information about what's happened and how to cope.  Our Coordinators are here to listen and to help with practical and emotional issues which may arise over time.
description: 40k children acquire a brain injury every year.  By donating you help give them a future

name: Action Duchenne Ltd
missionStatement:
Duchenne muscular dystrophy is a degenerative muscle wasting condition affecting approx. 2500 people in the UK. The average life expectancy is just 25. 

There is no cure.

Action Duchenne is the UKs longest serving charity dedicated to finding a cure and improving the lives of all those living with and affected by Duchenne.
description: With your help we can continue to make a difference to everybody living with Duchenne.

name: Give A Book
missionStatement: Give a Book promotes books and the pleasure of reading in the hardest places. We mainly work in prisons and disadvantaged schools around the UK. Our core belief is that to pass on a good read--to give a book-- is a transaction of lasting worth.
description: Please help us spread the pleasure of reading in the hardest places.

name: MIPSPTA
missionStatement: The PTA are committed to improving relationships between home and school. We work tirelessly to raise  funding for additional resources for the school. Having an active PTA that works in partnership with the school and engages parental support means the pupils have access to resources, events, activities which are not available through direct school funding
description: Make a donation

name: Friends of Targoviste Rescued Dogs
missionStatement: Supports a private shelter in Targoviste, Romania that rescues, cares for and rehomes dogs rescued from the public shelters and streets.  Registered charity no 1157768.  www.bidtosaveastray.com.  Facebook - Friends of Targoviste Rescued Dogs.  Twitter - Bid to save a stray.
description: Bid toBid to Save a Stray -Friends of Targoviste Romania  rescue, care for & rehome dogs.

name: Pancreatic Cancer UK
missionStatement:
Pancreatic cancer is a tough one but we're taking it on.
We're supporting those affected by the disease, investing in ground-breaking research, lobbying for greater recognition of pancreatic cancer and being a voice for everyone involved in the fight.
Together we're taking it on.
description: Support Pancreatic Cancer UK by helping us to take on this tough cancer together.

name: Action for M.E.
missionStatement: Action for M.E. works to empower people with M.E. (myalgic encephalomyelitis) to fulfil their potential and secure the care and support they need, while working towards a greater understanding of the illness and ultimately a cure.
description: Help us stop M.E. stealing lives

name: BEN - Motor & Allied Trades Benevolent Fund
missionStatement:
Ben is the charity dedicated to supporting the people of the automotive industry, providing support for life for them and their family dependents.

We support individuals to navigate through life's challenges, empowering them to make positive, lasting change. Ben works with people to improve their lives by enhancing their health and wellbeing through its free and confidential online self-help, helpline and support services.  Visit www.ben.org.uk
description: Help make a positive lasting difference to people's lives

name: The Animal Team
missionStatement: The Animal Team aims to help as many animals in need as possible.  We do this by matching volunteers with rescue needs for homechecking and transporting animals, we promote animals in rescue needing a home, we fundraise and donate to rescues to help them help animals in need, we cover the cost of emergency boarding to save dogs in pounds on borrowed time .... If we can help an animal we ALWAYS WILL.
description: Any money donated will be spent directly helping an animal in need or a rescue in need.

name: Gendered Intelligence
missionStatement:
Gendered Intelligence is the leading trans-led charity in the UK, working to increase understandings of trans people and of wider gender diversity.

Our services stretch from trans awareness training, to (what we believe is) the largest trans youth work service in the world, to policy and consultancy work.
description: Make the world a better place for trans people

name: Maternity Worldwide
missionStatement:
Maternity Worldwide saves lives in childbirth in developing countries. 
We train midwives, nurses and doctors to become skilled birth attendants, we provide community education on maternal health so people know when to seek medical help and we also improve access to health centres and hospitals using things such as motorbike ambulances.
description: Help women have a safe birth no matter where they live by supporting Maternity Worldwide

name: Stray Aid Ltd
missionStatement: We are a registered charity dedicated to the welfare of stray dogs and unwanted cats
description: We are raising funds to improve our kennels and cattery, to give our pets a better life

name: iQra International
missionStatement: iQra International is a UK registered non-profit humanitarian charity organisation whose mission is to help restore dignity to the millions of disabled people in developing countries. For the past 21 years, we have not only provided essential medical support and aid to thousands of disabled children and adults around the world who are unable to afford it, but have also raised much needed awareness of the plight of disabled people in developing countries who face daily neglect and discrimination
