description: Join iQra, make a difference, helping disabled children, poor & needy become self-reliant

name: Lurcher SOS
missionStatement:
We are a small non-destruct rescue charity. Our HQ is in Surrey and our dogs are in foster homes throughout the Home Counties.  All our dogs are placed in warm and loving foster homes where they are carefully assessed and, if needed, rehabilitated.  All Lurcher SOS rescue dogs are neutered where possible and given full veterinary treatment, microchipped and vaccinated wormed and deflead before going to their new homes.

We are a non-profit organization and receive no funding.
description: Please help us to help rescue more sighthounds and give them a chance of a loving home.

name: Carlisle Eden Mind
missionStatement:
We're Mind, the mental health charity.
We believe no one should have to face a mental health problem alone. We're here for you. We're on your doorstep, on the end of a phone or online. We'll listen, give you information, support and advice, and fight your corner. And we'll push for a better deal and respect for everyone experiencing a mental health problem.
description: Help us make sure no one has to face a mental health problem alone in Carlisle and Eden

name: The Thomas Ball Children's Cancer Fund
missionStatement: The Charity provides free holidays in two lodges on the Hampshire coast and with a Christmas trip to Disneyland Resort Paris.  The charity funds research into childhood cancers, in particular neuroblastoma, provides days out and special gifts for very sick children and raises money to improve children's oncology wards.
description: Supporting children and teenagers throughout the UK who have a diagnosis of cancer

name: Streetz Ahead
missionStatement:
Streetz Ahead inspires young people to express themselves to build their confidence through the power of dance and performance in a creative, inclusive and supportive environment and also engages a wider range of young audiences through their professional productions using their unique style. 

We are a registered charity providing free or low-cost, weekly dance, theatre and backstage programmes to young people throughout north London, who would otherwise not have access to such opportunities.
description: Please support a child to attend a Streetz Ahead programme.

name: Rushton Dog Rescue
missionStatement: We are a dog rescue charity helping dogs around the globe, we have recently started an extra project saving dogs from the meat trade in China..and dogs in the uk
description: we have a huge passion for rescue and dogs from the most horrific of situations

name: Bathtub 2 Boardroom Limited
missionStatement:
We provide coworking space for early stage startups and entrepreneurs, providing them with an affordable desk, mentoring, talks, social events and advisors.

We work with organisations such as the Princes Trust to provide bursary spaces for those who are economically or socially disadvantaged.

We work with young people to gain valuable skills in their career paths.
description: More bursaries allow those less fortunate a better advantage on starting a business

name: Children at Risk in Asia
missionStatement: Children At Risk in Asia (CARA) works to improve the lives of disadvantaged children in Asia, working through two partners One Sky Foundation and The Border Health initiative based in Sangkhlaburi, Thailand on the border with Myanmar (Burma). 100% of funds raised goes to support over a thousand children of mainly poor migrant families based in this area. We support social welfare programmes, healthcare and education, enrolling children in free Thai schools & enabling them to complete their education.
description: Your donation can give a child a better future

name: Tommy's
missionStatement: Tommy's exists to save babies lives because right now in the UK one in four women loses a baby during pregnancy or birth. We fund research into and provide information on the causes and prevention of miscarriage, premature birth and stillbirth.
description: We fund research that saves lives

name: Redwings Horse Sanctuary
missionStatement:
Redwings Horse Sanctuary believes that every horse, pony, donkey and mule has the right to a happy and healthy life, free of fear and neglect.

The charity rescues neglected and abandoned equines from all over the country, giving them a safe place to live, and is currently home to over 1,500 residents - making Redwings the UK's largest horse sanctuary.

As a 100% publicly funded charity, every donation - no matter how big or small - helps Redwings help horses in need.

name: CoppaFeel!
missionStatement: CoppaFeel! are the first UK breast cancer charity to create awareness amongst young people, aiming to install a new healthy habit that could one day save a life. We're on a mission to stamp out late detection of breast cancer and ensure the nation is checking their boobs regularly. Educating people on the signs and symptoms of breast cancer, encouraging them to get to know what is normal for them and empowering them to have the confidence to see a doctor if they notice anything that isn't right for them.
description: Your support enables us to educate young people around the UK

name: Raising Foundations
missionStatement:
RAISING FOUNDATIONS is a UK Registered Charity to catalyse a Generation of Faith - a Revival Generation.
Our vision is empowering Christians to spread the Gospel. 

We facilitate, mobilise and enable Christians to:
- Fulfil the Great Commission
- Support missions, revival and evangelism outreach
- Raise and release finance
- Help establish and support churches
- Provide humanitarian aid and relieve poverty
- Access technology tools and apps
- Network Christian communities and promote awareness
description: Become a Partner, Supporter & Champion of Our Vision - catalyse a Generation of Faith!

name: Tees4LGBT
missionStatement:
STOP-Homophobia.com is one of the world's largest anti-homophobia orgs, with over 50 million website users and a massive social media presence. 

The object is to educate and inform on a global scale.
description: One card in the right hands could save a life.

name: Crawley Open House
missionStatement: Crawley Open House provides support and services for those suffering the effects of homelessness, unemployment, loneliness, discrimination, or other forms of social exclusion. Our support is available to anyone in need.
description: Help make a difference to the homeless and disadvantaged.

name: Inernational Tortoise Association
missionStatement: We provide care for tortoise in need and advice and help for our members and the public.  The RSPCA and Border Force send us any tortoise seized from the public or airports to be cared for and re-homed.  We provide information and assistance to our members on feeding, housing, first aid and breeding together with incubation and hibernation services.
description: Your donation will provide a safe home and help for a sick or abandoned tortoise.

name: Lluest Horse and Pony Trust
missionStatement: Lluest meaning Haven in Welsh, was founded in 1985 by the late Ginny Hajdukiewicz, who sadly passed away at the young age of 38 leaving the Trust as her legacy. A NEWC member charity, nestling amongst the Brecon Beacons in the beautiful Carmarthenshire countryside. We rescue, rehabilitate and re-home horses, ponies and donkeys who have been the victims of cruelty and neglect. We help them to recover from their often traumatic experiences before re-homing them with new Guardian homes.
description: Help us to keep giving horses and ponies a second chance

name: Southend Mencap
missionStatement: Southend Mencap is a registered charity formed in October 1955. The charity's main aim is to serve the interests and needs of the learning disabled and that of their parents and carers.
description: We provide services and support for children and adults with a learning disability

name: London's Air Ambulance Ltd
missionStatement: Since our launch in 1989 we have flown over 34,500 missions. We fly 365 days a year and are the only air ambulance in the UK that always caries a senior doctor and a paramedic trained specifically to treat patients who have suffered major injury as the result of an accident.
description: Help us to keep London's Hovering Hospital airborne and saving lives every day.

name: Mesothelioma Uk
missionStatement: Mesothelioma UK is a national specialist resource centre, specifically for the asbestos-related cancer, mesothelioma. The charity is dedicated to providing specialist mesothelioma information, research, support and education, and to improving care and treatment for all UK mesothelioma patients and their carers.
description: We rely 100% on donations to enable us to be a one stop shop for Mesothelioma patients

name: Incredible Kids
missionStatement: To provide play and support services to families with a child with a disability or additional need to reduce inequality and social isolation.  To provide an opportunity for parents and carers to take a short break from the pressures of everyday life and encourage a mutually supportive environment for parents and carers.
description: We are a lifeline to families that have a disabled child.

name: Post Pals
missionStatement: Making seriously ill children and their siblings smile by sending cards, letters and gifts
description: Make a sick child smile from cheerful mail. Volunteer run, all donations go to the kids

name: Greater Manchester Community Chaplaincy
missionStatement:
Our vision
Our vision is to help offenders and ex-offenders of all faiths and none to re-integrate positively into society.
Our mission
Our mission is to provide support in the form of
Activities and groups
Advice and guidance
Mentoring and befriending
Training
Volunteering opportunities
To enable our service users to create a fresh start.
description: Helping create a fresh start

name: Purpose of Life
missionStatement: Purpose of Life is a 100% donations charity that helps the needy both in the UK as well as abroad
description: Never delay a good deed

name: GRACE CHURCH BOLTON
missionStatement: We are looking to serve our community in a number of ways, including hiring out our building to local groups, facilitating a toddler group, youth group and senior citizens group on a weekly basis.
description: A church serving the community

name: Grassroots Global
missionStatement: Releasing ordinary people to do extra ordinary things!
description: Ordinary people making a difference

name: Eurovision Mission To Europe
missionStatement: Eurovision Mission to Europe, the Ministry of David Hathaway: Preaching the Power of Faith in Jesus Christ across Russia, Ukraine, Israel and Europe. Supporting the needy and most vulnerable.
description: I have a vision in my soul - Eurovision - a vision of Europe won for Christ.

name: Pace4Life
missionStatement: Reusing Pacemakers in the Developing World
description: Leave a Legacy, Donate your Pacemaker

name: Smilez
missionStatement:
Smilez is an International Charity Organisation registered with the UK

The Charity organisation is run by passionate volunteers with one simple mission.

Bringing smiles to peoples lives.

Our projects provide relief and assistance to people in need who are living in poverty, hardship and distress by supplying them with food, clothes, medical aid, education and financial assistance.
description: Bring a smile to peoples lives

name: Happydays Ministries UK
missionStatement: Happy Days Ministries uk provides supported housing for street homeless men throughout Calderdale and Kirklees.
description: Helping the homeless.Everyone deserves a home.

name: ChildAid to Eastern Europe
missionStatement:
ChildAid transforms the lives of vulnerable and disadvantaged families, children and young people in Belarus, Moldova, Siberia and Ukraine. We bring security, empower children and young people, educate and train, provide free rehabilitation therapies, provide loving homes and deliver social welfare.
As a Christian charity we serve any child, young person or family that is in contact with our locally run projects and this is unconditional and never contingent or restricted by any faith or none at all.
description: You can't change the world, but you can change a child's world

name: Odiham Cottage Hospital
missionStatement: Money raised by OCH charity shops enable OCH to provide a range of health and social care services for our local communities in Odiham/Old Basing/Hook/Hartley Wintney, Hampshire.
description: Money raised by our shops enable OCH to provide a range of services to our local community

name: Village By Village
missionStatement: We want to transform the relationship between the world's richest and poorest.   We live in a rural remote village living in poverty in Africa and talk to the people and Elders to discover what will have the biggest impact in their community. We return to the UK and raise the funds and then move on to the next village and start the process again.	We intend to reach 100 villages in Ghana, West Africa by 2016.
description: We are a small charity making a big difference

name: MediCinema
missionStatement: MediCinema builds, installs and runs state-of-the-art cinemas in hospitals and places of care, giving patients and their families the magic and joy of a night at the movies together. Our cinemas are as much built for a healthcare setting as they are to give a fully immersive cinema experience. No-matter if a patient is in a wheelchair, attached to a drip or even unable to leave their bed, we are able to welcome them, and to ensure their safety throughout the film.
description: Donating can ensure that a patient can escape their harsh reality of their illness.

name: Friends of the Strays of Greece
missionStatement: We have been registered in the UK since 2002 and are run solely by volunteers.We help provide food, shelter and veterinary care to stray and unwanted cats and dogs in Greece.There are no Government supported animal welfare organisations in Greece and we support many local groups all over the country in their aim to alleviate as much unnecessary animal suffering as possible.We particularly support neutering campaigns to reduce the number of animals born into a potentially miserable existence
description: Your donation will make a difference to some of the millions of neglected animals

name: Art in the Frame Foundation
missionStatement: Founded in 1998 by two local art teachers, Art in the Frame Foundation is Jersey charity no 21. In 2002, we opened The Harbour Gallery Jersey in St Aubin with our current patron Lady Dalton. We help up and coming artists and craftworkers exhibit their work in Jersey and UK and enhance art education by running workshops, talks and events in the island's schools and for students of all ages. Through the gallery, we offer up to 12 stunning art and craft exhibitions a year and host workshops and events.
description: Don't take art for granted! Help support new artists and art education for all in Jersey!

name: Women on the Frontline Ministries
missionStatement: We are a Christian led organisation passionate about making change and a difference in the lives of women involved in street based prostitution and victims of trafficking helping women to see their potential and overcoming barriers to change. We provide weekly outreach services on the streets to known areas providing gift bags, hope, listening ear as well as one to one confidential help and support empowering women to know they can make alternative choices.
description: Help support us make a difference give hope and a way out to those sexually exploited

name: St James Mar Thoma Church UK
missionStatement: St James Mar Thoma Church as a worshipping community have been in existence in UK since the early 1950s. Membership consists mainly of families who reside in and around London and the Home Counties.
description: We are at a crucial period of our building project and we have a financial shortfall

name: Powys Samaritans in Llandrindod Wells
missionStatement:
Samaritans vision is that fewer people die by suicide.  Suicide is not inevitable; it is preventable.  The causes of suicide are complex, but we know it is both a gender and an inequality issues.  Behind every statistic is an individual, a family, and a community devastated by their loss.

Our mission is to alleviate emotional distress and reduce the incidence of suicidal behaviour.

We do this by: 
Being available 24 hours a day to provide emotional support
Reaching out to high risk groups
description: Purchase a building that will be a Community Hub & allow us to greater support our callers

name: Youth 2000 Charitable Trust
missionStatement: We organise weekend retreats for young people in the UK to experience and learn about the Christian faith and make friends. Many young people have shared what a positive impact these retreats have had upon their lives, particularly for those struggling. These retreats happen 6 times a year across the UK, the largest of which attracts over 1300 attendees. Whilst each young person costs us 100 pounds to attend, we ask them to only pay what they can afford so that no one is prevented from coming by cost.
description: Help a young person have a life-changing experience over the course of an amazing weekend.

name: People Against Poverty
missionStatement: We are an independent charity whose shared intention is to alleviate poverty and suffering around the world. We deliver help on the ground through local partnerships who we help change lives by meeting basic needs: food, housing, education, shelter, giving people legitimacy and legal status. Our projects are designed to empower greater self-sufficiency, new hope and a more sustainable future; a handshake, not a hand out.
description: Help us give a handshake, not a handout, to people living in desperate poverty

name: The Big First Aid Project
missionStatement: Our First Aid Africa initiative provides access to life saving emergency healthcare training and equipment to the communities that need it the most.   Your donations allow us to provide dignified training and sustainable equipment to rural communities, with life saving results.
description: Donate the cost of a sustainable first aid kit or training course for a rural village.

name: European Parkinson's Disease Association (EPDA)
missionStatement: The European Parkinsons Disease Association (EPDA) is the only European Parkinsons umbrella organisation. We have been championing and working with the global Parkinsons community for nearly thirty years. As the leading voice for Parkinsons in Europe, we provide information and resources to all Parkinsons stakeholders, raise awareness of the disease complexities and impact, and advocate for concrete policy change that benefits the Parkinsons community.
description: Enable people with Parkinson's to live a full life while supporting the search for a cure.

name: The Whole Autism Family
missionStatement:
'The Whole Autism Family' was born to offer help, support and guidance to families who are impacted by Autism.

Autism has had a massive impact on everyone within our family and we believe its important that everyone has access to the support network we provide, whether it be parents, carers, grandparents, aunts, uncles and siblings.
description: TOGETHER WE CAN MAKE A DIFFERENCE

name: Bramber Bakehouse
missionStatement: Bramber Bakehouse was born to provide support and training to women who have experienced forms of exploitation. Over an 8-month programme we run 8 workshops, and each workshop consists of two halves. The first, led by previous Great British Bake Off Contestant Martha Collison, focuses on baking skills. The second, in partnership with The Sophie Hayes Foundation provides employability training. Our hope is to see women successfully transition back into the workplace and society as a whole.
description: Donate today and make a difference

name: the believe and achieve trust
missionStatement: The Believe and Achieve supports children who have been effected by meningitis or those who need help to succeed in sport therough the giving of grants.
description: we believe everyone deserves a chance

name: BETEL OF BRITAIN
missionStatement:
Restored specialises in antique vintage, shabby chic and retro furniture expertly refinished in Betels workshops Our non profit stores can be found on high streets across the country and stock a wide range of classic British Dutch and French furniture as well as new mango wood pieces crafted by residents in our centres in India 

The proceeds of RESTORED solely benefit Betel of Britain Charity whom run residential centres for the homeless addicted and marginalised across the UK
description: Giving broken lives new direction in a loving family atmosphere

name: Sands (Stillbirth & Neonatal Death Society)
missionStatement: Sands supports anyone affected by the death of a baby, works in partnership with health professionals to try to ensure that bereaved parents and families receive the best possible care and funds research that could help to reduce the numbers of babies dying and families devastated by this tragedy.
description: Help us support families and reduce the number of babies that die

name: The Uphill Trust
missionStatement: The Uphill Trust supports the development of a Uphjll Junior School, a privately-owned Primary School with Kindergarten in rural western Uganda. Our current goals include helping to provide suitably equipped school buildings, maintaining a motivated and well-qualified teaching staff, facilitating access to clean water and good sanitation and supporting the education of girls and orphans. A little of what we have here goes a very long way in Uganda - can you help us to help them?
description: A little of what we have goes a VERY long way in rural Uganda!

name: Meningitis Now
missionStatement: Meningitis Now is the leading UK charity with 30 years experience, dedicated to raising awareness of meningitis, providing support and funding preventative research. Meningitis is a life threatening, infectious disease that can leave devastation in its wake. Of those who survive, many will suffer life changing after-effects.. We are working tirelessly to ensure a brighter future, where no one dies from meningitis and anyone affected gets the support they need to live a happy, full and complete life.
description: We are dependent on fundraising to continue our work to fight against meningitis.

name: The Garden House (Marple) Charity
missionStatement:
A community farm who is a charity, supporting the community and organisations with people with complex needs.
The Garden House is set across 27acres between woodland and the River Goyt, yet within easy access for the surrounding town and public transport. There are a number of walking routes, cycling routes and bridle routes surrounding the facility, with a carpark which accommodates 85 parking spaces, including space for the disabled.
description: Charity which is a local community farm, supporting well being & people with complex needs

name: Spina Bifida Hydrocephalus Information Networking Equality-SHINE
missionStatement: Shine is committed to improving the lives of people affected by the disabilities spina bifida and hydrocephalus. People affected by these disabilities face a lifetime of health, mobility, social, and learning difficulties. Shine provides lifelong support, including advice, practical help, and the opportunity to be part of a lively national community for all those affected by these conditions.

name: FLINTSHIRE CITIZENS ADVICE BUREAUX
missionStatement: Citizens Advice Flintshire is a local charity providing advice and assistance to people across Flintshire and beyond.
description: A donation can make a big difference and will help us continue to offer free advice to tho

name: Grief Encounter
missionStatement:
Grief Encounter provides professional support to bereaved children and young people in the UK following the death of a loved one.

Children often feel lost and isolated following a significant bereavement, they can believe everyone close to them will leave them or die. The emotions experienced by a grieving child can have life altering and long lasting negative impacts on a child's development. Children in this mind set need appropriate intervention to work through these feelings.
description: To be a standalone, child focused, open access specialist bereavement service.

name: Essex & Herts Air Ambulance Trust
missionStatement: Essex & Herts Air Ambulance, unlike NHS emergency services, is a Charity. Our aim is to save lives, reduce or prevent disability, or suffering from critical illness and injury, by delivering a first class pre-hospital emergency medical service to the people of Essex, Hertfordshire and surrounding areas.

name: ShelterBox Trading Limited
missionStatement:
We are impatient to see a world where no family is left without shelter when disaster strikes. This drives us to transform the support of our donors, fundraisers and volunteers into the hope and power of families all over the world - the power to rebuild homes, lives and communities. 

Our impatience leads to determination. We will do whatever it takes to ensure that no family goes without shelter.

https://www.shelterbox.org/donate
description: Working towards a world where no family is without shelter when disaster strikes

name: 50th North Devon Scout Group
missionStatement:
50th North Devon Scout Group UK provides a safe, educational & joyful place for 6-14 year old children to learn & play.  Unpaid volunteers are vetted under strict criteria and return week after week to help the children from local communities have a structured and varied program of fun activities.  

Our Scout Hut (also shared with the local Rainbows Group) is in desperate need of replacing.

* PLEASE HELP US *
(Add Gift Aid - to boost your donation by by 25%) Thank you
description: Help us build a new Scout Hut to continue providing a safe and fun place for kids to play

name: Ty Hafan Ltd
missionStatement: Ty Hafan offers care, comfort and support for children in Wales who suffer from conditions which mean that they will not reach adulthood, and includes family support and bereavement counselling.  This service is completely free to all the families that use Ty Hafan and currently costs over 4 million pounds a year. Please help us to make a difference for these children and their families

name: Care for Kids North Devon
missionStatement: Care for Kids North Devon was founded in 2009 to meet two very special needs.  The charity provides instant financial assistance to families of children receiving care through the Caroline Thorpe Ward at NDDH.  In most instances a child with a life-threatening illness is transferred to a specialist hospital often a long distance away, incurring unexpected costs and loss of earnings.  The charity also supports the ward with the extras that make a stay in hospital just that little bit more bearable.
description: Supporting families in North Devon....caring for a child close to you.

name: World Animal Protection
missionStatement:
World Animal Protection (formerly The World Society for the Protection of Animals) is an international non-profit animal welfare organisation that has been in operation for over 30 years. 

A world where animal welfare matters and animal cruelty has ended
description: help fight animal cruelty by supporting World Animal Protection

name: Children's Burns Trust
missionStatement: The Children's Burns Trust is dedicated to providing rehabilitation support for burned and scald injured children and their families as well as prevention and awareness campaigns for which there is little or no national funding.
description: A burn injury is for life. We aim to help children lead a happy life as much as possible

name: HOPE ALIVE PENTECOSTAL CHURCH
missionStatement: A Church in the North-West of England who's aim is to reach the lost and help the needy
description: Be a part of what we do and join the many others who are involved in making a difference.

name: Three Peas
missionStatement: Supporting people fleeing war and persecution by raising awareness, supporting other groups working on the ground, running a housing program for vulnerable families and individuals and a community center for socialising, language courses as well as support and advice.
description: Everybody deserves a future

name: HOPE for Autism
missionStatement: HOPE has group sessions for children with Autism handled by trained, professional staff. We offer support to guardians and guidance on different aspects of the spectrum.
description: HOPE provide a safe and inclusive environment for children with Autism.

name: Flourish House
missionStatement:
Flourish House is an independent Charity established in 1997 which aims to enable people with mental illness to regain purposeful lives in the community.
We want to live in a society where people who have mental health difficulties are valued as neighbours, colleagues and friends.              Our mission:Providing support and services to people recovering from enduring mental health problems.      We are a clubhouse based in Glasgow, Scotland, UK. .
description: Support us to be a solid foundation for mental health recovery.

name: Macmillan Caring Locally
missionStatement: Macmillan Caring Locally supports the Macmillan Unit, a Palliative Care unit at Christchurch Hospital in Dorset. It operates The Grove, a hotel in Bournemouth for Cancer patients and carers and also supports a range of posts and services for Cancer diagnosis and treatment at the Royal Bournemouth Hospital.
description: Help us to help others.

name: Harper Asprey Wildlife Rescue
missionStatement:
We are a wildlife rescue charity, open 365 days a year. We rescue, rehabilitate & release all wildlife species, from tiny birds & hedgehogs to larger animals like deer, foxes & badgers. 
We also run an education programme, to teach people about the wildlife/environment that surrounds them and how they can help.
description: Help us to give wildlife a second chance today!

name: Siddiquia Education Trust
missionStatement: Help and support people in need. Young, Vulnerable  and old are welcomed to come and share their problems and needs.we support them via counselling, education, and private prayer facilities.
description: Charity is a good DEED that is Never Ending!!!

name: Cafe Unity 2014 Ltd
missionStatement: Community cafe for Heald Green village.
description: A local Cafe which aims to help with loneliness

name: Stockton Arts Centre
missionStatement: ARC is a community arts charity working from it's building in Stockton on Tees to provide people from the local community with access to meaningful arts activity. This often includes people from deprived or socially isolated groups who may not be otherwise able to access arts and cultural activity. The Theatre Trip for Every Child initiative enables businesses and individuals to support local children to attend the theatre for free, for many children this is their first experience of a trip to the theatre.
description: Share the magic of theatre with a local child!

name: Nettlestone and Seaview Shed
missionStatement:
Nettlestone and Seaview Shed is affiliated to the UK Men's Sheds Association.  We are based on the Isle of Wight, a Place to be, but not be alone.  Activities to do solo or with others.  People not alike but who like each other.  Creative and calming.  The aim is to improve the health and well-being of those (mainly, but not exclusively, older Men) who currently lack interaction because of a lack of appropriate facilities.
Learn things, Make things, Drink coffee or tea.
description: We need to build and equip a new workshop.

name: School Food Matters
missionStatement:
School Food Matters campaigns for fresh sustainable food in schools
and promotes food education through cooking, growing and visits to farms.

Our mission is to ensure that every child enjoys fresh sustainable food at school and understands where their food comes from.
description: Make a difference to the health of school children

name: Blairgowrie & Rattray Development Trust
missionStatement: Booklore Community Bookshop, an integral part of the Blairgowrie & Rattray Development Trust, is run entirely by volunteers. It sells donated second-hand books, rare and valuable books and local arts and crafts. Our volunteer team also provides a tourist information service and a warm welcome for anyone - buyer, browser or a visitor - with or without their dog! The shop is self-sufficient with any surplus funds invested in local community projects for the benefit of the town and the folk who live there.
description: Buy a book today and support our local community

name: Headway - the brain injury association
missionStatement: To promote understanding of all aspects of brain injury and to provide information, support and services to people with a brain injury, their families and carers.

name: Islamic Dawah Centre International
missionStatement: Conveying the pure and peaceful message of Islam to help remove misconceptions about Islam, creating positive dialogue and helping build a tolerant and cohesive society.

name: Diabetes Research & Wellness Foundation Ltd
missionStatement: We are funding diabetes research in the UK & around the world in order to understand the causes, prevention, treatment and management - our ultimate goal is to find a cure.
description: Support those living with Type 1 and Type 2 Diabetes. Staying well until a cure is found.

missionStatement: HART Wildlife Rescue is a charity which runs a wildlife hospital in North-East Hampshire, helping around 3500 patients each year. Our mission is to rescue, treat, rehabilitate and release wildlife and educate the public in the needs and care of British wildlife. It has a charity shop in Alton, Hampshire which sells goods which have been donated by members of the public to provide valuable funds for the charity. eBay is used to sell some of these donated items.

missionStatement: We raise funds for live-saving research into SIDS, neonatal death and stillbirth and provide bereavement support services for grieving families

name: Promoting Economic Pluralism
missionStatement: We are seeking to create and support spaces for diverse voices, perspectives and approaches to understanding and organising our economies to help co-create truly sustainable, resilient and inclusive ones.

name: Friends of Hawksworth School
missionStatement: Help us raise money for Hawksworth C of E Primary School. A small rural school based in West Yorkshire.

name: Grace Kelly Childhood Cancer Trust

The Grace Kelly Childhood Cancer Trust was founded in memory of 4 year old Grace Kelly who passed away in 2014. The vision of the Trust was born from the inspiration that Grace imparted on the people she met. 

We are making a difference to other children whilst fulfilling Grace's wish of helping others.


The team work to raise awareness, fund research into rare cancers of childhood and produce educational materials. We also provide financial , practical and emotional support to families.

name: South Essex Wildlife Hospital
missionStatement:
Dedicated to putting "life" back into the "wild", SEWH is a wildlife rescue, rehabilitation and public advice charity. We care for sick and injured wildlife and aim to release animals back into the wild. 

No injured or sick animal is turned away. SEWH relies entirely on donations. 
We help thousands of birds and animals each year.
They wouldn't be alive today without your help. Even a small sum will make a big difference.
description: The only wildlife hospital in East London and Essex. Funded entirely on donations

name: Calums Cabin
missionStatement: Calums Cabin and Calums Cabin Cottage are holiday homes on the Isle of Bute for children suffering from cancer and cancer related diseases where the whole family come to spend quality time together and make irreplaceable memories and recharge their batteries for what may lie ahead.
description: Help pay for families to come to to Calums Cabin and be a normal family again

name: Love Support Unite Foundation
missionStatement: We establish small-scale projects in Malawi, Africa which can be sustained and replicated to trigger change on a large-scale. Our volunteers contribute directly to genuine, long-lasting development projects, working alongside communities in Malawi to create real opportunities and active progress. We have provided healthcare, education and skills workshops to those who need it most. We have created opportunity where there was none. We are working towards a world where every community is self-sufficient.
description: Help us to make a positive change for communities in Malawi

missionStatement: At Humanists UK, we want a tolerant world where rational thinking and kindness prevail. We work to support lasting change for a better society, championing ideas for the one life we have.
description: Humanists UK: Think for yourself, act for everyone.

name: Unitarians MDA
missionStatement: Unitarians MDA - Working with various charities througout the UK

description: help us give animals a voice, and help a small charity make a big difference

name: Burma Aid
missionStatement: We are a non-profit, non-political, humanitarian relief organisation. Our team have ties with Myanmar either through birth or family. Burma Aid will aim to improve the present condition of the people living in Myanmar and and help rebuild the lives of Rohingya Refugees.
description: Monies raised will help us to provide a better life to those in need in Burma.

name: Book at Bedtime
missionStatement: Book at Bedtime provide a bookcase full of new and secondhand children's books in great condition into women's refuges throughout the UK.  This gives children who have experienced very frightening situations books that they can escape into.  If they have a favourite they can keep it as a gift when they leave and we top up the bookcase. We also provide a set of books & toys that the children's workers use 1:1 with the children to help them deal with their emotions and their experience of domestic abuse.
description: Do you remember escaping into a book when upset?  Provide this for children in refuges.

name: Bike for Good
missionStatement: Established in April 2010, Bike for Good is now the largest bike recycling organisation in Glasgow and Edinburgh. Our organisation offer adult and kids refurbished bicycles as well as cycle training, mechanic training, Fix Your Own Bike session and free Dr Bikes to the communities. We also teach Bikeability to local schools. Unemployed people, refugees and asylum seekers as well as ex-offenders use our service to learn new skills and to become professional bicycle mechanics.
description: Every penny will help us supply bikes to a child in need.

name: Action Against Abduction
missionStatement:
We have created Clever Never Goes - the replacement for Stranger Danger
Our goals are to ensure that:
The UK has the right policy and practice to prevent child abduction, and achieve the best outcomes when children are abducted.
Parents and professionals have the most effective strategies and resources to keep children safe.
We have a reliable and up-to-date understanding of the nature and scale of child abduction.
description: Help us give parents and teachers a proven replacement for Stranger Danger.

name: Willen Hospice
missionStatement:
Willen Hospice is a registered charity that provides specialist care for people whose illness no longer responds to curative treatment (also known as specialist palliative care).
We provide care for people from the age of 18 years upwards and work in Milton Keynes and the surrounding areas. Willen Hospice provides services to three Primary Care Trusts - Milton Keynes, Bedfordshire & Northamptonshire. The Hospice is based at a quiet lakeside area close to the City Centre.

name: Shine Youth Music Theatre
missionStatement:
Shine Youth Music Theatre is a charitable not for profit organisation based in Carluke, South Lanarkshire. Shine was established as a community musical theatre group for children in Primary 4 and above. From small beginnings the group grew in every way possible to what is now one of Scotland's largest youth theatre companies.

Our aim is to provide a safe and positive environment which supports young people, enhancing their self-esteem and to provide a purposeful and challenging environment for members.
description: providing a safe and positive environment which supports young people.

name: The Lute Society
missionStatement: The Lute Society, founded in 1956, exists to spread information about the lute and its music, with courses, playing days, concerts, speaker meetings, a magazine, an academic journal, plans and sheet music.
description: Help us share the gentle music of a bygone age.

name: LICC Ltd
missionStatement: LICC is a Christian organisation dedicated to equipping Christians with teaching and resources on contemporary issues, helping them to make a difference in the world, wherever God has placed them.
description: We equip Christians to make a difference, wherever they are...

name: Bristol Festivals
missionStatement:
Bristol Festivals is a registered charity that promotes, supports and develops the extraordinary festivals and events that happen in Bristol every year. In this climate of increasing economic and political uncertainty, work that supports these typically small and under-resourced organisations is more important than ever.

With your help, we can work with festivals across Bristol to tackle huge challenges faced by the sector around skills retention, career access, audience access and evidenced advocacy.
description: Help us support a vibrant programme of festivals in Bristoi.

name: BOUNCE! Brighter Futures Foundation
missionStatement: We provide mental health support services to children, families and educational staff in primary school communities.

Our project work currently includes film & other creative-based youthwork courses, a foodbank, a choir for those affected by dementia, support of refugees & asylum seekers, retorative justice courses & support of ex-offenders, and much more.

name: The Royal Society for the Protection of Birds (RSPB)
missionStatement: Everyone working together to help give nature a home. We will use our expertise to identify threats to wildlife and natural places, and then work with our supporters, governments, partners and people of every generation to deliver the answers. If we are taking care of nature we are taking care of ourselves and future generations.

The David Shepherd Wildlife Foundation (DSWF) is a highly effective wildlife conservation charity supporting a range of innovative and far reaching projects to protect endangered wildlife and their habitats from the impacts of wildlife crime.

We fight wildlife crime, protect endangered species and engage with communities across Africa and Asia.

missionStatement: The SIA is the national organisation for spinal cord injured people. Every year in the UK over 1,000 people experience a spinal cord injury, most resulting in paralysis. name: Cats Protection
missionStatement:
Our vision is a world where every cat is treated 
with kindness and an understanding of its needs.

All money raised goes towards funding projects at Hockerill Anglo European College, Bishops Stortford

name: Cat & Rabbit Rescue Centre

Educate the public in responsible pet ownership. Eliminate indiscriminate breeding by encouraging the neutering of all pets, including pedigrees. Advise and help the public in the humane control of feral cats.

missionStatement: The Foundation’s ethos is typified by a determination to create opportunities for society’s most vulnerable and marginalised groups – principally, we address root causes of poverty by equipping individuals with the tools and means to reverse inequality.

name: Emmaus UK

Emmaus is a homelessness charity with a difference, providing a stable home and meaningful work to people who have experienced homelessness and social exclusion.

We support more than 765 people at our 29 Emmaus communities across the UK, providing them with a home for as long as they need it, as well as meaningful work in our social enterprises, selling secondhand and upcycled furniture.

This combination of home and work helps the people we support to find a long term route out of homelessness.

missionStatement:
At PDSA, saving, protecting and healing pets is what we’re all about. We are dedicated to improving pet wellbeing in three very special ways – by educating owners, preventing disease and carrying out life-saving operations.

Pets are part of the family. Our four-legged friends give unconditional love and are sometimes a person’s only companion. They don’t deserve to suffer through economic and social hardship. 

They can’t help themselves. But we can – with your help.

Fiona & Martin earn their living elsewhere (Fiona is a retained fire-fighter & Martin works for a Bank

Each year we rescue, rehabilitate and rehome around 1,000 cats and kittens from across Edinburgh and the Lothians.

missionStatement:
Kay's Endeavours will act as a support fund for cancer patients. It will offer grants to adults who have a cancer diagnosis and are being treated at St Bartholomew's Hospital. 
The charity's aim is to provide funding for measures which will improve the quality of life for the patient and to address any gaps in the support already available. The charity was set up in memory of our much loved friend Kay Everett who had cancer. Registered Charity Number 1173531
description: We want to help cancer patients to have a better quality of life.

name: Shine
missionStatement:
SHINE stands for Social, Health, Inner, Natural and Economic wellbeing. We believe that people need to thrive in all these areas for a fulfilled life.
We are a community-hub in West Bowling that reaches the socially excluded, brings the community together, and delivers a wide range of life-enhancing services and opportunities to people of all ages, faiths and ethnicities. It seeks to create a new story for West Bowling, that binds people together and helps restore our community in body, soul and spirit.
description: Our goal is to build a vibrant and healthy community in West Bowling.

name: Halo Leisure Services Ltd
missionStatement: Halo is a charity & social enterprise running community leisure centres to 'Create Healthier Communities'. All our profits are reinvested back into our services & facilities. Everything we do supports more local people from babies to seniors to get more active more often - especially those who find exercise a challenge...
description: Support our future as a provider of community leisure; help us to reopen.

name: Ardstraw Football Club
missionStatement: Ardstraw Youth and Community Forum enables the community to actively participate in the sport of football, promotes health, education within sport, integration and social cohesion. These are achieved by offering the services of qualified coaches, necessary equipment and appropriate facilities. The club have a core purpose in the promotion of amateur sports participation and operate strictly on a non-profit making basis, and re-invest any profits in the sports club.
description: The club have a core purpose in the promotion of amateur sports participation

name: Downlands Trust
missionStatement: We raise funds for investment into the local Surrey countryside and chalk downland by the provision of grants to local conservation projects. We aim to promote the conservation, protection and improvement of the countryside and to encourage access to the countryside for all. We strive to promote the health and social benefits of becoming involved in local practical conservation work groups and to advance the education of the public in the conservation and management of the physical and natural environment.
description: Please help us! Dwindling public funding represents a major threat to chalk grassland. .

name: Chabad Lubavitch of Birmingham Campuses Ltd
missionStatement:
We aim to increase inspiration and knowledge of Judaism through educational classes, and individual tuition and discussion.   We promote social cohesion through Sabbath, Holyday, and Festival meals and hospitality in a warm home environment.
We contribute to the good mental health of our participants through advice counselling and social events, and to their physical health through such hospitality including kosher meal delivery to those homebound due to sickness. These services are available to all.
description: Support Jewish Student and Communal life in Birmingham! Provide a home away from home!

name: CYMDEITHAS Y CYMOD YNG NGHYMRU/FELLOWSHIP OF RECONCILIATION IN WALES
missionStatement: Cymdeithas y Cymod (Fellowship of Reconciliation) is a spiritually-based movement that believes in the power of love and truth to create justice and restore community, and is committed to active non-violence as a way of life and as a means of transformation - personal, social, economic and political
description: We are a grassroots organisation campaigning for peace and justice in Wales and everywhere

name: Banchory Primary PTA
missionStatement: The Banchory Primary PTA is a charitable organisation which helps to fundraise and organise events for the children and families of Banchory Primary School.
description: We are raising funds for a number of improvement initiatives for play and learning

name: The Mary How Trust for Cancer Prevention
missionStatement:
Our mission is to make health screenings and healthy living advice available to all, ensuring the widest benefit to the community. 

Our heartfelt wish is to help people stay well through prevention and early detection of serious illness. 

Each screening costs us 305 pounds and we receive no NHS funding.

***PLEASE ENSURE YOUR NAME IS ON YOUR DONATION & LET US KNOW IF YOU ARE A UK TAXPAYER AS WE CAN GIFT AID YOUR DONATION*** Thank you!
description: We’re a small charity and entirely donor-supported. Your donations make an amazing impact.

name: Europa PTA
missionStatement:
Europa PTA is the parent teacher association at Europa School UK, a unique state-funded 'free school' in Oxfordshire, offering a broad bilingual / Baccalaureate education to pupils from 4-18. 

Our object is to advance the education of the pupils, in particular by:

i) Developing effective relationships between the staff, parents and others associated with the school.

ii) Engaging in activities or providing facilities or equipment which support the school and advance the education of the pupils.
description: Advancing the education of the pupils at a unique state funded bilingual IB school.

name: The Parochial Church Council of the Ecclesiastical Parish of St Thomas, Brampton, Chesterfield
missionStatement: At St Thomas' our vision is to be a church family that lives out Jesus' Great Commission to be a church of 'disciples making disciples' (Matthew 28:16-20). We are a church that is passionate about Jesus and his desire to transform lives. We love people and seeing them grow in faith and in relationship with God. We are committed to our local community and being a beacon to our town and beyond.
description: We are a church of disciples reaching out to our community with God's love.

name: Bleakholt Animal Sanctuary
missionStatement: Rescue and rehoming centre in a large mixed Animal Sanctuary.

name: Thames Hospice
missionStatement:
Thames Hospice is the local charity for people living in East Berkshire and South Buckinghamshire.   We provide expert medical, nursing and therapeutic care to adults who have a life-limiting illness - and their families and carers. 
It costs more than 7 million every year to keep our Hospice running.  We rely on 80 per cent of our income from charitable donations, which enables us to provide our services free of charge, 365 days a year, to the people who need us.

name: Dr Kershaw's Hospice
missionStatement: Dr Kershaws Hospice provides specialist palliative care for patients with non curable, life limiting illnesses in a peaceful and homely environment. Our services include, a 24 hour inpatient unit, Hospice at Home, Caring Hands and our Well Being Centre. All services provided are free of charge and costs 8500 pounds per day to run. Your support is enabling us to continue providing this unique care to our patients and their families.
description: Help us to raise 2.3 million pounds per year.

name: Nurture A Child
missionStatement: Nurture A Child provides support and assistance to young people to enable them to achieve their goals and aims
description: Young people deserve the right to flourish

name: Avon Cat Rescue
missionStatement: We are a small cat rescue charity, founded in the 1960s. Our rescue centre is based in a picturesque village in South Warwickshire, although our activities extend to neighbouring counties.

name: The Salvation Army
missionStatement: We are a local expression of The Salvation Army, a worldwide Christian church which puts its faith into action by offering practical help for people without discrimination, standing up for those who are vulnerable, fighting against injustice and encouraging people to deepen their relationship with God.  Responding to the local realities of life, we offer a variety of community services and work closely with other agencies to identify and support the most vulnerable within our community .

name: Ganet's Adventure School Fund
missionStatement:
Ganet's Adventure School Fund is a small UK charity run 100% by volunteers to support Ganet's Adventure School, a small primary school with big ideas, teaching around 200 children in rural Malawi. 

The school receives no government funding, and relies on support from around the world to keep it running. It was founded by its director Gertrude Banda in 2004, and in 2011 won a Pan African Award for Entrepreneurship in Education.
description: Just 5 pounds enables a child to learn at our school for a month!

name: Lehatzliach - (Helping every child succeed)            Registered Charity No. 1166641
missionStatement: To provide children who have learning difficulties with an individually tailored educational programme whilst allowing them to retain access to their mainstream setting. The programme is for children with SEN who perceive themselves as - and want to be part of - the mainstream population. With social integration, pupils are enabled to become productive and independent adults within the community.
description: Give these children a chance in life and help them reach their full potential..

name: THE TABERNACLE GLOBAL MINISTRIES
missionStatement: The Tabernacle affectionately known as "The Tab" Church is in Lewisham, South East London.  It is a trans-generational and multi-cultural church standing as a 21st Century church positively impacting the generation in which we live with a real message of hope and help for people through our very real God. A strong part of  our DNA is "people helping people" through REACH, our community action initiative, with a direct focus on practical ways to help bring restoration,  empowerment and community help
description: Help The Tab in creating a community support hub in the heart of Lewisham

name: The Cookie Jar Foundation
missionStatement: We are a family run charity set up in memory of our late son, Christopher, who lost his 2 year fight against Hodgkin's Lymphoma at the age of 19.  Over the last 2 years we have funded 13 vein finders for local hospitals, donated money to Maggie's Young Persons Group in Edinburgh and helped numerous families with funding. We are a bespoke charity with community links.
description: The Cookie Jar works with a local community in order to give something back

name: Shivia
missionStatement: Shivia works with families living in poverty in rural India.  We provide the tools and training for people to start their own income-generating enterprises from home. Focusing on farming and agriculture, our programmes enable people to start earning a regular income and provide a brighter future for their children.  Our flagship programme empowers women in particular, providing them with the capacity to earn their own money from raising chickens and selling the produce. Visit us at shivia.com
description: Your donation could help a women in poverty start earning money from raising chickens

name: Derbyshire Cave Rescue Organisation
missionStatement: DCRO are a Volunteer Cave Rescue Team, on call 24/7 to provide specialist underground search and rescue to those in need, in support of the Police and other emergency services
description: Help our Volunteers save lives, even a small donation will help keep us operational

name: Bernard's Acre
missionStatement: Bernards Acre is located in an ideal spot for families, walking, church or youth groups to stay in self-catering chalet style accommodation near the village of Belstone in Devon.  Less than ten minutes for the A30, yet at the foot of some of the highest and wildest parts of Dartmoor, Bernards Acre has an unrivalled setting. the Centre can accommodate 24 in 6 bedrooms with the option of 3 group camping pitches and a hookup for a camper van.
description: We aim to provide a quality, low cost self-catering facility to further Christianity

name: Search for Common Ground UK
missionStatement: Conflict is inevitable, violence is not. Search for Common Ground works in 35 war- and conflict- torn countries around the world, to give people the tools to resolve conflict peacefully. Building new cultures of peace takes decades - Search is there for the long term, employing local people, and working at all levels of society from the grassroots to government leaders, to build and embed the tools for peaceful conflict transformation. Get involved in our innovative and transformational work: www. sfcg.org
description: Conflict is inevitable, violence is not. Support Search to build a more peaceful world.

name: PAPAA
missionStatement: PAPAA  is a national registered charity dedicated to helping people with psoriasis and psoriatic arthritis. As a patient-centred organisation, we put those most in need at the heart of our work by providing a positive approach that enables people to be involved in an informed way as they move through their healthcare journey.  We help people understand and manage psoriasis and psoriatic arthritis by providing access to free information, extensive advice and support via a website and printed material.
description: Supporting & helping people with psoriasis/psoriatic arthritis to take a positive approach

name: Sturge Weber UK
missionStatement: We are a registered charity supporting families. 1016688
description: We fund a Family Weekend Conference and support research into the syndrome

name: Stray Cat Rescue
missionStatement: Stray cats have often had a very difficult life. They have to survive hunger, harsh weather, preganancy, disease and injury. Abandoned cats have their whole world turned upside down when they go from a loving home to a shelter. Our aim is to rescue, rehabilitate and rehome these cats. We have a policy to ensure that no cat in our care is put down except in extreme cases of illness or injury, with veterinary advice

name: Tithe Barn Trust
missionStatement: The Tithe Barn Trust has been set up to restore a medieval tithe barn in the centre of historic Landbeach village in Cambridgeshire UK. It is a precious piece of history of enormous local and possibly national significance. The Trust is bringing it back into use for the local community and as a learning resource for the wider community. The Tithe Barn Trust's first immediate aim is to repair the roof structure and rethatch the roof to protect the structure for future generations.
description: Please help restore a precious piece of medieval history before it is lost forever. Thanks

name: The 2 Minute Foundation
missionStatement: The 2 Minute Foundation is devoted to cleaning up our planet 2 minutes at a time.  Our campaigns use social media and direct action to inspire and enable individuals, groups and businesses to make simple changes or take part in simple actions that will contribute to the planet's well-being, as well as their own.  We have a network of beach cleaning, litter picking and street cleaning stations that make it easier for people to take action against litter.
description: Your donation will help us to clean up our planet 2 minutes at a time

name: Shenley Christian Fellowship
missionStatement: The Oak Tree Centre is the home of Shenley Christian Fellowship & Phase 1 is complete. Phase 2 will provide an additional needed resource to serve the local community; incorporating a 400-seat auditorium, which doubles up as a major sports hall, for local people to play sports. It also intends to have a youth centre area. This element is a direct result of the outcomes of community door-to-door surveys carried out locally, complementing the work of our youth staff members and volunteers.
description: Phase 2 of The Oak Tree Centre will provide a much needed local community resource.

name: Love Praise Church of Christ
missionStatement:
CRN: 1088177 -
We offer people a safe place to come to receive help and support, a listening ear for the discouraged and depressed, food for those who do not have, activities and entertainment for children and encouragement and hope to overcome and have a positive future outlook. Done through practical, educational and biblical teachings from the Bible.  Our free adult learn to read classes, opens the door for the less privileged adults to be educated for personal and employment benefits.
description: Community Outreach, Feed the Poor, Offer a Helping Hand, Free Adult Learn to Read Classes

name: Mayday Trust
missionStatement:
Life can have its ups and downs. When tough times happen, we often know what we need to get through. But it's not always possible to access what we need or it can take us down a path we don't feel is right for us. This can make the situation worse. It can feel like we don't have any choice or control.

Often what we need is someone to listen and walk alongside us as we find our way out of our situation. Mayday provides Person-led, Transitional, Strength-based (PTS) Coaches that do just this.
description: Every donation helps us to create a positive change for people going through tough times

name: Bungay Arts & Theatre Society
missionStatement: The Fisher Theatre is a registered not-for-profit charity and receives no on-going revenue funding. The running costs of the building, productions, staffing and maintenance are met solely from income generated by the activities in the theatre and donations made by our supporters. The Fisher Theatre Bungay, is a professional producing and receiving theatre and thriving entertainment and event space in Suffolk.
description: We are a registered not-for-profit charity and receives no on-going revenue funding.

name: Juvenis
missionStatement: Juvenis is an exciting charity offering bespoke support and training enabling young people involved or at risk of criminal involvement to turn around their lives and (re)engage with education, employment, or training
description: A future where all young Londoners have more than one chance to fulfil their potential

name: Little John's House
missionStatement: A secure home for children with special needs in Romania. Founded in 1994, Little Johns House supports children and young adults from the poorest backgrounds, in both homes and orphanages, to give them hope for their futures.
description: Help to provide a better future for children and young adults less fortunate than you

name: LBJ Community Forum
missionStatement:
The LBJ Forum work to support and engage the local community in various ways: 
#Providing space to meet and engage, continuing to ensure the Lowedges Community Centre remains open and usable by the whole community.
#Being a facilitator, supporting and enabling other organisations and groups to deliver services and activities locally, such as adult learning and hosting the local Valley Park Family Centre. 
#Being a voice and holding services to account, such as roads and highways.
#Being a listener
description: We are currently aiming to raise funds to create a community play garden for children

name: Mango Tree Goa
missionStatement: Mango Tree Goa supports is an education based charity. We support disadvantaged children in Goa through the provision of pre-primary schools and afternoon tuition classes. Because we know good nutrition is essential to help children develop and learn we provide daily meals for all children too.
description: Please help children find their way out of poverty. Your support can change a life

name: Caring Matters Now UK
missionStatement: Caring Matters Now is the UK charity supporting those effected by Congenital Melanocytic Naevi (CMN) - a genetic condition, consisting of a dark brown hairy birthmark covering up to 80% of the body.  The condition can also grow internally, which in the worse cases can be fatal.
description: Support those effected by CMN and fund pioneering research to find a cure for CMN.

name: Help Finder
missionStatement: Help Finder offer a number of services to those in need. Our first services to those who are street-based allowing them to get food, drink, clean clothes, essentials. We offer a parcel service encompassing food, furniture, electricals, kids toys and anything we have available to households who need help.
description: Help Finder supports the most vulnerable people in society facing a wide range of issues.

name: London Euphonia Orchestra
missionStatement:
The London Euphonia Orchestra is a fun, diverse group of talented classical musicians from a huge range of backgrounds and nationalities, reflecting London's traditional inclusivity and inventiveness. 

We are immersed in London's culture and strive to play an active part in that scene, with varied and interesting concerts several times a year and more informal play-days for fun in between, along with charitable community events. 

All players and audiences are most welcome!
description: THANK YOU for helping to keep the LEO playing. See you at a concert soon!

name: Womankind Worldwide
missionStatement: We're a global women's rights organisation. We work with women's rights organisations and movements to change the world for women and girls. Our job is to support the women who are powering other women around the world. Because we know that when women come together, they have the power to change their own lives.
description: Stand with us as we make equal rights a reality for all women and girls

name: Friends of Urambo and Mwanhala
missionStatement:
For over 50 years FUM has supported rural communities in the Tabora Region of Tanzania, around Urambo, Nzega and Sikonge townships.
Health: we support two hospitals and eleven rural clinics that we have built in remote areas.
Education: poor students at 3 rural crafts colleges (FDCs) receive bursaries. 120 poor and orphaned students at Imeli primary school in Nzega receive bursaries to enable them to attend secondary school.
Water: we aim to provide a reliable source of clean water at each of our sites
description: Support FUM and help poor, rural Tanzanians to a better life. Visit us at  www.fum.org.uk

name: Dronfest
missionStatement: We are a charity Music Festival that raises funds for groups and charities in the local community. Over the years we have raised almost 70k which has been donated to very worthy causes that provide help and support for the local community.
description: We run a local community event that relies solely on sponsorship and donations to operate.

name: ENABLE Scotland
missionStatement:
ENABLE Scotland is the largest charity in Scotland dedicated to creating an equal society for every person who has a learning disability.
 
We are a membership-led organisation that campaigns, fundraises, and supports people to live good lives as valued members of their community.
description: Help us to build an equal society for every person who has a learning disability

name: Soundabout
missionStatement: Soundabout unlocks the potential of children, young people and adults with severe, profound and multiple learning disabilities by helping them to develop their ability to interact with the world around them through music and sound. Since lockdown we have moved many of our community music making sessions online enabling us to reach many more families living in increased isolation with many of their support structures stripped away.
description: It's Soundabout's 25th anniversary: a gift from you would help us tremendously in our work

name: Anukampa Bhikkhuni Project
missionStatement:
Anukampa Bhikkhuni Project aims to promote the teachings and practices of Early Buddhism, through establishing a Bhikkhuni presence in the UK.
Our long term aspiration is to develop a monastery with a harmonious and meditative atmosphere, for women who wish to train towards full ordination.
We will raise enthusiasm and funds for this project by organising retreats, talks and discussion groups, that present the Buddha's teachings in an authentic, relevant and accessible way.
description: To develop a monastery in UK for women who wish to train towards full ordination.

name: The Hepworth Wakefield Garden Trust
missionStatement: The Hepworth Wakefield have been working with renowned garden designer Tom Stuart-Smith to transform our outdoor site from unused land into a beautiful free public garden, featuring outdoor sculptures. As a living composition, it requires daily, labour intensive care and attention from our Cultural Gardener, Katy Merrington. Your donation can help ensure our Garden thrives so that it continues to be a vital resource to all our visitors.
description: THW are raising £10,000 to help maintain our Garden, a vital resource for all visitors.

name: East London Out Project
missionStatement: ELOP is a LGBT mental health & wellbeing charity  which provides a spectrum of support services including: individual & couples counselling, mental health crisis prevention & intervention, mental wellbeing workshops, support groups, befriending, community events, forum & activities, an asylum service, a youth service and family support, along with training workshops & programmes for schools, public & corporate sectors.
description: Help LGBT+ people access quality, life-changing mental health support at a time of need

name: Larne YMCA
missionStatement: Larne YMCA is a pioneering voluntary agency serving communities and individuals with a range of innovative and holistic services for young people, adults, and families. Established in 1982 it offers services in the Larne community from its purpose-built center. All programmes reflect the key commitments of: Promoting Youth Development, Promoting Healthy Living and Promoting Community Engagement,
description: Providing a range of services for young people and families within the local Larne Area

name: Green Paw Project
missionStatement:
Veterinary Care
course there are parts of the world where people are fortunate enough to have easy access to veterinary care. Sadly there are also many groups of people to whom such a privilege is completely alien. All over the globe there are animals in need of help and professional care. Green Paw Project goes where veterinary care is needed most and set up a temporary, free veterinary clinic for all local wild and domestic animals.
description: We want to help all animals across the globe by offering free veterinary care

name: Four Paws Animal Rescue
missionStatement: We are a small independent charity who try to help any animal in need - those that are unwanted or in danger. Primarily, however, we tend to take in and rehome dogs, which is where our expertise is. However, when we do receive cats and other small animals. We pride ourselves in a non-destruction policy and as far as possible we try to foster dogs in a home environment where they can be assessed before rehoming.
description: Help us to keep saving lives

name: All Creatures Great and Small
missionStatement: The sanctuary rescues injured, abused and abandoned animals. We also run a rehabilitation and re-homing programme for domesticated pets.
description: We rely solely on donations and support from the public and receive no government funding.

name: Animal Welfare Furness
missionStatement: We are a local charity operating in the South Cumbria area run by a committee of volunteers. We protect and provide sanctuary for unwanted and distressed animals until loving new homes are found. We also facilitate neutering and micro-chipping services.

name: Support Our Paras
missionStatement: SUPPORT OUR PARAS is a charity which supports The Parachute Regiment and Airborne Forces through the welfare of serving soldiers and families and those affected by recent operations and through the maintenance of its Regimental efficiency, ethos, spirit and heritage.
description: Support our serving Para soldiers and their families

name: Serbian Orthodox Church of Saint Sava
missionStatement: Serbian Orthodox Church of St Sava London - GENERAL CHARITABLE PURPOSES. PROMOTION OF SERBIAN ORTHODOX RELIGION. PROVIDING HUMAN RESOURCES, FACILITIES AND ADVICE.
description: Make a difference

name: Norfolk and Norwich Send Association
missionStatement: NANSA was founded in 1954 by a group of families whose children had been diagnosed with cerebral palsy. They found a vital need for locally-based, core support services; for them, their children & other families in Norfolk. Demand for support has grown ever since. NANSA now supports people across a range of age groups with very varied physical, learning and sensory disabilities, working in close partnership with many organisations Norfolk-wide, and is a locally recognised as a provider of quality services.

name: Madania Welfare Trust
missionStatement: At Madania Welfare Trust, we facilitate many projects, from building a well so a whole village has access to clean water for life to providing schools with the books that will empower their youth. Help us to help others, and allow them the chance to build a better future.
description: Help us build a better future.

name: Special Needs Older Rabbits Sanctuary
missionStatement: SNORS is a charity dedicated to providing palliative care to special needs or older rabbits. We give rabbits that cannot be rehomed in rescue centres a home for life releasing spaces for more healthy rabbits to be rehomed. We provide excellent facilities, veterinary care and companionship for their remaining days.

name: George House Trust
missionStatement: George House Trust has been providing HIV support, advice and advocacy services to improve health outcomes since 1985. We are a service user centred organisation, with a diverse team of highly trained and knowledgeable staff and volunteers.
description: No one should have to face HIV alone. Help people living with HIV live happy healthy lives

name: Leigh Caring Kitchen t/a The Bridge at Leigh
missionStatement:
The Bridge at Leigh is a Social Supermarket and Community Cafe who collect perfectly good excess food before it goes to waste and offer to our community members at affordable prices so they can feed their families.
We also offer advice, wellness, activities, support and accommodation for people in need as a way to improve their lives. Building Bridges to a Better Future

name: The Excellent Adventure Sanctuary
missionStatement: TEAS provides a sanctuary for guinea pigs with ongoing medical needs - primarily dental - working in conjunction with an exceptional vet in this field.  Our work ensures animals can live a good quality of life and receive the care they need, whereas otherwise they would have had to be put to sleep.  We sometimes have healthy pigs come into our care, for which we strive to find caring forever homes.  We are a unique charity in what we do!
description: Our guinea pigs need you!  Help us to help them!

name: The Last Night A DJ Saved My Life Foundation
missionStatement:
As a foundation we create initiatives to support children in crisis. 

Some of our activities include building wells in Africa & India, supporting a special needs children village in Tanzania, funding cleft palate operations for children in the Philippines, providing musical equipment to various projects around the world.

By supporting small projects we are able to show donors the difference their donations make.

See our website for further information -www.lastnightadjsavedmylife.org
description: Donate & support children in crisis

name: 4thechildren
missionStatement:
4thechildren is primarily concerned with the safety, welfare and human rights of children in the UK, by collaborating with local communities & schools through relief and development programmes.
Our main focus is underprivileged children from low-income families and refugee children.
Additionally, we aim to provide a level of support for their families.
4TC works wherever the need is greatest, irrespective of colour, creed, status or religion.
description: We work closely with UK schools to identify and support underprivileged & refugee children

name: 1st Worthington Guides
missionStatement: 1st Worthington Guides is a small village unit within Girlguiding UK. We are a group of 10-14 year olds working towards a common goal - to do our best. We care for our community, the world and our environment.
description: Help 1st Worthington Guides benefit from a varied programme of activities.

name: LBT Global Limited
missionStatement:
Supporting families of missing persons abroad, and the victims of families suffering a serious crime overseas. We help with murder, manslaughter, assault, sexual crime and much more.
Providing financial assistance, practical support, discounted or free travel, help with legal procedures and emotional support.
Formed after the death of Lucie Blackman in Tokyo in 2000. We provide the answers and problem solving families facing the unthinkable need.
description: Please help us be there for families facing a death or missing person overseas. Thank you

name: SOUTHBANK CENTRE LIMITED
missionStatement: Southbank Centre is a world renowned multi arts-centre on the South Bank of the Thames. We passionately believe the arts improve lives and so should be available to everyone  - and this lies at the heart of all we do. We partner with schools who do not have the means to provide music or art lessons. "from working on an opera with Marin Alsop to meeting Russell Brand. There are too many things - big and small - to write about, and it has had a transformative effect".  Teacher at Heathbrook School
description: You can make a world of difference, helping us ensure that art really is for everyone.

name: Sapurd-e-Khuda
missionStatement: Sapurd-e-Khuda is a Charity which is providing all basic needs and funds to finish Child Labours in the world. It is helping these child labours to start their education and make them a respectful member of our Society. It is also Providing Free Legal Consultancy to our children against child abuse and bring relief for Child Labours. Every year we help thousands of children get an education by providing School Fees, School Books, School stationery, Free Food allowance and Free Legal Consultancy.
description: The money, you donate today could protect a child from Labour work and dangers like abuse
