name: New Spring Trust
missionStatement: A Holy Spirit led healing ministry who heal us from all kinds of limitations and ailments resulting from buried memories of hurts often received in early childhood.
description: A Holy Spirit led healing of memories to those who have received hurts in their lives

name: NATIONS TOGETHER
missionStatement:
Nations Together aids Social Inclusion and acceptance for adults with Learning difficulties living in Tanzania, East Africa.

Offering service users a safe space where they are valued and supported to reach their utmost potential
description: Help us to empower, enable and educate not just services users but communities as a whole

name: ANOOPAM MISSION LIMITED
missionStatement: Anoopam Mission believes in serving God by serving humanity. Through the vision of its respected spiritual leader, Guruvarya Param Pujya Sahebji, Anoopam Mission has committed itself to working in the areas of Health, Education, Relief, Rehabilitation, Social welfare, Spiritual and Cultural activities. The aim is to help those who need it the most, without any discrimination of caste, creed, colour, gender or religion.
description: Please help us build our New Temple for a better future for our Net Generation Community

name: Oakley Preschool
missionStatement: Oakley Pre-school is a charity parent run organisation which has been operating for over 50 years.  We provide Ofsted recognised 'Outstanding' quality childcare for the village and surrounding community for all children between the ages of 2 and 4 of every ethnic minority, religion and race.  We encourage each child to develop and flourish in a happy, supportive and secure environment, enabling them to be confident, challenged and successful and to the have high self-esteem.
description: To build a new facility suitable for the health & safety needs of all children and staff.

name: Dancers Development Fund Ltd
missionStatement: The DDF works to promote and further the art of dance and movement science and performance to young people and the public in general.
description: We need funds to help young people to access training for a career in the theatre

name: 2nd Beeston Seascouts
missionStatement: Based on Lilac Grove in Beeston, and with their own Water Activity Centre located on Barton Island in the River Trent, the Group is uniquely placed to offer a wide range of adventurous activites for young people boys and girls aged 6 to 18.
description: As well as a beaver, Cub and Scout section, and linked to Discovery Explorer Scout Unit

name: Tz Rising
missionStatement: Tz Rising is dedicated to empowering our girls with Secondary and College Education, giving them the tools to live incredible lives in joy, not fear.
description: GET INVOLVED.... do something special, have a bit of fun and raise some dosh for us!

name: RSPCA Barnsley & District Branch
missionStatement: The RSPCA as a charity will, by all lawful means, prevent cruelty, promote kindness to and alleviate suffering of all animals.

name: Spitalfields Farm Association Ltd
missionStatement: Spitalfields City Farm brings the countryside to the city, providing education and environmental opportunities to local communities in a relaxed and enjoyable way.The Farm challenges people to respect themselves, each other, their environment and animals. The Farm strives to be sustainable and leads by example.
description: Help the Farm to remain a community space that inspires and that everyone can enjoy!

name: Edward's Trust
missionStatement: Edwards Trust provides vital support to families facing traumatic bereavement. We support parents who have lost a child, and children and young people who are bereaved of a parent, significant carer, sibling or friend. We receive over 850 new referrals annually and support over 3,000 families every year in a variety of ways, including counselling, Wellbeing therapies, group work and retreats. We constantly fundraise so we can keep our services free and accessible for all.
description: Help us support families through traumatic bereavement and give them hope for the future

name: CAMBRIDGESHIRE EAST GUIDES
missionStatement: The Jarman Centre is owned by Girlguiding Cambridgeshire East and is managed by a team of volunteers. We offer residential opportunities for young people of all abilities, challenging them to be independent, to learn team-building skills and giving them the chance to enjoy and appreciate the outdoors on our safe eighteen-acre woodland estate.
description: Help young people make a world of their own at the Jarman Centre

name: Welsh Highland Railway Limited
missionStatement: We operate a narrow gauge steam railway in Porthmadog, opposite the national railway station, preserving and showcasing the North Wales Narrow Gauge railways of the early 1900's. Volunteer run, we own and operate "Russell" built 1906, the only surviving steam locomotive of the Welsh Highland Railway, which we have recently restored to running order. Volunteer run, we have a small fleet of steam and diesel locomotives and original rolling stock, plus a museum showcasing the slate railways of North Wales.
description: We are a volunteer run heritage railway, safeguarding the North Wales industrial era.

name: CATS PROTECTION BARNSTAPLE & DISTRICT BRANCH
missionStatement: Our vision is to ensure that every cat is given the chance of a life where it will be treated with kindness and an understanding of its needs.
description: Every penny raised goes towards taking care of needy cats & kittens

name: St Helena Hospice Ltd
missionStatement: St Helena exists to meet the physical, emotional and spiritual needs of people with life-limiting illness, in North East Essex, no matter what their diagnosis. All service are free of charge to patients and their families, so every penny donated really can make a difference

name: PRO DOGS DIRECT REHOMING
missionStatement: Rescue and re home unwanted and abandoned dogs all over the uk.  We are foster based and avoid using kennels where possible.  We ensure all vet work is undertaken prior to being re homed.
description: We need your help to continue to make a difference to the dogs,  give them hope and help.

name: Cat Concern
missionStatement: We rescue, neuter and re-home unwanted and stray cats in Lanarkshire and Glasgow.  We aim to help cats of all ages and temperaments.
description: We are a small self-funding charity. We have lots of cats and need help with vet bills.

name: CARLA LANE ANIMALS IN NEED
missionStatement: We are an Animal Rescue Centre based in Melling, Liverpool. We Rescue Rehabilitate and Rehome Dogs, Cats and other animals. We have a no destruction policy..
description: Please help us to save more animals!

name: InterAct Stroke Support
missionStatement: To improve the speed and quality of stroke rehabilitation by the provision of a reading service.  Post stroke depression and a lack of neural stimulation can slow or arrest recovery, we work to tackle these problems.

name: Stable Life
missionStatement: We support disadvantaged young people aged 10 to 18 and their families in the Scottish Borders who are experiencing personal challenges in their lives.  Working together using the horse and its environment, we help these young people with social, emotional and behavioural issues to succeed, discover a sense of self, build resilience, learn transferable life skills, reengage with mainstream education, increase social inclusion, look to a healthier and happier future with dreams and aspirations.
description: Help us to give our young people a hand to hold, a heart to heal and a horse to hug.

name: CancerCare North Lancashire & South Cumbria
missionStatement: CancerCare is a charity supporting people affected by cancer or bereavement across North Lancashire & South Cumbria. Around 93% of our work is funded by people like you who donate, fundraise or give a gift in their Will.

name: The Junction Church
missionStatement: Will you prayerfully consider supporting the Junction Church? Your giving would be much appreciated. Resources are always challenging for a pioneer church like ours, so it would be a massive encouragement to us to know that you are standing with us as we seek to establish a brand new church.
description: The Junction Church is not built on the gifts of a few but on the sacrifice of many

name: Kingfisher Canoe Club
missionStatement: Promote healthy recreation, in particular the sport of canoeing, for both adults and youth in the Abingdon area.
description: Donations needed for a new home for the club, on the bank of the River Thames in Abingdon

name: Friends of Ladbrooke School
missionStatement: We are a Parents and Teachers Association (PTA) for a very small school 'Ladbrooke JMI School' in Potters Bar. We fund raise to help with New Buildings, Sports Equipment, Computer Equipment, Books for the Library, School Trips ect.  our aim is to help the school keep up with the latest technology so the children learn also to help maintain the school, to keep the children safe and to make sure costs of school trips are kept low so all parents can afford to send their children on all the trips.
description: Prior to Covid we handed over 50k for a new hall. The builders went bust taking our   50K.

name: The Seahorse Trust
missionStatement:
The Seahorse Trust is a registered charitable organisation for research into and of seahorses, education about seahorses and the wider marine environment and the enjoyment of seahorses and other species. 
We also look to conserve other species and habitats in the sea, on land and in the air for the future of nature and the natural world
description: The Seahorse Trust working in partnership with nature

name: Corby Nightlight
missionStatement: Corby Nightlight is a registered charity established to relieve poverty among rough sleepers and homeless adults in Corby and the surround area. We are proud to have been instrumental in drawing attention to the need for a night winter shelter over the past three years. Our Winter provision this year includes a five day a week food service form our mobile catering van in Corby town centre.
description: Please donate to help us provide a hand up not a hand out.

name: THE CHILDREN'S HEART FEDERATION
missionStatement:
The Children's Heart Federation CHF is the UK's leading children's heart charity.

We provide:

Information sheets on heart conditions and caring for heart children
Information phone line
Medical equipment and learning resources for children with heart conditions
E-newsletter
Campaign for better provision for children with heart conditions
Promote better awareness and support for heart children via social media
description: Your donation will improve the life of a child with a heart condition.

name: Newcastle United Foundation
missionStatement: Newcastle United Foundation aims to use the local passion for football to encourage learning and promote healthy lifestyles that will make a real difference to the lives of children, young people and families in our region.

name: Armagh Robinson Library
missionStatement:
Armagh Robinson Library and  No 5 is an independent 4-star visitor attraction, library and museum on the Ancient Hill of Armagh.

We offer exhibitions, group tours, children's activities, and research facilities. 

Our collections hold many wonderful manuscripts, printed books, pamphlets and periodicals, atlases, prints, coins, gems, medals and archaeological artifacts.
description: Please help us to reach our £1 million target. This is a gift that will go on giving!

name: Human Aid Initiative
missionStatement: Human Aid Initiative is a UK based charity organisation aimed at providing individuals and communities poverty relief, emergency assistance, rehabilitation support, healthcare and education.
description: #LetsHelpThoseInNeed

name: Rhino Tears
missionStatement: Rhino Tears Jewellery is registered charity in the UK (1189095) that raises money through the sales of jewellery and direct donations. All proceeds go to towards a number of fantastic conservation and anti-poaching projects across Africa. These projects are carefully selected and deliver tangible results in protecting the world's remaining rhino and help in ensuring a future for such a magnificent species.
description: Help us ensure a future for the rhino.

name: HERE4U
missionStatement: HERE 4 U is a small charity based in Blackpool supporting local residents affected by mental health, autism, care leavers and those isolated/lonely live a 'normal life'. Majority of our clients needs are deemed 'too low' to receive social care and/or NHS input and are left to struggle. How would you feel if you were unable to the little things like going to the corner shop for bread or seeing your friends? We support these people to do these little things and have a 'normal life'
description: Help us help those have a normal life

name: Watford & three rivers furniture recycling scheme
missionStatement:
Run by a small team of staff and volunteers, 9 Lives Furniture is a Hertfordshire-based charity that collects, refurbishes and distributes quality household goods from our showroom, at subsidised prices, to people identified as most in need by other local charities and agencies. We also provide training and work placements for people with learning disabilities and mental ill-health.
Our showroom is also open to the general public.
description: 'We give people and furniture a second chance'

name: Wolfwood
missionStatement: A small, very busy independent centre, devoted to the rescue, care and rehoming of stray and needy dogs and providing rescue and rehabilitation for wildlife casualties.

name: Wales Ape & Monkey Sanctuary Ltd
missionStatement: We rescue and rehabilitate animals in need  and provide them with a permanent stress-free high level of care and quality of life.We aim to continuously improve animal welfare,increase public awareness and combat animal abuse.

name: St Wilfrid's Hospice (Eastbourne)
missionStatement:
We provide specialist care for people with any progressive, advanced life-limiting illness. Referrals are made by the patient's GP or other healthcare professionals and care is delivered by a team that includes consultants in palliative medicine, specialist nurses, occupational therapists, physiotherapists, counsellors and social workers.

We want to see a community where people talk openly about dying, live well until the end of their life and where nobody dies alone, afraid or in pain.
description: We provide specialist care for people with progressive, advanced life-limiting illness.

name: PCNHMF
missionStatement: We provide practical assistance to children who have lost Mum, Dad, brother or sister through violent crimes such as murder or manslaughter.
description: Supporting children affected by violent crime and giving them opportunities for a brighter

name: Makomborero
missionStatement:
Makomborero is a UK registered charity that helps to relieve poverty in Zimbabwe, Africa through the education of children.
The charity achieves this by investing time in disadvantaged communities, and by supporting talented students to allow them to complete their education and attain excellent grades in their A-levels. Makomborero gives these children the chance to fulfil their undeniable potential and gives them hope and a future.
description: Help a Zimbabwean child achieve their dreams by donating to Makomborero

name: MS Research Treatment and Education
missionStatement: MS Research Treatment and Education is a charity dedicated to furthering our understanding of MS and developing better treatments through research and education.
description: With your help we could look forward to seeing the back of MS.

name: Acorn Villages Limited
missionStatement:
Every adult with a learning disability deserves independence, dignity and empowerment.
Our philosophy is people first, disability second with the motto since day one being 'Life is for Living'.
It is thanks to generous people like you that we can continue to live up to this. 
Find out how your donations make a real difference on a daily basis at www.acornvillages.com or via our social media sites.
Charity Number: 263954

name: Joining Jack
missionStatement: Joining Jack was created nine years ago by Andy and Alex Johnson, the parents of a then four-year-old Jack after he was diagnosed with Duchenne Muscular Dystrophy (DMD, a horrific muscle-wasting disease for which there is currently no cure. The charity raises money to increase awareness and fund research to find a cure for all boys living with DMD.

name: Feline Care
missionStatement:
Specialising in the rescue, rehoming & care of domestic & feral cats. Cats of all ages, behaviour & health are offered sanctuary & cared for by a very committed team of volunteers, always in the hope of finding them permanent & well suited homes.
All our cats are neutered & micro-chipped.  We operate a strict policy that every cat is welcome with us for as long as they need & no cat will be put to sleep, unless of course their health dictates.  Thanks for supporting us!

name: Blue Sky Autism Project
missionStatement: We work with children aged 0-10 who have autism or other developmental disabilities. We also support parents and families through training and coaching. We work across Scotland and have recently opened in London.
description: We change little lives one step at a time!

name: BirdLife International
missionStatement: BirdLife International is a global partnership of conservation organisations (NGOs) that strives to conserve birds, their habitats and global biodiversity, working with people towards sustainability in the use of natural resources.
description: BirdLife International is fighting globally to create a better world for birds.

name: Gardeners' Royal Benevolent Society
missionStatement:
Perennial is the UK's only charity dedicated to helping everyone who works in horticulture, and their families, when times get tough.

Perennial provides free and confidential advice, support and financial assistance to people of all ages working in, or retired from horticulture.
description: Your donation helps provide a lifeline to horticulturists who have nowhere else to turn.

name: Project Volunteer
missionStatement: We work in association with SOS Children's Villages to support the work they do with the orphans and other children requiring additional care throughout Botswana. During the year we run two visits to Botswana for UK volunteers, over periods of 10 days each, spending time with the children at all of the three SOS Village locations. We effectively run a summer camp for them, with games, bead making, movies, face painting, sports days, parties, workshops and much more.
description: Botswana to UK Educational Visit for 10 children in 2018

name: The Message Trust
missionStatement: With a special focus on the poor and needy, we will work in partnership raising up young people from every corner of Greater Manchester who will truly follow Jesus Christ. We also actively encourage and support others around the world with a similar vision.
description: We work with young people in schools, prisons & communities across the UK & South Africa.

name: Age Concern East Cheshire
missionStatement:
Age UK Cheshire East is a local charity supporting people over 50 years of age, their families and carers through the provision of high quality practical and emotional support. Services include information and advice, dementia day support, men in sheds, help at home, lifestyle support and more. 

Our vision is a county where older people flourish. We believe that poverty; isolation and loneliness, poor services, inadequate care and support, discrimination and a lack of respect are unacceptable

name: The Family Centre (Deaf Children)
missionStatement: Family Centre (Deaf Children) supports all families of deaf children overcome a sense of isolation or lack of confidence that they may feel due to their deafness. Deaf children can be more at risk of having emotional difficulties, with many feeling isolated and lacking in confidence due to their communication difficulties. The Family Centre provides a peer support for the whole family through events and activities where parents and children are enabled to come together.
description: Support the Family Centre (Deaf Children) to improve the wellbeing of deaf families

name: Kent Wildlife Trust
missionStatement: Nature is in crisis. More than half of all wildlife in the UK species are at risk of extinction, we need a healthy environment to give us clean air and water, healthy food and more. We want to restore nature on a massive scale, bringing back an abundance of wildlife and making us resilient to the impact of the climate crisis. We are working to create a Wilder Kent, but we can't do it alone. Simply put, Wilder Kent is KWT's vision for restoring nature (not just protecting it) on a massive scale.

name: WABIL
missionStatement: A World Without Barriers (WWB) is an independent, voluntary, not for profit and non-governmental organisation. Our intention is to help everyone on the basis of humanity, with the main focus being placed on helping orphans, the needy, the destitute and the most vulnerable worldwide. Our aim is to bring the plight of the poor to you to help change lives.  You can find out more about us here: https://worldwithoutbarriers.org/about-us/
description: We have a 100% donation policy with zero admin fees.

name: deptford action group for the elderly
missionStatement: The purpose of DAGE is to combat social isolation for pensioners of SE London by the provision of a weekday pop-in facility for social contact. We offer an information service providing help with forms and referrals to specialist agencies, and host advice and information from fire safety to crime prevention.
description: Help give our pensioners a lifeline by supporting DAGE.

name: you raise me up ltd
missionStatement:
The sole purpose of the charity is to offer financial, practical and emotional support to families that have lost a young adult. We offer one-to-one counselling, support groups and Families Days 24 hour helpline  and a drop in centre at the Coffee Shop on Polegate High Street.
We are entirely funded by donations and fundraising
description: Supporting life after the loss of a young adult

name: Alabare Christian Care and Support
missionStatement: Alabare is a charity that works with vulnerable, homeless  and marginalised people in our communities, supporting and enabling them to live an enjoyable and independent life.  Within our Homes and Services, we work with: those who are homeless or at risk of becoming homeless; Armed Forces Veterans; young people; young parents and their babies and adults with learning disabilities.  Our vision is a society where everyone has the opportunity to live a fulfilling life.

name: Child Protection and Rehabilitation Trust (CPRT) charity
missionStatement: We want to save the street children in Pakistan from despair and hopelessness. Our aim is to protect their childhood, provide learning opportunities, guide them to a better future and most of all inspire them to dream and to fulfill their ambitions. We believe our children will help build a stronger community and a peaceful country.
description: Help us protect their childhood

name: Myaware
missionStatement: Myaware are the only charity in the UK dedicated solely to the care and support for people living with myasthenia and their friends, family and carers. We are working hard to raise awareness of myasthenia, as it is a little known condition. Myaware funds the research that brings us closer to finding a cure as well as raising money for specialist nurses and advisors.
description: Help myaware and together we can fight myasthenia.

name: The Huddersfield Singers
missionStatement: The Huddersfield Singers is a chamber choir that seeks to advance the causes of classical music through the public presentation of concerts, workshops and other special events. The choir specialises in the presentation of interesting classical repertoire, in the form of lesser-known works and music by relatively unfamiliar composers, in order to differentiate itself from other groups and to improve the musical education of its audiences. New music is also premiered by the group when the opportunity arises.
description: Invest in the UK's choral music tradition: support a choir with an adventurous repertoire!

name: National Zoological Society of Wales
missionStatement: We are home to a number of endangered species who are part of European Breeding Programmes. We also support a number of overseas conservations projects with Red Pandas and Lemurs as well as native projects with Red Squirrels and Seal rescue.
description: Donate to help animal conservation in the UK and Overseas

name: Special Stars Foundation
missionStatement:
Special Stars Foundation is a registered charity supporting people with disabilities and their families, in Hull and East Yorkshire. (Registered Charity number: 1156237)
We provide a diverse range of inclusive and accessible activities for people with disabilities and their families, with the aim of reducing social isolation. In addition, we offer a range of support, training and advice services for parent carers.
For more information, visit: www.heyspecialstars.co.uk

name: Rangers Charity Foundation SCIO
missionStatement: The Rangers Charity Foundation exists to be a force for good on behalf of the Rangers Family, showing compassion to those in need, tackling inequalities and creating opportunities for people of all ages to change their lives for the better.
description: Donate today to the Rangers Charity Foundation

name: Chabad Manchester City Centre
missionStatement: Through an array of social, educational and business opportunities, Chabad in the City offers a bespoke service for Manchester's business and young professional community.
description: Be a part of securing a vibrant future!

name: St Richard s Hospice Foundation
missionStatement:
The mission of St Richard's Hospice is, in partnership with other providers, to enhance through specialist palliative and end of life care and education, the quality of life of patients and those important to them, suffering from life-limiting illnesses.
Our vision is to be a centre of expertise providing excellent individualised care and support. Our aim is to maximise quality of life by creating a safe caring environment offering physical, emotional and spiritual support to patients and their families

name: Brent Lodge Bird & Wildlife Trust
missionStatement: Brent Lodge Wildlife Hospital runs a wildlife hospital near Chichester in West Sussex for the treatment, care, and rehabilitation of sick, injured, and orphaned wild birds and other wildlife. Each year we provide care and treatment to over 3500 wildlife patients.

name: ROYAL MARINES ASSOCIATION - THE ROYAL MARINES CHARITY
missionStatement: We are the Royal Marines' chosen charity and we exist to give a lifetime of support to the Royal Marines family. Our mission is to provide support, advice and friendship to serving and retired Royal Marines, their families, those who aspire to join and those with close links to our Corps.
description: Supporting Royal Marines and their families through life.

name: Action on Addiction
missionStatement:
ACTION ON ADDICTION is a national charity which offers high quality, effective residential rehab and community-based addiction treatment.
Our fully qualified addiction counsellors provide life-changing treatment to individuals and families.

We treat private paying clients, those on private medical insurance schemes, and those in receipt of state funding. We also run a bursary scheme.
description: In the grip of addiction, reach for safe hands.

name: The Shiny Zone
missionStatement:
We run a small animal sanctuary. 

Living in the countryside we get a lot of feral cats. We do what we can to neuter and flu jab them. Then release them. To stop the population going mad. 

Each little life is precious. The sick and old spend their days with us as re-homing them would be almost impossible. I do not like the thought of an animal in a cage for it's whole life. 

Your money and support helps me continue supporting them. Thank you.
description: Support animals in need. Warm beds and food for all.

name: Cancer Support Scotland
missionStatement: Cancer Support Scotland is here to provide emotional and practical support - on a one-to-one basis and through community based groups - to anyone affected by cancer including family, friends and carers.
description: We rely heavily on the generosity and kindness of the public to fund our work.

name: Harlow Stroke Support -Rehab Centre
missionStatement:
Harlow Stroke Support Group are a non medical rehab Centre.  For Stroke Survivors and their Carers.
We run Speech and language classes, Chair Base exercise groups , social groups which work on confidence and Rehab tools and much more, for the Harlow community plus surrounding areas.  If out side these areas all welcome, if have own transport.
description: Stroke is a long term condition, so we have over 350 members, and funding is always a prob

name: Life-line Ministries (Ireland)
missionStatement: Life-line Ministries is a Christian charity based in Northern Ireland which works in rural areas of Western Kenya to help to relieve poverty and spread the gospel. We have ten churches and five nursery & primary schools. Older children are supported through secondary education and some through university through our child sponsorship programme. Our primary focus is on orphans and widows but we try to help as many needy people as possible and show the love of God in practical ways.
description: Help us to help a child in Kenya receive an education and learn of God's love.

name: Caritas - Anchor House
missionStatement:
Caritas Anchor House is a homelessness charity based in East London.

We provide a home and tailored support to hundreds of people experiencing homelessness each year. By offering opportunities to improve health and wellbeing, and access to training and employment support, residents can rebuild their lives and move on to a positive and fulfilling future.

name: Pancreatic Cancer Action
missionStatement: Pancreatic Cancer Action is working towards saving lives. Only 7% of patients will survive beyond 5 years & this number has barely changed in over 40 years. Through our awareness campaigns and educational programmes for medical professionals and the public alike we aim to get more people diagnosed in time for surgery - currently the only potential for a cure. Please help us "Change the Numbers" for pancreatic cancer.
description: Your support enabels us to save more lives through early diagnosis

name: Clutha Trust
missionStatement: The Clutha Trust helps disadvantaged youngsters through the Arts. We organise plays, music events, art. We give young people a chance to release their potential.
description: Help us to give kids a chance

name: Harrow Association of Disabled people
missionStatement: HAD is a User Led Organisation, led by and for disabled people.  Our aim is to create a world where equality of opportunity is a right for disabled people. We provide a range of campaigning and awareness raising activities and services including advice and information on welfare benefits, Direct payments for care, independent living activities towards work, life skills and developing coping strategies, advocacy and self advocacy workshops.
description: Engaging Potential

name: OSCAR's PBTC
missionStatement:
OSCARs Paediatric Brain Tumour Charity was formed in November 2014 by the parents and friends of Oscar Hughes, a 9 year old boy who died of a Medulloblastoma, a brain tumour, in May 2014.
The journey Oscar went on for a year to try and be free of cancer was both heartbreaking and inspiring to see. The treatments involved to fight brain tumours have devastating effects on a young body and mind. This is unacceptable and the only way to change this is by researching these cancers and find better treatments.
description: Brain tumours are the biggest cancer killer in people under the age of 40

name: Kenya Children Centres
missionStatement: Kenya Children Centres cares for 300 poor orphaned and vulnerable girls and boys at our residential home and three day centres in slum villages. Our outreach projects support destitute families with education and micro-business grants, clothing and personal hygiene items.  All administration and fund-raising costs are paid by our Trustees so 100% of every donation is spent on care of the children.
description: Help us rescue and rehabilitate more vulnerable children and give them a bright future

name: York Against Cancer
missionStatement:
York Against Cancer is a local charity helping local people affected by cancer.

We provide care and support for patients and their families in York and North Yorkshire, fund pioneering cancer research and provide cancer awareness education and information. All our work is funded by fundraising and donations.

Supported by individuals, groups, schools,
organisations and businesses we have raised more than 15 million pounds over the last 30 years to help local people in the fight against cancer.
description: As a local charity we rely heavily on the generous support of our community

name: Alive and Kicking
missionStatement:
Vision: Alive & Kicking's vision is of an Africa where every child can play with a real ball, where thousands of jobs are sustained in the production and distribution of balls, and where sport significantly contributes to the health and quality of life of young people.


Approach: Alive & Kicking believes that by combining social entrepreneurship with sport's mass appeal, lasting economic and social development can be achieved in Africa.
description: Donate a ball to children who can't afford one. Made in Africa, for Africa

name: Africa's Gift
missionStatement:
Africa's Gift supports communities in southern Africa (principally Lesotho, but also South Africa, Tanzania, Zambia, Uganda and Malawi), working closely with community members to effect change through the development of practical solutions to clearly identified need.  
We also reach out to UK based community members who wish to become involved in making a difference to everyday lives, by visiting Africa to volunteer on projects targeting positive socioeconomic, educational and health outcomes.
description: We are totally volunteer run charity; all donations go towards helping make a difference!

name: Four Paws
missionStatement:
Since our creation in the 1980s, FOUR PAWS has worked tirelessly to help animals across the globe.

Our aim is to end the mistreatment of animals under human control, both now and in the future. Whether it's working on more immediate short term aims, or striving for social or political changes which secure a better future for animals in the long term, our approach is always to look for realistic solutions to the problems we raise.
description: Your donation (small or large) WILL help animals in need.

name: Rennie Grove Hospice Care
missionStatement: Rennie Grove Hospice Care is a charity providing specialist care and support for adults and children with a life-limiting illness in Bucks and west Herts. Through our unique Hospice at Home service, available day and night, and a range of day services we support our patients to live the best quality life they can with a choice about how and where they are cared for towards the end of life. We are also here for the families of our patients.
description: Raising funds for our vital nursing service

name: Zimbabwe Orphan Care
missionStatement: Jabulani Kids Home houses, feeds and schools 12 abandoned babies who were orphaned from a young age. We also run Zimbabwe Orphan care (ZOC) which is involved in feeding, clothing, educating and housing abandoned children and orphans in Harare and surrounding areas in Zimbabwe. We work in local orphanages and schools on a daily basis, paying school fees and providing uniforms.
description: Jabulani & ZOC use 100% of money donated for work in Zimbabwe. We have no admin fees.

name: Samaritans of Preston and District
missionStatement: Whatever you're going through, a Samaritan will face it with you. We're here 24 hours a day, 365 days a year.

name: Barth Syndrome UK
missionStatement: We are a small but mighty charity supporting children and families affected by Barth syndrome - a rare life-threatening genetic condition which attacks the heart, muscles, growth, immune and energy systems.  Please help us to fund research into treatments and to support families throughout their journey.  We provide an end to isolation, access to information and quality medical care.
description: Donate and join our Barth family as we fight for a cure!

name: Cirencester Baptist Church
missionStatement:
We are a lively community of Christians of all ages, loving and serving God, one another and the world.
We meet in Cirencester, Gloucestershire and seek to serve the community in the Cotswolds.
description: Building a new church &  community building in Cirencester.

name: Child Bereavement UK
missionStatement: Child Bereavement UK supports families and educates professionals when a baby or child of any age dies or is dying, or when a child is facing bereavement. Every year we train more than 9,000 professionals, helping them to better understand and meet the needs of grieving families.
description: Together we can help families rebuild their lives after the devastation of bereavement

name: The Laura Centre
missionStatement:
Opened by the bereavement charity COPE in 1991, The Laura Centre offers specialist bereavement counselling to parents whose child has died and to children or young people who have been bereaved of a parent or significant person.
Based in Leicester with new centres in Derby and Coventry, the centre offers wide ranging individual and group support as well as a variety of alternative therapies.
description: You will be supporting those suffering the worst experience life can throw at you.

name: The Maytree Respite Centre
missionStatement: Maytree is a unique national charity offering a support to suicidal people in despair. Volunteers and staff are available 24/7 to support people who are in suicidal crisis, providing a safe place and a chance to rest, reflect and be heard without judgement. We offer a free, single stay of five days to UK residents over 18 years of age undergoing a suicidal crisis. We also provide telephone and email support.
description: Supporting Maytree directly helps suicidal people in despair. Donate to save lives.

name: Youth With a Mission Scotland Ltd
missionStatement: Youth With A Mission Scotland Limited or YWAM Scotland is a family of Christians dedicated to knowing God and making Him known in Scotland and wherever we find ourselves in the world.
description: Give to help us see Gods transformation  in every sphere of society

name: Mugstock: A Festival of Music & Merriment
missionStatement: MugStock is a Festival of Music & Merriment. As a not for profit festival with a strong conscience, we have positioned MugStock as being extremely reasonably priced, meaning that MugStock is accessible socially, geographically and financially.
description: We're so excited about the future. Join us and help make the festival you want to go to

name: Conwy Mind
missionStatement: Mind is a national mental health charity concerned with the needs and rights of mentally distressed people and their families.  Aberconwy Mind helps local people rebuild their lives by providing friendly support and a chance to share experiences and regain self respect.  We offer a warm welcome, a chance to make new friends and an opportunity to develop new skills and interests.
description: We provide support to people experiencing mental ill health in the county of Conwy

name: Youth With A Mission Radiant London
missionStatement: Youth With A Mission Radiant London is involved in various kinds of activities affecting a wide range of people. One is mercy ministries including Drop-ins and Community Projects (such as skills workshops, art or education classes, arts exhibitions/live performances, etc). As well, we offer training courses which allows YWAM to encourage people in areas such as deepening their Christian faith to involvement with the projects we work with.
description: Please support our charity to help us continue our work

name: Keep Wales Tidy
missionStatement:
Keep Wales Tidy works across Wales to protect our environment for now and for the future.
We know a good quality environment matters to people and the benefits can have a big impact on our communities, health and well-being and economy. We support an army of passionate volunteers to keep Wales beautiful. We deliver practical action, environmental education, training and environmental solutions. Our selfless volunteers work hard to keep communities, streets, and the countryside free of litter and waste.
description: Help us support volunteer action to create a beautiful Wales that is enjoyed by everyone

name: FAMILY FUND TRUST
missionStatement: Family Fund provides grants and services to families on low incomes raising disabled or seriously ill children and young people. Everyday families tell us about how this support has a huge impact on their lives, but we need your help so we can continue to make a difference. Last year, we provided 88,407 grants or services to families throughout the UK, but we want to help more. Our ambition is to provide 150,000 grants and services by 2022, and we need your support to achieve this.
description: Help us support more families raising disabled and seriously ill children

name: St Richard of Chichester Christian Care Association Ltd
missionStatement:
Stonepillow is a single homeless charity.

STONEPILLOW offers shelter, information and support to empower homeless and vulnerable individuals to make positive changes in their lives.

It aims to create a safer environment that promotes social inclusion with practical assistance and without prejudice for all.

name: Empower Global
missionStatement: BUILDING FUND ONLY - Raising funds to build a brand new Family Church HQ in Portsmouth. This building will be used to serve the local community as well as others around the UK and beyond. Housing all of our Portsmouth based operations and supporting all other Family Church offices, this will be a hive of activity seven days a week!
description: Help us raise money for a new building

name: Eden Valley Hospice, Carlisle
missionStatement:
Eden Valley Hospice and Jigsaw, Cumbria's Children's Hospice provide palliative care for people with incurable or life limiting illnesses, enabling them and their carers to live life as fully and as independently as possible. We will deliver services with a common focus, working collaboratively across Cumbria and South West Scotland.

For more information please visit www.edenvalleyhospice.org or www.jigsawhospice.org

name: Smart Works Charity
missionStatement: At the heart of Smart Works sits a two hour dressing and coaching service for unemployed women with confirmed job interviews.
description: Coaching and dressing women who are trying to get back to work

name: Shetland Health Board Endowment Fund
missionStatement: Over 600 patients from Shetland travel off island to Aberdeen or Glasgow for MRI scans each year, a round trip of over 450 miles.  The Shetland MRI Scanner Appeal hopes to raise 1.65 million so that a MRI Scanner can be located in Shetland which would bring quicker access to diagnostic tests, reduce inconvenience and the need to travel off island.  An MRI scan is used to diagnose and monitor a wide variety of conditions and the number of patients who need them is steadily increasing.
description: With your help and support we hope to raise 1.65m to bring alive a MRI Scanner in Shetland

name: Cliff Top Kennels Re-Homing Centre
missionStatement:
Objectives: (a) The relief of suffering and distress among dogs and the care and protection of any dog which has need of this by reason of sickness, maltreatment or neglect or homelessness in any ways which are deemed charitable in law,
(b) The advancement of the education of the public in the ways in which to achieve the above and in other matters of general dog welfare in the local area.

Aims: To find homes for unwanted dogs in the Scarborough area. A healthy dog is never put to sleep.
description: Help rescue dogs unable to leave kennels. We face difficult challenges due to coronavirus.

name: The Ehlers-Danlos Support UK
missionStatement:
EDS UK was set up in 1987 to support, advise and inform those living with any of the Ehlers-Danlos syndromes (EDS). We aim to help people with EDS live a full, active and positive life. Over 30 years later, we remain the only active UK charity that exclusively represents and supports people with any type of EDS.

EDS UK strives to educate the medical community, promote continuity of care, improve accurate diagnosis and provide information on specialist treatment and management of the condition.
description: Nobody with EDS should have to fight alone. Everyone deserves access to treatment/care.

name: Allergy UK
missionStatement: It is estimated that 21 million people in the UK live with allergic disease. But there remains a huge gap in healthcare services for those affected by this disease of the immune system. Our mission is to raise the profile of allergy at all levels, with a vision for everyone affected by allergy to receive the best possible care and support.
description: Help us to help others

name: 1st Hellingly Scout Group
missionStatement:
Scouting exists to actively engage and support young people in their personal development, empowering them to make a positive contribution to society.

A Scout is to be trusted.
A Scout is loyal.
A Scout is friendly and considerate.
A Scout belongs to the world-wide family of Scouts.
A Scout has courage in all difficulties.
A Scout makes good use of time and is careful of possessions and property.
A Scout has self-respect and respect for others.

name: Great Ormond Street Hospital Children's Charity
missionStatement: Every day brings new challenges at Great Ormond Street Hospital (GOSH). Every day, 619 children and young people from across the UK arrive. Every day, doctors and nurses battle the most complex illnesses, and the brightest minds come together to achieve pioneering medical breakthroughs. And every day is a chance for you to make a difference. This extraordinary hospital has always depended on charitable support to give seriously ill children the best chance to fulfil their potential.
description: Help Seriously Ill Children

name: Inspirited Minds
missionStatement: We are a grassroots charity which aims to reduce stigma, raise awareness and provide advice, support and encouragement to those, in particular Muslims, affected by mental health problems from a faith and culturally sensitive perspective.
description: To support all those affected by Mental Health problems.

name: Future Youth Zone
missionStatement:
Future is a state of the art Youth Zone, open 7 days a week to young people in Barking & Dagenham.  
 
We have 20+ activities every evening including cooking, boxing, music recording, a hair and beauty salon, a climbing wall, dance classes, art and a fully equipped gym.
description: Support us to give young people somewhere to go, something to do and someone to talk to

name: Wigan & Leigh People First
missionStatement: We are a self-advocacy charity for people with learning disabilities, we enable people to have a voice and speak out about the issues that matter
description: Help us give people with Learning Disabilites a Voice

name: Anxious Minds
missionStatement: Anxious Minds directly provides a range of proactive, person-centred mental health support services to people in emotional distress or struggling with addiction, including survivors of domestic violence, veteran families, suicide prevention, and  mental health support for children
description: Become a fundraiser and help keep happy smiles everywhere

name: NANCHERROW PROJECT
missionStatement:
We are a Youth Centre in the most westerly town in Cornwall, a deprived area. We host a weekly club night for 40+ local kids and have a music studio, cafe a hall that we rent out. 
We have a new enthusiastic committee who are raising funds and reworking the club so that it is more youth centric and self sustaining
description: We need to fund the centre or it will close down

name: DOVE HOUSE HOSPICE LIMITED
missionStatement: Dove House Hospice is a hospice based in Hull which cares for adults across the city and the East Riding of Yorkshire who have illnesses which are no longer curable. We improve the quality of life of our patients by offering specialist care which is holistic and individually tailored. We offer specialist inpatient care, symptom control, end of life care, day care, planned short-term respite care, social care and more. This care is free of charge and therefore we rely on funds raised in the community.

name: Valgray's Border Collie & Animal Rescue
missionStatement: We are a animal charity and our aim is to help animals nationally and internationally.
description: Our aim is to help all unwanted animals find loving homes.

name: Help Harry Help Others
missionStatement: We are a Birmingham based Cancer charity that raises funds for 3 main areas: Help Cure - we fund brain tumour research, Help Cope - we support families financially when they find themselves struggling following a cancer diagnosis of any kind, Help Care - where we offer all services outside of treatment from under 1 roof at our Birmingham Drop in Cancer Support Centre www.hhho.org.uk
description: Please help us to continue supporting Cancer families in their hour of need

name: Cornwall Trust for Nature Conservation Ltd (The)
missionStatement:
Cornwall Wildlife Trust believes in a wilder future for Cornwall. A future in which wildlife thrives on land and at sea, where Cornwall's beautiful and unique wild places are protected, and people to action to benefit nature.

We are working towards this by protecting and managing over 5,500 acres of wildlife-rich and important habitats across 59 nature reserves, and through projects that promote nature's recovery and protect threatened and much-loved wildlife.
description: Help protect Cornwall's much-loved wildlife places and wildlife for a wilder future.

name: Congresbury Community Preschool
missionStatement: We are a diverse and inclusive not for profit preschool run by a committee of volunteers and a team of dedicated early years professionals who provide a nurturing and fun environment for our local children.
description: We wouldn't exist without the generosity of others!

name: Helping Hands Community Project
missionStatement:
Helping Hands Community Project became a Registered Charity in March 2015. (registered no. 277354), we are a community charity helping local people in need. We are governed by a small
number of local trustees.  
 
 
As a community project we work with local people in Leamington, Warwick and Kenilworth who are homeless, vulnerable, have addictions and need help and support to realise their potential.
description: Helping local homeless and people in need across Leamington, Warwick and Kenilworth

name: The Anthony Booth Trust
missionStatement: We aim to educate and research aplastic anaemia a rare blood disorder and also bone marrow transplants.This will involve research into cord donors and a cord bank ,plus building clean rooms in intensive care units in the midlands for people with immune deficencies.

name: Mane Chance Sanctuary Limited
missionStatement: Mane Chance rescues and rehabilitates neglected and abused horses and in a non-judgemental environment creates peaceful and beneficial relationships between them and vulnerable & special needs children & adults to create a circle of care. We help the horses and they help us.

name: The Adnan Jaffery Educational Trust
missionStatement: One Degree is a mentoring charity that has been improving the academic performance and self-belief of students from disadvantaged backgrounds in London for 5 years. We believe an A-C grade in GCSE Maths and English, together with huge doses of self-belief are the "passports" that will change the life direction of the students we mentor.
description: Help a disadvantaged student pass his/her GCSE exams

name: Band of Builders
missionStatement: Band of Builders is a registered charity in who provide practical assistance through life-enhancing projects for members of the UK Construction industry and their families who are faced with life changing or limiting circumstances.
description: We provide life-enhancing projects for tradespeople & their families facing difficulties

name: Lion Aid Ltd
missionStatement: LION AID is committed to ensuring a stable future for the African Lion, Panthera Leo, an iconic species currently under considerable threat.	This will be achieved by supporting scientifically relevant research on disease threats, genetic analyses, and population viability assessments. LION AID is dedicated to forming multidisciplinary collaborative partnerships with governments, research institutions, universities, and other charities to ensure significant conservation outcomes.
description: Pls support our work to save lions! There are only 15,000 left & only 5 viable pops.

name: The Chartwell Children's Cancer Trust CIO
missionStatement: Through fundraising, The Chartwell Children's Cancer Trust provide a range of support services including, capital projects, equipment, training and medical staff in our local hospitals. The CCCT also fund Childhood Cancer Support Groups for children and their families in similar situations at such a difficult time.
description: All donations make a direct difference to seriously ill children

name: Community Council of Shropshire
missionStatement: Shropshire RCC provides a helping hand to vulnerable people and helps to build thriving communities in Shropshire, Telford & Wrekin. Living in a rural area can be very hard. Services can be difficult to access, public transport is often limited and living in a remote rural area can leave people feeling lonely and isolated. We lend mopeds and bikes to help unemployed people access work. We help people stay connected in their community through our hearing support and wise and well team.
description: Help us to make Shropshire a great place for everyone.

name: Place2Be
missionStatement: Place2Be provides mental health support in nearly 300 primary and secondary schools across the UK. The charity reaches a school population of 142,000 pupils helping them to cope with a wide range of mental health issues, from bullying to bereavement, from depression to domestic violence and neglect.
description: Help us reach more children and young people who need mental health support.

name: Big C Little Warrior
missionStatement: We boost confidence and esteem by providing free beauty and grooming treatments to anyone undergoing treatment for cancer. We are a small caring charity that is based in South Yorkshire and we work in hospitals, homes and hospices in the surrounding area. Our mission is to continue the work of Laura our "Little Warrior".
description: Help us to help people undergoing treatment for Cancer.

name: Matthew's Friends
missionStatement: Matthew's Friends Mission is to make Ketogenic Dietary Therapy a treatment option available to all who may benefit from it; To raise public and professional awareness of the therapy as a treatment for epilepsy, metabolic and other neurological disorders.  To provide families, patients and professionals with up to date evidence based information and to support families and patients on their dietary therapy journey.
description: Please dontate now to help people with epilepsy.

name: British Tinnitus Association
missionStatement: We are an independent charity supporting thousands of people who experience tinnitus and advise medical professionals from across the world. We are the primary source of support and information for people with tinnitus in the UK, facilitating an improved quality of life. We aim to seek effective treatment for tinnitus through a medical research programme.
description: Please give generously and help to improve the lives of those affected by tinnitus

name: The Royal Star & Garter Homes
missionStatement:
We were founded in 1916 to care for the severely injured young men returning from the battlegrounds of the First World War. 

We provide loving, compassionate care to veterans and their partners living with disability or dementia. Our Homes in Solihull, Surbiton and High Wycombe offer outstanding residential and day care. We help those who have had the courage to serve our country to live happy, fulfilled lives.
description: Help support the vital therapies and activities that make a difference to our residents

name: Service by Emergency Response Volunteers SERV (Kent)
missionStatement: SERV Kent, Service by Emergency Response Volunteers  also known as the Bloodrunners is a charity that provides emergency courier services transporting blood products, samples and other patient essential items for the major hospitals and hospices in Kent outside normal working hours.
description: Our volunteers provide their services free, saving the NHS thousands of pounds a year

name: Oakfield PTFA
missionStatement: We are a parent, teacher & friends association for a small Primary School in Totton, Southampton.
description: The children need improved play equipment to better their experience and overall health.

name: Shop4Scouts Ltd
missionStatement: The 11th Folkestone Scout Group is a larger than average Scout Group, catering for young people from the age of 6 to 18. We are situated in and cover the east end of Folkestone with a purpose built Scouting Centre. The Group was formed in 1919 and originally started life in the church hall of St. John's Church in Folkestone. Although we have now moved away from the church grounds, we still maintain strong and active links with the church.
description: Scouting for all

name: Marygate House Holy Island
missionStatement:
Marygate is a House of Peace, a House of Welcome.
It is a centre for peace and reconciliation.

We provide a safe, welcoming environment for people who visit the Holy Island of Lindisfarne located off the coast of Northumberland for religious, cultural, or educational reasons.  Marygate provides a still space for people to listen and to talk to each other.  It is a place to find peace, encounter creation and holiness, in nature and through everyday life.
description: We do not charge, we rely on donations with no other funding, or sponsorship.

name: Revitalise respite holidays
missionStatement:
Revitalise is a national charity providing respite care in a holiday setting for disabled people and carers for over 50 years. Revitalise also offers inspirational opportunities for volunteers through one of the largest and most diverse volunteering programmes of any UK charity.

Revitalise was founded in 1963 as the Winged Fellowship Trust (WFT). In 2004 WFT became Vitalise and in 2014 Vitalise became Revitalise.

We run three accessible holiday centres in Chigwell in Essex, Southampton and Soutport

name: North Shields Spiritualist Church
missionStatement: We are a community based Spiritualist Church in North Shields, Tyne & Wear. We have a strong membership but our services are also open to the general public. We hold a weekly service of worship, a midweek service, and a weekly Healing Service. We have a philosophy based on the 7 Principles of Spiritualism, and we have mediumship at two of our services. Our healing service is dedicated to providing spiritual healing from our trained and accredited healing mediums.
description: We are currently closed. We run entirely on donations, please help!

name: Good News Family Care (Homes) Ltd
missionStatement: Good News Family Care is a charity providing a safe-haven for women and children affected by debilitating circumstances such as domestic abuse, homelessness or substance misuse. We are a Christian organisation showing God's love to people in practical ways through a range of approaches. We provide practical help to empower individuals in a secure and supportive environment. Our vision is to make a positive impact in the community, as each transformed life impacts the whole family and society.
description: Enable GNFC to give vulnerable women and children life changing opportunities.

name: Blood Bikes Wales
missionStatement: Blood Bikes Wales is a charity that transports blood, plasma, platelets, samples, vaccines, donor breast-milk & any other urgently required medical items to hospitals at night, weekends and bank holidays, free of charge.
description: We work to save the NHS vital funds

name: Therapies Unite
missionStatement: Therapies Unite is a UK registered charity who operate in Puerto Vallarta on the Pacific coast of Mexico. We provide physiotherapy services including equipment to disadvantaged children and adults with physical disabilities. Our work includes postural management, education and provision of wheelchairs and specialist seating as well as hydrotherapy and physiotherapy. Without our help they would not be able to afford the necessary equipment and therapy.
description: Working Towards a Brighter Future

name: Girlguiding Staffordshire
missionStatement:
Girlguiding Staffordshire gives girls and young women a space where they can be themselves, have fun, build brilliant friendships, gain valuable life skills and make a positive difference to their lives and their communities.
We build girls' confidence and raise their aspirations. We give them the chance to discover their full potential and encourage them to be a powerful force for good.
description: Make a difference! #girlscan #InsireGirls

name: Wolfson Hillel primary school PTA
missionStatement: Supporting the children of Wolfson Hillel Primary School
description: A device for every child.

name: Old,Disabled,Damaged and Black Animals Rescue
missionStatement:
ODD Animals Rescue wants to give a chance to the most vulnerable and overlooked.
Our goals:
1. To neuter as many animals possible. From our point of view this is the only viable solution to reduce the population of stray dogs and cats.
2. To help with vet costs and care old and/or disabled animals. In time and with your support we hope to be able to build a small sanctuary for them where they can spend their lives loved and with dignity.
3. To help rehome black cats.
description: Make a difference. Donate now

name: Alex Moulton Charitable Trust
missionStatement:
The Alex Moulton Charitable Trust is responsible for the care, conservation and promotion of the industrial legacy set by the Moulton family and the innovations of Dr Alex Moulton, known foremost for his creation of the Moulton bicycle and innovative suspension systems. The Trust looks after his home, The Hall, a stunning Jacobean house located in Bradford-on-Avon, Wiltshire, UK, the grounds and wider estate, and the historically significant collection within. 
Charity No. 1190082
description: Help us protect a significant piece of Britain's industrial heritage, today.

name: Reach Learning Disability
missionStatement:
Reach is a registered charity that supports over 200 people with learning disabilities in Nottinghamshire.
We run courses, social activities and projects to help people get the life they want in their own community.
description: Your gift will help us make a real and lasting difference.

name: Prospect Hospice Ltd
missionStatement: Prospect Hospice provides the only dedicated specialist end of life care in Swindon, Marlborough, north Wiltshire, Lechlade and Fairford.  Last year Prospect Hospice supported more than 7,300 people; as patients, carer's and family members, through a range of services developed to bring care, comfort and confidence at life's most difficult time.  Last year it cost 8.4 million pounds to raise funds and deliver our range of services.  With less than 30 percent funding, your support really is vital to us.

name: Halo Dogs Rescue & Rehabilitation
missionStatement: Rescuing, rehabilitating and rehoming abused, abandoned and unwanted dogs and providing a forever home for those too damaged to return to society safely as pets since 2009.
description: Help us care for the dogs everyone else has given up on

name: Bright opportunities
missionStatement:
Bright Opportunities is a not- for- profit , community interest company 
We are a  day service for adults with learning difficulties/ disabilities living within the High Peak. 
The service is dedicated to providing the highest quality person centred care and support and offers access to a variety of leisure, educational and developmental activities. Our day service is based around the local community resources. We offer a range of activities for a
description: Fantastic cause - every penny goes to our clients for new equipment and trips out

name: Emmaus Gloucestershire
missionStatement: We provide a home and meaningful work for formerly homeless people who run our social enterprises.  We also help protect the environment by recycling items kindly donated by the Gloucestershire public.

name: Protecting Preloved Border Collies
missionStatement: We are a network of Border Collie lovers who endeavour to keep free to good home collies out of the hands of the fighting community by messaging owners and if help is required rescuing and rehoming throughout the UK
description: Every penny that is donated helps us to ensure the welfare of these intelligent dogs.

name: Butterwick Limited
missionStatement:
Butterwick Hospice's mission is to add quality of life for those suffering from a progressive life limiting illness and to support their friends and family.
We provide pain and symptom control, end of life, respite, day and home care, complementary therapies, bereavement care and family support free of charge to babies, children, teenagers and adults across the communities of Teesside, County Durham and Wearside.
description: Because every moment counts

name: West Belfast Projects
missionStatement: West Belfast Projects runs a cross Community Foodbank in Belfast we also do a School Uniform Project for struggling families.

name: St Leonard's Hospice
missionStatement: We are a York based adult Hospice caring for local people in central York and surrounding areas. We offer In Patient care, Holistic therapies, Hospice at Home care as well as bereavement counselling and support. We receive limited statutory funding but the vast majority of our work is funded through voluntary donations.
description: Without your support and donations we would not be here. Because YOU Care, We Can

name: Afghanaid
missionStatement: For almost 40 years, Afghanaid has worked alongside some of the poorest and most rural communities in Afghanistan to rebuild basic services, improve agriculture and other livelihoods, strengthen the rights of women and children, and respond to natural disasters. Despite many persisting challenges, we will continue to make life better for over 1,300,000 Afghans in 2021. Our community-led approach gives ordinary Afghans a voice in their own development, and the development of their communities.
description: Donate today to empower the most vulnerable, hardest-to-reach Afghan communities!

name: PANS PANDAS UK
missionStatement: PANS PANDAS UK are a charity established in order to educate and raise awareness of these conditions amongst the general public and medical professionals.   PANS PANDAS UK are working  closely with a Network of Doctors in order to ensure recognition and early diagnosis resulting in effective treatment for those suffering with these little understood, but life changing conditions.
description: We need your help to raise awareness of these life changing but little known conditions.

name: House of Bread
missionStatement:
House of Bread (HOB) is an organisation that supports vulnerable and homeless people in Stafford and the surrounding area. Throughout the week we hold activities and drop-in sessions providing food, friendship, support and advice available to anyone who comes along. Ask any of our visitors and they will tell you, it isn't a house that makes a home; it's the family inside it.

HoB is like a real home; we eat together, laugh together, cry together and support each other.

name: SOLARAID
missionStatement: SolarAid is a charity tackling poverty and climate change by building a sustainable market for solar lights in Africa. Solar lamps provide families with safe clean light; improving health, saving money and allowing children to study after dark. Our goal is to eradicate the kerosene lamp from Africa.
description: Help us eradicate the kerosene lamp in rural Africa.

name: Bristol Zen Dojo (1998) Limited
missionStatement: Bristol Zen Dojo was founded in 1986 and offers a dedicated centre of Zen practice located on Gloucester Road. We hold five sessions a week to practice Zazen (traditional Zen mindfulness meditation) in a formal and supportive environment.
description: The dojo is closed, but practice continues.  Please support us in spreading the dharma.

name: Penrith & District Red Squirrel Group
missionStatement: Founded in 1994 by local people concerned that they would lose their red squirrels.  The group became a registered charity in 2006.
description: All money raised goes directly to red squirrel conservation

name: Aspire
missionStatement: Aspire is a national charity that provides practical help to people who have been paralysed by Spinal Cord Injury.
description: Every four hours someone is paralysed by a spinal cord injury.

name: ACTION KIBOGORA
missionStatement: Action Kibogora is raising funds to build a new maternity ward at Kibogora Hospital in Rwanda. The current ward has over 140% occupancy meaning that for a large part of the year there are 2 women sharing a bed.
description: Grest need to imp[rove maternity care to save the lives of babies and mothers

name: Devizes Opendoors
missionStatement: We support homeless and vulnerable adults by helping them through the processes of finding suitable accommodation and maintaining their tenancies, whilst providing three cooked meals a week, a shower facility, access to a clothing store, laundry, phone and computers
description: Help us befriend and support those who find themselves homeless, with no one to turn to.

name: EASTBURY FARM SCHOOL ASSOCIATION
missionStatement: Eastbury Farm School Association EFSA is a registered charity set up to raise additional revenue for our state funded school. Our committee work tirelessly to enable our children to have a more enjoyable education and a safer school environment
description: To enrich the education of our students beyond what is provided by our local authority

name: Age UK Blackburn with Darwen
missionStatement: We are a local independent charity which provides services which make a difference to the lives of older people and their carers within the Borough of Blackburn with Darwen

name: Held In Our Hearts
missionStatement: SANDS Lothians is an Edinburgh based community charity that provides compassionate support to families following the death of a baby through specialised bereavement services including befriending and counselling.
description: Please donate to continue supporting families who have lost their precious little ones.

name: St Cuthbert's Hospice
missionStatement: St Cuthbert s Hospice Durham provides specialist palliative and end of life care to all those affected by life-limiting illnesses, at a time and a place that is right for them. St Cuthbert s Hospice, making every day count....
description: St Cuthbert s Hospice Durham provides specialist palliative and end of life care

name: Samaritans of Coventry and District
missionStatement:
Coventry & District Samaritans is an independent charity, run entirely by unpaid volunteers.  We provide a free 24 hour helpline for people who are upset or troubled or who are feeling suicidal.   

We are proud holders of the Queen's Award for Voluntary Service, this is the volunteering equivalent of an MBE.

name: NEWMAINS COMMUNITY TRUST LTD
missionStatement: We are a community trust centre providing a safe and welcoming space for local groups to engage the community with learning and socialising opportunities.
description: We welcome any donations that will help with the running costs of our Community Centre

name: PlayforStrays
missionStatement:
PlayforStrays is a registered charity based in Northern Ireland, UK, and was created to bring toys and positive enrichment to rescue animals all over the world.

Many charities do a fantastic job offering food and shelter to abandoned waifs and strays. Unfortunately the provision of toys and playthings are not always in budget.

We hope, by delivering these small toys, it will allow these animals to relieve stress and boredom and bring a bit of play into their day.
description: Enrich a Rescue Animal's Life Today!

name: Bonnie Babies
missionStatement: SINCE 2000 "BONNIE BABIES" HAS BEEN MAKING AND SENDING TINY PREMATURE CLOTHES, BLANKETS AND SADLY BURIAL OUTFITS TO U.K. SPECIAL BABY CARE UNITS, ALSO TO PARENTS WHO NEED OUR SUPPORT. WE ARE A NON-PROFIT REGISTERED CHARITY, DEPENDING ENTIRELY ON THE HARD WORK, KINDNESS AND DEDICATION FROM MEMBERS AND FRIENDS WITHOUT WHO'S SUPPORT NONE OF THIS WOULD BE POSSIBLE
description: SINCE 2000 "BONNIE BABIES" HAS BEEN MAKING AND SENDING TINY PREMATURE CLOTHES, BLANKETS AN

name: Al Furqan Islamic Centre ( MSICT)
missionStatement: Al Furqan Islamic Centre(MSICT) was established in 1997 in  Manchester. Since its establishment it has grown exponentially as a multicultural Islamic centre. It is a centre that is suitable for establishing  five daily prayers, community gatherings, Islamic festivals, learning Islam and good citizenship.
description: Support Alfurqan MCR Media equipment project

name: Trinity Winchester
missionStatement:
Trinity Winchester is a local charity providing support to homeless and vulnerable people. Our direct access drop in centre provides free food, laundry facilities, full learning programme, a contact address and phone number, advocacy and referrals for people suffering the effects of homelessness, addiction, mental ill-health and poverty. 
Our dedicated women's service provides a safe space for victims of domestic abuse and women who are socially isolated.
description: Please donate to help homeless and vulnerable people in Winchester, Hampshire

name: United Kingdom Thalassaemia Society
missionStatement: Supporting patients and families suffering with thalassaemia major for over 40 years.
description: Help us to continue the work we do. Striving for a cure

name: Bearded Fishermen Charity
missionStatement: We are a mental health awareness and suicide prevention charity we help families in need with all aspects of mental health and vulnerable families that are struggling. www.beardedfishermen.org.uk.
description: your donation will go a long way to helping families in need

name: The Karen Hilltribes Trust
missionStatement:
The Karen Hilltribes Trust is a small International Development charity which exists to help the marginalised Karen people of northern Thailand build themselves a better future. 

We do this through sustainable, community led projects which are delivered at the request of the Karen people. Projects firstly address the lack of clean water for drinking, washing and cooking, then water for agriculture. 

All of our staff in Thailand are Karen and our projects address the needs of the Karen people.
description: Building a better future for the Karen people living in northern Thailand

name: Hope for Tomorrow
missionStatement:
Hope for Tomorrow is a dedicated charity bringing cancer care closer to patients  via our Mobile Cancer Care Units. As a cancer charity we understand that time is a crucial factor for patients.
In 2007 we launched the worlds first Mobile Cancer Care Unit to bring vital cancer care closer to patients enabling them to spend more time with family and friends. We develop, build, provide and maintain units to support patients who are going through Chemotherapy by alleviating the stress.

name: The Happy Baby Community
missionStatement: The Happy Baby Community is a charity supporting new mums who have fled form traffickers and violence and have sought international protection in the UK. It provides a huge range of services through two london drop in centres to over 500 new mums a year.
description: Every donation supports services to new mums who are living in poverty

name: Dundonnell Mountain Rescue Team
missionStatement:
Dundonnell Mountain Rescue Team (DMRT)
operate in a vast area of rugged and 
remote mountainous country. The team 
of around 35 volunteers is available 
24 hours a day, 365 days a year to help anyone in difficulty on the hills, mountains or crags in an area spanning more than 2,600 square miles.
description: You can help us save lives and help those in difficulty by donating. Thank you.

name: Universal Bull Terrier Rescue
missionStatement: We are a Bull Terrier Rescue charity - registered in the UK. We rescue, rehabilitate and rehome unwanted Bull Terriers, offering a lifetime backup guarantee.
description: We rescue, rehabilitate and rehome Bull Terriers

name: Our Sansar
missionStatement:
We are a charity run by volunteers and have projects in Nepal benefiting street children and education. 

Our main projects:
- running a children's home for street children in Birgunj
- running a transit home for children affected by the earthquake and other vulnerable children needing emergency assistance in Dhading
- assisting families of the children affected by the earthquake in Dhading
- running a teacher training programme in Makwanpur
description: Support most vulnerable children in Nepal!

name: The Chinese Crested Club of Great Britain Rescue
missionStatement: Our aim is to rescue, rehabilitate and rehome dogs of predominantly Chinese Crested origin. We work with a network of volunteers across the UK.
description: Help us to rehabilitate and rehome Chinese Cresteds in need

name: Safe House for Unwanted Animals Trust
missionStatement: SHUA is an acronym for Safe House for Unwanted Animals. Started in September 2001, SHUA is a very real rescue organisation specialising in the emergency rescue & re-habilitation (& subsequent re-homing) of kittens & cats (including strays)in Barry and the Vale of Glamorgan. SHUA is a registered charity run by volunteers. We have a Charity shop at 97 High St. Barry, CF62 7AJ which is our main source of funding. A lot is raised by donations and fundraising events.
description: We have helped 1000's of animals, mostly cats and need support to keep going.

name: Evesham Adventure Playground Association
missionStatement: Evesham Adventure Playground Association was set up by a group of local volunteers in 1982. Initially prioritising the needs of children, it has developed into a larger community project facilitating the growth of a number of community initiatives, but still prioritising the needs of children.
description: we want to address issues that stop people achieving their potential and engage people wit

name: Rainbows Bereavement Support GB
missionStatement:
