RAINBOWS BEREAVEMENT SUPPORT GREAT BRITAIN is a well respected national charity having a proven, positive impact on the lives of children, young people and adults grieving a significant and often devastating loss in their lives.
Our vision is quite simply for every child and young person in every school in Great Britain, grieving a significant and often devastating loss in their lives, to be understood and supported appropriately.
description: Supporting Children & Young people in times of Bereavement and  Loss

name: Greyhound Trust
missionStatement: The Greyhound Trust was founded in 1975, since then we are proud to have found over 100,000 loving homes for greyhounds. Each year, we home approximately 4,000 retired racing greyhounds and help hundreds more, but there are many more that still need us. Our vision is for a day when all racing greyhounds retire to loving homes and are treated with compassion and kindness. Our mission is to provide good lives, bright futures and loving homes in retirement for racing greyhounds.
description: Our aim to successfully home as many greyhounds in our care as possible!

name: Kent Search And Rescue
missionStatement: Kent Search & Rescue (Lowland) is a search and rescue organisation manned by volunteers 24/7/365 and called out by Kent Police, Coastguard, and Local Authority, to locate and rescue vulnerable missing persons, including children, the elderly, dementia or alzheimers sufferers, confused persons, despondents, medically vulnerable and many other persons classified as vulnerable that go missing for a number of reasons as well as victims of crime.
description: We are totally dependent on volunteers and donations.

name: Hatton Musical Theatre Society
missionStatement:
Hatton Musical Theatre Society, formerly Hatton Operatic Society is a theatre group presenting two fully-staged musical productions a year. 
We pride ourselves on being a friendly family and our cast and crew, whose ages range from 10-80, aim to put on shows to the highest possible standard.
description: Help us to entertain you.

name: MRKH Connect
missionStatement: MRKH Connect is a registered charity in England and Wales (reg. 1157477). We are a non-profit, aiming to connect those with MRKH all over the world; providing a safe place to connect and also raise awareness of MRKH publicly and professionally to improve care and support for all
description: Connecting those with MRKH together

name: OCD-UK
missionStatement:
We're here for the estimated three quarters of a million people living with and affected by Obsessive-Compulsive Disorder (OCD) here in the UK.


We're here to support people through the difficult times, right through to recovery and everything in between.  We are OCD-UK.
description: The national OCD charity, run by and for people with lived experience of OCD

name: Genuine Imitation
missionStatement: Genuine Imiatation is a unique, simple and practical series of christians courses for discipleship as a tool for Individual Studies, Discussion Groups and Preachers/Teachers.
description: together we can do much more than on our own

name: Home-Start Worldwide
missionStatement: Home-Start Worldwide is a membership organisation that provides strategic leadership to a network of Home-Start organisations in 22 countries. All our members offer a free of charge service to families with at least one pre-school child by providing support and friendship through regular home visiting.
description: Working together worldwide with families to give children the best start in life

name: Daisy Chain Project Teesside
missionStatement: Daisy Chain provide services and support to children, adults and families affected by autism along with training for individuals, professionals and businesses. Our unique facility in Stockton on Tees provides a haven for children and adults alike.

name: TOURETTE SYNDROME (UK) ASSOCIATION
missionStatement:
Tourettes Action is a charity that works to improve the lives of people with Tourette Syndrome and their families.
We provide information, support and advocacy for people with Tourette Syndrome (TS). Our work also includes educating people about the condition to help combat stigma.
Tourettes Action works in England, Wales and Northern Ireland and is the leading support and research charity for people with Tourette Syndrome and their families.
description: Please donate and help us improve the lives of people with Tourette Syndrome

name: Bradford Environmental Action Trust
missionStatement: To work towards a healthy, sustainable environment for all people in the Bradford District.
description: BEAT are an environmental charity dedicated to reducing climate change.

name: STECS
missionStatement:
STECS - Scottish Terrier Emergency Care Scheme. We are the Scottish Terrier Breed Rescue Scheme for the UK, and our aim is to provide welfare and new homes for Scotties in need. We are a completely voluntary organisation, Registered Charity 275666/SC041298.

All proceeds will be used to fund veterinary care, and/or to rehabilitate and rehome Scotties in need, giving them a safe and secure environment in which to flourish.
description: All proceeds will be used to fund veterinary care, and/or to rehome Scotties in need.

name: WESLEY'S CHAPEL AND LEYSIAN MISSION
missionStatement: Wesley's Chapel and Leysian Mission: serving east London for over 250 years.  Today it is a large, inclusive church with many children and young adults alongside multi-generational families.  We work against homelessness, hunger, and exclusion.  A local church with a global reach, here for the long haul.
description: Your cast offs can change people's lives: see what we can do together!

name: ST MARY'S PLAYGROUP (RIVERHEAD)
missionStatement: St Mary's Pre School is a registered charity based in Riverhead Village hall in Sevenoaks, Kent. We cater for children from 2 years old and offer a friendly, welcoming environment with an emphasis on learning through play. We seek to provide a nurturing and stimulating environment for our children.
description: We wish to raise money to provide equipment of the pre school.

name: Oxfordshire Foster Care Association
missionStatement: The OFCA is a voluntary association run by foster carers to provide support for all our carers and the children we look after. The consists of sponsoring a wide variety of sporting and recreation activities. We also run forums and help groups on a regular basis throughout the country.
description: The OFCA provides support for foster carers and the children we look after.

name: Edington PCC
missionStatement: A Christian presence in the community
description: Support the life, ministry and mission of Edington Priory Church

name: Guru Nanak Gurdwara Football Club
missionStatement: We are a grassroots football club

name: The British Horse Society
missionStatement: The British Horse Society is the UK?s largest and most influential membership based equine charity, working for every horse and rider. The BHS promotes equine welfare, raises standards in safety and education, and improves access. Its mission is to be a beacon of excellence in all matters relating to the advancement of equine welfare and in the provision of practical support, training and education to all those who share its passion for horses.
description: Bringing horses and people together

name: hajjah naziha charitable organisation
missionStatement:
Hajjah Naziha Charitable Organisation (HNCO) is a proud, interfaith not-for-profit organisation. Fundraising is met through regular religious observational donations, community collections and kindness from all over the world.  
The allocation of these donations will never be based on race, religion, creed, colour or class; simply just 'help where it's needed most'. HNCO works on food, water well, and orphanage projects across the globe but is most renowned in the NW for its 'help the homeless' programs.
description: Help where it's needed most. The NW charity with big ambitions on a local to global level.

name: The Stewards' Trust
missionStatement: The Stewards' Trust is a Christian charity supporting and encouraging a Christian family of all ages and stages of life from different church traditions across the UK. We provide a range of Christian teaching events and are passionate about Christian discipleship and mentoring and leadership development.
description: Our mission is to equip, nurture, grow and connect our broad Christian family in the UK.

name: Bridlington CYP
missionStatement:
Bridlington CYP is a registered Charity operating out of a Sports Centre on the Havenfield Estate. 
Our ethos is to bring sporting opportunities to all and ensuring cost is not a barrier to participation for anyone. We currently have over 2000 weekly users across a variety of sports including Football, Boxing, Netball, Dance, Karate, Badminton and more. 

CURRENTLY THE CENTRE REMAINS CLOSED DUE TO THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC. ALL DONATIONS ARE GREATFULLY RECIEVED DURING THIS DIFFICULT TIME
description: Bridlington CYP relies on sponsorship and donations to keep operating

name: The Silvers Workshop
missionStatement:
The Silvers' Workshop is a Men's Shed Project. Our continued aim is to combat
loneliness and social isolation arising as a result of age or disability by the provision
of a workshop where older men can meet and engage in practical activities and
social interaction together. We provide fully equipped wood and metalwork shop
where members offer and develop their skills in a number of genres, engage their
practical and artistic creativeness and generally socialise and have fun.
description: We need your help to secure stable long term accommodation for our Workshop

name: The Great Generation
missionStatement:
The Great Generation is a social enterprise with charitable status committed to solving the issues of communities living in tough social and economic conditions. We deliver experiential learning programmes in which students and professionals use their skills in collaboration with a local community in the developing world to address a specific local problem.
A catalyst for positive change: We inspire profound change in the existing systems and empower people to tackle the challenges of the 21st century.
description: Help us to empower communities to tackle the challenges of the 21st century.

name: North East Lincs Animal Rescue
missionStatement: A small registered charity run by a small group of volunteers and fundraisers dedicated to the rescue, fostering and rehoming of cats in the North East Lincs area.
description: Donate and help provide care and medical attention for the cats in care.

name: Harrogate & Area CVS ltd
missionStatement: Harrogate & District Community Action (HADCA) is a local charity which supports our communities, charities and volunteers to make the Harrogate District a great place to live and work.
description: Help us to help others across the Harrogate district

name: Beloved Rabbits
missionStatement: Beloved Rabbits is a Scottish Charitable Incorporated Organisation dedicated to all aspects of Rabbit Welfare throughout many areas of Scotland.  We provide rabbit rescue, adoption, bonding and care advice services as well as rabbit welfare education and awareness activity.

name: RSPCA Burton upon Trent & District Branch
missionStatement: The local animal home for Burton Upon Trent & District -  We are a separate charity operating under RSPCA rules, our work is invaluable to the lives of the many animals that have suffered from cruelty or neglect. We are responsible for raising our operating funds locally

name: South Georgia Heritage Trust
missionStatement: South Georgia Heritage Trust promotes for the public benefit, the conservation and protection of the physical and natural environment and surrounding waters of South Georgia - and advances the education of the public in the island's historical heritage.
description: Protect a hectare of sub-Antarctic South Georgia for its wildlife and heritage

name: Denis Law Legacy Trust
missionStatement:
The Denis Law Legacy Trust delivers free to access activities that enable young people to take part in & gain access to sport & other creative activities within their local communities.
We aim to reduce instances of youth crime & anti-social behaviour; promote health & wellbeing & encourage inclusivity through sport, physical activity & creative endeavour.
Our activities engage a range of age groups & include a wide variety of opportunities that help contribute to healthier & safer local communities.
description: Support & empower young people who need it the most onto a positive destination.

name: Quinton Youth for Christ
missionStatement: We support struggling teenagers through providing free mentoring provision, prepare young people for the transition to secondary school through a year long lunch club based in the local primary schools and support the local churches in their youth work through running events and delivering provision.
description: Make a lasting difference to impact the lives of young people in Quinton

name: Just Small Change
missionStatement:
We work to enable the very poor in developing countries to build a pathway out of poverty through small business development.

We believe that with training and support, micro finance can unlock the personal and economic potential of the poorest communities, allowing them the opportunity to achieve a life free from poverty, with dignity and purpose.
We work with partner organisations in developing countries to train, fund and support aspiring business men and women of all faiths and none.
description: Help create a fairer world by helping the poorest build their own businesses

name: Radio Sunderland for Hospitals
missionStatement:
Radio Sunderland for Hospitals is a registered charity, we provide a ward visiting service and broadcast specialist and personalised programme's to the patients of the Sunderland Royal Hospital 24 hours a day.
We are an entirely voluntary organisation that is totally self-supporting. 
Our aim is to:
 * Provide relief from the anxiety of a hospital stay
 * Reduce boredom
 * Relax the Listener
 * Aid convalescence
 * Be the patients personal bedside friend
 * Provide health & wellbeing information.
description: We are enthusiastic, unpaid volunteers, and running a free hospital service is expensive!

name: Steps to Hope SCIO
missionStatement: Steps to Hope is a non-profit charity with a purpose to aid and support the homeless and those suffering from addiction. We operate 2 soup kitchens as well as paying for accommodation for those waiting to get into rehabilitation. We do morning coffee runs where we give hot drinks to those sleeping rough as we as giving them our information. Our organisation has volunteers who are in recovery and have shared the same experiences as our service users.
description: we want to put a catering van on the streets offering hot drinks and food to the homeless.

name: K9 Crusaders Dog Welfare
missionStatement:
We are a Cornish based rescue, rehoming and rehabilitation centre who service the whole of Cornwall. We are independent and rely solely on donations to survive and on a small but dedicated team to run the centre, fundraise, conduct behavioural support, and advise on any aspect of dogs and dog welfare.

For more information visit our website www.k9crusaders.dog or find us on Facebook (https://www.facebook.com/groups/k9crucornwall/)
description: Love dogs? Support K9 Crusaders and help us to save unwanted dogs

name: Furniture Recycling Project
missionStatement: Working towards overcoming hardship and social exclusion through the provision of furniture and white goods, and personal development opportunities.
description: Help us in Creating a Better Community.

name: Stray2Me Rescue
missionStatement: We are a non profit organisation trying to help find homes and minimise the number of homeless dogs in UK and Romania. We do that by placing the animals in "fostered" accommodation, fundraise for their shelter and food, and work with other rescues to find homes for them. We also fund spaying campaigns to help decrease the number of suffering animals born on the streets.
description: A better life ahead for stray animals.

name: Save China's Tigers
missionStatement: Save China's Tigers was established to protect and conserve the tiger and other endangered cat species of China, in the knowledge that these are essential for the maintenance of a balanced co-existence with nature.
description: Save the nature for a better future

name: Manchester City Mission
missionStatement: Founded in 1837 Manchester City Mission is a Christian charity which works to support those who find themselves in need of practical, emotional or spiritual support.  Our projects include meeting with vulnerable people via our support hub or out on the streets, we are currently working to expand our Next Stage Housing project and are developing a child hunger project.  We also work with primary schools, residential homes and provide evangelism training to churches.
description: changing lives one day at a time

name: Journey UK
missionStatement: Journey UK is a pastoral discipleship ministry helping Christians grow in a lifelong, experiential relationship with God; expressing His image as sons and daughters and enjoying security in their relationships.
description: Donate to Journey UK. Thank you so much.

name: Wells Community Hospital Trust
missionStatement:
Wells Community Hospital Trust is a local charity that provides a wide range of flexible and integrated health & wellbeing services for the community we serve. 

We support people locally to keep independent for longer by the provision of high quality clinical services and non-clinical therapeutic support in a safe environment. We also address a wide range of social, emotional and practical needs holistically enabling people to take greater control of their own health and wellbeing.
description: Donate today and support your local community

name: Wildwood Trust
missionStatement: Wildwood Trust's vision is to bring back our true 'wildwood', a unique new way of restoring Britain's land to its natural state. This involves releasing large wild herbivores and developing conservation grazing systems to restore natural ecological processes to help Britain team with wildlife again.
description: To help preserve British Wildlife

name: CDH UK
missionStatement: CDH UK is leading the way in supporting families and helping to improve outcomes for the often fatal condition Congenital Diaphragmatic Hernia (CDH), that affects Babies, children and adults. By education and research we are making a difference and need you to help us to continue with our work. Help us to keep breathing life into supporting families and medical professionals affected by this devastating condition. Find out more www.cdhuk.org.uk

name: Tabor Centre
missionStatement: We are a day centre for disabled adults
description: Delivering opportunities for adults with disabilities and respite for their families

name: Step by Step (Wales)
missionStatement: Step by Step (Wales) is a Christian Charity which was set up to help ex-offenders, people with addictions or anyone who needs a bit of help and encouragement to get into employment.
description: We continue to provide employment opportunities to disadvantaged people even with COVID

name: Age NI
missionStatement:
Age NI is the leading charity for older people in Northern Ireland. 
Our population is ageing. There are more people over the age of fifty than under the age of nineteen living in Northern Ireland. In the next twenty years, the number of people over sixty will increase by more than 50%.
Our mission: to enhance and improve the lives of older people. Our vision: to create a world where older people flourish.
description: Help improve life for older people in Northern Ireland

name: Cambodian Children's Fund UK
missionStatement: The Cambodian Children's Fund is a remarkable charity which spends a minimum on running the charity and the maximum on the Cambodian children and families that benefit most.  Emphasis is placed on educating the children, the country's future decision makers.
description: 4000 pounds pays for the university education of one of CCF's children

name: SADS UK
missionStatement: SADS UK is a cardiac charity working to save young lives. Sadly, Sudden Arrhythmic Death SAD is more common than currently recognised. SADS UK campaigns, raises awareness and organises defibrillators and training in schools and the community, it funds research into SADS and was instrumental in making changes to DOH policy that has saved lives.  The charity supports people affected by sudden cardiac death and people who suffered a cardiac arrest and, or, have been diagnosed with a heart rhythm condition.
description: SADS UK strives to prevent devastating young sudden cardiac deaths, join SADS, STOP SADS

name: The CGD Society
missionStatement: The CGD Society supports families affected by chronic granulomatous disorder and are the leading global charity for patients and medical professionals. With support from diverse sectors, we are able to give on-the-ground support to CGD-affected people in a multitude of ways, including medical advice, emotional support and raising awareness of the condition.
description: Your generosity will make a lasting difference to those affected by this rare condition.

name: The Thyroid Trust
missionStatement: The Thyroid Trust works to make things better for people affected by thyroid disease, by providing information and support, as well as awareness raising and advocacy work.
description: Thyroid disorders have been overlooked for too long, please help us make a difference!

name: Artists Project Earth
missionStatement:
APE produces Afro-Cuban collaborations with top International musicians to bring awareness of ocean plastic pollution, other maritime issues, climate change and natural disaster relief. Some of these artists are Red Hot Chilli Peppers, Ed Sheeran,Mumford & Sons, Coldplay,Bob Dylan, Eminem and Beyonce.

APE supports effective environmental projects and awareness-raising initiatives to combat climate change and raises funds for natural disaster relief.
description: You can help save our oceans by downloading our CDs or making a donation.

name: Starlight Family
missionStatement: Starlight Family Charity Organisation, supports vulnerable children and adults in rural Kiboga, Uganda. Currently donations are helping with food, clothing and shelter, medicinal and educational needs of the beneficiaries. In the long term we aim to undertake projects that will raise standards of living and help Starlight Family Kiboga to become self-supporting. To find out more please view our website http://www.starlightfamily.org/home
description: All donations no matter how small make a BIG differnece in our beneficiaries lives.

name: Worcestershire Animal Rescue Shelter
missionStatement: Worcestershire Animal Rescue Shelter is a charity that rescues, re-homes and rehabilitates mistreated, unwanted or abandoned cats, dogs and ex-battery chickens. We provide care, shelter and love for them until the right forever home is found. As a small independent charity, we rely on the generosity of our staff, volunteers and local community to keep our work going.
description: Help us rescue and rehome even more animals to find them their loving forever home.

name: Boxer Welfare Scotland Trust
missionStatement: Boxer Welfare Scotland was founded in 2005 and since then we have rehomed over 1000 boxers across Scotland. We rely on donations with our aim being to rescue and re-home all boxers whose previous owners are no longer able to look after them. We microchip, vet check and neuter / spay all our dogs before rehoming them with their new family. We keep in touch with boxers we have re-homed and offer support and advice. For more information on our rescue and how to adopt a boxer from us please get in touch.
description: Please donate to Boxer Welfare Scotland and help support our charity.

name: The Philosophy Foundation
missionStatement: Today more than ever we need the understanding, critical thinking skills and perspective philosophy brings. Founded in 2007 The Philosophy Foundation's mission is to bring understanding, wisdom and flourishing to the heart of education for children and adults. We do this primarily by facilitating philosophical enquiry in schools and other learning environments, including prisons and hospital schools, and in the workplace.
description: Your gift will help sponsor a school to receive regular philosophy for young people

name: Starfish Christian Trust
missionStatement: We are a small Christian Charity accepting that we cannot change the world but we can make a difference to one life, one family or one community. Our current projects include releasing families from bondage of slavery in Pakistan's brick kilns, building a school in Ethiopia, helping with a micro finance project in Burundi, supporting an orphanage and digging wells in India etc. We hold leadership and training seminars, mainly in Kenya. Also involved in Philippines and Guinea. We are a UK registered charity
description: You cannot change the world but you can change a life, family or community.

name: Wilberforce Trust
missionStatement:
The Wilberforce Trust are committed to supporting people with sight loss, we do this through our supported accommodation, low vision clinic, visual awareness training and activities within the living and learning zone.

Our vision is to see a world in which all people with sight loss, including those with other disabilities, are truly integrated in society with equal opportunities in all aspects of life, and to know that our passion and commitment have been influential in bringing this about.
description: Your money can help make a difference to people with sight loss in York

name: Mission International
missionStatement: "Making this world a better place"
description: Provide a hand up to needy individuals, families and communities in the developing world.

name: Scottish Book Trust
missionStatement: Scottish Book Trust is a charity that changes lives through books, reading and writing.
description: Change lives through books

name: Net Church Sittingbourne
missionStatement: We are a local church with many communities projects
description: where people matter and lives are changed

name: Duchenne UK
missionStatement:
Duchenne UK has one clear aim, to end Duchenne. 

Duchenne muscular dystrophy (DMD) is a progressive muscle-wasting disease. 

As the leading DMD charity in the UK, Duchenne UK is at the forefront of advancing treatments and care for everyone affected by the disease to end its devastating impact. 

Duchenne UK is going further than anyone has before, and doing it faster because this generation of people living with DMD can't wait. 

Together, we will end Duchenne.
description: Together, we will end Duchenne.

name: Emmanuel Church Northwood
missionStatement: We are a lively evangelical church in Northwood, Middlesex, seeking to grow deeper (in our relationship with God and in our relationship with each other), grow younger (committed to placing a special emphasis on trying to reach children, young people and their families) and grow wider (in our outreach as a church seeking to love and serve the people who live and work in Northwood). We hold four services each Sunday to suit all worshipping styles, as well as lots of mid-week activities for a range of ages.
description: Making Christ known and working to love and serve the people of Northwood and beyond.

name: Rotary eClub of London Centenary
missionStatement:
The Rotary Club of London Centenary is a club with an international Membership, a number of our members live outside England.  Although we are governed by the rules of Rotary International we rarely meet physically, but have weekly video-conference meetings which enable us to carry out our programs in the same way traditional clubs do, but from the comfort of our own homes or businesses.  
Our aim, as a club, is To Do Good in the World to make life a little easier for those less fortunate than us.
description: By donating to us you will be doing good for someone who is in need of our support.

name: Alexandra Rose Charity
missionStatement:
We know there is a crisis in the way people are eating, with too much junk food consumed and not enough fruit and veg. We understand that a family's economic situation can have a direct impact on the food choices they make on a daily basis. 

At Alexandra Rose Charity, our vision is for everyone to have access to healthy, affordable food.

Our Rose Vouchers for Fruit and Veg Project helps to increase access to fruit and veg by giving families the spending power to be able to make healthy food choices.
description: Everyone should have access to healthy food. Help us provide fruit & veg to families!

name: Borders Animal Welfare Association
missionStatement:
Borders Pet Rescue

We have been dedicated to the rescue and re-homing of domestic pets in the Scottish Borders since 1989. Our mission is twofold: to find suitable loving homes for abandoned and unwanted pets and to promote responsible pet ownership through education and training. We are a registered Scottish charity and rely entirely on your generosity to support our work.

name: White Lodge Centre
missionStatement: White Lodge supports disabled children/adults and their families in the Surrey area by providing a range of flexible services. Our specialist centre offers therapies, nursery education for children with cerebral palsy, family support services for disabled children/young people and a resource centre where disabled adults can socialise, learn new skills and access therapies.
description: To help support disabled children, young people and adults and their carers

name: The Pituitary Foundation
missionStatement: The Pituitary Foundation provides support to pituitary patients and their families. Pituitary diseases are rare and often hard to diagnose so they can be very isolating. We aim to provide support and information for patients during what can often be a very long and difficult journey.
description: Donate now to support pituitary patients

name: Evenstar Charitable Organisation
missionStatement: We help abandoned, abused and neglected pets in Qatar find forever homes, anywhere in the world.  We are run entirely by volunteers who receive no payments of any kind, other than the satisfaction of knowing lives have been saved.
description: Help us give them a better brighter future

name: Adoption Matters
missionStatement: Adoption Matters is a children's charity and voluntary adoption agency - we recruit train and support adoptive families and offer ongoing support and training for as long as they need it
description: All proceeds go towards shaping a child's future

name: Team UnLimbited
missionStatement: Team UnLimbited Design, Gift and Open Source 3D Printed assistive devices.
description: Help us to keep giving a helping hand

name: Mango Tree Home Ltd
missionStatement: Providing a safe and secure home for 37 children in Haiti
description: Educational and development support

name: Ciata Foundation
missionStatement: A DOMESTIC ABUSE CHARITY SUPPORTING SURVIVORS AND ABUSED INDIVIDUALS IN MANCHESTER
description: transforming the lives of domestic abuse survivors and sufferers for the better

name: The Ryan MS Therapy Centre
missionStatement: The provision and continuance of a Therapy Centre to support people with MS by the delivery of physio and other therapies as may be beneficial to the health and welfare of all such persons.
description: supporting those living with MS

name: Yardley Gobion Pre-School
missionStatement: We are a committee run Pre-School and a registered charity. We are a member of the Pre-School Learning Alliance. We are inspected regularly by Ofsted to ensure the children's educational standards are met. We try to ensure a friendly happy atmosphere, whilst at the same time encouraging learning for our children through the interesting, fun and enjoyable activities we offer.
description: Please donate today. All donations help to keep our much loved Pre-School up and running.

name: Lanark Community Development Trust
missionStatement: Lanark Community Development Trust is a charitable, non-profit body which carries out projects for the common good. It is an independent, volunteer-led organisation which is part of a growing network of Development Trusts which exist across Scotland and the UK. Here in Lanark, we aspire to develop and deliver priority community projects which have a social, environmental and economic impact.
description: Support Lanark Community Development Trust

name: THE KEVIN CRUISE FOUNDATION
missionStatement: The Royal Borough of Windsor and Maidenhead is rich in culture and heritage. However, it is also a borough of great diversity and we have identified a need for further exposure to the performing arts, particularly for children from disadvantaged backgrounds.  The Kevin Cruise Foundation is a response to this need.  Offering complimentary theatre tickets to children, families, carers, schools and charity volunteers.
description: Donate to us so we can continue to bring The Arts to those less fortunate

name: ABDULLAH AID
missionStatement: ABDULLAH AID IS A CHARITY ORGANISATION SERVING HUMANITY. PROVIDING EMERGENCY AID RELIEF AROUND THE WORLD TO THOSE PEOPLE ORPHANS WIDOWS AND REFUGEES IN NEED REGARDLESS OF RELIGION, RACE, IN CRISIS AND NON CRISIS SITUATIONS.
description: Assist us in helping those in need and serve humanity

name: LymeAid UK
missionStatement: LymeAid UK provides private overseas Lyme disease tests to those who need, but can't afford them. The NHS test is flawed and whilst no test exists to rule out Lyme Borreliosis, most NHS doctors will not treat based on a clinical diagnosis alone and will misdiagnose as chronic fatigue syndrome/ME or fibromyalgia.  A positive Lyme Disease test is the difference for many people between getting treatment on the NHS or not; or being able to successfully fundraise for and obtain private treatment or not.

name: The Padua Charitable Fund
missionStatement: The Padua Charitable Fund was founded in July 2007 with the conviction that everyone has the basic right to a decent home, good health and education necessary to ensure the community of a safe, sound and happy.

name: Cats Protection - Newbury & District Adoption Centre
missionStatement:

Cats Protection aims to - 

Find good homes for cats in need.

Support and encourage neutering of cats.

Improve people's understanding of cats and their care.

Support: We provide a range of activities and initiatives to help men through this tough time. 
Awareness: We teach men the importance of checking their balls regularly and going to the GP early

We provide a simple breakfast of porridge followed by sandwiches in mid-morning and a three course lunch as well as tea and coffee and a variety of snack items.

We also provide a  warm, friendly and informal environment where people can engage in social interaction and can, for a few hours, relax and feel safe and warm.

We seek to educate visitors and school groups through our activities, cave tours and our collections.

An apolitical membership organisation open to all

A promoter of the best of what we are culturally, now and in the future

A catalyst to ensure new ideas are considered and the best of them are made real

With a small staff team and 138 volunteers, we work with people as soon after diagnosis as possible. We understand each persons fears and aspirations, and help them live a full, independent life.

description: Supporting the Animals of the RSPCA Suffolk East & Ipswich Branch

name: HUGHES SYNDROME FOUNDATION
missionStatement:
APS Support UK, aims to achieve earlier diagnosis and offer support to anyone affected by antiphospholipid syndrome (APS) through awareness, education and research. 

APS is a life-threatening autoimmune condition that causes the blood to clot too quickly. The condition can cause potentially fatal events such as strokes, heart attacks, blood clots in the lung and DVTs. 

In pregnancy, APS is the most important treatable cause of recurrent miscarriage and is strongly associated with stillbirth.
description: Help us save lives by raising awareness of this significantly under-diagnosed condition.

name: World Parrot Trust
missionStatement:
Of the more than 350 known species of parrots, nearly 100 are threatened in wild. Popular as pets, many are captured for the wild bird trade or suffer from hunting or loss of habitat. Each species is an integral part of their environment and the extinction of even a single species is a sad and permanent loss to us all.

The objectives of the World Parrot Trust are to promote the survival of all parrot species in the wild and to advocate for the welfare of individual birds in our homes.
description: Please help parrots to survive in the wild and thrive in our homes

name: Coventry Cyrenians
missionStatement: We aim to provide a comprehensive range of high quality services to enable any person who is homeless, or person whose accommodation may be at risk, to improve their quality of life and empower them to live as independently as possible.

H=Honesty
E=Empathy
A=Achievement

We are Habitat for Humanity, one of the worlds leading housing NGOS.

We believe every person has the right to live in a decent home that will keep them safe, secure, and warm.

We stand with the most vulnerable to build decent and affordable homes that help give families and communities the foundation for a life out of poverty.

Building a world where everyone has a safe place to call home will take all of us.

Together we can all make a difference.

We are Habitat for Humanity.

A charity founded over 150 years ago, we are independent so you can be.

Many come to us not only with physical illness but many have psychological issues due to the extremely abuse .
We cannot continue without the support of the public all the volunteers work full time and the rescue runs on your kind donations and our own funds.
Our aim for 2016 would be to find a bigger yard where our work could expand .

name: Finding Your Feet
missionStatement:
Finding Your Feet support families affected by amputation or limb difference, through a range of sporting initiatives and social inclusion projects.
Isolation is a huge problem for many amputees.  It has been proven that quality of life and even life expectancy is greatly reduced without social inclusion, with as many as 30% of vascular amputees not surviving to one year post amputation.  FYF are key in addressing this issue.  We are directly saving lives.
description: Donate to help someone find their feet!

Action for Conservation is a UK charity which uses pioneering approaches to engage and inspire young people, between the ages of 12 and 18, to become the next generation of nature conservationists.


Our vision is that every young person in the UK is moved and empowered to protect the natural world.


Our mission is to bring the magic of nature into UK schools, inspiring a youth movement committed to conservation and to the earth.
 

Our values are Hope, Wonder, Action, and Change.
description: Help us inspire the next generation of conservationists through UK-wide school workshops

There is a special need for age-appropriate coping tools, interactive gaming offers a huge range of benefits throughout medical environments
