missionStatement:
We are a supportive sisterhood of women who have rebuilt their lives after the trauma.
We offer free sessions for female trauma and abuse survivors.
description: Free and multilingual counselling for female survicors of trauma or abuse.

name: Rolvenden Cat Rescue
missionStatement: Rolvenden Cat Rescue is a small, independent and entirely voluntary charity, dedicated to the care, rehabilitation and homing of homeless, abandoned, abused and feral cats.

name: The Tom Bowdidge Foundation
missionStatement:
We fund projects that support teenage cancer sufferers and their families. We work on projects that provide clinical, practical, financial and emotional support to help them cope with their cancer diagnosis. 
We are funding a major research project into teenage cancers with specific reference to sarcoma research.
description: Supporting teenagers and young adults with cancer

name: Yad Veachisomoch L'Chaim
missionStatement:
L'chaim Foodbank distributes food daily to tens of needy individuals and families. These families come from diverse backgrounds, and include single parents, families who have had their bread winner made redundant, elderly, ill and infirm.
The foodbank also provides emergency short term food supplies to families and individuals who have been hit by a crisis. The foodbank aims to fill the gap of days and sometimes weeks until the professional care services can come into play
description: WHERE EVERYONE IS VALUED

name: Archdiocese of Cardiff, St Peters Roath
missionStatement:
A Catholic Church in the Archdiocese of 
Cardiff, Wales, UK.
With active service to the needs of local people.
With prayerful liturgies and worship.
description: Live the Gospel and spread it through good works

name: Brightons Parish Church
missionStatement: Brightons Parish Church seeks to show Christ's love to all and be a blessing to the wider world. We are based in Brightons, Falkirk.
description: Support us so that we can partner with God's mission in the world.

name: Stockport Without Abuse
missionStatement: We are a local charity who offer a range of services to help and support women, men and children who are affected by domestic abuse.
description: We support women, men and children who are affected by domestic abuse.

name: Retro Computer Museum
missionStatement: TO ESTABLISH AND MAINTAIN A MUSEUM FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE PUBLIC FOR THE PRESERVATION, DISPLAY AND PUBLIC EXPERIENCE OF COMPUTER AND CONSOLE SYSTEMS FROM THE 1960'S ONWARDS

name: Quaker Service
missionStatement: Quaker Service provides support for people in Northern Ireland going through difficult times. Our two projects are Quaker Cottage a cross community family crisis centre delivering a range of services for mothers, children, and teenagers in some of the most disadvantaged areas in Belfast, Quaker Connections, is a programme that supports families visiting prison, and people in prison through befriending and practical support services.

name: Vegan Organic Network
missionStatement:
Aims to
Educate the public about how their food is grown.
Network with growers around the world.
Specify the methods and standards for veganic growing and enable growers to become certified using these standards.
Support veganic demonstration, education and research centres.
Encourage veganic cultivation on all scales.
Support farmers who want to convert to veganic growing and individuals who want who want to learn how to grow veganically.
Campaign for a veganic standard label on produce.
description: By supporting  VON you can help create a kinder, greener world for everyone.

name: Revive Congo
missionStatement: To educate and equip young people between the ages of 8-21 in the Democratic Republic of Congo and in the UK.
description: Donate what you can and be a part of equipping Congo's future leaders.

name: Trio Uganda
missionStatement: Trio Uganda is a volunteer-led charity. We work with small community based organisations that are driven by the commitment, knowledge and experience of local people. Our partners in Eastern Uganda are registered grassroots initiatives, addressing complex and challenging issues with very limited resources.  We work together to build services, resources and financial independence, contributing to the fight against poverty through a local to global model of sustainable, citizen-led change.
description: Support sustainable local change in impoverished communities.

name: The Cedar Tree Trust
missionStatement: We see ourselves as a haven of specialised support where people can be signposted when they have experienced the trauma of losing their baby(ies).We want to continue to make a difference in being available for those who need our service. We are the preferred provider for this type of bereavement support in the eyes of the local hospitals, bereavement midwives, GPs and Gateway Mental Health workers.
description: Offering support with pregnancy choices and pregnancy loss

name: Torrington Drive Community Association
missionStatement: TDCA has been operating for over 30 years. Since its creation it has strived to ensure that local residents have a voice in their local community. The association has developed over this time to be recognised locally as an example of good practise. A great deal of the associations work is focused on providing solutions to the challenges that many of our residents may face in their day to day lives.
description: Supporting Elderly and Vulnerable residents within the Halewood community

name: Waltham St Lawrence Charities
missionStatement:
The Waltham St Lawrence Charities have for over 400 years existed to help people in need who live within the parish of Waltham St Lawrence.   

Qualifying older residents currently receive a winter payment and get help with transport and other benefits.   

Younger residents can apply for grants for further education or training.   

Any application to support a charitable purpose within the parish will be considered by the trustees.

Charity No: 204983
description: Waltham St Lawrence Charities exists to help people in need who live within the parish

name: DPA Performing Arts Academy
missionStatement: DPA Academy of Dance & Performing Arts is a Centre of Excellence in Performing Arts Education. We want to instil in our students a desire to challenge the status quo, nurture their self development and provide every child and young person with the opportunity to be inspired by the Arts and achieve success in the future so that they may achieve their fullest potential as people, students, performers and leaders.
description: Providing subsidised or free access to education, training and performance opportunities

name: Quartet Community Foundation
missionStatement: Quartet inspires philanthropy to tackle immediate needs and long-term change by connecting people who care with causes that matter, being an ever-present source of support to local charities, community and voluntary organisations and social enterprises (the VSCE sector). Collaborating with many others including working with our fund holders to inspire more philanthropic and other support to give everyone in our region a fair chance of a good life.
description: Help to change people's lives for the better across the West of England

name: Lincolnshire House Assocation Ltd
missionStatement:
Lincolnshire House is a registered charity based in Scunthorpe, North Lincolnshire, providing residential, day and respite care services for adults with Cerebral Palsy and Similar Disabilities.
We provide high quality residential accommodation for 35 residents with day and 2 respite care facilities for people who have some form of Cerebral Palsy. Our aim is to provide as full and varied a life as possible for people in our care.
description: Quality care and support for people with Cerebral Palsy

name: Winchester Excavations Committee
missionStatement: The Winchester Excavations Committee is a charity with small teams based in Winchester and Oxford, led by Prof. Martin Biddle. Our focus is the publication and digitisation of the 'Winchester Studies' series of volumes. These are works of detailed scholarship, covering the findings from the archaeological excavations in Winchester from 1962 to 1971. Incorporating literary, artistic, historical, documentary and architectural evidence, the series will provide a comprehensive profile of Winchester's past.

name: THE RESOLUTION FOUNDATION
missionStatement: The Resolution Foundation is an independent think-tank focused on improving the living standards of those on low-to-middle incomes. The Foundation conducts authoritative analytical research on living standards in the UK, working across a wide range of issues with a specific focus on the experiences of low to middle income households. Typically these are considered to be working households with incomes below the median in the UK.
description: Donate to support those on low-to-middle incomes

name: Ellen MacArthur Cancer Trust
missionStatement: The Ellen MacArthur Cancer Trust supports, empowers and inspires young people aged between 8 to 24 who are in recovery from cancer through sailing. Our sailing trips provide the opportunity to try something new and exciting with others who have experienced a similar journey, to rebuild self confidence which is vital to their long term recovery and full engagement with future life.
description: Donate today and help more young people recovering from cancer grasp their futures.

name: Klinefelter's Syndrome Association
missionStatement:
Klinefelter's Syndrome isn't rare....but it is rarely diagnosed! It affects 1 in 600 males but 75% are never diagnosed and never get support, help or an explanation.
The KSA works to raise awareness particularly amongst medical professionals and to provide support and reliable information to those affected.
The KSA runs a helpline 0300 100 4748 and hosts a website www.ksa-uk.net as well as running an annual conference. It produces a regular newsletter and runs social events to allow those affecte to meet
description: 1 in 600 isn't rare. Raising awareness, providing support!

name: Al-Mustafa Welfare Trust International LTD
missionStatement: Our journey began in November 1983 on a small scale by a group of highly motivated intellectuals, social workers, lawyers, doctors, engineers and business executives, who had the passion for philanthropy. In the last 31 years since our formation, Al-Mustafa Welfare Trust has provided medical care, education assistance, food aid, poverty relief and community development in disaster areas, war torn countries and many rural and poverty stricken areas of the world, serving millions of needy and
description: Support the needy and helpless with us today!

name: REACH Lanarkshire Autism
missionStatement: REACH Lanarkshire Autism provides help, support and advice for those living with an Autism Spectrum Disorder and their families. We run activities 7 days a week in North and South Lanarkshire for children and young people with ASD and their siblings.
description: We are a parent led charity and we are committed to providing support.

name: Urban Church
missionStatement: Planting new generation churches across the North West of England. Finding gold in broken lives, unlocking rich potential and serving across our communities.
description: Bringing the Gospel to an unchurched generation. Making a difference wherever we go.

name: Women in Sport
missionStatement: Women in Sport (formerly the Women's Sport and Fitness Foundation) is a registered charity working to transform sport for the benefit of every woman and girl in the UK. Drawing on over 30 years of knowledge and insight, we champion the right of women and girls to take part in and benefit from sport - from the field of play to the boardroom, from early years and throughout their lives. Our work is centred on a belief in fairness and equal opportunity for women and girls.
description: Help us empower women and girls to achieve to reach their full potential through sport

name: Burton Joyce Village Society
missionStatement: The Burton Joyce Village Society was established to protect and enhance the village environment and to assist in the Continuance of a flourishing Community in our Village
description: Support Our Village

name: Holmfirth Civic Hall Community Trust
missionStatement: Holmfirth Civic Hall Community Trust is a registered charity, established to run and manage Holmfirth Civic Hall, in our community, by our community and for our community.
description: There is lots going on at Holmfirth Civic Hall, please support your local community hall.

name: The Raze Collective
missionStatement: The Raze Collective is a charity that supports LGBTQIA+ (queer) performers and performance through events, workshops, artist development and commissioning new work. Find out more at  www.razecollective.com
description: We are supporting new queer performers to get their first break in theatre!

name: Walney Community Trust
missionStatement:
We're a charity based in Barrow in Furness, Cumbria. 
We support young people, families and individuals through provision of groups, activities, courses and practical every day support.
description: We're currently supporting individuals and families through the Covid Crisis

name: Llantarnam Grange
missionStatement: Llantarnam Grange is Cwmbran's centre for Contemporary Art and Craft. We're a friendly space where everyone is welcomed to enjoy, feel inspired and included, appreciated and respected.
description: Providing access to culture, for all to feel involved and fulfilled through creativity

name: ROMSEY AMATEUR OPERATIC AND DRAMATIC SOCIETY (RAODS)
missionStatement:
Romsey Amateur Operatic and Dramatic Society (RAODS) owns and operates The Plaza Theatre, Romsey.  Close to Southampton, Salisbury and Winchester, the Plaza Theatre is perfectly situated to serve a large local community. 

RAODS produces 12 to 14 shows each year, at the Plaza and other venues.

An art deco venue with bucketfuls of character, the Plaza offers Pantomime, Musicals, Comedy, Drama, Dance, Youth productions and Live Music, from a variety of production companies.
description: Own and run the Plaza - Keeping theatre live in Romsey.

name: OurBrainBank UK
missionStatement: OurBrainBank is a patient-led charity designed to move glioblastoma (GBM) from terminal to treatable, powered by patients. It's the first non-profit created by, for, and with people with GBM, an aggressive and deadly brain cancer. Our key tool is a free mobile device app that enables patients to track their symptoms and treatments, and to donate their de-identified data to research. The app both empowers patients and accelerates GBM research.
description: Moving glioblastoma from terminal to treatable, powered by patients

name: India Village Care Ministries
missionStatement: We reach in with love and out with care to otherwise marginalised people and communities in rural South India. We do this in various ways: by giving food and clothing to widows and helping them with medical needs; by giving 20 orphans a home and educating street children; by providing food parcels to the blind; by supporting the families of a team of indigenous passionate pastors who spend their time serving their communities holistically.
description: Vital support to marginalised people and communities in rural south India.

name: ageuklincoln
missionStatement: Thank you for considering donating to help older people. Our vision is a world in which older people flourish. Our mission is to improve the lives of older people within Lincoln and South Lincolnshire. Funds raised will support our FREE information and advice service and our volunteering department particularly our befriending scheme making sure that older people have company and companionship and relief from loneliness and isolation.
description: Help support older people in Lincoln and South Lincolnshire by donating or buying from us

name: Yorkshire Cancer Research
missionStatement:
Yorkshire Cancer Research is a charity dedicated to funding research so that you and those you love live longer, healthier lives. Our aim is for at least 2000 more people to survive cancer in Yorkshire every year. To do this, each year we fund £10 million of world-leading research to prevent, diagnose and treat cancer.

Yorkshire is big and beautiful and while we have much to celebrate, sadly more people in our region are likely to have their lives cut short by cancer than almost anywhere else in England.

name: Chester Music Society
missionStatement: Chester Music Society objectives are to provide, maintain, improve and advance education in the widest sense of the word by furthering public appreciation of music. It aims to play a significant part in the on going cultural life of Chester as one of the strategic arts organisations in the city. It provides a varied programme of predominantly classical music that would not otherwise be provided in the city and surrounding region by commercial organisations.
description: Help support the activities of Chester Music Society

name: Open Clasp Theatre Company
missionStatement:
Our aim is to Change the World, One Play at a Time, by placing theatre at the heart of transforming the lives of disadvantaged women and girls. 

We are an award winning women's theatre company and a leading force in the North of England with national and international reach. 

We collaborate with women and young women on the margins of society to create bold and innovative theatre for personal, social and political change.
description: Your donation will help us continue to respond to the needs of women and girls.

name: Manchester Transport Museum Society Ltd
missionStatement: TO ESTABLISH AND MAINTAIN FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE PUBLIC A TRAMWAY AND TRANSPORT MUSEUM AND FOR THE LIKE PURPOSE TO PROMOTE THE PERMANENT PRESERVATION OF TRAMWAY AND ASSOCIATED VEHICLES OF GENERAL INTEREST OR EQUIPMENT OR ANY OTHER ITEMS OF TRANSPORT INTEREST OR OF ACTUAL OR POTENTIAL HISTORICAL OR SCIENTIFIC IMPORTANCE AND EDUCATIONAL VALUE WITH PARTICULAR REFERENCE TO ITEMS HAVING A CONNECTION WITH THE AREA COMPRISED WITHIN THE COUNTY OF GREATER MANCHESTER

name: Queen Elizabeth Parks Project
missionStatement:
The Queen Elizabeth Park Project is a Community Conservation Project bringing together the Staff, Schools and Communities of the Queen Elizabeth National Park in Uganda and the Queen Elizabeth Country Park in the UK.
We are a Project of cultural exchange and mutual support that focuses on conservation by promoting the exchange of best practice between the Rangers of the two Queen Elizabeth Parks and by facilitating and empowering meaningful community engagement
description: Help us to Protect Wildlife and the People impacted by Wildlife

name: Droitwich Spa and Rural Council for Voluntary Service
missionStatement:
We are an established charity based in Droitwich Spa.  We run a hub offering rooms to hire, communal spaces and information library.
We have a community transport service taking residents to medical appointments, day centres, clubs and shopping. We deliver training courses such as First Aid, Safeguarding and Food Hygiene to volunteers and groups and run educational courses for 16-19 yr olds in Maths, English, Employability with mentoring and confidence building.
description: Please donate so that we can continue supporting our vulnerable residents.

name: Into Work
missionStatement:
We help people with disabilities and long-term health conditions find, build and maintain great jobs.

Into Work provides a personalised service by taking time to get to know people, building trust and instilling confidence. We identify people's skills and interests and support them to reach their employment goals.

We help the people who come to us secure meaningful, paid and sustainable employment. With your support, we can make a difference to more peoples lives.
description: Help us support people with disabilities and long-term health conditions into work!

name: Chandran Foundation UK
missionStatement:
The Chandran Foundation strives to ensure that children with a difficult start in life do not miss out on the benefits of a good education. In recognising the neglected demand for accessible education, we work with schools and housing associations in inner-city areas to ensure we reach the young people who need our help most. 

Currently, we are offering GetFed and GetSmart clubs. In our clubs, we provide free breakfast and free tutoring.
description: Help us provide free breakfast and free tutoring to young deprived children

name: Rotary Club of Stevenage Grange Charitable Trust
missionStatement:
Our fundraising & community service work helps forge closer relationships with our Rotarian members and the community we serve here in Stevenage. With your help the Trust supports a wide range of local charities & causes often with a child, elderly or disability focus.

Covid 19 has greatly affected our ability to physically raise funds and so we are delighted now to invite you to make donations electronically with the help of the PayPal Giving Fund. Thanks
description: Helping you support our local and other charitable causes, simply

name: Cove Burgh Hall
missionStatement: The Cove & Kilcreggan Book Festival is normally held in Cove Burgh Hall which is owned and operated by the local community.  Fund raising is central to keeping it going, with  the Book Festival being a key event.  Given pandemic restrictions, it has been transformed into a virtual format. We hope that all who sign up will very much enjoy the experience.  In order to cover set up costs, any donation would be most appreciated.
description: Support our Annual Book Festival (2020) this year in virtual format and FREE to view

name: St Mark Universal Care
missionStatement:
St Mark Universal Care exists to do the right thing for those in need, overseas and in the UK, transforming lives around the world.

Our work began as a mission to improve the lives of disadvantaged communities in Egypt, North Africa and the Middle East, through a series of targeted health and welfare programmes, but now we do much, much more, including our work and alliances with charitable organisations close to our Warrington, UK home.
description: Donate now to Give health, give life, give hope

name: Wiltshire Creative
missionStatement:
Wiltshire Creative is a pan-arts organisation that brings together the energy and ambition of Salisbury Arts Centre, Salisbury International Arts Festival and Salisbury Playhouse. It is an ambitious and innovative joint arts offer that secures a bright future for audiences, artists and participants.

Wiltshire Creative is rooted in, and draws inspiration from, the city of Salisbury and works beyond its boundaries and draws audiences from across the county and further afield.
description: Wiltshire Creative builds new relationships with audiences, artists and participants.

name: The Kimmeridge Trust
missionStatement: Our mission is to advance education & learning by creating, sustaining & maintaining a world class, accredited & designated museum & centre for excellence in the village of Kimmeridge, Dorset to conserve the incredible Etches Collection and reveal it to the widest possible audience, both in person and digitally. We are a unique destination where our visitors can come to discover our amazing stories of life & death in the Jurassic seas of Dorset 157 million years ago....

name: Farnham Community Support And Response Group
missionStatement:
We are a group of likeminded volunteers that can offer a variety of services to our community, Local Authorities, Emergency Services and Volunteer Agencies.
Principally this is providing transport and logistical support in times of major emergencies and severe weather.
This could involve transporting essential supplies or personal to areas that would be inaccessible by normal vehicles.
We also provide assistance when an emergency response organisations own assets have been depleted by the demand.

name: The Albert Hall
missionStatement: Built in 1896, The Albert Hall, Llandrindod Wells is Mid Wales' Oldest Theatre. The Albert Hall Management Committee manage the Building, on behalf of the local community. We are fully self funded, and do not receive any regular income from grants. The Albert Hall is a community space, and we work tirelessly to ensure the building remains open, and used for future generations to visit. Take a look at our website, thealberthall.co.uk for more information.
description: Operation of our local, community theatre, in Llandrindod Wells

name: lincs ark
missionStatement: Lincs Ark is a small charity operating in the South Lincolnshire area to rescue and rehome cats, kittens and rabbits. We are entirely self-funded, raising money via appeals, fundraising events, etc. Everyone involved with the group is an unpaid volunteer, with a love of animals, and each year over 170 cats, kittens and rabbits are helped. All funding goes directly to the care of the animals; we do not pay for any administrative overheads, our time and effort is given freely.
description: To help us to continue to care and rehome those animals most in need

name: Action for Happiness
missionStatement: Action for Happiness is a charity which promotes mental health and wellbeing, through the provision of information, evidence-based resources, public events, educational services, training and community activities
description: Help us create a happier and kinder world. Join the movement, be the change

name: Zimbabwe Educational Trust
missionStatement: Supporting community organisations in Zimbabwe. We focus on both the material conditions within schools and wider social conditions which influence education. We also aim to increase access to education and increase the quality of education
description: Education is a human right and the best way to enable quality of life.

name: Veterans For Wildlife
missionStatement: Veterans for Wildlife is an international charity committed to the protection of wildlife and the world's critically endangered species. By deploying highly skilled and experienced service personnel, Veterans for Wildlife aims to play a key role in conservation and the prevention of wildlife crime.
description: Help us empower veterans and prevent wildlife crime!

name: Queens Hall Action on Poverty
missionStatement:
The Brick is a small project that delivers big results for the community it serves. It offers services to people who are homeless, in poverty or facing debt crisis. 

As its name suggests, it provides a safe, solid building block for people in crisis to begin to construct a new life and become valuable members of society.
description: Help rebuild lives in Wigan and Leigh

name: Lynx Educational Trust for Animal Welfare Limited
missionStatement: To inform, inspire and empower the public, with a particular focus on young people, to become champions of the unique and extraordinary creatures with whom we share our beautiful planet.
description: Help us to inspire and educate future generations about unique and amazing creatures

name: Wrights Meadow Centre
missionStatement: To provide all members of our community access to a safe, welcoming place to meet in friendship and enjoy recreation, exercise and learning. Especially those who are vulnerable or isolated.
description: Help socially isolated people get the support & friendship they need

name: Voices for Life
missionStatement: Voices for Life is a charity to help inspire children to be happy and confident through the provision of high-quality specialised singing and confidence coaching programmes for primary schools.
description: Inspiring children to be happy and confident through music …

name: Funsani
missionStatement: Our mission is to provide a safe, caring environment through Funsani Home and our partnership network to support the wellbeing and education of vulnerable children impacted by HIV in Zambia.
description: Every child in Zambia impacted by HIV has the opportunity to achieve their full potential.

name: Sound Minds
missionStatement: A user led charity and social enterprise that uses the arts to improve the lives of people living with mental ill health through arts activities and projects as well as peer support. We are a local grassroots organisation, mainly serving Wandsworth and surrounding boroughs. Much of what we achieve is through the support of people who originally came to receive the service they now help to deliver.
description: The arts for mental health - self help designed and delivered with creativity, locally

name: International Development Partnerships
missionStatement: IDP is transforming the lives of some of the poorest communities in rural Ethiopia by providing access to the basic services necessary to sustain life, such as affordable health care, a clean and reliable water supply, adequate nutrition and at least a basic level of education.
description: Support our work and help IDP transform the lives of Ethiopia's poorest communities.

name: TAG Pet Rescue Centre
missionStatement: We are a registered charity that rescues and rehomes unwanted pets in and around Thanet
description: We receive no outside funding so need all the help we can get.

name: makki mosque organisation
missionStatement:
Makki Mosque Organisation is a UK registered charity based in Sheffield. We are privileged to serve the community in the following charitable causes:
Education/training
Religious activities
Amateur sport (cricket)
description: Our Organisation require funds to further our service offering to the most vulnerable.

name: The Lutyens Trust
missionStatement: The Lutyens Trust is a charity dedicated to preserving and promoting the spirit and substance of Lutyens heritage. Our intervention and influence has helped protect many Lutyens buildings from harm.
description: We are not government funded, and so depend on public donations to support our work.

missionStatement: Wallingford 1155 aim to plan, coordinate and support a number of established charity events in the town  but also to have great fun and make new friends in the process!
description: Giving Back!

name: Norton Housing and Support Ltd
missionStatement:
We provide supported accommodation to adults with ongoing mental health issues at a time when they are most vulnerable, helping them to feel safe and secure and enabling them to live the life they want as independently as possible.
Support is also provided to vulnerable individuals living in their own homes by our Personal Assistant Service.
Our new scheme provides temporary accommodation and support to homeless young mums until they have secured a home of their own.
description: Please donate and help us to keep changing lives

name: Epiacum Heritage CIO
missionStatement: We seek to preserve and protect a unique lozenge shaped Roman fort with multiple ramparts near Alston and to research it and the landscape around it. We make the area and research available to the public relying solely on donations, grants and fundraising to do so. The fort is a Scheduled Ancient Monument, is the highest in England and has been described as 'possibly the best preserved Roman fort in England'. For further information see our website : https://www.epiacumheritage.org
description: We need to raise 1600 pounds each year just to keep the fort open and run the website

name: BECKFORD NATURE RESERVE
missionStatement:
Beckford Nature Reserve is a small haven close to the centre of Beckford where wildlife, waterbirds and some rare plants thrive. The reserve contains a number of wildlife habitats that 
have evolved partly through natural progression but also 
by careful management - assisted by local conservationists.
It is open to the public and is maintained by local volunteers, but still requires financial help to pay for insurance and the occasional contract work, particularly to keep the area safe for visitors.
description: Preserving Nature doesn't come free.

name: The Sofii Foundation
missionStatement: The Showcase of Fundraising Inspiration and Innovation exists to provide a free, online, easily accessible archive of effective fundraising from around the world to give fundraisers the knowledge and inspiration they need to raise more funds for their important causes. Our focus lies on the exhibits featured on our website.  These are case studies of innovative, tried and tested fundraising ideas and examples from around the world.  Such a feature is unique to us and is our USP.
description: Help spread great fundraising ideas and practice to changemakers around the world

name: The Ameca Trust
missionStatement: Founded by Ruthie Markus in memory of her son, Alex Coutselos, a junior doctor and serving British Army Office. AMECA impact by working in partnership with the Department of Health and by only supporting initiatives that are community driven. AMECA's clinic provides primary healthcare for a community of 22,000. AMECA also facilitate surgical training in district and mission hospital as only by an uplift in healthcare provision at district level, can the healthcare system in Malawi be supported effectively.
description: Please help us to support sustainable healthcare initiatives in Malawi

name: Rothwell District Lions (CIO)
missionStatement: Rothwell District Lions Club (CIO) is a member of Lions Clubs International (LCI) the world's largest non-political service organisation. Founded in 1917 LCI currently has over 1.4 million members worldwide. Rothwell District Lions Club has been serving the local area for over 50 years through a combination of service projects and donations to local charities and other local good causes. every penny donated goes towards these good causes as administration of the club is funded by its members.
description: Help us to help others

name: Mikeysline
missionStatement:
Mikeysline was founded in 2015 after a number of suicides in the Highland area. We run two services, a text line 07786207755, as well as the Hive centre in Inverness. We have 4 aims which are the motivation behind all that we do: 
Help fight the Highland wide problem of chronic loneliness. 
Provide a light in the dark for those in the depths of depression. 
Offer a distraction from thoughts leaning towards self harm. 
Tackle head on the staggering rate of suicide in the Highlands.
description: Every donation, however small will help us to help others when they need us

name: The Brickworks
missionStatement: The Brickworks was set up to support projects in South Sudan. Since 2016, it has also supported South Sudanese refugees who are living in camps in Uganda.  The charity now supports a health clinic in Yei, South Sudan and 7 schools, four of which are in a refugee camp and three are in Yei.  The charity gives scholarships for health training and supports 20 teachers to study for a Diploma in Teaching.  The Brickworks keeps overheads to a minimum and works entirely with South Sudanese church partners.
description: Rebuilding lives in South Sudan

name: EXETER ROYAL ACADEMY FOR DEAF EDUCATION
missionStatement:
The  Deaf Academy exists to enable young deaf people to acquire language, achieve independence, develop socially and
emotionally and excel educationally.
The principal way we achieve this is through running a bilingual (British Sign Language and English) day and residential school and college for students aged 5-25 years from throughout the UK.
description: Donate today and help inspire deaf young people to achieve their potential

name: StreetInvest
missionStatement: StreetInvest exists to improve street children's lives around the world. Street children are subject to violent abuses of their human rights every day, yet they are also highly capable, resilient, responsive and resourceful. We are experts in street work, a holistic approach to working with street children that combines street based support with community advocacy, to create lasting positive change in their lives.
description: Every one pound raised will allow a street worker to support a street child for a month.

name: HHI Humanity Health International
missionStatement: HHI Humanity Health International is a non profit organisation registered in England, Wales and Ghana to improve the health and wellbeing of Prisoners, ex-Prisoners and their families in need.
description: Help us to create real life improvements for prisoners, ex-prisoners and their families

name: Alness Baptist Church
missionStatement: We are a small fellowship of outward-looking evangelical Christians who love the Lord Jesus Christ in the town of Alness, which is located in the Highland Region of Scotland.
description: To share the good news of the love of God the Father through the sacrifice of Jesus the So

name: Women’s Inclusive Team
missionStatement: Women's Inclusive Team (WIT) is a charity led by women who work with Tower Hamlets residents for over 15 years supporting them with social inclusion and their health and wellbeing.
description: Please donate to our food bank and community kitchen

name: Minara Foundation
missionStatement: Minara Foundation is a UK based charity working in countries such as Pakistan, India and Bangladesh to end poverty. We provide clean water and food to those living in poverty.
description: Donate to Minara Foundation and join us in our fight against poverty.

name: Richmond Good Neighbours
missionStatement: Richmond Good Neighbours is a registered charity which was established to provide services to the elderly, the disabled, the housebound and others living in the old civil parish of Richmond.
description: RGN supports elderly housebound lonely residents in Richmond

name: Breakthrough
missionStatement:
Breakthrough is a charity supporting adult survivors of trauma and abuse. 
We provide specialist services and therapy for survivors; as well as training for those provide effective mental health support.
description: Help support survivors of abuse

name: ONCA Trust Limited
missionStatement: ONCA is a Brighton based arts charity that bridges social and environmental justice issues. With our public programme, we create inclusive spaces for collaborative learning, artist support and community solidarity.
description: Help us to inspire positive and creative action in the face of environmental change.

name: The National Education Museum
missionStatement: A project to establish a National Education Museum for England and Wales
description: A project to learn from the past to guide the future. Let's build it together.

name: Tutorfair Foundation
missionStatement: Tutorfair Foundation is a charity set up to fight educational inequality by improving access to high-quality tutoring. The Foundation partners with schools and other educational organisations to deliver volunteer-led tutoring programmes to young people from less-advantaged backgrounds.
description: Help us to deliver quality tutoring to students from less-advantaged backgrounds.

name: Zante Strays
missionStatement:
Zante Strays is a dedicated all-volunteer animal rescue. We are passionate about helping the wonderful, friendly stray & abandoned dogs of Zante (Zakynthos) Island, Greece. We rescue, provide veterinary treatment (inc neutering), foster & find loving homes in the UK, Germany/Holland. 

These extraordinary strays are dumped in rubbish bins or up mountains, shot, starved or living on the streets (tourists feed them in Summer then poison is spread Autumn-Spring) yet they still trust & love people.
description: Please support us to help the sweet strays of Zante live to find safety & loving homes.

name: HULL LGBT+ COMMUNITY PRIDE
missionStatement: Pride in Hull delivers a large scale annual event in Hull aimed at promoting inclusion, community cohesion and raising awareness of issues affecting the LGBT+ community. The event consists of a large parade which offers creative opportunities in the weeks and months prior to the event to engage the local community in artistic projects. The main event consists of a large outdoor concert.
description: Make it happen!

name: The Butterfly Trust
missionStatement: We support people living with Cystic Fibrosis in Scotland. We are Scotland's lead proving agency of social support to children & families living with Cystic Fibrosis. We make a positive impact in peoples lives helping with benefits, housing issues, supporting from diagnosis at birth right the way through to supporting young adults moving into independent living.
description: Support people living with Cystic Fibrosis in Scotland

name: Aniridia Network
missionStatement: We are a support group and charity concerned with the rare genetic condition aniridia which causes a lack of irises, the coloured ring in the eyes, and poor vision from birth. Since 2000 Aniridia Network has been helping people with aniridia as well as their families, doctors and teachers to be hopeful, confident, supported and well informed about aniridia and related issues.
description: Help us make people with aniridia hopeful, confident, supported and well informed

name: VICTA
missionStatement: VICTA is a national charity that provides support to children and young people who are blind or partially sighted and their families. We believe that everyone has the right to an independent and fulfilling life. VICTA's support, advice, grants and activities enable young people and their families to build skills, develop confidence and help each other towards a positive future.
description: help us to help blind and partially sighted children and young people

name: David Nott Foundation
missionStatement: The David Nott Foundation is a UK registered charity which provides surgeons and medical professionals with the skills they need to provide relief and assistance in conflict and natural disaster zones around the world. As well as providing the best medical care, David Nott Foundation surgeons will train local healthcare professionals; leaving a legacy of education and improved health outcomes.
description: Well trained doctors save more lives

name: Restorative Justice for All International Institute CIC
missionStatement:
We are charity with a mission to advance community and social cohesion at the local, national and international levels. 

We focus on redistributing power in a more equal way by delivering educational programmes, work placements & volunteering opportunities to the most marginalised groups of society. 

We use the restorative justice values of equality, power sharing, dignity and respect to deliver our projects.

name: Togs SCIO
missionStatement: Togs is a Dundee based Children's clothing bank.  We provide quality donated clothes to local families. Healthcare Professionals, Teachers and Charities submit a referral to us, we pack 1 weeks worth of clothing ready for collection.  We also aim to provide new pants, socks and toiletries for each child. We can also give out baby equipment, school clothes and shoes.  Togs is run entirely by volunteers who are committed to helping children and families.  We value every donation your support is appreciated.
description: Giving children dignity and confidence to develop and fit in with their peers.

name: The Aloud Charity
missionStatement: At The Aloud Charity, we believe in the power of group singing to change lives, improve wellbeing and strengthen communities. Our exciting activities nurture aspiration and equip young people with the skills to fulfil their potential.  Our central programme of activity is Only Boys Aloud (OBA). Made up of 12 choirs across Wales, OBA delivers music and team activities to 13-19 year old boys, providing them with a second family and a sense of brotherhood, whilst improving their self-esteem and ambition.
description: Please support us today to provide life-changing opportunities to young people.

name: Mindapples
missionStatement: Mindapples has been promoting public mental health and wellbeing across the UK since 2008. Our vision is of a world where taking care of our minds is natural and normal for everyone. We want to help people feel comfortable talking about their minds and exploring what works for them. We run campaigns and education programmes; publish books, pamphlets and apps; and support other charities, schools, universities and healthcare bodies. We provide tools, training and a framework for talking about mental health.
description: Mindapples helps everyone in the UK take better care of their mental health and wellbeing.

name: Dont Lose Hope
missionStatement: We are a mental health charity who offer a free or low cost counselling service to residents of lincolnshire
description: To enhance the emotional well-being of all members of our community.

name: Macclesfield Youth Brass Band
missionStatement: Macclesfield Youth Brass Band offers young people aged between 7 and 19 the chance to learn a brass or percussion instrument and play in one of its three bands. It's an activity which develops musical, educational and social skills, and at about one pound a week is extremely low cost. There's no extra charge for the loan of an instrument, music or uniforms. The bands performs in the local community as well as travelling further afield to play in contests.
description: Help us to give even more young people the chance to participate in music making.

name: Basic Income Earth Network (BIEN)
missionStatement: The Basic Income Earth Network (BIEN) works to educate the general public about Basic Income, that is, a periodic cash payment delivered to all on an individual basis, without means test or work requirement; to serve as a link between the individuals and groups committed to, or interested in, Basic Income; to stimulate and disseminate research about Basic Income; and to foster informed public discussion on Basic Income throughout the world. The organisation has little money and is run by volunteers.
description: The Basic Income debate is now intense and we can't cope. We need some staff.

name: SNAP (Special Needs Action Project)
missionStatement: Supporting children and young adults who have additional support needs. Founded in 1996, SNAP has grown over the years with the needs of our children, young people and families. We run clubs and activities for young people aged 5 to 19 and for those aged 19 and above who need the continuation of the friendships and activities at SNAP. Activities provide a place and time for fun, trying out new and popular activities, creating simple socialisation opportunities whilst giving their families a break.
description: Please help us provide the best care to as many children and young people as possible.

name: BEACON (Bradford Ecumenical Asylum Concern)
missionStatement: BEACON seeks to address the varied needs of the many asylum seekers who find themselves in the Bradford district.  We aim to offer care and support to asylum seekers and foster a culture of welcome.  Our projects offer practical support and hospitality to asylum seekers attending appeal hearings at the local tribunal hearing centre, support to asylum seekers without legal representation, a home to those facing destitution, and English conversation classes to all who wish to improve their spoken English.
description: Help us 'Welcome the Stranger'

name: TOLWORTH GIRLS' SCHOOL PARENTS & FRIENDS ASSOCIATION
missionStatement:
Tolworth Girl's School PFA is a voluntary association of parents, carers and friends of children who attend the school.  
Its aim is to advance the education of pupils in the school, done through a range of fundraising activities that bring together parents, staff and children.
Our aim is to provide additional resources for the school that benefit current and future children's education.
Events are run in the school with some events run on line and external events may be run via outside organisations.
description: We need your support to help us to improve the education of our next generation

name: George and Annette Bell Foundation
missionStatement:
The George & Annette Bell Foundation was established in 2019 with the mission of leaving a long lasting legacy, by helping to create and sustain communities where people are inspired to live healthier and happier lifestyles and are given the opportunity to reach their full potential.
We aim to be the force for good through the delivery of a range of local and national projects. To support and generate fundraising activity and offer the hand of friendship to those most in need.

name: First Aid 4 Gambia
missionStatement:
Now more than ever, we need your help.

First Aid 4 Gambia is targeted First Aid training and equipment for staff and helpers at schools and nurseries in Gambia. By donating money or volunteering to run a fund raising event you will help our team continue their valuable work. You could also volunteer to join our outreach team in Gambia for a week or two, where you can help deliver crucial life saving training and equipment to those who need it the most.
description: Providing Free First Aid Training to staff in Nurseries and Schools in The Gambia

name: Age UK Teesside Ltd
missionStatement:
To Age UK Teesside 'older people' means anyone over the age of 50. We recognise that early retirement is a feature of life today, which with an expectation of a longer lifespan on a reduced income and a smaller social network can lead to difficulties.
We aim to improve lifestyles by:
Age UK Teesside working with anyone over the age of 50 Helping to claim rightful entitlements to a range of benefits, so promoting financial security and stability. Promoting healthy living and a chance to meet new people.

name: ATLANTIC PACIFIC INTERNATIONAL RESCUE LIMITED
missionStatement:
Atlantic Pacific International Rescue is an NGO with a simple vision; to combat global drowning.

Atlantic Pacific exists to tackle this crisis and eliminate death by drowning by providing Lifeboats and trained crew to areas of need.
 
We work with communities around the world who do not have a water rescue service but find themselves in areas vulnerable to flooding and natural disasters.
description: Help us save lives by providing lifeboats, crew and education to areas of high drowning.

name: knitted knockers uk
missionStatement: Knitted Knockers are a UK charity that knit and crochet breast prostheses for women who have undergone a mastectomy or lumpectomy.
description: Made with love and filled with hope and provided free to to ladies who need them

name: Disability Initiative
missionStatement: Disability Initiative is a registered charity established in 1975 supporting adults aged 18 and over who have a physical disability and or acquired brain injury, many with associated learning challenges or mental health issues.  Client diagnoses include stroke, traumatic brain injury, multiple sclerosis, muscular dystrophy, Huntingtons, Parkinsons and cerebral palsy
description: Help our disabled clients achieve their goals with Disability Initiative

name: Goodheart Animal Sanctuaries
missionStatement:
Goodheart Animal Sanctuaries is a new, exciting charity. We are dedicated to providing relief from cruelty and suffering for animals in need of care, by creating awareness & facilities for rescue, re-homing and lifetime care.

We run a farm animal sanctuary in Milson, Kidderminster which is home to over 200 animals, as well as supporting two other sanctuaries: the 25 year old Farm Animal Sanctuary at Evesham and Wiccaweys Rescued Border Collies in Lincolnshire.

name: Blackpool Carers Centre Limited
missionStatement: We provide specialist support, respite and outings for carers from the age of 5 years. We help them to create friendships, feel less isolated, strengthen their resilience and make happy memories. Making a Better Life for Carers.
description: Your generous donations will help us to continue supporting carers in Blackpool.

name: PETERSFIELD LIONS CLUB (CIO)
missionStatement:
Petersfield Lions Club (CIO), part of Lions International, is a charitable organization.
We serve the community, fundraising for local good causes, welfare & youth projects. 
There are also regular social activities within the club.
description: Serving the Community, Locally, Nationally & Internationally

name: The Friends of Herons Dale Primary School
missionStatement: The Friends of Herons Dale Primary School raise funds to provide specialist equipment and resources, so the children can participate in a wide range of experiences within the school and their local community.
description: To help us raise vital funds to enrich each and every pupil within our school community.

name: Rangjung Yeshe Gomde Trust
missionStatement: Developing an International meditation centre and a Woodland Hermitage in the Highlands of Scotland, under the guidance of Chokyi Nyima Rinpoche and taking special care to protect the woodland environment and increase Biodiversity.
description: Help Gomde Grow

name: Granshaw Presbyterian Church
missionStatement:
Granshaw Presbyterian Church is a congregation of the Presbyterian Church in Ireland. The congregation seeks to be a haven for people with broken hearts. We believe that as God's family we should love, care for and support one another in the ups and downs of everyday life. We want all who attend our services to feel at home, be inspired by the worship, and challenged by the biblical messages. Granshaw Family Church exists to help the wider community in its practical and
spiritual needs.

name: THE OPEN TABLE NETWORK
missionStatement: The Open Table Network is a growing and connected partnership of Christian worship communities which welcome and affirm LGBTQIA+ People, our family, friends, and all our allies, in the UK. The network has been created by, and for, LGBTQIA+ people. Churches don't always feel safe or welcoming to LGBTQIA+ people. But our name, 'Open Table', is an open invitation to come in, just as you are, and be with us, in a safe, affirming community. You're more than welcome to come as you are: www.opentable.lgbt
description: Creating safe sacred spaces for LGBTQIA+ Christians in the UK

name: Marlow District Scout Council Pheasants Hill Campsite
missionStatement: Pheasants Hill campsite is a volunteer run charity that is owned by Marlow District Scouts and provides a campsite to any youth groups near the River Thames in South Buckinghamshire.
description: Give an outdoor experience to a child in a safe & beautiful environment

name: Teens Unite Fighting Cancer
missionStatement: Teens Unite Fighting Cancer aims to improve the lives of young people aged between 13-24 with life limiting or terminal illness. Teens Unite will build Respite Homes and help teenagers providing a support structure tailored to their needs.
description: Teens Unite provides long-term, ongoing support to 13-24 year olds who are fighting cancer

name: St Matthews Children's Action Group
missionStatement: We work with children aged 5 to 12 in  a free open access play ground and provide free food during the holidays and term time.  We provide a safe place for children to play and be supervised and allow them to freely choose play in their own way.  Children are given opportunities to visit new places locally and around the country which they would otherwise not have.  We hope to empower young people through STEM projects that will encourage them to be creative and enthusiastic.
description: Children & Young people need your support for safe free play spaces and you can help.

name: London Academy of Excellence Tottenham
missionStatement: London Academy of Excellence Tottenham is the place for academic rigour. We exist in one of the top 2% most deprived areas to provide the very best opportunities for our students with a particular focus on developing confident learners who achieve top A Level grades thus opening the door to the best further education available to them. Beyond this, we aim to ensure that once students access the most competitive courses at top universities, they have the confidence and resilience to feel that they belong.
description: Help students from one of the most deprived areas of the UK to access top universities

name: Blackfriars Arts Centre Ltd
missionStatement: Blackfriars plays a very important role as Boston's centre for entertainment and the arts. It relies on a dedicated force of volunteers who provide vital support to help keep theatre LIVE in Boston. With the current covid-19 pandemic forcing the Theatre to close its doors we would appreciate any help people can give to help us maintain the building so that when the restrictions are lifted we can be ready to open the doors the return LIVE THEATRE to Boston.  Registered Charity Number 228391
description: Keep Theatre LIVE in Boston Lincolnshire

name: Order of Friars Minor Conventual
missionStatement: We are the Friars Minor Conventual, Catholic men dedicated to living the Gospel of Jesus Christ in the spirit of St Francis of Assisi. We focus on the Gospel life, embraced by Saint Francis of Assisi, our Seraphic Founder. We are spread throughout the world in service of the Gospel, living as pilgrims, preaching poverty and penance. In Great Britain and Ireland, we are known as the Greyfriars, a name derived from the colour of our religious habit which was originally made from a greyish unbleached wool.
description: Donations support our priestly formation, education and training, ministry and retirement.

name: Albilaadi Community And Education Centre LTD
missionStatement:
This is an appeal for a sister and her family who live in Barawa -Somalia 

She is a single mum of 5 children who also cares for her elderly mother. 

Unfortunately due to heavy rainfall and living in close proximity to the sea the majority of her home has been destroyed. 

She does not have enough money to support herself and her family day to day, so the possibility of her being able to ever fix the damage is non existent (she is zakat eligible).
description: Test2

name: FareShare south west
missionStatement:
FareShare South West forms part of the UKs largest food hunger charity, FareShare. We are one of a network of 21 similar centres located across  the country. We're a community of independent charities all fighting the same issue; food waste and hunger. Over 270,000 tonnes of perfectly edible surplus food is throw away each year. We want to see that food put to good use.
Your support makes a huge difference to people in need in your community - every pound enables four meals for someone in need.
description: Donate today to fight hunger and food waste in your community- every pound counts!

name: Trekstock Limited
missionStatement:
Life as a young adult is tough, try it with cancer. 

Facing cancer and it's long term effects as a young adult come with a complicated set of physical and emotional challenges that put your life on hold. It's lonely and isolation. We get this. That is why we are here. 

Trekstock provides relevant social and practical support helping young adults navigate their journey through and beyond cancer.
description: Trekstock provides social and practical support for young adults facing cancer

name: Dudley & West midlands Zoological Society Ltd
missionStatement: Dudley Zoological Gardens is not only home to a collection of endangered species, but also an 11th century castle, a collection of Tecton buildings, and an important geological site.  Our aim is to provide our visitors with an understanding and awareness of all elements of this unique site, the history of the castle and the geology, the importance of the architectural design of the Tectons, and the opportunity to get closer to the world's rarest animals.
description: Get closer to the world's rarest animals at DZG where conservation counts

name: Friends of Highbury and Whitehill Schools
missionStatement: We are the Friends of Highbury and Whitehill Schools raising much needed funds for our children's education. We aim to do this by having as much fun as possible and building a strong school community.
description: Every penny raised helps our wonderful schools and children.

name: Thorngumbald Preschool
missionStatement: Thorngumbald Pre-School is a charity based, locally run Pre-School offering high quality and personal early years education. Being independent with limited funding, we rely heavily on fundraising to enrich the children's learning experience.

name: Friends of Corfu Donkey Rescue
missionStatement: FCDR exists to raise awareness of the activities of the registered Greek charity Corfu Donkey Rescue (CDR), to raise funds for CDR and to provide a means of donating to that charity from the UK.
description: Our mission is to support CDR by facilitating the transfer of donations to CDR from the UK

name: Shopmobility Market Harborough
missionStatement:
Shopmobility Market Harborough is a self funding charity that helps anyone with a mobility difficulty, be it temporary or more permanent, as a result of illness, injury or long term disability, to access the facilities of Market Harborough and surrounding area using a mobility scooter or wheelchair.

Mobility scooter and wheelchair hire is available short or long term; for home use, days or weekends.

name: Spirit of the Dog Rehabilitation Fund
missionStatement: SPIRIT OF THE DOG OFFERS SHELTER OR SANCTUARY FOR THE BENEFIT OF DOGS, WHICH ARE IN NEED OF PSYCHOLOGICAL ATTENTION; PROVIDING PSYCHOLOGICAL TREATMENT AND CARE FOR DOGS; ACTIVELY SEEK NEW HOMES FOR "RESCUED" DOGS. PROVIDE MEDICAL ATTENTION WHERE APPROPRIATE TO DOGS IN OUR CARE, OFFERING GUIDANCE WHERE NEEDED TO THE OWNERS OF DOGS REGARDING THEIR CARE AND TRAINING.
description: Please help us save a dog from the pound and give it a second chance for a happy life

name: Purrs Cat Rescue
missionStatement: Purrs is a small, dedicated volunteer led charity based in Essex, England. We aim to rescue stray and abandoned cats and find their forever homes.
description: We rely on help from the public to help fund our rescue work. We'd be nothing with you!

name: Creation Skatepark Ltd
missionStatement:
Creation Skatepark is an indoor skatepark facility located in Birmingham, which serves the immediate area and exists for the benefit of the local community, young and old.

Our skatepark has 50000 members and brings together a community of people who share a common sport in a safe controlled environment.

Our skatepark works with local schools and dis-advantaged pupils and offers a valuable resource for them.
description: Transform young lives today, give a little to make a big difference.

name: The Friends of the Wisdom Hospice Limited
missionStatement: The Friends of The Wisdom Hospice is a Charity dedicated to supporting the work of the Wisdom Hospice, providing specialised end of life care to people in Medway and Swale
description: Please help us support hospice services

name: West Mercia Rape & Sexual Abuse Support Centre
missionStatement:
West Mercia Rape & Sexual Abuse Support Centre provides free, confidential and non-judgemental support for survivors who have experienced any form of rape or sexual abuse at any time in their lives.

WMRSASC provides a telephone helpline, counselling, an Independent Sexual Violence Advisory Service, a Children and Young People's Service, internal and external training and education programmes, volunteering opportunities and Continuing Professional Development. 

WMRSASC has been operating since 1986.
description: Help us to provide support for change. #endsexualviolence

name: Lewes District Churches HOMELINK
missionStatement: Lewes District Churches HOMELINK was set up in the late 1990s in response to rapidly increasing homelessness, to help people who are homeless, or threatened with homelessness, by organising a local interest-free rent deposit scheme.
description: To meet the need for somewhere to call home, we welcome donations for grants and loans

name: The Fabulous Foundation
missionStatement: We are a charity providing small grants to people under the age of 25 to continue in education. We provide grants for any educational purpose from school uniforms to school trips and extra curricular learning too.learning
description: Helping Young People Stay in Education

name: Village Rwanda UK
missionStatement: Village Rwanda UK works in a remote part of South West Rwanda helping develop Early Years Education and Sustainable Income Projects. The Trustees originally became involved having been VSO volunteers in Rwanda from 2009 to 2013
description: Making Lives of Children and Families in Rwanda better

name: Continuo Foundation
missionStatement: To support a flourishing historical performance sector, sustaining the careers of its virtuosic freelance musicians, creating opportunities for the next generation of artists entering the field and widening access to performances for communities across the UK
description: Without urgent help, the UK's community of excellent period ensembles could be decimated

name: Ballygowan Community Pre-School and Playgroup
missionStatement: We provide pre-school and playgroup sessions for children aged from 2years 10 mths.  Our aim is to advance the development and education of our kids and to provide a safe and satisfying way of learning through play in a parent involved, community based group. Our focus is on learning through play, so that although your child might think they're just playing and having fun with their friends, in reality, they are learning to take turns, developing their fine and gross motor skills. It's all about the kids.
description: We provide pre-school and playgroup sessions for children aged from 2years 10 mths.

name: Murphy's Army
missionStatement:
Murphy's Army is a registered charity based in West Yorkshire.  Our mission is to help reunite missing pets with their owners, raise pet theft awareness, and promote pet safety, welfare and care.

In 2016 we launched our Murphy's Army Purple Poppy Campaign to pay tribute to animals lost in service, and to those who serve us today.  

Your support of our campaign is very much appreciated and will help our chosen worthy causes, details of which can be found on our website theyalsoserved.org

name: Sri Gangamata Gaudiya Math
missionStatement:
WE ARE A SPIRITUAL COMMUNITY AND HEALING CENTRE ADDRESSING A HOLISTIC APPROACH TO LIFE, BODY MIND AND SOUL. JOIN US FOR WORKSHOPS AND PROGRAMS ON THE PHILOSOPHY FROM THE VEDAS.
WE NURTURE POSITIVE THINKING AND HEALTHY LIVING INVITING ALL SECTIONS OF THE COMMUNITY TOGETHER (DIFFERENT AGE GROUPS AND CULTURAL BACKGROUNDS) TO PROMOTE HARMONY, RESPECT AND UNDERSTANDING.
description: THE REAL WELFARE WORK, NOT CONCERNING THE TEMPORARY BODY AND MIND BUT THE ETERNAL SOUL

name: PM Charity Foundation
missionStatement: We are a UK Based charity organisation helping to address the issues of global poverty focusing on the provision of safe water, sanitation and basic health care facilities to poorer communities in Sierra Leone. West Africa.
description: EBOLA APPEAL- SIERRA LEONE WEST AFRICA

name: Cheltenham Festival of Performing Arts
missionStatement: The Cheltenham Festival of Performing Arts is held each May to give performers of all ages the opportunity to perform in a superb venue, help with expressing themselves and building confidence and showing off their talents.
description: With the 2020 Festival having been cancelled, please support us for our 2021 Festival.

name: Signal Sensory Impairment, Globally, Nationally and Locally
missionStatement: Signal is a UK charity based in Shrewsbury, working to empower Deaf people and people with hearing loss sub-Saharan Africa, and Deaf people, people with hearing loss and people who experience tinnitus in the UK.
description: Make Communication Clear

name: OXFORDSHIRE SCIENCE FESTIVAL LIMITED
missionStatement: IF Oxford is a powerful, cost-effective way to inspire curious minds of all ages and backgrounds to access and shape new ideas. IF Oxford is run annually by Oxfordshire Science Festival. In 2019, 16,000 people came to 105 events in 35 venues over 11 days. In 2020, a COVID-safe IF Oxford brought digital hands-on, discussion and performance activities to 21,000, where 8 out of 10 people said it was the only, or key, 'science and ideas' event for them. Your donation allows the Festival to thrive - thank you.
description: Help this independent charity create accessible, authentic learning experiences for anyone

name: HEEL AND TOE LTD
missionStatement: Heel & Toe Children's Charity provides FREE conductive education therapy to children with cerebral palsy and other physical disabilities in the North East of England. Children aged between 6 months and 19 years old can attend hourly sessions at the charity's centre based in Pelton, Chester-Le-Street. Conductive Education is a mixture of Physiotherapy, Occupational Therapy and a learning process rolled into one. Benefits include; strengthened muscles, improved posture and wellbeing.
description: We are not government funded and rely solely on donations and public support

name: Penumbra
missionStatement: Penumbra is one of Scotland's leading mental health charities. We provide a wide range of services for young people and adults which offer hope and practical steps towards recovery. Our vision is of a society where every individual is accepted, supported and has the resources to fulfil their potential, without limits caused by mental ill health. One in four people will experience mental ill health at some point in their lives.
description: Help us to help more than 1,000 people every week on their road to recovery.

name: The Animal Project
missionStatement: The Animal Project is a recently established British charity that has a range of aims some of these aims are to provide support to animal sanctuaries and nature reserves. We are currently in the process of partnering up to sponsor some research and educational projects, some of these projects are to help relive pollution affecting marine life. We are looking to include PayPal as one of our fund raising platforms.
description: Supporting Animals whilst ensuring the environment doesn't crumble around them.

name: Creative Crieff Limited
missionStatement:
We are a social impact organisation.

We aim to improve the lives of young people and the wider community in rural Strathearn and Strathallan through deep impact engagement in music, film and the creative arts.
description: Improving the lives of young people in rural Strathearn and Strathallan through culture

name: Notts Kidney Units Appeal
missionStatement: Nottinghamshire Kidney Units Appeal is a partnership between Kidney Research UK and the Nottingham University Hospitals NHS Trust to improve the care and support for local kidney patients. We are a small group of volunteers who raise money to directly benefit the renal units at Nottingham City and Mansfield Kings Mill Hospitals. All money raised is divided equally to purchase essential medical equipment, and an equivalent sum given to Kidney Research UK to fund research to save lives.
description: "helping to save lives"

name: The Forget Me Not Children s Hospice
missionStatement: Forget Me Not Children’s Hospice supports children with life-shortening conditions, their families and families living with loss, across West Yorkshire.We’re here for any family confronted with the news their child has a life-shortening condition, however, wherever and whenever they need us. As a charity, each year we need to raise over £4 million to run our hospice. With less than 4% of that coming from the government or NHS, your support is vital. Thank you.

name: ICC Missions
missionStatement: ICC Missions is a Christian organisation comprising of eleven churches around the UK and made up of people from all over the world.  Our hope and our prayer is to advance the Christian faith; to share God's love and compassion with those around us in word and in action.
description: Your donation gives opportunities for many to come to know God.

name: GSD 2000
missionStatement: German Shepherd Rescue & Re-home (GSD 2000) was set up to alleviate the suffering and distress of unwanted, abandoned or badly-treated German Shepherd Dogs.  Since gaining charity status in January 2000, we have helped more than 1200 dogs in the South West, Southern Counties, Midlands and South Wales.  We operate a non-destruct policy and are passionate about German Shepherds.

name: Thurrock African Group
missionStatement: TAG is a voluntary community organisation aimed at promoting the interest of African communities in Thurrock through information sharing, soliciting tolerance, developing projects and advocating for community cohesion with the wider Thurrock community
description: Become a member of TAG.

name: Northern Devon Healthcare NHS Trust Charitable Funds
missionStatement:
Over and Above supports the work of Northern Devon Healthcare NHS Trust.

We fundraise Over and Above what the NHS is able to provide to make a real difference to our patients, their families and our amazing staff that treat them.

Your donation will make a huge difference for patients by improving the hospital environment, buying medical equipment and helping us to go way beyond the NHS standard. We support causes across the entire Trust in hospitals and our community services.

name: Loughborough Carillon Tower & War Memorial Museum
missionStatement:
We are a volunteer run museum located within Loughborough's Carillon Tower & War Memorial.

Three floors of military memorabilia and stories commemorate those who fell in the two World Wars and other conflicts. We rely on donations and shop sales to maintain and improve our collection and the displays.

We are looking to raise 1300 pounds to purchase a cabinet for individuals and organisations to display their own collections. This will open the museum to new and more diverse audiences. Thank you.

name: St. Pauls Centre
missionStatement: The aim of St Paul's Centre is to bring hope, confidence, dignity and opportunity to local residents. The Centre tries to help those who are struggling for whatever reason. This might mean providing emergency food, or even a bed to sleep on. It could mean providing opportunities for retraining or learning a new skill. The Centre is involved in many projects all aimed at enriching the lives of local people, including Furniture Recycling and Sales, Training and a Foodbank.

name: SAMARITANS SHOP GUILDFORD WAVERLEY AND WOKING LIMITED
missionStatement: Each day 16 people will take their life by suicide in the UK. Samaritans provides  emotional support 24/7 by phone, email, text and face to face, to anyone in emotional distress, struggling to cope, or at risk of suicide. Offering a safe, confidential space to talk things through Samaritans allow callers time to find a way through their problems. Every six seconds somebody will make contact; ten times a minute Samaritans can help someone turn their life around.
description: Please shop on Ebay for us and help support those at risk of and affected by suicide.

name: Age UK Trafford
missionStatement:
The vision that shapes our activities is a Trafford where every person over 50 is treated with respect, and an understanding of their needs and aspirations.
Our values are:
Older people and their carers are at the centre of everything we do.
We are committed to the best possible support for people with dementia and their carers.
We value and respect our volunteers, supporters and staff.
We are committed to providing the highest quality of service and;
We are open and honest.

name: Aiming Higher for the Disabled Community

Aiming Higher is a unique charity established in 2011 for disabled children and their families, set up to improve lives and offer much needed support. We offer stay and play sessions, counselling & have a team of family support workers at our Blackpool centre. 
We rely heavily on fundraising, donations, and sponsorship to provide these wonderful services for our precious children and families.
description: Aiming Higher supports children with disabilities & their families access the community.

We also offer a family support service which provides information and emotional support. We believe that early intervention for these children gives them the best possible chance for the future.
description: Help us improve opportunities for children with additional  and complex needs

name: Pardada Pardadi Educational Society UK
missionStatement: To facilitate the creation of a socially and economically empowered model for rural development in north India. By educating girls and employing women, PPES UK helps bring communities out of the cycle of poverty for good through local intervention.
description: Educating Girls, Transforming Communities

missionStatement: 'The Friends of the PRUH' charity raises funds for the Princess Royal University Hospital in order to purchase items that the NHS can't provide.  Our aim is to make the hospital a better place for both patients and staff.
description: Help us to help our hospital

name: Court Lane Infant Community Association
missionStatement: We are a registered charity run by parents supporting Court Lane Infant School. We raise funds for school equipment and support activities where school funding needs supplementing. We also run numerous events for the local community throughout the year.

name: Greensleeves Homes Trust
missionStatement: Greensleeves Care is a growing charitable organisation, which provides highly innovative care for older people in its residential, dementia & nursing care homes across England. As an organisation, Greensleeves Care is constantly adapting to meet the needs of older people.
description: Our mission is to encourage residents to thrive as individuals.

name: The Diamond Centre for Disabled Riders
missionStatement: horse riding for disabled adults and children
description: buy a horse for Diamond

name: Home Dialysis Network
missionStatement: Working alongside Dialysis Patients throughout the UK, offering information, support and we are currently working on respite holidays.
