name: Age UK Nottingham and Nottinghamshire
missionStatement:
Age UK Nottingham & Nottinghamshire is the largest independent charity providing a wide range of services for older people from all communities and backgrounds in Nottingham and Nottinghamshire. 
Our vision is a world in which older people flourish and our mission is to enhance the quality of life and promote the health and wellbeing of all older people in Nottingham and Nottinghamshire.

name: Geek.Zone
missionStatement:
Geek.Zone run events to promote social inclusion, either by organising and hosting them directly or by arranging a group to visit another organisations event. We use the common theme of GEEK as a core to support each other through any anxiety and mental wellbeing difficulties, but of course non-geeks are welcome too! 

We fight to change the negative perception of "geek", create links with local organisations to provide community support and offer a safe space free from harassment.
description: Currently raising funds to allow us to rent a building and host more of our own events.

name: West Sussex Mediation Service
missionStatement: We provide a range of mediation services to those suffering conflicts in their lives, across West Sussex using trained and accredited, local volunteer mediators. We help change lives for the better and make our local community a more peaceful place to live and work. We have been helping to resolve disputes since 2000 and service 360 referrals a year.
description: We find it very hard to fundraise, not being a 'sexy' charity. However we do great work.

name: northern english springer spaniel rescue
missionStatement: Northern English Springer Spaniel Rescue (NESSR) is a registered charity breed rescue that has been running for over 30 years and is a kennel club registered rescue in the UK.
description: To help raise funds for dogs needing our help

name: KCF Watford
missionStatement: The charity's objects are for the benefit of the inhabitants of Watford and surrounding area and in Kerala. In particular they are for the benefit of those inhabitants who are malayalees or of Kerala (a state in India) origin
description: Help community, Help Kerala

name: Breast Cancer UK Limited
missionStatement: BREAST CANCER UK is a charity providing practical information about lifestyle changes that can reduce people's risk of getting breast cancer.  We also engage with decision makers and medical practitioners to ensure they take the issue of prevention seriously and have the latest information on prevention at their fingertips.  And we fund our own research into understanding and addressing the causes of breast cancer, and how it can be prevented.
description: Your donation helps fund vital research, to help people lower their risk of breast cancer

name: GIST Cancer UK
missionStatement: GIST Cancer UK provides information and support for patients with a rare form of cancer known as Gastro-Intestinal Stromal Tumours (GIST). We host support meetings throughout the UK for patients and their carers, and host an online community providing practical advice and information. We also fund research into furthering treatment options for GIST patients and work with medical professionals to increase awareness and understanding of GIST cancer.
description: Supporting patients and funding research into GIST cancer

name: Friends of Serenity
missionStatement: Friends of Serenity aims to preserve and protect the health of sick pregnant women and those who have suffered a miscarriage, stillbirth or neonatal death. Providing memory boxes and miscarriage keepsakes in East Lancashire and throughout the country on public requirement. Providing qualified information by any means appropriate on the 2nd most common chromosome disorder Trisomy 13.
description: We provide comfort to bereaved parents to make a devastating time a little gentler

name: Downpatrick & County Down Railway
missionStatement: The Downpatrick & County Down Railway exists to allow visitors to experience traveling over a section of the original Belfast & County Down Railway restored as a working railway museum. Items of equipment and documents relating to the original BCDR are conserved to allow research into that railway's effect on the area that it served. In making the collection available to the general public, the museum also aims to promote tourism and the economic regeneration of the district.
description: Keep steam trains alive in Northern Ireland

name: Cuerden Valley Park Trust
missionStatement: Cuerden Valley Park covers 650 acres in rural Lancashire, close to Preston, Leyland & Chorley. It is home to a rich variety of plants and animals, allowing people free access to the countryside.  The Park is owned and managed by an independent charity, rather than by local authority. We are raising funds to help build a new eco-friendly Visitor Centre & cafe to generate income to ensure that the park in its present form can be enjoyed by future generations.
description: Please help us to ensure that Cuerden Valley Park can be enjoyed by all in the future

name: Brecon Mountain Rescue Team
missionStatement: We are a voluntary search and rescue team that undertakes well over one hundred callouts per year. We assist people who are injured or lost in the mountains and rural areas of South, Mid and West Wales. Our members are unpaid and we rely solely on fund-raising to achieve the fifty-five thousand pounds needed each year to run the team.
description: We are always available to be called to help the lost and injured in South Wales

name: THE PAROCHIAL CHURCH COUNCIL OF THE ECCLESIASTICAL PARISH OF ST JAMES CARLISLE
missionStatement:
St James Church runs  'Cornerstone', a Community Coffee bar in Carlisle. We support our community by providing a free activities and events and run support such as a food bank. All money from the sale of our eBay auctions goes into support the running of Cornerstone and the services we provide for our community.

Thank you for your support.

name: St Marys PCC Eccleston (Chorley)
missionStatement: St Mary the Virgin is the Parish Church of Eccleston, a village of about 6,000 within the Borough of Chorley.  It is a Grade II* listed building dating back to the 14th century.  A major renovation was carried out in the last 15 years Today the village is a commuter base ideally placed to serve local towns and cities of Chorley, Leyland, Southport, Preston and further to Bolton, Manchester and Liverpool. We aim to promote village life and community cohesion.
description: We wish to replace our organ with one from leading builder Harrison & Harrison.

name: Glaucoma UK
missionStatement: Glaucoma is a leading cause of  preventable sight loss.
description: Donate.  Glaucoma doesn’t have to mean sight loss.  Together we can change the outlook.

name: Able Foundation
missionStatement:
Our vision is to have a society where excluded, disadvantaged, marginalised and vulnerable adults with learning disabilities are valued as individuals, and are enabled to achieve their full potential.

Our mission is to maximise opportunities for excluded, disadvantaged, marginalised and vulnerable people with learning disabilities.
description: Help us improve people lives

name: Suicide Prevention Bristol
missionStatement:
Suicide Prevention Team is a valued search and support service in Bristol.
We patrol areas of Bristol on foot and by car to locate people at risk.
Then we use our skills in crisis intervention to offer supportive listening to start a dialogue and to encourage more hopeful solutions than suicide.

name: Berkshire Autistic Society

Autism Berkshire is the working name for Berkshire Autistic Society, an established charity providing comprehensive services for all ages of people with autism, their families, carers and professionals working in the field. 

Our services include a daily helpline, workshops for parents and carers, regular newsletters, adult community learning for autistic adults and social and leisure activities for children and adults.

description: Donate to TAG to help us care for Marc Bolan's Rock Shrine.

name: Yeovil Freewheelers (EVS)
missionStatement: Yeovil Freewheelers EVS provides a unique out-of-hours free motorcycle courier service between different hospitals and patients in their homes across the whole South Somerset and North Dorset area.We save the NHS and Yeovil Hospital (where our bike fleet is located) a minimum of 85,000 - 90,000 pounds per year.
description: We receive no payment from anyone, all the funds being raised through donations

name: Friends of Manjushree Vidyapith School and Orphanage
missionStatement: Our Charity FMVSO was founded in 2005 to help sustain, improve and expand the facilities of the Manjushree Vidyapith School and Orphanage in northeast India, founded in 1998. The Trustees spend time at Manjushree every year, teaching and working with the children, and discussing future policy and funding priorities with the Principal and the Headmaster. FMVSO currently covers all food costs, and funds all the senior students who have gone on to further education.
description: Help us to give disadvantaged children a better life, an education and a future

name: Acts Trust

These include tangible aid (such as provision of furniture, clothing and food) as well as advice and guidance, mentoring, and supporting young people to 'live life to the full'
description: Support us in our mission to end Poverty in Lincoln! Every person counts!

name: Medair UK

name: Essex Wildlife Trust Limited

Our climate is in crisis and nature needs our help. Together we can protect the future. Join us.
description: Please help us to protect wildlife for the future and for the people of Essex.

name: EVI: Esperanza Verde International
missionStatement:
Esperanza Verde is a Wildlife Rescue Centre and Conservation project in the Amazon Jungle. We rescue animals from the illegal wildlife trade and give them a second chance.

In Peru many species fall victim to illegal hunting, either for meat or to be sold into the Pet Trade. We rescue and rehabilitate animals that have been confiscated from this trade and where possible try to release them back into the wild. We protect a large area of Rainforest and try to reforest areas previously lost to farming.

have a rewarding and valuable life after their racing careers have ended.

We constantly raise funds to pay for the care and treatment of our cats by running our own fairs and attend other events.
description: We are run by volunteers, and need funds to pay for the care of the cats we look after.

name: Ogwen Valley Mountain Rescue CIO
missionStatement: Ogwen Valley Mountain Rescue CIO (OVMRO), or Sefydliad Achub Mynydd Dyffryn Ogwen as we are known in the native Welsh language, is a voluntary mountain rescue team responding to incidents in the mountains and valleys surrounding the Ogwen Valley, Glyderau and Carneddau mountain ranges and surrounding area in northern Snowdonia. We are on-call 24 hours a day, throughout the year. Our team is made up entirely of volunteers. Team members are all mountaineers with local knowledge and first aid training.
description: Please support Ogwen Valley Mountain Rescue team

name: International Rescue Corps
missionStatement:
We are a specialist Urban Search & Rescue team responding to natural & man-made disasters all over the world using specialist skills & equipment. Our mission is "United To Save Life" & this ethos applies to every action of our volunteer specialists.
After receiving a request for help, our aim is to mobilise a self-contained rescue team within minutes for UK missions or within 24 hours for overseas missions.
We are supported entirely by donations made by the public & corporate sponsorship.
description: United to Save Life

name: Child to Child
missionStatement:
Globally, Child to Child is a child rights agency that champions children's right to be listened to and taken seriously in matters concerning them. Our award-winning approach inspires them to work together to change their world, leading to healthier, safer lives and better access to education. 

Based at the UCL Institute of Education, we have been equipping the world's leading agencies to work with children in this transformative way for over 30 years.
description: You can help create Young Journalists, active citizens and inclusive classrooms worldwide.

name: The Aspex Visual Arts Trust Ltd
missionStatement:
Aspex exists to support emerging artists, expose the creative process, and engage new audiences with visual art.

We achieve this by delivering an exciting and varied programme of exhibitions, off-site projects and participation events. Our aim is to make the appreciation and creation of art a more inclusive activity.
description: Support Aspex Gallery

name: LEARN Lifechanging Education for All in Rural Nepal
missionStatement: We provide the funding for our school in Nepal to enable all children in the village (irrespective of ability, gender, caste, etc.) to receive a top quality education. It also provides education for the ladies in the village. We firmly believe that education is the best way out of poverty.
description: The education provided by our school has the potential to change the future!

name: INTERNATIONAL PRADER-WILLI SYNDROME ORGANISATION
missionStatement: The International Prader-Willi Syndrome Organisation provides information and support to professionals, caregivers and families around the world. Our vision is a world where all People with PWS can live full and happy lives with access to all the medical care, treatment, care and information they and their families need.
description: Support our work to spread awareness of PWS and raise standards of care globally.

name: Amersham Band
missionStatement: Amersham Band is a valued community asset; providing music education and entertainment for local people, supporting civic events and bringing people together. Participation in music is beneficial for young people through improved educational attainment, and for young and old alike it can inspire people to take action to change their lives.
description: Help us to extend the accessibility of learning music throughout the local community.

name: Be: Trans Support & Community
missionStatement:
We are a registered charity in the North East of England providing peer support services and safe community spaces for Trans including Non-Binary people throughout our region.

We are also involved in campaigning for Trans rights nationally, and working with employers and service providers to improve outcomes for our community.
description: Help support Trans including Non-Binary people in the North East to live better lives

name: Broughton Community and Sports Association
missionStatement:
A registered Charity (No. 1170067) in Broughton (N. Lincs) with the main aim of developing community health, physical activity and social cohesion.

We aim to do this by promoting current organisations, clubs & activities. We also aim to improve the provision of both facilities and community activities for all ages and abilities.

name: The Warwickshire Wildlife Trust Limited
missionStatement:
Our goal is nature's recovery, on land and at sea.

We recognise how important nature is in our daily lives and believe it should be at the heart of our society. We stand up and work for nature on all fronts.

We rescue and restore places for wildlife and people, and help others to do the same.

Together we have a mission to create Living Landscapes, to secure Living Seas and to inspire people to value and take action for nature.
description: Support our work to save wildlife and wild place for the benefit of people and wildlife

name: Newham Community Renewal Programme Ltd
missionStatement: The Renewal Programme has been working with the community in the London Borough of Newham to transform and inspire lives for over 45 years. We empower people to change their lives through advocacy, education, temporary accommodation, and a range of positive activities. Our services are taken up by over 5000 people a year, including refugees, asylum seekers, migrants, carers, vulnerable adults facing homelessness, adult learners and young people.
description: We need your help to support the community in Newham to empower people and transform lives

name: Help For Hope
missionStatement: Help for Hope is a not for profit charity which has been set up to help dogs in Romania.  Our aim is to build puppy kennels for rescuers throughout Romania to save the lives of puppies and dogs which would otherwise die from exposure to the elements.
description: Help to build puppy shelters in Romania!

name: Conservation Education & Research Trust
missionStatement: Earthwatch is an international environmental charity which engages people worldwide in scientific field research and education to promote the understanding and action necessary for a sustainable environment.
description: Creating Knowledge. Inspiring Action.

name: Faith and Hope Charity
missionStatement: we are a small charity rescuing dogs which other charities will not as they need expensive vet fees, being badly treated. the dogs are looked after by our volunteers and the faith and hope fund pay all expenses. no one receives any remuneration.
description: we take in dogs who otherwise would have been put to sleep due to cost of vet fees

name: SHP
missionStatement: We have over 40 years experience supporting homeless Londoners. Our mission is to prevent homelessness and help vulnerable and socially excluded people to transform their lives. We work toward a society in which everyone has a place to call home and the chance to lead a fulfilling life.
description: Help us provide long-term tangible support to homeless Londoners

name: Natural Enterprise
missionStatement: The Island 2000 Trust is a charity based on the Isle of Wight which aims to make a real difference to the Island's people, businesses and its countryside. We undertake a wide range of work through the Trust or its trading subsidiary Natural Enterprise, both locally and regionally.
description: Loving your local countryside

name: Operation Mobilisation
missionStatement: Whether facilitating partnerships with individuals and churches to OM's ministries worldwide or reaching out to diverse ethnic communities, OM has a long-established presence in the UK seeking to fulfil a vision of 'Mission at the Heart of the Church and the Church at the Heart of the Community'
description: Partner with us in serving God in His Mission in more than 110 countries around the world

name: Oakengates United Church Pre-school
description: Supporting children's learning and development

name: Seeds4Success
missionStatement: Seeds4Success is a youth work charity based in Mere, which provides opportunities for personal and social development for young people living in South West Wiltshire. We enable young people to access programmes that develop practical skills, enhance education, improve employability, provide recreational activities, conserve the natural environment and strengthen the local community.
description: Help S4S to offer personal and social development for young people

name: CATHERINE DE BARNES VILLAGE HALL
missionStatement: Providing and maintaining a village hall for the use of the inhabitants of Catherine de Barnes and surrounding communities without distinction of political, religious or other opinions for meetings, lectures and classes and other forms of recreation and leisure-time occupation with the object of improving the conditions of life for the inhabitants
description: Sustainably improving the village hall facilities in keeping with the needs of its users

name: Highfield Community Association - Keighley
missionStatement: Highfield Community Association is a charity based in Keighley, West Yorkshire.  Our main objective is to maintain and manage the community centre for the benefit of residents providing facilities in the interests of social welfare for recreation and leisure time occupation with the objective of improving the conditions of life for residents.

name: The Food Bus
missionStatement: We are currently working on a new project called the "Food Bus". The aim of the project is to refit buses into catering kitchens to prepare and cook hot meals for Low Income Families, Refugees, Elderly & Young People, Homeless, Asylum Seekers & Vulnerable People.
description: Bringing the community together and making a difference

name: Holmes Chapel Boxing Club
missionStatement:
Holmes Chapel Boxing Club is a Community Club.  Its aims and objectives include:
- Offer coaching and competitive opportunities in boxing
- Promote the values of hard work, discipline and respect for self and others
- Promote the club within the community 
- Promote and encourage healthy lifestyles
- Provide a positive alternative to crime and anti-social behaviour 


We are affiliated to England Boxing, the National Governing Body for Amateur Boxing
description: A positive, engaging environment for the local community

name: South India Children's Education and Welfare Trust
missionStatement: Our mission is to Build Children Better Lives by promoting, encouraging and supporting the education and physical welfare of disadvantaged children in South India through directed grants to established Non-Governmental Organisations with proven track records. Initially working in Bengaluru we aim to extend our work as opportunities present.
description: Help us build deprived children a better future

name: Nurullahi Muslim Community Northampton
missionStatement: We are a UK registered charity organisation with the ambition to promote the good teachings of Islam to benefit everyone in the community
description: Make a donation now and support the cause

name: PATT Foundation
missionStatement: The PATT Foundation has previously planted 3 million trees in Asia but has now turned its focus to supporting the Northern Forest Initiative to plant 50 million trees in the UK as well; as launching the Dare to Bee project
description: Saving the planet one tree at a time!

name: The Duchenne Research Fund
missionStatement: We began fundraising in 2007 with a clear goal in mind: to cure Duchenne muscular dystrophy, a devastating muscle-wasting disease that leads to paralysis and early death for all sufferers. The disease is 100% fatal. There is currently no cure.
description: Make a difference for all boys with Duchenne

name: Spark Of Hope
missionStatement:
Spark of Hope was set up to make food available for under privileged children and their families. To turn struggling, institutional orphanages into stable, loving, nurturing homes where children can thrive and truly change the story of their lives.

To set up healthcare and education programs which will support the children and their families. We also train women to provide home-based health care for terminally ill patients
description: funding a fishing boat to support the orphans

name: Chrysalis Youth Community Project
missionStatement: ProvideS, education, training and social skills to young disadvantaged people throughout Yorkshire
description: creating a better future for young disadvantaged people

name: Friends of the Ordinariate
missionStatement: The Friends of the Ordinariate charity was established in June 2011 to support the work of the Personal Ordinariate of Our Lady of Walsingham. The Friends support seminarians, liturgy and music at Ordinariate churches, and any activities which promote the Roman Catholic faith.  The Friends publish Newsletters twice a year to inform supporters of the charity's activities.
description: Help support the work of the Personal Ordinariate of Our Lady of Walsingham!

name: the haven parrot rescue
missionStatement:
To help abused and neglected parrots and much loved pets who have lost their homes due to change of circumstances, bereavement etc.
To evaluate rehabilitate and rehome those suitable to knowledgeable vetted homes as pets. 
To provide or source those sanctuary for those who are unsuitable as pets , need a differant way of life or have other special needs.
description: Please donate to help our incoming birds get the new start they need

name: Statewatch
missionStatement: Statewatch is a not for profit voluntary group founded in 1991 comprised of lawyers, academics, journalists, researchers and community activists. Our European network of contributors is drawn from 18 countries. We encourage the publication of investigative journalism and critical research in Europe in the fields of the state, justice and home affairs, civil liberties, accountability and openness.
description: To monitor civil liberties and the state in Europe and the UK

name: Axis Counselling
missionStatement:
Axis provide a free, confidential and independent service
For women, men, young people and children (aged 11 upwards) who have experienced non-recent (historic) childhood sexual, physical and emotional abuse; any form of sexual assault, sexual violence, sexual exploitation or rape.

Axis is an independent charity operating within Shropshire, Telford and Wrekin and the immediate surrounding area.
description: support suffered from emotional abuse, rape or sexual violence.

name: Brass Bands England
missionStatement:
In 1968 we started life as the British Federation of Brass Bands. Our aim was to support brass bands throughout the UK and help them build a strong future.

50 years later, we still have the same core values. We are still supporting brass bands, their members and promoting the wider brass band movement.
description: We shout about the life-enhancing benefits of this vital part of our culture.

name: Hertfordshire Action on Disability
missionStatement: We provide many services in and around Hertfordshire. A Driving Mobility Accredited Driving Centre which conducts assessments for people with medical conditions and an Equipment Centre providing assessments by Occupational Therapists and Trusted Assessors. Occupational Therapy led rise and recline seating and scooter assessments at our centre in Welwyn Garden City or in your home.
description: Delivering innovative, affordable and practical services to older and disabled people

name: Salama UK
missionStatement: At Salama UK, a central focus of our work is to create and provide opportunities for advancement through education to the mentally and physically disabled. Another large part of what we do is helping to build and equip schools with better facilities and resources to enable them to meet the needs of disabled children.
description: Help us to equip schools for the disabled, purchase disability aids and sponsor students.

name: County Durham Community Foundation
missionStatement: County Durham Community Foundation is an independent grant-making foundation. We work with individuals, families and local businesses who want to put something back into their community, either in their lifetime, or through leaving a legacy. We love steering money out into the community where it can change health and happiness for the better.
description: We fight inequality through smart grant-making: getting money into our communities

name: Care for Someone Charity
missionStatement:
Care for Someone is a small charity, working hard to make a big difference to the lives of disadvantaged people both in the UK and Zimbabwe. We support girls access education in Zimbabwe and do this by paying their school fees. Of late, due to need, we also support boys. In the UK we offer mentoring & coaching to ethnic minority women.

Our charitable objective  is to ensure those that are disadvantaged have access to education & training opportunities to support them realise their full potential.
description: Transform the life of a girl through education

name: K.U.K Alliance
missionStatement: We are a group of 7 young Zimbabweans that are determined to change the narrative through education, health and empowerment. We came together because we collectively felt that involvement in projects aimed at the regeneration of Zimbabwe are undoubtedly crucial. Our passion is to create and foster an environment that encourages enterprise and empowerment. Our part in this process is to strive to make a difference for the next generation and ensure that we do not let this vicious cycle continue.
description: Help us make a difference to tomorrow's youth!

name: Blenheim Scout Group
missionStatement: To continuosly transform the local community into a plcae of inclusion and engagement through community lead projects and programmes
description: Helping provide Scouting to people in South Bristol

name: York Polish Organisation
missionStatement:
We are a Registered Charity called York Polish Organisation (Charity number 1143609) functioning in York and surrounding areas since 2008 with the aim of integration of Polish, British and other communities through promoting Polish culture.
We run Polish Saturday School in York (www.szkolawyorku.org.uk/) and organise various social events throughout the year.
description: Polish & British communities to create events & socialise together

name: Southern Shih Tzu Rescue
missionStatement: Southern Shih Tzu Rescue is a UK registered charity 1049494, dealing with the rescue and rehoming of Shih Tzu dogs throughout England and Wales. We provide care and protection for Shih Tzu who are in need because of sickness, maltreatment and poor circumstances and the prevention of cruelty and suffering.
description: We are run by volunteers and rely on donations/fundraising to provide for the dogs

name: 186th Sheffield (Manor) Scout Group
missionStatement: 186th Sheffield (Manor) Scout Group is a Scout group based in one of the more deprived areas of the UK. We aim to have an inclusive group, no matter the child's background or socioeconomic class. By using the Scouting model we bring a sense of adventure and fun, whilst teaching young people skills for life
description: Help us deliver Scouting to all, no matter of ability or background

name: paws lost and found
missionStatement: We offer shelter, food and veterinary treatment to all lost, abandoned and unwanted animals in local area.   they stay with us until reunited with owners or a new loving home is found.   some remain all their lives.
description: We  help all animals in need providing care and shelter

name: Uthink People Developing People
missionStatement:
Uthink PDP believe in making art and creativity accessible for all and using it as an effective tool to support community development.

Uthink Creative is our charities portfolio of central spaces, which offer and develop a wide range of networking and collaborative opportunities with other creatives, industry specialists as well as voluntary an community groups and charities.
description: we provide free or affordable space for artist most in need..

name: Connect2Us
missionStatement: At Connect2TC Forth Valley we believe it is possible for hurting people to completely break free from addiction and live fulfilling lives as contributing members of society. We are a Christian charity that aims to help people who have developed life controlling problems. We also offer preventative help to those who may be in danger of becoming addicted.
description: Help us to help people be set free.

name: Let's Get Talking
missionStatement: At Let's Get Talking we work directly with young people in many places such as Schools and Youth Clubs, currently we are working our way through London delivering resources and workshops to the most in-need areas. We are an expert medium for exploring adolescent issues, this is achieved by a method of learning conversation and discussion without pressure.
description: We are driving behavioural change through challenging current thinking.

name: Kingfisher Church
missionStatement:
We are a Christian church providing practical and spiritual services to any and everyone who needs it.

Our mission is "to reach lost people and see them transformed into fully devoted followers of Jesus Christ". 

We hope to see everyone live in the truth that Jesus came so that we may experience life in all it's fullness.
description: Help others live life in all it's fullness!

name: Akram Khan Dance Company
missionStatement: Akram Khan Company has established itself as one of the foremost innovative dance companies in the world. Embracing an artistic vision that both respects and challenges Indian kathak form and contemporary dance, Akram Khan has created a body of critically acclaimed work that ranges from classical and modern solos to artist-to-artist collaborations and company productions.
description: One of the world's leading dance companies, reaching audiences through powerful stories

name: Kondanani
missionStatement:
Kondanani (Meaning "Love One Another") Children's Village is a home for the orphaned young. It is a place of hope and life. 

Kondanani is a place where a child can find love, care and a new family. A place that cultivates a sense of belonging and security for each child; giving them the opportunity for a fresh start and the hope of a better future.
description: www.youtube.com/watch?v=5jZmg1V-yqg

name: Help For Dogs
missionStatement:
We foster and rehome dogs. We provide help and support for rescues and pounds in the UK and abroad. We are invested in education and neutering to prevent the suffering of dogs in the future as well as helping dogs already in need. We have a strong emphasis on recycling to help the dogs and fundraise.
Every penny donated goes direct to the dogs
description: Preventing and relieving the suffering of dogs

name: Wecock Community Association
missionStatement:
Wecock Community Association was formed in 1977 and has been serving the needs of the local community ever since. The association is run by a team of trustees with a broad range of skills and experiences, who are all unpaid volunteers wanting to support the local community. The centre also has a number of paid staff to support the volunteers and ensure the smooth day-to-day running of the centre.
We were lucky enough in 2004 to have a new centre built and equipped.
description: Wecock Community Association was formed in 1977 and serves the community.

name: Calne Bike Meet
missionStatement: Calne Bike Meet is an organisation that is run by a local committee to put on a local meet of motorcycle enthusiasts. Its aim is to raise funds through charitable donations and events to enable the re-development of the local area of Calne, Wiltshire and further financial support to worthy Charitable causes either local or national.
description: Make a difference to bikers and the local community

name: Hope and prosperity
missionStatement: Our work focuses on assisting those around the world, especially in third world countries like Bangladesh, to lift them out of poverty and provide them with the necessities to live a meaningful existence.
description: Donate a little hope and help the needy prosper

name: Home-Start Cambridgeshire
missionStatement:
Home-Start is one of the UK's Leading family support charities, a voluntary organisation offering support to 
families who have at least one child under five when family life becomes difficult. Our service supports families, through weekly volunteer home visits, to deal with diverse concerns such as parental mental health issues, isolation, postnatal illness, disability, bereavement, multiple births and parenting skills.
description: One parent helping another parent through a difficult time.

name: Friends of Namuncha
missionStatement:
Supporting education in a Maasai community in Kenya.
Primary, secondary schools, teachers and facilities, post-secondary education and training and research.
description: Educating a community out of poverty into healthy living

name: ACTION HOMELESS (LEICESTER) LIMITED
missionStatement:
Every night of the year, the charity is home to 204 people who would otherwise have nowhere else to go. Where possible we aim to give people and families long term affordable homes from which they can start to rebuild their lives.

We believe it is only when people feel stable and secure in their homes, and when they are able to stop worrying about where they are sleeping from one week to the next, that they can really turn their lives around.
description: Be a part of our mission to end homelessness

name: Shepshed Word of Life Church
missionStatement:
We are a new church called Shepshed Word of Life Church, formed in November 2013 by the uniting of two long-standing churches in the town of Shepshed in Leicestershire - Belton Street Baptist Church (formed in 1880) and the Evangelical Free Church on Kirkhill (formed in 1969).
We are currently raising funds for a new church building.
description: Please consider donating to this cause

name: Stopford Cat Rescue
missionStatement:
Stopford Cat Rescue is a small cat rescue charity run entirely by volunteers. We operate in the Stockport area of the UK.


Our charity has simple and clear objectives to help cats:


Homing - Finding good homes for stray and unwanted cats 

Neutering - Encouraging the neutering of cats

Information - Improving the public's understanding of cats
description: Help stray and unwanted cats in the Stockport area.

name: Pompe Support Network
missionStatement: A network of individuals, families, scientists, and healthcare professionals who aim to improve the lives of all people living and working with Pompe disease. The network is run by members of the Pompe community, for the benefit of the Pompe community.
description: Show your support to improve physical and mental wellbeing of the whole Pompe community

name: Vineyard Compassion
missionStatement: Vineyard Compassion is a charity bringing together an established range of community based projects that offer a holistic approach to tackling poverty and its underlying root causes.We currently deliver over 620 interventions to families and individuals each month with the help of over 390 volunteers who are involved in organising and delivering this support.Foodbank,free debt counselling, clothes bank,housing and voluntary work placements are some of the services we run in partnership with local agencies.
description: We support people who are disadvantaged, socially excluded or suffering financial poverty.

name: Society of St Francis
missionStatement:
The Society of St Francis (European Province) aims to build up a body of men following Jesus Christ in the way of St Francis of Assisi. 

SSF is based throughout the UK running houses for retreat and working with the poorest in our society, through giving hospitality, help and hope. Through creating community and living as one body in Christ we hope to bring Franciscan joy to the world, calling each aspect of creation our brother and sister.
description: Bringing Franciscan joy to those in deepest darkness

name: Friends of the Newport Ship
missionStatement: The Friends of the Newport Ship help to protect one of the most important historical ships in the world. A ship older than the Mary Rose that sailed in the time of Christopher Columbus. The Newport Ship Project provides outreach to the local community to help educate everyone on the importance of their collective history and why they should be proud of it.
description: Help protect the most important maritime find in the world

name: Wildcard Theatre Company Ltd
missionStatement: Wildcard Theatre finds, nurtures and produces stories that promote positive social change. Our present work looks at the importance of support-networks during a mental health crisis and we have partnered with the Mental Health Foundation to advance this campaign further. Wildcard also provides ongoing support for emerging artists taking their first steps in the theatre industry; giving artists training and networking opportunities.
description: Empower the disenfranchised with Wildcard

name: Riaz ul Karam
missionStatement:
Riaz Ul Karam is a humble charity managed by volunteers. 
All your money goes to poor and needy. There is no other cost, all working with us are volunteers.

We provide water pumps to poor and disabled. We provide education and accommodation to orphans.
We distribute food and monthly food items. We help the poor families with everything they need.
description: Help Poor Families with Water Pumps, Food, Health Facilities and Houses

name: Alanouwaly Salifou Sylla Foundation
missionStatement: Alanouwaly Salifou Sylla Foundation brings the joy of African music & dance workshops to schools and the wider community and holds an Annual Music Festival celebrating togetherness with people of all backgrounds and ages. In Guinea we support our partners with the development of a Community Centre and its projects: computer learning & internet, sewing skills & enterprise, cultural exchange and creating clean water sources.
description: Contribute to enable people to help themselves and to get communities together!

name: God's Vineyard Ministries
missionStatement:
God's Vineyard Ministry is a God given vision to reach out to all nations with the gospel of our Lord Jesus Christ in an atmosphere of warmth, love and excitement.

We believe that the power of God through the gospel will give hope to the hopeless, freedom to those in captivity, healing tot he hurting, joy and peace to the troubled.
description: Empowering Live and Building Society

name: Hope For Tomorrow Global
missionStatement:
We work with and through churches to help bring hope of lasting change to the poor and broken-hearted in Burundi. We are a Christian charity but serve and support those of any or no faith!

We support initiatives which bring dignity to the poor and vulnerable and which empower people to bring about change and transformation in their own communities and nations.
description: bringing hope, transforming lives, changing nations.

name: The Beer-Harris Memorial Trust
missionStatement: We support community projects which promote social inclusion and connection for people who suffer from severe mental illness. We have a strong emphasis on projects offering social and psychological support to vulnerable groups, especially through community based activities such as art, music, gardening. We also support projects and research which promote good mental health in young adults, including those in higher education.
description: Now more than ever we need to promote good mental health & support those already suffering

name: Jubilee Society of Mongolia
missionStatement: The prevention and relief of poverty in Mongolia by providing grants, items and services to individuals and/or charities or other organisations working in Mongolia to prevent or relieve poverty. We also provide or assist with education, training and healthcare projects and all the necessary support designed to enable individuals to generate a sustainable income and be self-sufficient.

name: Access Employment Ltd
missionStatement: It is a Social Firm providing disadvantaged people with training and employment opportunities, enhancing their lifestyle, and thus allowing them to operate more effectively in the community. AEL's aim is to develop sustainable businesses in which we can provide disadvantaged people with the skills, experience and confidence to find employment within the open labour market. AEL also aims to create employment within our own businesses for those we are seeking to help.

name: Essex Community Foundation
missionStatement:
Our Visions: A strong generous community - an Essex where people work together to enhance the quality of local life.

Our Mission: To inspire philanthropy and charitable giving - matching people ideas, resources and needs to make a lasting difference
description: By donating you will give back to Essex and help improve the lives of others.

name: SIGN HI SAY HI - FYLDE, WYRE & BLACKPOOL DEAF CHILDREN'S SOCIETY
missionStatement: Sign Hi Say Hi! is a charity run by parents and grandparents with deaf children. We hold a club for deaf/hearing impaired children/young people, their families and siblings in the Blackpool, Fylde and Wyre area.  The club holds a variety of activities and events during the year. All are welcome whether their choose to communicate by speech/BSL/ sign supported English etc
description: The Club helps reduce the feelings of isolation faced by deaf children

name: Villa Scalabrini
missionStatement:
We provide a person centred care approach, ensuring all of our residents feel safe, comfortable and constantly engaged. Our residential senior care home is based in Shenley, Herts.

Villa Scalabrini offers a multicultural and multiracial environment. Even though the majority  our residents are from an Italian and English heritage, we also support individuals from a Portuguese, Spanish, Polish, Czech, Brazilian, Maltese, French and all other backgrounds.
description: The human and compassionate touch of person centred care against COVID-19

name: Pamoja Leo
missionStatement: Pamoja Leo is a registered not-for profit based in Tanga, Tanzania. Our sister organisation in the UK is also called Pamoja Leo which is a UK Registered Charity (No.1162710). Pamoja Leo mission is to transform care for orphan and Vulnerable children in Tanzania at three levels child, family and community. Our vision is a society where all children can reach their potential.
description: Donate to help vulnerable children get the care they need to thrive

name: Scottish Network for Arthritis in Children
missionStatement: The objective of the charity is to provide a national support network for children with arthritis and their families through the provision of factual, practical and emotional support. It aims to pull together the wider community of affected children in Scotland as well as raise public awareness of childhood arthritis.
description: Children get arthritis too...

name: Smile For ME
missionStatement: We are a UK charity that sends personalised presents, which we call Smiles, to ME sufferers and their carers to brighten their day and make them smile. Find out more on our website www.smileforme.org.uk

name: The Malala Fund UK
missionStatement: With more than 130 million girls out of school today, Malala Fund is breaking down barriers that hold girls back by supporting the work of local education activists through our Gulmakai Network; advocating for resources and policy changes needed to give all girls a secondary education; and amplifying girls' voices.
description: Help give all girls the opportunity to learn and lead.

name: West Cumbria Carers
missionStatement: West Cumbria carers provides support to unpaid carers form the age of 5 who are carrying out a caring role to look after a family member, friend or neighbour who could not manage without their help
description: Support to unpaid carers, particularly young carers to maintain their health & wellbeing

name: Dyslexia Association of London
missionStatement: The Dyslexia Association of London has been in operation since 1972. We believe that dyslexia should not stand as a barrier to success for any person. Many celebrities, entrepreneurs and high-performing individuals have overcome their learning difficulties to achieve their goals. We encourage our members to aim high and offer them resources to unlock their potential through the careful promotion of events, support groups, and creative opportunities.
description: Help us in delivering support to people with dyslexia through your donations.

name: Heart Jewel Centre
missionStatement: We are a registered charity aiming to promote meditation and other Buddhist practices in modern society in order to increase happiness and well-being.
description: May everyone be happy, May everyone be free from suffering

name: I AM SOMEBODY'S CHILD SOLDIER
missionStatement: I am Somebodys Child Soldier was established to empower war affected individuals and populations through improved wellbeing and strengthened community inclusion. Its strategic goal is to work with local communities in Northern Uganda to enhance the lives of formerly abducted children and the communities in which they live with the specific objectives of improving the mental health of upto 1000 war affected individuals, facilitating the creation of a conducive rehabilitation environment.
description: Join us shed light on mental illness suffered by child soldiers

name: St Albans for Refugees
missionStatement:
StAR exists to collect and distribute emergency aid for refugees from war, oppression, natural disasters, climate change, and those being persecuted for reasons of race, religion, nationality, or membership of a particular social group or political opinion.

We also work to preserve and protect the physical and mental health of those granted refugee status and their dependents.


We advance the education of the public in general about the issues relating to refugees and those seeking asylum.
description: Help us deliver aid for refugees directly to where it matters!

name: warwickshire wildlife sanctuary
missionStatement: We are a small family run charity that covers a wide area across the Midlands. We rescue wild animals that have been injured, attacked or abandoned and nurse them back to health. Once they are recovered we release them back into the wild. We have been doing this since 2001 and to date (2019) we have had 62000 birds and animals! We have no funding, so rely on donations. Our staff are all volunteers so every penny raised goes directly to the wildlife in our care.
description: Please donate and help us care for UK Wildlife. Without us, they have no one.

name: Darul Arqam Educational Trust
missionStatement:
Established in 1998, Darul Arqam Trust is a Leicester-based educational charity set up to serve the general public and in particular the local Muslim community. To date, the Trust continues to initiate and run a long list of pioneering courses and activities.

We also fund raise for the international community to provide humanitarian and disaster relief for the most impoverished people in the world.
description: knowledge, spirituality, action

name: Kiran's Trust
missionStatement:
Kiran's Trust supports young people in the Arts, Music, Writing and Sports. 
Support provided ranges from individual scholarships, school prizes and group workshops in the various creative arts, including music, writing, and drama.
Just small amounts of money make a huge difference--most of the time it is really a confidence boost for the young people to see their talent and efforts recognised by others..

name: Mind Allies
missionStatement: Mind Allies is a newly formed Non-Profit Organisation providing support for people suffering from depression, anxiety, suicidal crisis or any form of negative mental health. Leaping in the current support available, we have begun a journey of making support available here and now for as many as we can. From our interactive service making use of the digital era to our group activities, events and sanctuaries.
description: Help us provide instant support for people suffering from Mental Health

name: The Herefordshire Wildlife Trust Ltd
missionStatement: Our vision is to create a Herefordshire richer and more diverse in wildlife, cared for by people for the benefit of all. Our mission is to restore Herefordshire's wildlife and engage people with the Natural Works, to conserve Herefordshire's biodiversity for future generations, to grow so that it can do the above on a sustainable financial basis & to do the above whilst deriving broader benefits to society.

name: Leicester International School
missionStatement: Running a private School and relief and educational projects in African countries.
description: Educational & Relief projects in UK and Africa

name: K-9 Angels
missionStatement: K-9 Angels was created in order to help dogs all over the world. Their mission is to improve the quality of existence of our canine friends from all over the globe as well as educate people about animal welfare.  K-9 Angels provides a much needed network link between dog rescuers in foreign countries and prospective adopters in the UK, as well as funding for spay and neuter programmes, food and material aid, shelters, medical and veterinary aid.
description: Please donate to help homeless dogs & save the lives of those who can't help themselves

name: The League of Jewish Women
missionStatement: The League of Jewish Women is a voluntary service organisation that provides help wherever it is needed, within both the Jewish and the wider community. Our voluntary work ranges from hospital and home visits to working in prisons and running day centres for older people. Many members also work in schools, baby clinics and contact centres. The type of work members do is as varied as the members themselves and most of it is organised locally.
description: Please help us to provide much needed voluntary support to the Jewish and wider community.

name: Khalsa Aid International
missionStatement:
Khalsa Aid International is a UK-based humanitarian relief charity (Registered Charity Number: 1163294) providing support around the world to victims of natural and man-made disasters such as floods, earthquakes, famine and war.

Our team is often one of the first on the scene to help distribute food, water, clothing, medical and sanitation supplies.

The charity was founded by Ravinder (Ravi) Singh, who was struck by the plight of the refugees in Kosovo in 1999.
description: Recognise the whole human race as one

name: Let Them Help Themselves out of Poverty
missionStatement: We are a community regeneration charity. Our aim is to alleviate poverty in rural Uganda via interventions that allow communities to become economically active and sustainable
description: Help us help them out of poverty

name: The Priors Education Trust
missionStatement: Advancing for the public benefit education in the United Kingdom, in particular, but without prejudice to the generality of the foregoing by establishing, maintaining, carrying on, managing and developing a nursery school. Offering appropriate play, recreation, education and care facilities at in activities or providing facilities or equipment which support other educational facilities with the area including, but not limited to The Priors School.
description: Supporting Education locally

name: The Metamorphic Association
missionStatement: The Metamorphic Association is an Educational Charitable Trust with an International presence. It functions as a network of people who support each other in learning, sharing, exploring, practising, promoting and teaching the Metamorphic Technique "to promote good health and well being through awareness, understanding and use of the Metamorphic Technique in the UK and internationally and to uphold standards in practising and teaching the Technique".
description: So we may offer our work in hospices, palliative care,homes for the disabled & the elderly

name: Change through Education in Africa
missionStatement: Small charity founded in May 2017 which strives to make a sustainable change through quality education in Uganda. Our vision is for every child to achieve their full potential. Our mission is to empower both children and adults in Uganda to become successful and valuable members of their community. We want to give them the power of knowledge and the opportunity to change not only their lives.
description: Help children in Uganda to reach their full potential!

name: St Edmunds Society
missionStatement: St Eds offers vocational training opportunities to young people from disadvantaged and dysfunctional families and to those who have struggled throughout mainstream education. For many, the chance to gain meaningful trade related qualifications, as well as the attitudes necessary to achieve sustained independence, can be a turning point in many young people's lives and give them feelings of self-worth and value that they had lost.
description: Vocational training to disadvantaged young people

name: MANACARE FOUNDATION
missionStatement: Manacare is set up in over 10 countries with a goal to help the most vulnerable citizens in society. Sri Lanka is our current project, we provide hope to those who need it. During the the corona pandemic we set up two outreach projects feeding hundreds of stray dogs and feeding hundreds of starving families. We also provide jobs for poor single mothers whilst educating their children.
description: Provide help to the most vulnerable people in Sri Lanka

name: Abergele Community Action Ltd
missionStatement:
1125169

We seek to meet the needs of people in the community. Our main focus since the pandemic is Abergele District Foodbank supplying emergency food to people in crisis as well as Abergele Community Money Advice providing help and advice for those people experiencing problems in managing their money and Abergele Youth Shed which provides a safe place where young people can enjoy new opportunities and experiences.
description: We seek to address the needs of the community, working in the community for the community

name: Bombo Productions
missionStatement: Bombo Productions is a community arts organisation that believes in the power of music to improve people's lives. Established in 2007, through the medium of Afro-Latin based music we connect people from different social-ethnic-generational groups including refugees, survivors of trafficking and young people from deprived areas in London. Our regular events are aimed and motivating community cohesion, creativity, personal development and team-building.
description: Your donation will help marginalised people benefit from our community music programs.

name: The Peace Centre Uganda
missionStatement:
We provide a loving home, healthcare and education for 40 orphans at The Peace Centre in southern Uganda.  We also provide an education for 20 orphans who live within an extended family in the local village.
The children are aged between 4 and 18.  
When they leave us we aim to support them in further education (eg teaching, nursing, agriculture) for the future benefit of their communities.
description: We are in one of the poorest areas of Africa, the children who come to us have nothing

name: Chiltern Open Air Museum
missionStatement: Chiltern Open Air Museum rescues and redisplays historic buildings from around the Chilterns from the Iron Age to Second World War, including cottages, a tin chapel and traditional farm. School programmes include workshops and theme days from Stone Age to Victorians. Special events include historic re-enactments, horse shows and family Terrific Tuesday events. Experience days for blacksmithing, heavy horses, straw plaiting and baking.
description: Help us to preserve historic buildings and Chilterns landscapes for future generations

name: Southampton Natural History Society
missionStatement:
The Southampton Natural History Society (SNHS) celebrated its centenary in 2012 and is concerned with all aspects of natural history in and around Southampton. The society holds regular field and indoor meetings and produces newsletters and an annual report detailing some of the exciting flora and fauna of this region.
The Society has a general (and large!) recording area of all locations within 15 miles of Southampton.
description: Getting closer to nature. Locally.

name: Hamara Healthy Living Centre
missionStatement: Hamara (meaning ours) provides support for people of all ages, communities and backgrounds including information, advice and guidance, day opportunity services for adults with learning disabilities, training and education, youth activities, sport, health and exercise. Our vision is a cohesive and cooperative community that collaboratively works with each other and wider external stakeholders for improved health and well-being with equal access to opportunities and services.
description: "The Cockburn Centre" - Lifeskills for Adults with Learning Disabilities

name: Kyle and Lochalsh Community Trust
missionStatement:
We aim to achieve sustainable regeneration of our community which, despite its magnificent geographic setting, has been identified as one of the most economically fragile in the Highlands.

We generate income through enterprise and the ownership of assets. As a not-for-profit organisation, all of our trading surpluses are reinvested in the community.

Owned & managed by the local community and organised on democratic principles.

name: The Community of the Resurrection
missionStatement:
The Community of the Resurrection consist of men who, freely accepting the call of God, have committed themselves to follow the gospel life.

The Community's contemporary mission continues to radiate from Mirfield.

We live together as brothers in Christ, rooted in the Anglican tradition, and formed in a Benedictine round of worship, ministry and hospitality.

We welcome others to come, see, learn and share.

name: PF Counselling Service
missionStatement:
PF Counselling Service provides counselling and psychotherapy for people facing the difficulties of everyday life.  Our volunteer counsellors offer a professional service to individuals over the age of 18 regardless of ability to pay, with clients contributing what they can afford.

Our vision is to enable people to embrace life more fully through the growth, changes and healing that can take place through the counselling process.
description: Providing counselling to adults regardless of their background or ability to pay.

name: SEAS Sailability
missionStatement:
The coast of North Wales is one of the most beautiful places in the world. We believe that everyone should be able to experience its beauty and adventures without the barriers posed by disability. 
Our Vision is a community where disabled people and their bubble are supported and enabled with the skills, experience and confidence to get out on the water and have adventurous fun!
description: Supporting Enabling Accessible Sailing for disabled people and thier bubble

name: Friends of Hatchlands Primary School
missionStatement: Friends of Hatchlands is the PTA group associated to Hatchlands Primary School in Surrey.  We are raising funds to improve the academic performance of all pupils, to improve the learning, work and play environment for all pupils and staff.  We also work tirelessly to nurture a strong relationship between the parent and staff community, and to promote the positive image of the School into the local community.
description: Fundraising for all pupils attending Hatchlands Primary School in Surrey

name: The Highlanders Museum Limited
missionStatement: The Highlanders' Museum is an accredited, Visit Scotland 5 star rated, independent Museum situated within Fort George.  It is a visitor attraction showcasing Highland military history and is the jewel in the crown of this imposing and impressive military barracks. The collection housed within the Museum has been recently recognised as nationally significant to Scotland.  This accolade is awarded by Museums Galleries Scotland on behalf of the Scottish Government.
description: Preserving the heritage of the Highland Soldier

name: Harnhill Centre of Christian Healing
missionStatement:
Harnhill Centre is a registered Charity in Gloucestershire dedicated to providing healing through Jesus Christ by offering personal retreats, healing weeks and quiet days with opportunities for prayer ministry.  We work with organisations supporting those experiencing or overcoming life's challenges. 

Three public services are held weekly.  

Our facilities are available for bookings by organisations, church and Diocesan groups seeking conference facilities or space for teaching, away or quiet days.
description: Promote the CofE’s Charitable work / Anglican faith and further Christian Healing Ministry

name: The Christian School (Takeley)
missionStatement:
The school caters for children from 3years through to 16 years of age. 
Our overall aim is to provide a Christ centred education that enables children and young people to become confident, creative, aware and responsible members of their communities.
This crucial work is shared between the school, the parents and, of course, with the young person themselves.
DFE No. 881/6041 ~ Registered Charity No. 1148518 ~ Company No. 8165830
description: Help us to serve one another through Christian education

name: THE PAROCHIAL CHURCH COUNCIL OF THE ECCLESIASTICAL PARISH OF TRING TEAM
missionStatement: The Tring Team Parish is the Church of England in Tring, Long Marston, Wilstone and Puttenham in Hertfordshire. We are a community celebrating and working out our faith through many different styles of prayer and worship. We do our best to live and share God's love in this modern world, through services, social events and service to the community around us. For more information please visit our website www.tringteamparish.org.uk
description: Please help Tring Team Parish to support and maintain our five historic churches.

name: Mid Devon Mobility
missionStatement: We provide a number of services aimed at increasing the independence, mobility, well-being and peace of mind of older, rurally isolated and disabled people in Mid Devon; helping to combat the problems of loneliness and isolation and enabling access to local services, social clubs, day care, health appointments and amenities. Our Mission Statement, 'Increasing the independence, mobility and peace of mind of older, disabled and isolated people in our communities.'
description: we need help to continue to provide services to our elderly, disabled community

name: The GFG Foundation
missionStatement: The GFG Foundation was launched in February 2017 by Sanjeev and Nicola Gupta to support industrial skills development and to encourage and inspire young people to pursue careers in engineering, metals and renewable energy. The Foundation supports various STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering and Maths) programmes through several partnerships. The aim of these programmes is to encourage and inspire young people into pursuing science and engineering as a career choice.
description: Investing in future generations.

name: Harley Village Mission Rooms Trust
missionStatement:
We have converted "The Mission Rooms" in our Village into a dual-purpose building improving the quality of life, providing social facility, educational, physical, recreational opportunity for lonely older people whose lives are blighted by ill-health, disability and immobility through to our younger people who are isolated by the lack of public transport and local facility 

The building was about to close and would have otherwise become derelict.

name: Foundation for the Preservation of Yungdrung Bön
missionStatement: The Foundation seeks to preserve the rich knowledge encapsulated in the Yungdrung Bon tradition for the benefit of all peoples throughout the world. Its charitable activities shall take a two-pronged approach: ensuring the teachings of Yungdrung Bon are preserved in the West; ensuring the teachings of Yungdrung Bon are preserved in situ, in Tibet and Himalayas. For more details please visit our website: https://yungdrungbon.co.uk/about-us/
description: Help us preserve the most ancient living spiritual tradition on Earth!

name: MKSI Comunity Centre Peterborough
missionStatement:
The Muslim Khoja Shia Ithna Asheri Community was established in the 1970s in order to advance the religion of Islam, to promote the Shia Ithna Asheri faith and to maintain and develop the worship and life of the Shia Ithna Asheri in Peterborough 

The community continues to grow with a number of families making Peterborough their new home

Today our community includes among its regular participants Shia Muslims of diverse cultures.
description: Please help us keep our centre running

name: URBOND
missionStatement: URBOND is a charity working to improve access to primary education and advance diversity and equality within our communities. The charity was founded with the primary purpose of helping local communities to integrate and support one another. In Guinea, our Child Education programme is helping us achieve this by working with partners and the local community to provide educational support and resources to children who would otherwise go without.
description: Support our work, together we will change lives and provide opportunities.

name: Believe In Bee Foundation
missionStatement:
Believe In Bee is a UK registered Charitable Non-Profit Organisation
www.believeinbeefoundation.org.uk

The charity supports vulnerable 
persons aged between 10 - 27 years of age who have suffered Domestic Violence, Abuse, Exploitation, and Post Trauma during their childhood adolescent years within the 
Birmingham West Midlands area. 

The foundation provides bespoke 1-2-1 mentoring/coaching support, and group work activities for these clients with the goal to improve their overall life outcomes.
description: BelieveinbeefoundationNEEDSYOU!

name: Sing! Bentley Heath
missionStatement: Sing! Bentley Heath is a community choir rehearsing and performing in the Solihull borough and raising much needed funds for good causes working within our community.  During the pandemic, we have had to look at different ways to rehears perform and raise funds for charity.  This PayPal account allows us to accept donations on behalf of our current good causes only (i.e. not the choir). For more details, visit:  www.singbentleyheath.org.uk/charity

name: Rajasthan Association, United Kingdom
missionStatement:
The objectives of RAUK are:

a) The advancement of education in Rajasthani traditions and values in particular, but not exclusively through the provision of cultural and social and events in line with Rajasthani traditions and values.

b) The prevention or relief of poverty in any part of the world by providing grants, items and services to individuals in need and/or charities, or other organisations working to prevent or relieve poverty
description: Prevention or relief of poverty by providing grants, items and services to individuals

name: scottish spina bifida association
missionStatement: Spina Bifida Hydrocephalus (SBH Scotland) provide a lifetime commitment of specialist support and information to all those affected with rare, complex disabilities. We aim to empower those affected to live as independently as possible. SBH Scotland's Support Team support over 4000 individuals with a range of services including; a helpline, one to one support in homes and schools, health checks, advocacy, clinics in hospitals, support groups, financial advice, play sessions and workshops.
description: We need to raise £1million annually and every penny counts. Thank you for your support

name: Darlington Railway Preservation Society
missionStatement: The Darlington Railway Preservation Society is a charity set up and run by volunteers to preserve for the public benefit; steam and other railway locomotives, rolling stock, machinery and equipment for educational and historical interest. The DRPS is home of 78018 British Rail Standard 2-6-0 class 2MT tender locomotive, famously caught in a snowdrift at Bleath Gill. The DRPS also houses a number of locomotives and Wagons that were built or worked in Darlington.
description: Support Darlington Railway Preservation Society

name: Just42
missionStatement: Making a positive impact on the lives of young people and children in rural Suffolk.
description: Please support our work with children and young people in and around Woodbridge.

name: The Flying Seagull Project
missionStatement: The Flying Seagull Project is a troupe of clowns, magicians, circus performers and musicians taking smiles to those in need, whether is hospitals in the UK, in refugee camps in Greece and Eastern Europe or in Lebanon and India.
description: Please help up spread smiles far and wide!

name: Age UK Richmond upon Thames
missionStatement: Age UK Richmond provide a range of services to help promote physical and emotional wellbeing through a variety of ways. We provide group activities to improve fitness, develop new skills and build confidence. We offer practical and emotional one to one support that provides companionship and the ability to stay living at home independently for longer. We also campaign and promote issues affecting local older people, providing volunteering opportunities and build stronger communities.
description: Help us improve the quality of life of older people in our borough.

name: The Women's Royal Army Corps Association
missionStatement: The Women's Royal Army Corps Association was formed in 1949 on the birth of the WRAC. The WRAC Association superseded and incorporated the QMAAC and ATS Comrades Association. Everyone who served in the QMAAC, ATS or WRAC, as either a Regular or Territorial Army soldier or officer, is eligible to join the WRAC Association.
description: Support the women who served in the ATS & WRAC

name: Adult Cerebral Palsy Hub
missionStatement:
Adult Cerebral Palsy Hub is a charity founded to represent the needs of adults living with Cerebral Palsy (CP) in the UK.  Registered Charity Number 1179458

Adult Cerebral Palsy Hub has been established to create a hub for adults with CP. A place to receive support and access information based on the most up to date medical knowledge, understanding & expertise. In so doing to enable them to remain active members of society, despite their condition and changing needs.
description: Donate now to help improve services and support for adults with Cerebral Palsy

name: Care 4 Cats
missionStatement: Care 4 Cats is concerned with the welfare and care of feral and abandoned cats on the island of Ibiza, Spain.  The work includes a program of trapping, neutering and returning cats to their natural environment in the most humane way.  The object being to control the spread of feral colonies and maintain them in good health and keep them well fed.
description: Veterinary services are very expensive requiring a constant flow of funds

name: Church of Scotland, Reid Memorial Church, Edinburgh
missionStatement: We exist to workship God and serve our community
description: Cat A listed building in the Arts & Crafts Gothic style maintenance.

name: Polly Parrot Rescue UK
missionStatement:
A Rescue you can trust
Polly Parrot Rescue UK has been set up to take in parrots of all breeds. No parrot will be turned away regardless of age, health, condition or temperament.
 
We are a family run rescue who's founders have over 30 years experience in keeping parrots and have helped out at numerous rescues in the past. We have set up this non profit making organisation using our experience to form a rescue which cares for the birds and their welfare,
description: to help the hundreds of bird's we take in every year

name: Global Support Trust
missionStatement:
Global Support Trust is a UK Charity registered with Charity Commission.

We work with all people regardless of faith or background. 

Our main focus is supporting and empowering Orphans and under privileged children in the UK and around the world.

In the UK we work to support people in financial difficulty.
description: Support Orphans and under privileged children in the UK and around the world.

name: Midland Railway Trust
missionStatement: We operate Midland Railway-Butterley as a working museum for the public benefit, with the aim of advancing the knowledge and understanding of the vital role played by the Midland Railway Company and its successors in technological and social development, across the country, together with its links with communities and industry.
description: Dedicated to the former glory of the Midland Railway.

name: MUSLIM HELP UK
missionStatement: Muslim Help UK is a registered Charity Organisation and has been working in Educational, Training, Health care, Emergency and Housing projects in the non-profit development since the year 2012
description: Muslim Help UK runs various projects and activities for the neediest.

name: OPERA SOUTH
missionStatement: A visit to Opera South is an uplifting experience - a perfect tapestry of art, drama and great music. For 30+ years Opera South has showcased talented young soloists, ensuring that opera is available in Surrey, Hampshire and West Sussex. We rely on donations from generous friends, patrons and sponsors, ticket sales and legacies.  If you share our passion for top quality performances with emerging singers who relish opportunities to appear on stage with professional backing, donate now!
description: Nurture young opera singers to help save live opera for the future.

name: Sport 4 Life UK
missionStatement: Sport 4 Life UK exists to create a better future for disadvantaged and socially excluded young people.
description: Help level the playing field for the most disadvantaged young people

name: THE FROME CARNIVAL CHARITIES ASSOCIATION
missionStatement: One of the reasons that Frome Carnival is so special is that we are a registered charity  supporting individuals  organisations and good causes in the local area. Our fundraising events throughout the year allow us to put on the carnival which can cost many thousands of pounds. Once we have paid for that, any extra money and most importantly, that which is donated to us during the processionscan be passed to the charity.
description: Frome's Carnival, Frome Charity, raising money for over 88 years

name: Suffolk Artlink
missionStatement: Suffolk Artlink is a participatory arts charity. We develop and deliver inclusive arts programmes that bring skills, support networks, confidence and joy to people in the East.  Our creative projects help people transform their lives through the arts, and are delivered in community centres, hospitals and hospices, residential homes, refuges and schools. Our work is led by experienced arts practitioners and is delivered in close partnership with care, education, voluntary and community organisations.
description: Help transform lives through the arts

name: Hills Road Sixth Form College
missionStatement: We welcome our Hills Road Alumni where long-lasting bonds can be formed between past students and Hills Road Sixth Form College. In common with many educational institutions we feel we have considerable social capital that resides in both the actual and potential relationships we'd like to develop with our past students. We would like to inspire a new generation of alumni and engage them in our network to share their own stories of success.
description: How you can give back to the College and help the next generation of Hills Road students.

name: The Phoenix Group for Deaf Children
missionStatement: The Phoenix Group for Deaf Children and Young Adults work with children and adults and their families, providing a range of services that help deaf children develop confidence, independence and self-belief.  Supporting all members of the family is important to us: we have parents,children and young peoples's groups.  We deliver workshops and courses including work skills and life skills.  We also offer deaf awareness  and sign language courses for the local community.
description: We help with: Isolation, independence, self esteem, life skills, communication

name: Wensleydale Concert Series
missionStatement: For many residents, particularly the elderly, rural Wensleydale is too far from major concert halls to allow access to live classical music. Wensleydale Concert Series provide regular classical concerts with professional UK and international musicians.
