A community based organisation, we also provide outreach to young people in local schools and the elderly in their own homes, care homes and we are trialling special free events. This year we are introducing free transport to our concerts.
description: Support classical music in rural Wensleydale and community outreach

name: The Adventure Boutique Foundation
missionStatement: The Adventure Boutique Foundation was formed to put back into the communities through which we travel by identifying and funding by means of grants, local charities, voluntary organisations or international NGOs that benefit the people in these areas. As well as funding projects that will advance the conditions of life in socially and economically disadvantaged areas, funds will also be used to benefit those caught up in natural disasters such a earthquakes.
description: 100% of funding goes towards helping and empowering communities.

name: Hope Hill Foundation
missionStatement: Hope Hill Foundation is a charity committed to fighting poverty. We  support babies, children, pregnant women & single parent families who are in need. We aim to provide them with basic necessities, nappies, wipes, food items, grants to start businesses to help themselves, toiletries and much more. We work both in the UK & in Ghana. We want to impact lives, bridge the gap between those who can and those who need some help!
description: HELP US HELP OTHERS

name: AMOR
missionStatement:
AMOR is a humanitarian NGO and mission working to promote and protect Mayan heritage, and achieve peace, justice and reconciliation for the indigenous Mayan women and communities of Guatemala, Belize and Southern Mexico devastated and displaced by genocide through our Sustainable Community Transformation Model, Afretlain.

AMOR is home to the non-violent movement for justice for the 30 Mayan ethnicities, for the preservation of their critically endangered knowledge, heritage, lands and lives.
description: Help us realise our dream of freedom for the Mayan people

name: Swindon Music Trust
missionStatement: Swindon Music Trust is a local charity based in Wiltshire providing much needed access and funding for Music Therapy and 1-1 Instrumental tuition to children and young people in schools across the county. We assist children who have special educational needs children in care and those from disadvantaged or economically or socially deprived backgrounds. We believe all children should have access to the joy of Music regardless of social or economic constraint.

name: ONE UMMAH AID
missionStatement:
We Make It Easy to Help Others

Founded in 2000, One Ummah Aid Charity  is 100 % Donation Policy has been working hard with the help of our members and volunteers to help individuals in our area. Our work is dedicated to funding and delivering charitable services, and we strive to inspire and improve the lives of those who need assistance. Get in touch to learn how you can make a difference at our Charity
description: Our water pumps project service small village's to large schools to Community's

name: PTA OF ST JAMES C OF E PRIMARY SCHOOL
missionStatement:
The St James School PTA, is a small group of volunteer Mums, who are passionate about giving all the village school children the best start to their education by making sure they enjoy being at school. 

Your gift, no matter the size, will go an incredible way to making sure that the kids make the most of their early years education and give them the confidence to enter secondary school happy and capable individuals.
description: Donate Here

name: Victoria Music Ltd.
missionStatement: We raise fund through donations and performances and then plough all of the profits back into the local communities in which we operate using the arts for underprivileged children for free and wellbeing sessions for isolated and lonely or depressed adults as well as stay ay home mums, No one individual benefits from VML but rather communities in need of support and children with a dream and no financial means to pursue that dream.
description: To provide arts services to young people and adults  in the interests of social welfare

name: The Sreepur Village, Bangladesh
missionStatement: The UK based 'Sreepur Village, Bangladesh' funds and oversees 'Shishu Polli Plus' (translated as Childrens Village Plus) a small non-political organisation based in Sreepur, rural Bangladesh. SPP works with destitute mothers and their children to give them the health, knowledge and skills they need to function independently in society. At the moment over 150 mothers and 540 children are supported by SPP.
description: Helping destitute women and children in Bangladesh

name: Ollie Young Foundation
missionStatement: The Ollie Young Foundation is a UK registered charity which funds targeted paediatric brain tumour research and support.

name: Manchester Buddhist Centre
missionStatement: Manchester Buddhist Centre is located in Manchester's Northern Quarter.  Once a derelict Victorian warehouse, our building is now a place of peace, simplicity and beauty. We take our inspiration from the Buddha and how he transformed himself. We believe that is possible for us all.  We offer classes in meditation and Buddhism both for Buddhists and non-Buddhists. As a charity we rely on the generosity of everyone who values the Centre to keep our doors and activities open to as many people as possible.
description: Donating our the Centre enables us to continue bringing the Buddha's message to the world.

name: Kent Greyhound Rescue
missionStatement:
Kent Greyhound Resue rescue, rehabilitate and rehome unwanted and abandoned greyhounds and lurchers.  

We are all volunteers so all monies raised really does go towards the helping the dogs in our care.

Most of our dogs come from Ireland, although they may have raced in the UK, some come from Spain and Romania.  Our lurchers mainly come to us from the dog pounds.  Most of the dogs have been uncared for and need medical attention.

You can read a lot more about us at kentgreyhoundrescue.com
description: Save lives - help us help more greyhouds & lurchers in need.

name: Emmaus Glasgow
missionStatement:
Emmaus (pronounce E-May-Us) is a homeless charity with a difference. We don't just give people a bed for the night; we offer a home and meaningful work, training and a sense of belonging. We offer supported accommodation for 29 people who have experienced homelessness. 
We also support soup kitchens, food banks and provide free furniture to those most in need in the city.
description: Emmaus -the charity working to end homelessness

name: HUNTINGTON DISEASE LIVIN
missionStatement:
HD Livin' is raising funds to support people dealing with Huntington's Disease. In particular we aim to provide small 3 bed Respite Homes with a hub providing support and information.
HD is debilitating Disease where the brain breaks down over time, leaving the sufferer with no ability to complete physical tasks. Meaning in time someone has do everything for them.
This is a hereditary diseased where the child has 50/50 chance of getting it. A person can live up to 20 years from onset.

name: Bedfordshire Down's Syndrome Support Group
missionStatement: B.D.S.S.G is a parent run charity which supports families of children with Down's Syndrome. We support other parents by sharing information and creating opportunities for families to socialise and learn together. We support our children by arranging specific activities and by working with other agencies to increase awareness of Down's Syndrome and improve the opportunities available to people with the condition.
description: Please donate to support families and friends whose lives are touched by someone with DS!

name: Goodwill Caravan
missionStatement: Goodwill Caravan is a humanitarian non profit organisation that covers refugee emergency care primarily for accommodation and food.
description: We help pregnant women, infants and disabled families where children may be at risk.

name: Trunkies in the Room Foundation
missionStatement:
it is our mission to ensure animals have a life free from fear and abuse. To this end we actively support the development and management of animal sanctuaries and programmes that prevent and/or resolve human animal conflicts. We are proud to see the fruits of our labour materializing within only a few months in Sri Lanka through the Elephant Freedom Project. A sanctuary project for Elephants we developed in corporation with Volunteers at Work.

We also support the local communities in any way we can.
description: Give for Real results - animals and communities need support to stop abuse & start caring

name: Stepping Stones Play & Learn Group
missionStatement: Stepping Stones Play and Learn Group is a charity based in Colchester Essex. Our service includes an integrated nursery for children with additional needs and mainstream children to play, learn and develop alongside each other. We also run a weekly tots group for babies with special needs, Holiday clubs for school aged children 5-11 with complex needs and a monthly Family Stay & Play session. We provide advocacy and support for families and work closly with external agencies. Every child is unique to us.
description: Fundraising is vital for us to continue to support our familiesand to extend our service.

name: Environmental Justice Foundation
missionStatement:
The Environmental Justice Foundation, EJF, is a UK-based non-profit organisation working internationally to protect the environment and defend human rights.
Our work focuses on protecting the world's seas and oceans by investigating and exposing illegal 'pirate' fishing and exploitation in the seafood industry, showing the impacts of our changing global climate on vulnerable communities, and highlighting the effects of toxic pesticides.
description: Help EJF to protect people and planet

name: Pangbourne Valley Playgroup
missionStatement:
Pangbourne Valley Playgroup (PVPG) is a pre-school located in the village of Pangbourne, West Berkshire. As a registered charity PVPG is belongs to the families that use it. Our staff and parents are committed to providing a fun, safe and nurturing learning environment. 
We work with a unique child-centred approach, where children can learn and develop at their own pace within a happy atmosphere.

name: West Yorkshire Animals In Need
missionStatement:
West Yorkshire Animals In Need is a small independent animal welfare charity helping all kinds of animals throughout the world. 
Last year WYAIN helped over 1000 animals including Donkeys, Dogs, Cats, Horses and wildlife in countries such as India, Peru, Egypt and Eastern Europe as well as the UK.
We have gained an excellent reputation over the years and we are renowned for our integrity. WYAIN helps when others don't.
We rely totally on donations from the public to survive.
description: WE NEED YOUR HELP TO SAVE ANIMALS IN DESPERATE NEED WORLDWIDE - TOGETHER WE CAN DO IT!

name: THE DASH CHARITY
missionStatement: The Dash Charity is an Award winning charity that supports women, men & children affected by domestic abuse.  We've been operating since 1976 and offer a wide range of specialist services.  Our refuge Service offers safe accommodation for women; Our Advocacy & Outreach Service works with women and men in the community to keep them safe and reduce the risks; Our Children's Services Team reaches out to children and young people; We run the Freedom Plus Programme; We provide specialist domestic abuse training
description: help today -donate 2 pounds towards emergency welcome packs for women arriving at refuge

name: World Shirdi Sai Baba Organisation (UK)
missionStatement: Make a meaningful contribution to the welfare of society in accordance with the teachings of Shirdi Sai Baba
description: Welfare of society in accordance with the teachings of Shirdi Sai Baba

name: The London Sports Trust
missionStatement:
We work within disadvantaged communities to improve both the physical and mental health of Londoners. London Sports Trust is a charity dedicated to inspiring and cultivating positive change in young Londoners through the power of sport, lifeskills development, confidence building and education.  

Our three main objectives are:
- Inspire positive change in young Londoners & parents through the power of sport & lifeskills.
- Help disadvantaged children and their families to achieve their goals in life,
description: Every penny raised directly improve the physical and mental health of deprived children

name: The William Mills Foundation
missionStatement: The William Mills Foundation was founded following a tragic event in June 2018, when Will collapsed and died at home, near Bewdley in Worcestershire. William died of 'natural causes' although the exact cause of his death has not yet been ascertained. This meant that in the first days following his death, Will's family found it difficult to direct the offers of help and donations that quite naturally came from friends and family.
description: Providing Opportunity for young people

name: Nene Valley Community First Responders
missionStatement:
Nene Valley Community First Responders provide a volunteerCommunity First Responder scheme in support of East Midlands Ambulance Service to our local
communities of Wellingborough, Bozeat, Wollaston, Earls Barton, Sywell, Finedon, Rushden, Irthlingborough and Higham Ferrers and the surrounding areas.

Our volunteer responders give their time freely and the money that we use for our day to day running costs as well as the purchase of equipment is raised through fundraising events and donations.
description: We exist to attend potential life threatening emergencies before the ambulance arrives.

name: Norfolk Record Society
missionStatement:
The aims of the Society are to encourage the study and preservation of records relating to the County of Norfolk and to publish an annual volume on documents relating to the history of the County.

From its foundation the Society has played in important role in rescuing documents relating to the County of Norfolk, became a key player in the creation of the Norfolk Record Office where our rescued documents are deposited.
description: Preservation and Publication of Norfolk Records

name: International Commission on Radiological Protection
missionStatement: Founded in 1928 to improve the safety of the use of radiation in medicine, ICRP is now the global leader in setting international recommendations to protect the public, patients, workers, and the environment from harmful effects of radiation, including cancer and other diseases. ICRP continues to advance the System of Radiological Protection for the benefit of everyone around the world. As a small, independent charity, funding is vital to continue this important work.
description: Help us people, animals, and the environment from the harmful effects of radiation.

name: Raffingers Foundation
missionStatement:
Raffingers Foundation was formed in 2016, in memory of Jason Kew, a dear husband and friend, who sadly lost his life to pancreatic cancer.
The foundation supports Pancreatic Cancer Research Fund PCRF and has also supported Ovarian Cancer Action. We are pleased to announce that in addition to supporting PCRF, we will now be supporting the Alzheimers Society.
Money raised is split in two going to research projects and directly to families affected by these diseases experiencing financial difficulties.
description: Raffingers Foundation is helping fight two life taking diseases

name: The Wilberforce Society
missionStatement:
The Wilberforce Society is the first student-run political think tank to have been established in the UK, based at Cambridge University. We facilitate a unique, mutually beneficial dialogue between Cambridge students and national policymakers, across all areas of public policy, from the domestic to the foreign, from the social to the economic.

We work to produce practical yet innovative proposals with their viability and consequences always in mind and offer creative solutions to real world problems.
description: Donate and support new perspectives, new voices and new ideas!

name: The University of Sheffield Union of Students
missionStatement:
Sheffield Students' Union is an independent charity powered by students. Our vision is to give students the best University experience: top quality education, opportunities and experiences that liberate and support them for their future. 

The pandemic forced the SU to close its doors. The majority of our income generation disappeared overnight. As a result we are facing dire financial circumstances. Donating today will help us recover financially and allow us to continue to improve student lives.
description: Our finances have been hit hard by covid-19, help us to support and enhance student lives

name: HUGS
missionStatement: We provide memory boxes to local hospitals for parents who have lost a baby. We provide items in the box that help them make precious memories with their babies in the short time they have together. The boxes let the parents know they are not alone in their grief. We also provide support either 1-1 or in groups. We pay for alternative therapies for parents that need an extra little help, such as acupuncture, to help relieve stress.
description: Please help us to help bereaved parents.

name: Forthspring Inter Community Group
missionStatement: Forthspring Inter Community Group is a shared space community centre based in Belfast, Northern Ireland.  We are committed peace-builders and all of our work is relational, and about bring people together who are separated by physical 'peace walls' based on religion.  We believe in good relations, promote the practice of non-violence and are committed to peace and reconciliation.  We offer afterschool childcare, youth centre, detached street based youth work, family support, women's groups, and pensioners.
description: 100% of all donations will go to charitable activities to benefit the whole community

name: The Motherhood Plan
missionStatement: We are the voice of working mothers in the UK. We have a strong and deep connection with our beneficiaries. We provide world-class advice and support to mothers to help them improve their confidence and wellbeing, to give them the tools they need to challenge discrimination in the workplace and to support them to find work that works for them. We advocate for change and raise awareness of the specific challenges faced by working mothers.

name: Disability Solutions West Midlands
missionStatement:
Offering information, support, advice and guidance to people with disabilities and their families. Whilst helping to ensure that those responsible for service design, planning and delivery are linked with the voices and experiences of people with disabilities.
Our aims to enable people who are affected by disability to fully participate and integrate into all aspects of modern society through the provision that meets the needs of people with a disability or long-term, life-limiting health condition.
description: help us support people with disabilties, long term health conditions including cancer.

name: To Transplant & Beyond
missionStatement:
To Transplant and Beyond was established to give hope, encouragement and support to transplant patients, their families, friends and carers during a very traumatic time in their lives. It conveys the positive side of transplantation, by showing what can be achieved and by encouraging as many people as possible to join the donor register, so that many more lives can be saved.
The Charity is totally non-profit and all the committee members give up their time for free.

name: ROLDA UK
missionStatement: ROLDA U.K. are dedicated to saving homeless dogs in a very disadvantaged area of Romania. Few people know there are an estimated 2.5 million dogs currently roaming the streets. If they manage to survive the cold and scarcity of food, they are often injured by cars or by members of the public who see them as pests. ROLDA operate two shelters and currently care for over 650 animals. We adopt our beautiful dogs to loving homes all over Europe.
description: 2.5 million homeless Romanian dogs need our help. Please support us.

name: Incorporated Society for Psychical Research
missionStatement:
THE SOCIETY for Psychical Research was set up in London in 1882, the first scientific organisation ever to examine claims of psychic and paranormal phenomena. We hold no corporate view about their existence or meaning; rather, our purpose is to gather information and foster understanding through research and education.
Our members represent a variety of academic and professional interests all over the world. We welcome active researchers and volunteer helpers who wish to learn about the subject.
description: Help Secure the Future of the SPR in its New Home

name: OMPowerment Project
missionStatement:
Refugees worldwide have long benefited from yoga but access to the practice has been dependent on volunteer availability.
OMPowerment Project Empowers Refugees by teaching them to teach and lead themselves in the healing practice of trauma informed yoga.
We provide free, week-long trainings that equip refugees with the skills to create a safe space in their communities, free of labels and judgement, in which men and women can relieve anxiety and build confidence and self-esteem.
description: 100% of all donations go towards ongoing programming and we appreciate every contribution

name: Bexhill Light Operatic And Dramatic Society
missionStatement:
The Bexhill Light Operatic and Dramatic Society - BLODS - was originally known as Bexhill Amateur Operatic Society. Our very first production was The Mikado in 1933. 

The BLODS have always endeavoured to present a high standard of musical never shirking the challenge of new shows such as the Noda Award-winning Jekyll and Hyde

TO EDUCATE THE PUBLIC IN THE ARTS AND SCIENCES AND IN PARTICULAR THE ART AND SCIENCE OF MUSIC AND DRAMA. Registered charity - 294369
description: To be able to continue to produce high quality shows

name: ALKIONIDES UK
missionStatement:
We provide financial relief to needy patients and their families from Cyprus receiving medical treatment in UK hospitals, with free accommodation and/or by making grants of money for services or facilities not otherwise provided for.
We offer emergency assistance to the UK Cypriot & Greek communities on a case-by-case basis.
We instigate projects to help groups or individuals in the Cypriot communities such as families with children with special needs or students from low-income families.
description: Help us support less fortunate compatriots. We are fully transparent with minimal costs.

name: Dorset Community Workshop
missionStatement: We are focusing on day opportunities for people for mental health recovery, disabilities, stabilized addiction recovery, training for the homeless and job seekers and all sorts of community groups where their funding has been cut. Therapeutic or training activities like woodwork, crafts, pottery, metal work, engineering, mend or paint your own car, repair your bicycle.. A whole world of tools, equipment and materials to be shared where the whole family and community can also come and enjoy too!
description: Please help us to help the most disadvantaged gain quality of life through fun and crafts

name: Dorcas Dress Project
missionStatement: Our size-adjustable dress was specially designed so it could be made in remote parts of the world where access to electricity is limited and sourcing trimmings difficult.  We support people out of situations of hardship by providing training, resources and pastoral care.  We model our charity on our namesake Dorcas: a dressmaker from the early church, who welcomed others into her group, shared her sewing skills and took care of the marginalised in her community.

name: Holy Apostolic Catholic Assyrian Church of the East
missionStatement:
To advance the Christian faith in the tradition of the Holy Apostolic Catholic Assyrian Church of the East in the United Kingdom, primarily but not exclusively through the provision of a place or places of worship, the administration of the sacraments, rites and ceremonies of the Church according to its usage and forms, the proclamation of the Gospel in accordance with the Church faith, and the production and distribution of
literature relating to the Church faith.

name: The Royal Logistic Corps Association Trust
missionStatement:
To provide assistance either generally or individually to members, past and present and their dependants who are suffering hardship and distress
To perpetuate and honour the memory of all soldiers who made the supreme sacrifice whilst serving in the Pioneer Corps and the Royal Pioneer Corps.
To perpetuate and honour the memory of all soldiers who have died subsequent to serving in a Pioneer Regiment.

Our full list is available on request, due to character limit.
description: To provide benevolence to ex Soldiers from The Royal Pioneer Corps.

name: JAFFNA MEDICAL FACULTY OVERSEAS ALUMNI IN THE UK
missionStatement: Jaffna Medical Faculty Overseas Alumni is a Non-Political, Non-Profit organization. JMFOA-UK is founded by the graduates and former teachers of the Faculty of Medicine, University of Jaffna, Sri Lanka.  We formed JMFOA-UK with the intention of helping our faculty, hospitals, their staff and our people back home.  Our objective is the relief of sickness, and the preservation and promotion of good health for the public benefit in Sri Lanka and in UK.
description: Alleviate social deprivation, better health awareness and create professional links

name: THE NATIONAL ASSOCIATION OF CITIZENS ADVICE BUREAUX
missionStatement:
The Citizens Advice service helps people to resolve their problems. As the UK's largest advice provider we are equipped to deal with any issue, from anyone, spanning debt and employment to consumer and housing plus everything in between.

In the last year alone, the Citizens Advice service helped 2.1 million people with 6.6 million problems. But we're not just here in times of crisis - we also use clients stories anonymously to campaign for policy changes that benefit the population as a whole.
description: Support Citizens Advice now to help us make society fairer for everyone.

name: Somerset Sight Ltd
missionStatement:
Somerset Sight is a not for profit organisation, providing practical and emotional support to over 3,500 people and their families across the county who are blind or visually impaired.
Our services include low visual aids, a mobile advisory service, emotional support, activity groups and our flagship volunteer visiting service, plus many more!
description: Help us to support more blind and visually impaired people and their families in Somerset.

name: Link to Change
missionStatement:
Link to Change exists to support and protect vulnerable and disadvantaged children and young people that are at risk of or have experienced Child Exploitation and Abuse in Bedfordshire and Luton.

We have been effectively providing services for over 15 years based upon our philosophy of Choice, Challenge and Change.  This has resulted in Link to Change being known as one of the foremost specialist charities working across the boroughs.
description: Our mission is for a world where everyone can be free from Exploitation.

name: Durham Christian Partnership
missionStatement: Durham Christian Partnership supports Christian Communities in County Durham to work with each other and with other organisations. We support a variety of projects all of which respond to identified needs.  Our largest project being the County Durham foodbank.  These projects all aim to make a positive difference in the lives of people living in or visiting County Durham.

name: The Chelsea Fringe Ltd
missionStatement: The Chelsea Fringe is the alternative gardening festival, the Fringe to the world-renowned Chelsea Flower Show. We are an unfunded and volunteer-run initiative. Begun in 2012, the idea behind the Fringe was to encourage community gardening, art projects, street improvements and artistic engagement with landscape. In 2015 there were some 300 events in the Fringe worldwide. Our event is not only based in London but has spread to a number of other UK cities and countries, including Japan, Italy and Australia.
description: With no core funding, we are dependent on donations and our volunteers - please help us!

name: Young Melksham
missionStatement:
Young Melksham deliver services for children and young people up to 18 years old, or 25 for those with special education needs or disabilities (SEND).

The charity deliver positive youth activities to in excess of 200 different young people each week by running Youth Clubs targeted at different age groups, a free-to-access counselling service and holiday activities. We also offer peer leader opportunities for young people to help with clubs and have developed our own Introduction to Youth Work course.
description: Because good youth work works

name: Chiswick Rugby Football Club Limited
missionStatement: In 2018 Chiswick Rugby Club celebrates its 60th anniversary; this coincides with an exciting period of development as the club partners with the RFU who are investing 1.5million pounds for a new artificial grass pitch and floodlights at Chiswick RFC. It will be available for use round the clock for all sports teams, schools and community groups. In return for this incredible RFU investment, we're committing to extend and improve our clubhouse to provide better and bigger sporting and community facilities.
description: To support Chiswick Rugby Club build for the next 60 years

name: North Tyneside Art Studio
missionStatement:
NTAS aims to improve the lives of adults in North Tyneside who have mental health issues, by engaging them in a range of creative activities. 
We worked with approx 200+ individuals (our members) in 2018, with referral rates increasing year on year. People benefit from the social aspects of joining us, combating isolation and improving confidence etc, they learn new skills, and our activities can have therapeutic effect. "if it wasn't for NTAS, I wouldn't be here" (NTAS member, 2018)
description: Help us to improve the lives of adults with mental health issues.

name: Mid Deeside Community First Responders
missionStatement:
We provide emergency life-saving support using CPR, defibrillation and oxygen administration, in the vital early stages before an ambulance can be deployed or reach any casualty in our rural location.  We are based in the community and can often reach a casualty before an ambulance, which may have to come from as far as 40 miles away.  We operate in conjunction with the Scottish Ambulance Service, who give us our initial training and specify ongoing regular refresher training.

Reg. Charity: SC037411
description: Fundraising is needed for training and equipment costs.

name: Chrysalis Centre for Change
missionStatement: We support, empower and inspire adult women struggling with the impacts of mental health problems and domestic abuse, by offering a wide range of supportive services. We help women not only to survive and cope with pain and trauma, but to go on to thrive and reach their full potential. We help mums, sisters, grandmas, daughters, grand-daughters friends, aunties. Improving the lives of women offers benefits far beyond the individual. It enriches the lives of their friends, families and the local community.
description: Mental Health Matters! Donate now to help us help you or someone you care about!

name: OHOB Ltd (Open Hearts Open Borders)
missionStatement: OHOB is a charitable company based in the South West of England. OHOB provides humanitarian aid relief for refugees and asylum seekers in Europe and poverty relief in the UK through the provision of essential items or payments for goods and services to those who through circumstance, socio-economic status, conflict or homelessness find themselves in need. We also support the resettlement of refugees by providing essential and household items so they feel welcome and can begin rebuilding their lives.
description: Help us to provide essential and basic aid relief to those who have been disadvantaged

name: Scottish Mask and Puppet Centre
missionStatement:
Scottish Mask & Puppet Centre (The Garret Mask & Puppet Centre Trust Ltd) was founded in July 1985 by Malcolm Knight. It is a combination of theatre, museum and education instritute. It was created to promote mask and puppet theatre as an art-form in its own right as well as an intersection point for all the arts. T: 00 44 141 339 6185. E: info@maskandpuppet.co.uk. 
W: www.maskandpuppet.co.uk
Charity registered in Scotland No. SCO 14379
Company Ltd by Guarantee No. 94166
description: To educate, inform and entertain while sustaining our building development and its legacy.

name: The Sir Stanley Spencer Memorial Trust
missionStatement: The Trust is responsible for maintaining and managing an independent gallery devoted to the work of one of Britain's most original 20th century artists, Sir Stanley Spencer RA (1891-1959). The Gallery is run entirely by volunteers and is a Fully Accredited Museum under the scheme administered by Arts Council England. We arrange for regular visits by schools, academies and other groups and arrange visits for those with access needs. We hold extensive archives which are available for research purposes.
description: Volunteer run Gallery promoting the work of Sir Stanley Spencer RA

name: Polly for Women CIO
missionStatement:
Covid has highlighted the immense pressures that women face: more likely to look after homeschooling, be carers and at risk of redundancy. Anxiety and self-harm rates for young women are on the rise. Now, more than ever, women deserve dedicated support.

Polly will be the UK's first helpline & webchat supporting girls, women & self-identifying females aged 13+. We'll offer a free and confidential space to talk, unburden and find information. 

With your help we can support all women & girls.
description: Help us launch Polly: the UK's first dedicated women & girls' helpline and webchat!

name: St Francis Leprosy Guild
missionStatement: St Francis Leprosy Guild is a UK based charity that works to end leprosy across the world.  Leprosy continues to be prevalent in 160 countries and it is thought that 4m people may have undiagnosed leprosy.  We conduct research to interrupt transmission, send medics into remote areas for screening programmes, take care of those undergoing treatment and rehabilitate them into the community.  We've been operating for 125 years.  The end of leprosy is tantalisingly close.  Please join us in ending leprosy.
description: Help us end leprosy for good.

name: BIG BRUM (THEATRE IN EDUCATION) COMPANY LIMITED
missionStatement: Big Brum seeks to provide the highest quality Theatre in Education programmes for young people across all age ranges and abilities. The company uses theatre and drama alongside young people to help them make meaning of their lives and the world around them. The work has a strong theoretical basis, focusing artistically on the power of theatre images and dramatic action to create resonances and challenge new ways of thinking; whilst being educationally grounded in active learning and problem solving.
description: Big Brum seeks to provide the highest quality Theatre in Education Programmes.

name: FEAST WITH US
missionStatement: FEAST With Us eases food poverty by providing regular nutritious meals to homeless and vulnerable people, using food surplus, and through the provision of nutrition education and cooking skills. After lockdown we will return to providing community meals where volunteers and meal recipients cook and eat together in a social setting. Thousands of kgs of fresh food are saved from landfill each year. All stakeholders involved from across the community unite to raise awareness of, and help ease food poverty.
description: FEAST delivers meals to homeless and vulnerable people suffering food  poverty

name: Societi
missionStatement: Societi was established in 2015 as an organisation to raise awareness of Kawasaki Disease the #1 cause of acquired heart disease in UK children. Too few people today know Kawasaki Disease yet it's as serious as and more common than some types of meningitis. Progress in understanding Kawasaki Disease has been severely hampered by poor levels of awareness, a lack of investment and a lack of essential research. We raise awareness so EVERYONE in the UK is able to recognise Kawasaki Disease. Will you help?
description: Please stop #1 cause of acquired heart disease in UK children. Help protect tiny hearts!

name: Tees River Rescue
missionStatement: A charity aiming to preserve and protect life in and around the River Tees by deploying a river rescue craft with a fully trained crew at the request of emergency services and by providing routine river safety patrols.
description: Help us make the River Tees safe for everyone

name: Clean Slate Trust
missionStatement: Clean Slate is committed to working with Ex-offenders on a holistic level, to rehabilitate, empower, equip and release transformed men and woman back into society, living crime-free lives and contribute positively to society.
description: Supporting us in equipping ex-offenders with the skills for a smooth transition.

name: Steelers Wheelchair Basketball Team
missionStatement:
The Sheffield Steelers Wheelchair Basketball Club is a registered charity founded in 1987 by a handful of ex-patients from the Spinal Injuries Unit at Lodgemoor, a division of the NHS Sheffield Teaching Hospital Trust. They are an inclusive club with players of all abilities, from amateur through to world-class.

The Club trains at their multi-sport training venue in the Spinal Injuries Unit at Northern General Hospital.
description: Please help us fund raise to enable people with a disability access sport

name: CHIPS (Christian International Peace Service)
missionStatement:
CHIPS are Christian peacemakers.

We join with communities to help build sustainable futures free from violence and division.
description: As a UK charity our passion for peace is endless, Please join us.

name: Great Aycliffe Cancer Support Group
missionStatement:
We are a friendly support group that helps anyone affected by cancer around the North East. We provide many services  including representing patients and carers views. 
We provide Free Patient Transport to help patients get to hospital for life saving treatment.
We have regular social activities such as Day trips, Meals out, Social Events 
We make Chemo Bags and fill them with Goodies.
We provide Financial Advice and Support.
We provide Respite breaks in our Holiday Home
We provide emotional support
description: We help and support anyone affected by Cancer across the North East.

name: MIKE PROCTER FOUNDATION UK
missionStatement:
The Mike Procter Foundation enhances the wellbeing and life chances of disadvantaged children at the Ottawa School in a township on the edge of Durban, South Africa.

The charity, founded by the inspirational former international cricketer Mike Procter, provides sports coaching and food to the children at the school.  

Many of the kids have lost one or more parent to AIDS.

The charity employs former pupils from the school as assistant coaches, providing them and their families with an income.
description: Enhancing the lives of South Africa's most vulnerable citizens through sport.

name: Rotary Club of Storrington Charity Trust Fund
missionStatement:
Storrington and Pulborough Rotary Club raises funds to support both local and international initiatives.  Money raised by the eBay shop will help us to continue to run events for the elderly and those in isolation. We also help local youngsters with personal development opportunities and we provide support for individuals, families and groups through  specific projects.

Our eBay shop is run by volunteers and we aim to post items out twice a week on Tuesdays and Saturdays so please pay promptly, thanks!

name: Cowfold Community Pool
description: To provide access for every member of the community to swimming and waterbased activites.

name: Steyning Downland Scheme
missionStatement: We manage 165 acres (66 ha) of the Wiston Estate, on the South Downs National Park, near Steyning, West Sussex. A registered charity since 2009, we reconnect local people from all walks of life to our unique piece of species-rich downland, benefiting their mind, body and spirit. We create inspiring opportunities for new people to join the community through active volunteering, engaging events and inclusive access, so improving this special place for wildlife and for present and future generations to enjoy.
description: Help us to conserve biodiversity and build the local community

name: Kintyre Foodbank
missionStatement: Kintyre Food Bank, serving Campbeltown and the local area, runs a referral scheme whereby anyone facing food poverty can receive food parcels.
description: Help hungry families throughout Kintyre

name: North Tyneside Disability Forum
missionStatement:
NTDF aims to ensure disabled people are able to participate on equal terms in society as able decision makers with choice and control over their own lives in order that they have full citizenship and access.
We help people to:
Have fun and build skills 
Gain confidence and competence 
Realise their potential 
Recognise their aspirations 
Be in a good place to best advise service provision and future planning and policy making
description: All monies raised goes directly back to supporting disabled people's activities

name: The Outer Hebrides Fisheries Trust
missionStatement: The Outer Hebrides Fisheries Trust (OHFT) was formed as the Western Isles Fisheries Trust (WIFT) in 1996. The Trust is a charitable, community based organisation conducting scientific research into wild fish stocks and advising on freshwater fisheries management.
description: Help enable community advice on wild fisheries, whilst protecting & enhancing fish stocks.

name: Higham Hill Muslim Community Trust
missionStatement: Higham Hill Muslim Community Trust is serving the local community since 2014. The Trust is holding Maktab which (Teaches Quran and Islamic studies), Taraweeh Salah and Eid Salah every year in Walthamstow Academy. As you are well aware such a facility is much needed in our Higham Hill area.
description: Help Covid19 Victims

name: Home-Start Watford & Three Rivers
missionStatement: Home-Start is a voluntary organisation which is committed to promoting the welfare of families with at least one child under five years of age. Volunteers offer regular support, friendship and practical help to families under stress, in their own homes, helping to prevent family crisis and breakdown.
description: Support Home-Start Watford & Three Rivers reach more vulnerable families!

name: Positive East
missionStatement: Positive East has been on the forefront of HIV service and support for over 25 years; supporting people from point of diagnoses to longer term care. Guided by our mission to improve the quality of life of individuals and communities affected by HIV we have developed a holistic range of health and wellbeing services from HIV testing and counselling to complimentary therapies and workshops that improve self esteem, confidence and health.
description: Annually, we support over 4,000 people living with HIV in east London

name: Hear Us
missionStatement: Hear Us is entirely service user led with all of our trustees, staff and volunteers having lived experience of mental health issues. We have been in existence since 2001 originally as a social enterprise and became a charity in 2009. We provide peer support services to people with severe and enduring mental health conditions, primarily through our welfare benefit surgeries and linkworking projects
description: Donating to Hear Us helps us provide peer support to the most vulnerable people in our sos

name: HORWICH SPIRITUALIST CHURCH
missionStatement:
A community focused hub for almost 100 years, Horwich NSC is a registered charity relying on your support.  We are 100% self-funded so every penny really does count towards keeping the doors open!

Everyone is welcome to our services and events, whatever faith & beliefs.  Our offerings include charitable & well-being events as well as services based around spiritualism and it's principles.
description: Support us and help keep the doors open so that we can continue to serve & the community!

name: Bournemouth and District Cancer Foundation
missionStatement:
We raise money through a charity shop in the centre of Boscombe in Bournemouth.

Proceeds from the shop are donated to local charities and organisations involved in cancer research and cancer care in the Bournemouth and surrounding areas.
description: Working with the local community to fight cancer

name: Soldiers League
missionStatement: Soldiers League is a charity which supports mentally and physically injured soldiers and veterans.  Using Rugby League as a vehicle to help in their recovery.
description: Help injured soldiers get back involved in Rugby League

name: St Mark's Hospital Foundation
missionStatement: St Mark's Hospital Foundation helps to fund innovative research that is undertaken at St Mark's Hospital, a specialist in the treatment of bowel disease.
description: Future free from the fear of bowel disease

name: Diverse Cymru
missionStatement: Diverse Cymru is a unique Welsh charity committed to supporting people faced with inequality and discrimination because of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage and civil partnership, pregnancy and maternity, race, religion or belief, sex and sexual orientation.
description: Your donation will help us challenge discrimination and promote equality and diversity.

name: Brighton Yoga Foundation
missionStatement: Brighton Yoga Foundation brings yoga to those who need it most by providing free to access classes for: women recovering from abuse and trauma, those with mental health issues, youngsters in school, people referred by the NHS and many others. These classes bring dramatic benefits for those who attend. We are a registered charity with no full-time staff but lots of volunteers. And we organise the annual Brighton Yoga and Well-Being Festival - the 2nd largest such gathering in the UK, attracting 3000 people.
description: Your money will all go towards helping our yoga community outreach programmes!

name: Internet Watch Foundation
missionStatement:
We help victims of child sexual abuse worldwide by identifying and removing online images and videos of their abuse. Our goal is an internet free of child sexual abuse imagery.

We offer a place for the public to anonymously report suspected criminal imagery, which our team of analysts then assess. If criminal, we take steps to remove the content from the internet. 

We are one of the only non-law-enforcement organisations worldwide allowed to pro-actively search the internet for content to remove.
description: Help fund us so we can remove child sexual abuse material from the internet, for good.

name: HPAK-PTA
missionStatement: The purpose of the PTA is not just to raise money but, more importantly, to contribute towards our school being an exciting, fun and enjoyable place for pupils to be and for parents to be involved with. Our main objective is to support our school and to make our children's time there just that little bit more special. We aim to raise money for extra facilities, provide our pupils with little treats throughout the academic year and promote a feeling of community amongst pupils, staff and parents.
description: Help make our school an exciting and enjoyable place for our pupils, staff and parents.

name: Mansfield and Sutton Astronomical Society
missionStatement:
MSAS wants to capture imaginations, spark curiosity & debate, and enthuse audiences with the wonders of space by creating a Science & Discovery Centre.

Using a half-submerged Victorian reservoir, this will be a place where stargazers can understand the vastness of the universe, not simply see the stars as bright spots; a laboratory for future space explorers, where learning about STEM is fun and building the pipeline of talent in the local area; and a magnet for attracting tourists and locals alike.
description: We'd love to expand our facilities through development of a visitor centre and planetarium

name: Plaza Community Cinema
missionStatement: The Plaza is a registered Charity and community cinema run predominantly by volunteers. It shows a diverse program of film and is a totally inclusive space for all. The Plaza has an arts and education department and has partnerships with local schools, the Youth Service and other local community groups. We have a 1939 Art Deco building and all the proceeds go towards the refurbishment and upkeep of the cinema building. We aim to keep prices low for the whole community to enjoy.
description: The Plaza is a grass roots community project facing financial difficulties during COVID 19

name: Royal Caledonian Charities Trust
missionStatement: The Royal Caledonian Charities Trust supports Scottish causes in the following areas: the elderly, children, those with disabilities, the military, the injured and the homeless. It is estimated that over 3 million pounds has been given to worthy Scottish causes since the Caledonian Ball's inception in 1822. We aim to give where it will make the greatest difference: our grants fund projects and initiatives across Scotland, from the Borders to the Highlands and Islands.
description: Please help us continue a centuries long legacy of helping Scottish people in need.

name: The Harvey Hext Trust
missionStatement:
Supporting children across the UK who have lost a sibling by providing them with bespoke, personalised, wooden memory boxes and memory bears. The Memory boxes are designed by the bereaved child and are a useful tool for bereavement professionals to encourage children to show emotions and talk about their bereavement.
The Memory boxes are treasured by all who receive them and the quality enables them to go with the children into adulthood.
#preservingpreciousmemories
description: Supplying children who have lost a sibling with bespoke, quality Memory boxes and bears

name: Sam Beare Hospice
missionStatement: Woking & Sam Beare Hospices is a charity that cares for over 2,000 patients and their carers and families each year. We specialise in delivering holistic care for patients with progressive advanced conditions that are life limiting. The hospice's care is delivered in the community in patients homes, in care or nursing homes or through its in-patient ward in the hospice, as well as through the Bradbury Wellbeing Centre, which offer day care service to all it's patients and carers.
description: To give end of life care to those with life limiting illnesses.

name: Africa Educational Trust
missionStatement:
Africa Educational Trust is an internationally recognised expert in the field of education.  We bring education solutions to the most severely disadvantaged in fragile, conflicted and post-conflict regions of Africa.
 
We believe that providing education, giving people hope and the means to take charge of their lives brings understanding and change.   We have seen that by challenging the local norms which may be detrimental to sections of society - a new level of peace  can be built by the communities.
description: Give the gift of education to those who desperately want to learn.

name: Nottingham Multiple Sclerosis Therapy Centre Ltd
missionStatement: Since 1984, our centre has provided hyperbaric oxygen therapy to members with multiple sclerosis. A few years ago we decided to expand our membership and now include anyone with a chronic health condition that can benefit from HBOT. We are the only facility in Notts and Derbys to provide this service without prescription. We're entirely self-funded and rely on donations to keep our happy and supportive centre running smoothly.
description: Help us provide this much needed service to our members!

name: Wakefield and District Down's Syndrome Support Group
missionStatement: Our charity is run by volunteer parents and carers. Our aim is to provide a support network, information and fun activities for people with Down's syndrome and their families, creating opportunities for friendships to develop and to build parent-to-parent support. We raise awareness and promote social inclusion in a wide variety of ways and provide training and information for people who work with people with Down's syndrome.
description: Supporting people with Down's syndrome. See the person, not the syndrome.

name: Who is Hussain
missionStatement:
Who is Hussain has rapidly grown into a global movement with representatives in over 60 cities around the world. We empower communities around the world to organise charitable events for the common good.
We aim to inspire individuals through the timeless example of Hussain ibn Ali, and the values he stood for; those of justice and dignity. Our reps and volunteers organise events to give back to their local communities, ranging from blood donation drives to feeding the homeless and much more.
description: We empower communities to give back and act for the common good of society

name: BASICS North West
missionStatement: We are a team of clinicians who assist the ambulance service in providing life-saving critical interventions to those most in need, across the North West.
description: We need funds to continue our life-saving work!

name: The Centre for Vision in the Developing World Charitable Foundation
missionStatement: More than two billion people do not have the glasses they need to see clearly - including 100 million schoolchildren in developing countries. The problem is too few eye care professionals to serve the population in need. Adaptive spectacles are a scalable, sustainable solution based on Joshua Silver's pioneering work on self-refraction: glasses with lenses that change shape so that the wearer can adjust the power of each lens until he or she can see clearly, without the need for trained professionals.
description: Help schoolchildren see the blackboard clearly and get the most from their education!

name: Love146 (UK)
missionStatement: Love146 is an international human rights organisation working to end child trafficking and exploitation through survivor care and prevention. The trafficking and exploitation of children is one of the darkest stories and most severe human rights abuses imaginable. But for us, the hope of ending it is a reality. Love146 is helping grow the movement to end child trafficking while providing effective, thoughtful solutions.
description: Your donation supports our work in the UK with children who are trafficked & exploited

name: Bristol Pride
missionStatement:
Pride is a positive stance against discrimination and violence toward lesbian, gay, bisexual, and transgender (LGBT+) people to promote their self-affirmation, dignity, equality rights, increase their visibility as a social group, build community, and celebrate sexual diversity and gender variance. 

Bristol Pride work all year round to challenge homophobia, biphobia, transphobia and promote equality and diversity, for all, through various events, school visits, consultation services and lobbying.
description: Help make Pride happen

name: Savayra Foundation uk
missionStatement:
Savayra Foundation Uk is a Uk registered women's education social development & empowerment charity working in Pakistan & Azad Kashmir.

The charity aims to empower widows, orphan girls & other financially destitute women through skills, education & other poverty relief programmes.

Established in 2002 Savayra Foundation Uk has been supporting lasting economic and social development in deprived areas of Pakistan & Azad Kashmir.
We are a nonprofit organisation run by volunteer trustees on 0 salaries.
description: Kindly help to empower less fortunate women to gain self-reliance skills & education.

name: Adventure Therapy
missionStatement:
Adventure Therapy exists to improve the emotional and physical wellbeing of children and adults with unique health conditions, impairments or limitations, through outdoor and adventure-led activities.

The power of spending time outdoors in nature and adventure should not be under-estimated. Our activities improve vitality, aid rehabilitation, provide a sense of accomplishment - and are fun! We help people to gain a new perspective, whilst creating special memories for families.

name: The Border Collie Spot
missionStatement: The Border Collie Spot is run by Gill in Binfield, Berkshire. She has been rescuing border collies and occasionally other breeds of dogs for over 8 years, it has always been her dream to rescue unwanted farm dogs and this dream was realised when she had built her network connections to reach right across the UK. Gill has rescued 100's of dogs from appalling conditions and endeavours to find all dogs a happy loving new home. The expenses for this charity come straight from Gill's pension pocket.
description: ......loving the unloved, homing the homeless dogs

name: THE PAROCHIAL CHURCH COUNCIL OF THE ECCLESIASTICAL PARISH OF HOLY TRINITY, PRESTWOOD
missionStatement:
We are the parish church serving Prestwood and Great Kingshill in the Chiltern Hills. We come to church every Sunday at 9.30am.
Here we are invited to celebrate God's love for all people, rest in his presence and go out empowered to live our everyday lives.
In our worship we remove the barriers that separate us from God's love and build up the ties that bind us as a loving community.
We also like to enjoy ourselves, and there's lots going on!
We welcome you to come and join us.
description: To make Gods love  known and real to the people of Prestwood and Great Kingshill.

name: Search Dogs Buckinghamshire
missionStatement:
Our volunteer Search and Rescue Dog Teams help the police look for and safely recover missing vulnerable adults and children. As a charity we are totally reliant on public donations to enable us quickly get boots and paws on the ground when and where they are most needed. 

We are on call 24/7, 365 days per year and our members are trained and equipped to national standards. Throughout the COVID-19 crisis we have remained on standby ready to assist the police .

We are ever grateful for your support.
description: Search & Rescue dog team assisting the police in searching for vulnerable missing people.

name: East Anglian Mixed Martial Arts Academy
missionStatement: The East Anglian Mixed Martial Arts Academy, is a local registered charity that provides combat training and indoor archery to the community. We believe in giving people a chance to experience sport, that many can not afford or get to. We have over 50 years professional experience in the Martial Arts and in the art of competitive archery. Everything we do is for the good of our community
description: Keeping it local

name: An Hour For Others
missionStatement:
Our services bring together kind hearted people and businesses by offering their time, skills, resources, donations and expertise to help tackle many problems society finds itself facing today. Poverty, poor physical and mental health, poor living conditions, child obesity, community breakdowns and divisions, isolation and addictions all have a devastating effect on people and society as a whole. 

Our groups help build, communities empowering and inspiring people to spread kindness.
description: Charity founded by ordinary people wanting to build communities for our children.

name: The Healing Tree
missionStatement: The Healing Tree Centre Foundation, based in Cornwall, UK, was formed in March 2015. Our purpose is to develop the Healing Tree Centre so as to educate about shamanism, health, healing and well-being and shamanic wisdom and ancient earth wisdom along with environmental education and conservation of the immediate natural habitat and living in a sustainable way.
description: Help develop the Healing Tree Centre to educate about shamanism and healing

name: Robert Windle's Foundation
missionStatement: The Robert Windle Foundation is a registered charity, No. 529471 whose role is to provide s help with education to the youth of Thornton-in Craven which includes Thornton, Earby, Kelbrook and Harden. The foundation has been in existence since 1599. The Foundation also has to cover the running and upkeep of The Old Grammar School in Earby.

name: The Gaia Foundation
missionStatement: The Gaia Foundation has over 30 years experience accompanying partners to revive bio-cultural diversity, regenerate healthy ecosystems and strengthen community self-governance for climate change resilience. By reviving indigenous knowledge and protecting sacred natural sites, local self-governance is strengthened. Through a holistic approach to addressing the root causes of our converging crises, we seek to restore a respectful relationship with the Earth - our one source of life - and with one another.
description: Addressing the root causes of today's most pressing social & ecological injustices.

name: Yogi Divine Society (UK)
missionStatement:
Yogi Divine Society is a trusted hindu spiritual and humanitarian charity organisation. With its vast network of centers and volunteers world-wide, the organisation has enabled hundreds of thousands of children, youth and families to lead a happy, peaceful and harmonious life.  Motivated by our faith in Lord Swaminarayan, Yogi Divine Society serves the global community alongside all people, regardless of religion, race, ethnicity, or gender.

Founded by His Divine Holiness Guru Hariprasad Swamiji.
description: Support us

name: Kerala Caring Hands
missionStatement:
We aim to provide education and
food to the poorer, in India.
description: Yet there is plenty of food in the world for everyone. But hungry people a

name: Walser's Tanzania Charity
missionStatement: Walser's Tanzania Charity has been providing support to the rural community of Ifunda in Tanzania for over 20 years. We operate an educational sponsorship scheme for almost 300 students, we support the local schools and Vocational Training Centre and assist with funding for local projects. We are a family run charity with no paid staff & minimal costs, all donations go directly to benefit the community we support and we genuinely make a difference to peoples lives
description: Make a difference by donating to charity where you every penny helps to improve lives!

name: Dream Big Ghana Foundation
missionStatement: Dream Big Ghana Foundation delivers sustainable change in the Volta Region of Ghana.  We support community programmes related to sanitation, health, education, sports, reforestation, marine conservation, arts, music, job creation and renewable energy.  We partner with Dream Big Ghana NGO, Denyigba Lorlor NGO, Dzita Turtle Protection, Dream Renewables and Wornana.
description: We are a small charity with tiny admin costs. See how far your donation goes!

name: Sheep Music Ltd
missionStatement: We are an Arts and Music based charity who's aim is to bring a diverse range of entertainment to te border area of Powys, Herefordhire and Shrophire. We normally put on 3 events per year, one music event over a weekend, one Arts and Crafts based event and an annual Firework display which also involves music.
description: Support the building of a Community Barn for use by all Community Groups and schools

name: Wind-Up Penguin Theatre Company
missionStatement: The Wind-Up Penguins are a group of talented performers who share professional-standard music theatre performances and workshops with vulnerable children in isolated communities around the world (refugee centers, orphanages, slums etc).
description: Help us bring back a spark of childhood to vulnerable children through music and theatre.

name: Aid4orphans
missionStatement: Supporting abandoned and needy children in kenya. Working with Schools and a Children's Centre
description: Change the life of a child by providing education from primary School to College level.

name: Comunison RC
missionStatement:
Comunison RC (est.2006) is a human rights organisation promoting ecological and corporate responsibility, adult education and peace building.
For organisations we offer seminars, strategies and solutions. For individuals we offer advice, training and education, including accredited immigration advice (in the UK).  Our mission is envisioning and making possible a world with no war, no oppression, no poverty and no avoidable suffering.
description: Make possible a world with no war, no oppression, no poverty and no avoidable suffering!

name: THE PAROCHIAL CHURCH COUNCIL OF THE ECCLESIASTICAL PARISH OF ST. MARY THE VIRGIN, FELPHAM
missionStatement:
The primary objective of St Mary's PCC is the promotion of the Gospel of our Lord Jesus Christ according to the doctrinal and practices of the Church of England. 

The PCC has the responsibility of co-operating with the Incumbent, in promotion in the parish, the whole mission of the Church. pastoral, evangelical, social and ecumenical.
description: St Marys maintains a Grade 2 listed building solely by voluntary donations and your help.

name: The Springboard Charity
missionStatement: Springboard helps to reduce unemployment and poverty across the UK, enabling people of all ages and backgrounds, and especially those who experience barriers to employment, achieve their career potential in hospitality, leisure and tourism.
description: Please donate now to enable our vital services to continue and to make a difference

name: Hilltop Farm Animal Sanctuary
missionStatement: Hilltop Farm Animal Sanctuary is a non-profit charity organisation and a safe haven for unwanted animals. We pride ourselves with the experience and love that these animals need to be properly taken care of and we could always do with a hand around the farm!
description: to help give these unwanted, mistreated and abandoned animals a chance of life tgey deserv

name: St Keverne Preschool
missionStatement: We provide a wonderful setting for 2,3&4 year olds, giving them the opportunity to explore and learn through play, building character and friendships
description: please help us maintain our rural village preschool, its a vital asset to our community

name: Deenway Foundation
missionStatement: We educate hands, heads and hearts to help build a better world today. Supporting Montessori education in general and the work of the Deenway Montessori School in particular.
description: All children deserve the best start to life and that includes a world class education.

name: Friends of Knights Templar School
missionStatement: Knights Templar School often needs funding beyond that which the government provides. Friends of KTS is a charity run by volunteers to support our co-ed state secondary school that is at the heart of this North Hertfordshire community. The dedicated group of parents and carers fundraising has so far contributed in many and varied ways from ping pong tables to a grand piano, art & design and drama equipment and rain cover and an amphitheatre for outside areas.
description: Help support all of our secondary pupils. Current target a health and well being garden.

name: computers for the disabled
missionStatement: We are are uk registered charity for disabled & the senior citizens & disabled people of all ages
description: We help disabled & old people get a Laptop, iphone or ipad etc who are struggling

name: The Island Trust Limited
missionStatement:
For almost 50 years The Island Trust has been helping disabled and disadvantaged young people to develop self-confidence and improve their communication and life skills through the challenge of learning to sail.
We work with individuals, schools, youth groups and community organisations, locally and nationally.
Based in Plymouth, we have a small fleet of traditionally rigged sailing boats, Moosk, Pegasus and Johanna Lucretia; each has her own distinctive style and character all perfect for Sail Training.
description: We run sailing activities for young people to raise motivation and widen horizons

name: Addison's Disease Self Help Group (ADSHG)
missionStatement: We support people affected by Addison's Disease, a rare endocrine disorder where the adrenal glands do not produce enough steroid hormones. The condition affects almost 10,000 people in the UK and ROI. The ADSHG was founded in 1984 to support anyone affected by Adrenal Insufficiency.
description: Improve the quality of life of people with Adrenal Insufficiency now!

name: Nottinghamshire Blood Bikes
missionStatement: We are a UK Registered Charity run entirely by unpaid volunteers. Our aim is to provide an out of hours, emergency transport service to the NHS, delivering blood and other urgent medical items between hospitals in and around Nottinghamshire. NBB also support the provision of donor breast milk. We collect supplies from the Milk Bank in Chester and deliver them back to hospitals. If you like to know more about our charity, to donate or to volunteer, then please visit our website nottsbb.org
description: Providing an emergency out-of-hours delivery service for the NHS in Nottinghamshire

name: Manchester City FC City in the Community Foundation
missionStatement: City in the Community is Manchester City's dedicated charity, delivering inclusive and accessible programmes for local people across Greater Manchester by using football as a tool to empower better lives.
description: Your donation will help us to support the mental health and well-being of young people

name: Thamesdown Islamic Association
missionStatement: Thamesdown Islamic Association runs and manages a mosque in Swindon, Witshire
description: Help us serve our community

name: BURNAGE FOODBANK
missionStatement: We run a foodbank in South Manchester helping people in need
description: We need all the help we can get to feed people

name: LGBT Charity Uk
missionStatement: Our charity was designed to help people who are coming to terms with their sexuality and their families. Who are struggling to come to terms. We also help people that get evicted from their homes . We have a great support team we can help people. We also work with probable people to make sure that the right help is given to them e.g. if that means contacting social services the police or other Government agencies. We pride ourselves on giving excellent service
description: We pride ourselves on helping the local community and money stays within the borough

name: Community Action Fareham
missionStatement: Community Action Fareham supports thousands of people in Fareham with community services including Shopmobility, Home Help, Dial-a-Ride, Walking 4 Health, Gardening Service, Voluntary Car Service and Christmas Day Lunch so they can maintain their independence, the charity supports hundreds of small community groups and enables people to give their time through volunteering in the causes they are passionate about.
description: Everyone can help others to create welcoming, supportive communities in Fareham.

name: The Doncaster Little Theatre
missionStatement: Doncaster Little Theatre is a community theatre in the heart of Doncaster run by a family of friends who are passionate about putting on a shows. We are all volunteers who give our time to keeping the  theatre open for local and touring theatre companies as well as 12 of our own in house productions. We have theatre / films and live music on weekly.
description: Theatre for All!

name: Ruby's Fund
missionStatement: The purpose of Ruby's Fund is to run an inlusive sensory centre and social cafe for children and yound people with additional needs and disabilities, thier families, carers and friends. Providing a safe stimulating environment giving individuals and groups the chance to explore and develop in an inclusive setting which is also therapy, relaxation, education and most importantly frienship and fun.
description: Save our Centre- BOB Appeal

name: Hamble Hedgehogs Ltd
missionStatement: Welcome to Hamble Hedgehogs, a small Hedgehog Rescue & rehabilitation organisation covering Southampton and the surrounding area. As well as the rescue and rehabilitation of hedgehogs, we deliver education programmes for school and groups that is suitable for all age groups. As we rely entirely on public support, we appreciate every single donation no matter how small. Registered charity no: 1185442
description: Help save the Hedgehogs before they disappear forever!

name: Voices from the Nations
missionStatement:
Voices from the Nations Charity seeks to bring hope through music. Celebrating musical expression and partnering with musicians and artists to 
help transform the lives of the most vulnerable.

For example, in Tanzania, we have been partnering with the Wagogo people since 2003, recording and filming their songs and music on CD and DVD and 100% of sales from this project has funded village initiatives, restoring a well, building a medical dispensary with solar power and supplying medicines.
description: Together we can bring hope through music.

name: Blessing in Disguise
missionStatement: Blessing in Disguise Children's Charity aims to Improve the lives of children & young people with life limiting illnesses and disabilities. We actively encourage and support children, young adults to have the confidence to be independent and to recognise their ability not their disability, promoting social inclusion and building social skills.  We provide free of charge, a range of life enhancing equipment, activities and social/recreational opportunities for the whole family. We are a Blessing in Disguise
description: Improving the lives of children & young people with life limiting illnesses

name: We Are Family
missionStatement:
We Are Family CIO (WAF) is an adoption support community that operates in and around London. 
The focus of the charity is on the parent, through whom we seek to support adoptive families as a whole. Originally founded in the summer of 2013 by a small group of adoptive parents in Hackney and Islington, who wished to provide local, peer-to-peer support, WAF has grown to more than 10 groups and supporting c. 800 families.
description: Help us to help support adoptive parents throughout their adoption journey.

name: The Willow Tree Centre
missionStatement:
The Willow Tree Centre provides free, impartial help and support, for both women and men facing an unplanned pregnancy* or following a still birth, miscarriage, ectopic pregnancy, neonatal death or after an abortion. At the Centre clients can talk to a specially trained practitioner in confidence. 
NB*We do not refer directly for termination. We offer information on all the options and can provide both immediate and long term support as necessary, directing to other agencies as appropriate.
description: Free specialist help and support. We do not ask clients for donations.

name: Mencap in Kirklees
missionStatement: Mencap in Kirklees supports adults with learning disabilities, their families and carers.  The charity run a range of services; residential care, day services, evening clubs, employment training and community support.  We rely on the support of our local community to ensure we make a difference every day.
description: We make a difference.  Can you too? Your support today would mean the world to us.

name: THE MATCHGIRLS MEMORIAL
missionStatement:
The Matchgirls Memorial aims to raise awareness of the Matchgirls Strike of 1888 in Bow, East London, through education, presentation, poetry, music, art, plays, musicals and film. We also aim to ensure the names of the Matchgirls Strike and Union Committees are recognised.
Ultimately, we aim to secure lasting memorials to honour all of the Matchgirls and their contribution to the foundations of labour history, including a statue, murals, reliefs, street naming, education literature and heritage trails.
description: Help us to secure a memorial to honour the Matchgirls and their victorious Strike in 1888

name: SEED Malawi
missionStatement: SEED Malawi is a UK registered charity that works with communities in rural Malawi to safeguard and enhance education. Our aims are to improve standards of education in rural areas, to improve the safeguarding and welfare of vulnerable children and to increase attendance and completion of school. We provide resources for our partner schools, ranging from free school meals to the building of classroom blocks. We also sponsor our partner schools' most vulnerable children through our Education Plus Packages.
description: Your support aids children in Malawi to be safe & have access to a high-quality education.

name: Church on the Street Ministries
missionStatement: Church on the Street Ministries is a Christian church and charity, and we put our faith into action through social welfare provision. We are passionate about our work and we aim to do even more. We care for many people in need - the homeless, the elderly, children and families, prisoners, people suffering addictions - anyone who needs us will receive care, compassion and support. Based in Burnley, we make a difference to many people in our communities who may feel excluded or face loneliness and isolation.
description: Your help can make a difference to relieve those who are in poverty, hardship or distress

name: FRIENDS FIGHTING CANCER LTD
missionStatement: Friends fighting cancer supports people affected by cancer in and around Portsmouth, Isle of Wight,  Southampton, and Bournemouth, by giving grants to help with the financial devastation a diagnosis can bring. We hope to be able to support other areas in the future. The grants can be used for paying household bills, appliances, travel costs and  even a break away. Our supporters mainly raise funds through sponsored events or by donating football shirts and boots to our charity shop in Cosham Hampshire.
description: Our aim is to help those who find the extra cost of a cancer diagnosis difficult.

name: Amita Buddha Centre
missionStatement:
"You must be the change you want to see in the world" - Ghandi

Following the universal laws of nature, we aim to help people through guided meditation; empowering individuals into understanding themselves, changing bad habits and conquering negativity. 

We offer drop-in classes, healing groups, Mindfulness courses, children's classes, happiness retreats, online classes and 1:1 counselling.  We want to guide individuals into more positive, happy, healthy mindsets and heal our fractured communities.
description: Be part of the solution, not part of the problem. Donate NOW and make a difference!

name: Rising stars theatre company
missionStatement: We are a drama group for young people with both physical and learning difficulties.
description: we run a drama group that helps young people develop social skills and perform on stage

name: The Linkage Community Trust Limited
missionStatement: Linkage is a registered charity that supports people with learning disabilities. We deliver high-quality specialist education, care, employment and support services to individuals , their carers and families to ensure they can achieve their aspirations.

name: Goodwood Community & Education Trust
missionStatement: Providing a place of worship and dialogue between Muslims and Britains diverse communities
