description: Please donate to complete the construction of the Masjid and Islam education centre

name: Sanderstead United Reformed Church
missionStatement: We are a church in the heart of Sanderstead serving the community in many ways, such as hiring our premises and supporting a floating shelter for the homeless. In all we do our aim is to communicate by word and example, the gospel message.
description: To continue our mission and outreach in the community in which we serve.

name: The Conroy Rendon Charitable Trust
missionStatement: UK based Christian charity working to advance education and help people escape poverty in the Philippines by providing training, tools, equipment and resources that will enable them to gain employment or start their own businesses to earn an improved standard of living. The underlying ethos of the charity is to provide aid that is sustainable and will enable and empower beneficiaries to work their own way out of poverty in a way that recognises the dignity of the recipients.
description: Help us break the cycle of poverty in the Philippines

name: Belfast And Lisburn Community Project
missionStatement:
Belfast And Lisburn Community Project is a nonpartisan organisation committed to preventing and ending homelessness in our community and to support family in need.
Our work ranges from providing safe shelter, accommodation, food and health services to helping people affected by homelessness receive the education, employment and social services they need.

name: Christian Vision for Men
missionStatement: Christian Vision for Men (CVM) is a registered charity operating throughout the United Kingdom and based in Chesterfield. Its mission statement is to "connect men to Jesus and the church to men". It works with over 2,000 churches, mainly by having its materials used by the churches men's groups to achieve its aims.
description: Stand with CVM & enable men across the UK to hear and respond to the Gospel.

name: Neruka's Soul Food Soup Kitchen
missionStatement:
Neruka's Soul Food Soup Kitchen caters to the homeless and other people the community in need of help and support. 
We are opened two days each week. On Wednesdays: 12pm to 2pm a hot meal is provided to anyone in the community (including the homeless). Food parcels are also provided for people who are in need. 
Every fortnight we do workshops around housing, job readiness, health awareness, benefits etc.
On Fridays 10am to 12pm food parcels are also provided for people who are in need.
description: Help us feed the hungry and fight poverty in Leeds (UK)

name: Bees Abroad
missionStatement: We are a UK-registered charity seeking to reduce poverty through beekeeping. Volunteer Project Managers assess and support beekeeping projects in developing countries world wide. They use their expertise, working in the local community group to develop a viable project which will become self-sustainable.
description: Training women and young people in beekeeping to create sustainable livelihoods.

name: Cheshire Search & Rescue
missionStatement: Cheshire Search & Rescue is a team of volunteers available 365 days a year to assist Cheshire Police in the search for missing vulnerable people. We receive no government funding so rely 100% on the donations of the public to carry out this valuable work!
description: Help us to help you when your need is greatest

name: Runham wildlife rescue
missionStatement: We are a wildlife rescue charity, our objectives are to give wildlife a second chance at life, to rehabilitate and release back into the wild. We also offer education training to children on biodiversity and the importance of wildlife in our ecosystem
description: By donating to us you are saving little lives

name: Shift.ms
missionStatement:
Shift.ms is the social network for people with multiple sclerosis. We exist because a diagnosis of MS is life changing. It strikes when you're in your prime.

Hearing from people like you helps you listen, adapt and take charge. MS doesn't mean giving up on your ambitions, just rethinking how to achieve them.
description: We support and empower people affected by MS to take control of their disease.

name: Equal People Performing Arts
missionStatement:
Equal People Performing Arts is a fully inclusive performing arts studio centre serving South East Essex. It has created a safe and dignified space where disabled and non-disabled children and adults can work together in all aspects of the performing arts.

Registered Charity 1116649
description: Support Equal People Performing Arts

name: Omnibus Society
missionStatement: The Omnibus Society, covers all aspects of the bus industry. Instead of focusing on one specialised area, we cover a wide range of subjects and give our members access to the realities of the bus industry. it is happening.  We provide education and study opportunities through our visits and extensive Library & Archive.
description: Help us to preserve the history of the bus industry

name: parrots in need.co.uk
missionStatement:
Parrots in Need is a Registered Charity  no 1159864
 we rescue unwanted mistreated and neglected Parrots throughout the UK and find them forever homes while keeping them under the charity supervision, during the summer months we attend shows around the midlands offering advice and instruction and pitfalls of owning  these wonderful animals
description: we rely on donations from the public to help cover vet bills  and toys, cages and so on

name: Friends of Fe y Alegria UK
missionStatement: Friends of Fe y Alegria UK raise funds for Fe y Alegria Venezuela, a charity that provides food and education to the children in Venezuela, especially to those living in the poorest areas in the country.
description: Helps us to provide food and education to the children in Venezuela

name: The Sacred Hearts Trust
missionStatement: The aim of the Sacred Hearts Trust/Holy Cross Bookshop is to promote the Roman Catholic Fatih anywhere in the world and in particular run the Holy Cross Catholic Bookshop as a spiritual centre in London.
description: For the Greatest Glory of God and the Immaculate!

name: Community Gift Exchange SCIO
missionStatement: We want to see people living in flourishing communities. That's why we want to help release people from the harmful effects of poverty and social isolation. We believe that getting a fairly paid long-term job helps but know that some people have barriers to being ready for and finding work they can do long-term. So we run a bike restoration workshop, furniture upcycling centre, charity shop and other development projects to enable volunteers to help release people with disadvantages into sustainable work.

name: Animal Rescue Morocco
missionStatement: We are a UK based charity which helps to ensure the work of animal rescue organisations and shelters in Morocco continue their amazing work. We hep to raise funds for them, signpost individuals and groups who wish to help and make sure that the good work that is being done can continue
description: We need funds to help save the lives of so many neglected and unwell animals in Morocco

name: Hands Up! Education in Action
missionStatement:
Hands Up! is a small charity providing education to vulnerable children in Nakuru, Kenya. We work with mainly street children (or those at risk) in a range of settings. These include slum schools, juvenile prisons, and street child rehab centres.
We are very transparent, and donations go towards supporting the children, we do not pay any UK or admin staff. 
We rely entirely on donations to continue, so please consider supporting a small, but successful, educational charity.
description: We rely entirely on donations... thank you for choosing us to support!

name: Rigul Trust
missionStatement: Support a school and health clinic in the remote region of Rigul, Tibet, China
description: Help the children and community in Rigul, Tibet, China by supporting the school and health

name: Chorley Youth Zone
missionStatement: Chorley Youth Zone, named by young people as 'Inspire', is a purpose-built facility for the borough's young people aged 8 to 19, and up to 25 for those with disabilities. Based on the Onside Youth Zones youth facility model, young people can have access for just 50p per visit. Inspire Youth Zone provides a fun and safe environment where young people can come and enjoy themselves and will enable young people to raise their aspirations and confidence to create a happier and healthier generation.
description: Change the lives of young people in the UK!

name: Little Things & Co.
missionStatement:
Little Things and Co. are a baby bereavement charity.  We support anyone affected by the loss of a baby, regardless of gestation, circumstance or time elapsed.
We provide emotional and practical support with literature, support groups, clothing, practical items for funerals, a dedicated memorial garden and more.
description: Help us to support those at the most tragic time of their lives, after the death of a baby

name: East Twickenham Neighbourhood Association
missionStatement: A vibrant and buzzing Community Centre in the heart of TW1. The Centre has different spaces to hire and provides activities for all ages and a place for local groups to meet and hold meetings. We also host several self-help groups such as AA, Al-Anon and CODA as well as proving small rooms for one to one counselling. The Real Junk Food Project run a pop up cafe which takes food waste from local supermarkets and turns it into lunch for the community.
description: Help us to raise funds for ETNA's Community Kitchen and provide Step-Free Access

name: Chroma Church
missionStatement: The Vineyard Storehouse provides practical support to people in need across the City of Leicester. We work with a number of agencies to provide good quality furniture, clothing, household items, toiletries and food to the most vulnerable in our city.
description: Help us to provide essential items to those most in need in Leicester.

name: Forever Stars Ltd.
missionStatement: Forever Stars support parents and families that suffer stillbirth baby loss bereavement in Nottingham and the East Midlands.  This includes bereavement suites at the Nottingham University Trust and a baby loss remembrance garden in Highfields Park as well as midwife support.
description: Support baby loss families in their darkest hour now by donating to Forever Stars

name: Dharam Seva Records
missionStatement: Dharam Seva Records. Dharam Seva Records is a non-profit music charity started in 2013. The label aims to preserve the ethics of Sikh history using music and videos whilst inspiring the younger generations to the messages of the Sikh faith.

name: Kidz Aware
missionStatement: Kidz Aware is not-for-profit charity/ social enterprise with 3 core values at our heart: Equality; Inspiring; Embracing. We exist to ensure that all children and adults with a disability have the opportunities to achieve their aspirations in life.
description: To provide disabled children with mental health and self harm access the right services

name: Church Action on Poverty
missionStatement: Church Action on Poverty is a national ecumenical Christian social justice charity, committed to tackling poverty in the UK. We work in partnership with churches and with people in poverty themselves to find solutions to poverty, locally, nationally and globally.
description: Help to close the gap between  rich and poor in the UK

name: Two Wheels for Life
missionStatement: Our vision is a world where healthcare reaches everyone, everywhere. Two Wheels For Life is strengthening health systems by addressing one of the most neglected, yet vital, aspects of health development in Africa; transport and logistics. The programmes we support in collaboration with our international partner Riders for Health mobilise front-line health workers to significantly reduce the spread of disease, reduce maternal and infant mortality and address other specific countrywide health goals.
description: Motorcycles save lives.

name: 2nd. Witham Boys' Brigade
missionStatement: We are a local co-ed youth group offering a variety of activities for all young people aged 5 upwards in the Witham and surrounding area. We also provide community activities during school term time and holidays, including football, sports, holiday clubs, cycling events and support f other projects in the town
description: Help support the activities of this well established youth group please !

name: Southampton Society for the Blind
missionStatement: We are a local independent charity established in 1899 providing services to blind and partially sighted people in the city of Southampton and surrounding areas.  Our overall aim is to enable independence and increase confidence, thus increasing well-being and allowing people to achieve their individual aspirations.   We provide this through delivery of services to people with sight loss.
description: Southampton Sight provides advice and guideance for the visually impaired

name: Project Wingman Foundation Ltd
missionStatement: Project Wingman is a group of Airline crew volunteers dedicated to serving our NHS staff during this COVID-19 crisis. We provide airport style first class lounges in NHS hospitals giving the frontline staff First Class treatment and a space to unwind, de-compress and destress before, during and after hospital shifts.
description: Project Wingman - Supporting the NHS. Help us do even more to help the NHS frontline staff

name: Headrockdog rescue (charity number 1170663)
missionStatement: Headrock Dogs Rescue UK was established as a UK charity in 2016. The charity exists to relieve the suffering of dogs in need of care and attention, and to promote humane behaviour towards them. The charity does this by supporting projects which provide appropriate care, protection, treatment and security for those dogs which are in need by reason of sickness, maltreatment, poor circumstances or ill usage, in particular but not exclusively in Thailand.
description: Any visitor to Thailand will be familiar with the countrys street dogs. Help us help them

name: Healing Paws Animal Rescue
missionStatement: Healing Paws Animal Rescue is small exclusive organisation helping the stray animals in Zakynthos. It is run by Sue Deeth who lives and works on the Island. Sadly there is no funding from any government sources in Zakynthos, and most cats and dogs lead a very short and miserable existence. Puppies and kittens are often found discarded in the rubbish simply abandoned, and many dogs suffer abuse by being chained and, in some cases, starved. Sue spends every moment of her spare time rescuing these poor souls
description: Saving the strays of the Greek Island of Zakynthos from death and starvation

name: Paintings in Hospitals
missionStatement:
Paintings in Hospitals is a national charity dedicated to using world-class art to inspire better health and wellbeing for patients and carers in the UK.

Studies show that art can help us stay well and aid our recovery from illness and injury.

We are committed to bringing great art to everyone through our artwork loans and art activities in all types of healthcare and social care. 

We currently over two million people every year. But with your help, we could do so much more!
description: Donate to bring art, colour and hope to patients and carers across the country.

name: FiLiA
missionStatement: FiLiA's mission is: To host a world-renowned annual conference, bringing together women from all around the globe to exchange ideas, share experiences, and network. To advance the education of the public in the subject of gender equality by showcasing activists, academics, artists, NGOs and their work.  To promote human rights, especially women's rights.  To promote women artists, feminist and activist art, and to give voice to minority and disadvantaged women through art.
description: Support vulnerable women and stand up for women's rights today

name: Leicestershire, Leicester and Rutland Headway
missionStatement: We provide the only specialist support for local brain injury survivors and their families living in Leicester, Leicestershire and Rutland. This includes sessions at our activity day centre, 1-1 support, outreach groups, counselling as well as advice and signposting. Our support is specifically tailored to each brain injury survivor who uses our services and we know that the majority benefit from being part of a community and the support network that Headway Leicester offers.
description: With your help we can continue to improve life after brain injury.

name: Afrikaya
missionStatement: All monies raised by Afrikaya are spent on the project in The Gambia. Afrikaya has bought land and built a nursery school in The Gambia. It maintains the school for 166 children aged 3 - 7, 72 of whom are sponsored by donors in the UK. It provides a hot meal each school day and primary medical care for every pupil. Afrikaya employs 14 Gambian staff. There is also a community centre and adult education centre on site. The school will become self-financing in the next few years.
description: Help end poverty through education.

name: Fairstead House School Trust Limited
missionStatement: Fairstead House School is a mainstream, independently funded junior school and nursery for boys & girls in Newmarket, Suffolk, England
description: Educating and enriching children in Newmarket and the surrounding villages.

name: The Phab Shop
missionStatement: The Phab Shop is a charity shop that runs like any other charity shop, but the main difference is that over 95% of our volunteers have varying degrees of additional needs. The shop was set up to support people with additional needs in a real work environment to reduce isolation, learn new skills in retail, promote social skills and boost confidence. All our volunteers need some level of support from a one-to-one basis to working independently with support on hand when needed.
description: Help people of all abilities to shine and show the world how amazing people are!

name: Albany Road Baptist Church
missionStatement: We are a Church dedicated to our local community, we identify social need and move to positively effect the issues faced by local people. From poverty to elderly isolation we are a cradle to grave service supplier.  We also work with some amazing partners here in the U.k and abroad, helping, supporting and inspiring others to do the same in their communities.
description: Help us to help others, by donating or buying, you will positively effect lives

name: Bibbys Farm Scout Camp Site
missionStatement: Bibbys Farm is a Scout Camp Site and Activity Centre that provides wonderful, life-changing opportunities for ALL young people in the glorious outdoors
description: Help us to provide more opportunities for more young people

name: Mercy 4 All Foundation
missionStatement: Donate Quran (DQ) is a non-profit organisation that provides FREE English only translation (including detailed appendices) of the Quran to non-Muslims worldwide.
description: Sadaqatul Jariyah is ongoing charity that will continue to benefit us after our death IA.

name: Cocoon Family Support
missionStatement: A London wide peer led perinatal mental health charity, supporting new and expectant parents with the transition to parenthood and managing mental health conditions.
description: Helping families find their wings

name: Sight for Surrey
missionStatement: We are an ambitious charity offering a lifetime of support for people who are blind or partially sighted, Deaf, deafblind and hard of hearing.
description: If you lost your sight or hearing who would be your lifeline?

name: Rainbow Parents Carers Forum
missionStatement: Rainbow PCF is a supoport group and independent voice for parents/ carers who have children who are SEND  in Nottingham and its surrounding areas.
description: Supporting and empowering families to be heard & achieve better outcomes

name: The British Asian Trust
missionStatement: The British Asian Trust exists to drive positive social change across South Asia by galvanising the support of the South Asian diaspora to address poverty and inequality across the region.  Founded by HRH The Prince of Wales and a group of visionary Asian business leaders, we have impacted the lives of over four million people. Our programmes focus on education, livelihoods, anti-trafficking and mental health.
description: The British Asian Trust exists to drive positive social change across South Asia

name: New Roots Ltd
missionStatement: New Roots provides direct access accommodation for vulnerable and homeless adults, we accommodate and support over 450 individuals each night and place over 1000 residents per year. Residents are not only given a roof over their heads, we provide care, training and support to reduce social exclusion empower and increase self esteem to identify opportunities to realise the skills necessary towards leading an independent fulfilled life
description: Help us accommodate those who need it most

name: Swansea Community Workshops
missionStatement: Swansea Community Workshops is a community where people can come together to socialise and share workshop resources. We invite people who are socially disadvantaged by factors like loneliness, unemployment, bereavement or disabling conditions, and who wish to pursue craft hobbies or to acquire skills from other members.
description: Donate to keep all in society healthy, talking and working together

name: COMPASS Advocacy Network Limited
missionStatement: CAN is a unique user-led charity working with young people and adults with learning disabilities, autism and ADHD based in Ballymoney, Northern Ireland.
description: Enhancing Lives and Creating Change for local people in the local community!

name: Remember My Baby
missionStatement: We provide remembrance photography for families that experience the loss of a baby - before, during or shortly after birth. Professional photos free of charge.
description: We help families create memories at the lowest points in their lives

name: Epilepsy Outlook
missionStatement: Epilepsy Outlook is a charity based in the Northeast of England and assists people with epilepsy and their families in the Hartlepool area.

name: Birmingham Christmas Shelter
missionStatement: At Birmingham Christmas Shelter we open our doors 24 hours a day during Christmas week and welcome up to 150 guests daily, providing hot meals and drinks, entertainment, services, emergency clothing and a safe and warm place to sleep. We aim to provide food, warmth, shelter and friendship to our guests, regardless of age, disability, gender reassignment, race, religion, belief, sex, or sexual orientation
description: To run the shelter it costs us about 25k. Without donations we simply cannot operate

name: The Kenward Trust
missionStatement: Kenward Trust is a charity which helps those affected by addiction, homelessness and crime. Since we opened our doors in 1968 we have helped over 10,000 people to transform their lives and create a new future away from their addictions. Our work spans from sessions in schools delivering early education and interventions, through to residential rehabilitation and providing support to those resettling back into the community.
description: Help us continue transforming lives of those affected by addiction, homelessness and crime

name: Broadlands Group Riding for the Disabled
missionStatement:
Set deep in the calming Hampshire countryside in Medstead near Alton, Broadlands enjoys a unique environment for disabled children and adults to experience the benefits of therapeutic riding.
Interacting with horses using equine assisted therapy can heighten our awareness and open us up to new possibilities for personal growth and development. As a result, we can move forwards in our lives with purpose, more confidence and conviction.
description: Help us to improve the lives of others

name: Encircles
missionStatement: ENCIRCLES, is a registered charity (Registration No. 1182985) established in April 2019. Our mission is to Alleviate Homelessness, Loneliness, Isolation and Poverty in the Salisbury area. Our volunteers feed the homeless and others in need, 7 days a week. We also work alongside other organisations to provide emergency and long term accommodation to vulnerable individuals faced with homelessness and furnish & fully equip their new homes.
description: Help us to feed, house and support those who have fallen on hard times

name: Leicester Outdoor Pursuits Centre
missionStatement:
15 Acres of Adventure in the Heart of Leicester

Leicester Outdoor Pursuits Centre provides adventurous outdoor activity experiences designed to stimulate, educate and motivate young people and others at affordable prices in a challenging and safe environment.

We have fifteen acres of land to explore and there is an activity for everyone to take part in and enjoy, most of the activity sessions are available for both young people and adults as either individuals or as part of an organised group.
description: Support the development of our activities, our site and our environment.

name: West Cornwall Search and Rescue Team
missionStatement: Our team's unpaid volunteers are available 24/7, 365 days a year to support the emergency services to search for lost, missing and injured people.
description: Funded entirely by donations to support West Cornwall in searching for missing people.

name: Sally's Cat Rescue
missionStatement: Sally's Cat Rescue is a small registered charity based in Cornwall who rescue and rehome sick, stray, injured and unwanted cats and kittens.  All the team are volunteers and therefore no wages are taken from any donations . We often take on cats with very high vets bills that are due to be put to sleep and never ever give up on an animal. We give hope where there is none
description: Please help our small charity save as many lives in Cornwal as we can! we need your help x

name: Bar Pro Bono Unit
missionStatement: The Bar Pro Bono Unit is a charity which helps to find pro bono (free) legal help from volunteer barristers for people in need.
description: The Unit receives no government funding so relies on donations and voluntary support.

name: Hull Remembers
missionStatement: To provide a museum and research centre for the veterans, civilians and their families who endured the suffering of the two Great Wars of the 20th century and beyond.

name: Indoamerican Refugee and Migrant Organisation
missionStatement: IRMO is a community-led organisation that provides Latin Americans with tools and information in an empowering process to build secure, independent, and integrated lives in the UK.
description: By donating to IRMO you help us support the Latin American community in the UK.

name: Trinitarian Bible Society
missionStatement: To distribute freely the Infallible Word of God, the Holy Bible which is able to make a person wise unto salvation through faith which is in Christ Jesus.
description: The Word of God among all nations

name: Chile for Christ Trust
missionStatement: We provide financial support for individuals and churches in Chile involved in teaching and mission, and to individuals and communities in Chile for community development and disaster relief. We have contacts from Arica in the north to Tierra del Fuego in the south, and we work through trusted individuals in all Christian denominations. Run on a voluntary basis with no paid advertizing, 100% of all donations go to Chile except for essential foreign exchange fees.
description: Help us share God's love in word and action at the end of the earth.

name: West Mercia Search & Rescue
missionStatement:
West Mercia Search & Rescue find people who are at risk from mental ill-health, physical injury, hazardous terrain or water, and ensure their safety.

We are called out by the Police and Fire Services when help is needed in locating vulnerable people in Shropshire, Herefordshire or Worcestershire.

We are a registered charity, and nobody in the team is paid for their time.

100% of all donations go towards running the operational rescue team.
description: Every penny goes towards our operational team saving lives

name: CAPE
missionStatement:
CAPE is a mental health charity providing vital, comprehensive support for people with severe mental health problems.

Based in Ealing, West London, we offer a suite of services to our clients depending on their individual needs. These include our outreach service, therapy and wellbeing groups, social integration cafe, employment coaching, together with learning and volunteering programmes.

No matter how severe your mental health problems, we are here to help.
CAPE: Recovery Starts Here.
description: Support CAPE in making mental health recovery possible for more people in West London.

name: Giving for Sport
missionStatement:
We support you with not only a low cost, tax efficient method of collecting donations, but also novel and user friendly tools with which to do it!
We have partnered with charities and tech providers to ensure you, your donors and your sponsors have the best possible user experience while using a model that is driven to  ensure ALL parties benefit from every available tax incentive, no matter their geographic or tax location.
description: Giving for Sport: finding funding for all of us to take part in sport.

name: Gatehouse-Caring In East Anglia
missionStatement: Gatehouse is a local independent charity. Its mission is to serve the people of West Suffolk and surrounding area, particularly the most vulnerable and disadvantaged, by identifying and responding to needs unmet by other organisations. It campaigns with and for disadvantaged people; works with local communities to develop local sustainable support for disadvantaged families and individuals. It also offers a range of services to people with mental health issues and their carers.
description: helping those in need and the vulnerable in West Suffolk, through Dementia care, foodbank

name: The Lewis Foundation
missionStatement:
At The Lewis Foundation we source, package and hand deliver gifts & support to all adults going through cancer treatment in hospitals around the Midlands. Items people may find difficult to buy themselves or simply cannot afford.

It can be a sad, frightening and lonely experience for people in hospital undergoing cancer treatment. For many people we are their only visitors.

We rely on donations, fundraising support and volunteers to make a difference.
description: To provide comfort & happiness to all adults going through cancer treatment.

name: The Peckham Coal Line
missionStatement:
Creating a park to connect us. 
A resident led Initiative for a new linear link park between Queens Road Peckham & Rye Lane. Together we aim to repurpose disused rail coal sidings into a 1km long elevated urban park. A green ribbon cutting through a heavily built up ex-industrial area providing a precious green open space; a place to enjoy nature amble, cycle relax and play.
description: Be part of bringing the first part of the route to reality.

name: Lighthouse International Ministries
missionStatement: LIM (Lighthouse International Ministries) is, a registered UK charity no. 1032201, dedicated to serving and transforming the lives of orphaned, semi-orphaned and abandoned children in Romania, India and Africa.
description: Change the lives of disadvantaged children in Romania, India & Africa

name: Purley Overseas Trust
missionStatement: About one quarter of the world's population live in areas where the necessities of life - a healthy diet, clean water and access to medical aid and education - are inadequate. Our mission is to help the poorest of these people to help themselves to a better standard of living by funding small-scale self-generating projects. Projects that we have helped to fund in the past have mostly been in the categories of agriculture, health/sociology and education.
description: Please help us to help the poorest people of the world to the basic necessities of life.

name: British Ecological Society
missionStatement:
Founded in 1913, the British Ecological Society is a global not-for-profit membership organisation dedicated to the advancement of ecological science.  We have 6,500 members - many world leaders in their field - in 120 countries. 

The main beneficiaries of any gift you make will be young ecologists from disadvantaged communities in the UK and the Global South.  

We are facing huge environmental challenges.  We need a new generation of ecologists to find the solutions.  Please donate today.
description: Lets give the next generation of ecologists the support that they need

name: Kadampa Meditation Centre Manchester
missionStatement:
Kadampa Meditation Centre Manchester is located in Manchester City Centre & Chorlton . It is part of a large international network of Kadampa Buddhist centres, established by Venerable Geshe Kelsang Gyatso Rinpoche.
The centres provide a source of peace & harmony for the people of Manchester by giving access to reliable methods for developing inner peace. The centre is open to everybody
We offer meditation courses for beginners, intermediate students and those that wish to study in greater depth.
description: Centre for Meditation & Modern Buddhism. Everyone is welcome.

name: Sharing Wonders
missionStatement:
We're a humanitarian Charity promoting education and self sustenance.

We build schools, masjids, water wells, promote agriculture and provide social aid such as child education sponsorship and house construction support.

As of May 2020, we've built over 240 water wells, funded multiple women's gardens for agriculture and have 7 schools under our management.

Sharing Wonders is a small and efficient charity operating with transparency. We rely on your Gift Aid to help keep us operating.

Thank you
description: We'll apply your donation effectively

name: Medical Institute of Tamils
missionStatement:
Medical Institute of Tamils South Thames Region is a branch of MIOT and is a UK registered charity founded in 1990

In 2020 MIOT STR has donated to the following projects in North and East of Sri Lanka

 (1) Thilagawathiyar Orphaned Girls home ,Vaharai

(2) Hari Orphaned Boys Home ,Kallady

(3)ORHAN - Organization for the handicapped  in Vavuniya

(4) CANE Cancer hospice in Jaffna

(5) Medical Students means tested scholarship ,Jaffna University

(6)COVID Support funding
description: Health ,Social and COVID support funding in North and East of Sri Lanka

name: Club F.O.D
missionStatement: Club F.O.D began life as a monthly social event for the LGBT+ community formed to provide a regular and accessible dedicated safe space as many towns and cities do not have dedicated bars/clubs for the LGBT+ community to meet and socialise. Our aim is to organise events and activities and dedicated LGBT+ nights that prevent social isolation and fundraise for local LGBT+ charities, causes and projects through our Fund Of Diversity. There really is no place like home!
description: Donate Today: Your donation does so much more than prevent social isolation

name: Northumberland National Park Mountain Rescue Team
missionStatement: The team provides a search and rescue service to the area covered by Northumbria Police, a vast area (approximately five thousand square kilometres) encompassing all of Northumberland and neighbouring Tyne and Wear. We are available 24 hours per day, 365 days per year. The team is made up entirely of volunteers who give their time freely and without financial reward. We rely entirely on the generosity of the public and other organisations for donations and funding.

name: Phoenix Dog Rescue
missionStatement: Phoenix Dog Rescue was formed in 2008, and is run by a team of dedicated volunteers with a combined wealth of experience in the rescue and rehoming of dogs. All the dogs which come into our care are routinely vet checked, vaccinated, microchipped, wormed, flea treated and neutered. As well as receiving any necessary veterinary treatment. Our dogs are kept in comfortable, safe kennels in Warrington or in foster homes until their new home is found.

name: Unity Community
missionStatement: We are local voluntary group, setup to help people who are suffering from poverty, with food & other needs. Most cases are in-between decisions for Benefits eligibility process. This is a 100% not for profit. The donations go directly towards providing food, or electricity and gas bills to those who are unable to provide themselves.
description: Helping our community locally! Providing healthy food to families who cant make ends meet

name: Self Help Africa
missionStatement: For 30 years, Self Help Africa have been supporting families in rural Africa to escape hunger and poverty. With projects in eight countries- Zambia, Ethiopia, Uganda, Kenya, Malawi, Burkina Faso, Togo and Eritrea - we helped around 340,000 families last year. We don't give hand-outs or aid. Instead, we provide families with the skills and knowledge they need to grow enough food to feed themselves, earn a living and manage their own lives. They can eat well, educate their children and look to a better life.

name: The Lucy Rayner Foundation
missionStatement: The Lucy Rayner Foundation is a registered charity whose aim is to promote and raise awareness of physical and metal health of persons suffering from depression, in particular but not exclusively young adults through campaigning and education. The Lucy Rayner Foundation objectives is to build emotional resilience and stamina in young adults to enable them to thrive in society through group and one to one support. They strive to change the way mental health is perceived by society, to break down the sigma.
description: Donate and help us to reach young people with mental health challenges now

name: Outpost Highlands SCIO
missionStatement:
Outpost Charity has been dedicated to providing support for Military Personnel, Veterans and their Families since 2014. Our registered charity number: SC044790

Our aim is to provide relief from suffering and hardship for men or women who are or have at any time served with the British Armed Forces. The support we offer is based on emotional, social and practical support; currently focusing on the Veterans Camp & the provision of household necessities.

No-one receives a wage, were all volunteers.

name: The Not Forgotten Association
missionStatement: Through social activities and challenge holidays, The Not Forgotten combats isolation and loneliness amongst the armed forces community. We support any serving man or woman who is wounded, injured or sick and any veteran with a disability, illness or infirmity; whatever the cause and whenever it arose. Any serving or former member of The Royal Navy, The Royal Marines, The British Army, The Royal Air Force and The Merchant Navy, both Regular and Reserve Forces, may be eligible for our help.
description: Help us to help them

name: Tree of Life Church
missionStatement: We are a network of churches around the London area, but we are also fully committed to world mission helping fund orphanages in Burundi and Kenya, and help churches in Mexico, Bulgaria and other places.
description: Help Us Change the World!

name: Building Heroes Education Foundation
missionStatement: Building Heroes provide training and personal support to enable service leavers and military veterans to achieve a rapid transition into employment in the building trades. We provide a 5-week intensive programme covering a range of construction skills plus relevant health and safety training.  Our programme equips them to progress directly into a property maintenance role or to gain a foothold in a specialist career in construction by choosing to develop their skills in a single discipline.
description: The Armed Force put their lives on the line for our freedom, now help them start new lives

name: Crossways community
missionStatement: Crossways Community Enterprises is a wholly owned subsidiary of Crossways Community (charity no 1007156). We work with people who have enduring mental health issues and aim to challenge stigma in this area through social enterprise.
description: Please help us to help others!

name: SlumAid ltd
missionStatement:
SlumAid is a nonprofit organisation working with the most deprived communities worldwide.
With health, education and community projects, SlumAid supports local NGOs in empowering people to change their lives and assist volunteers in helping them.

The band is made up of members of the Scout and Guide Associations aged 8 and over.

Charnwood Trust is a Christian Charity that operates an Inclusive Nursery and Family Centre in Stockport.  Charnwood's Purpose is to provide and promote inclusive environments where all children and their families can thrive, especially including those with special needs. 

Across our 2 sites over 250 children attend nursery or playgroup sessions, of those 250 approximately one third have special educational needs.

missionStatement: Our mission is to improve the quality of and access to education and vocational facilities to benefit the most impoverished children and communities. We will form strong partnerships, in the UK and Africa, and through the power of learning we will enable and empower people to step forward,  lead and make a difference; both in their lives and for their global friends.

We work with people suffering from hunger and social isolation including the  elderly, children at risk, young offenders, those in recovery, asylum seekers and those suffering from mental ill health.

missionStatement:
Raising awareness to male domestic abuse and eradicating stigma.
Educating children and young people in healthy relationships

Advocating, abuse is abuse, not a gender issue

missionStatement: We are a registered charity dedicated to improving the lives of those living with dementia and other life limiting mental and physical health barriers, through the provision of music, creative arts, activities and therapies.

name: S.O.U.P

We go behind mainstream charity's ( that forget these people due to their operating costs / limits ) and we look after scared, lonely, vulnerable elderly people and we provide love, care and food for them. Your kind Contribution WILL save lives, that makes you a HERO today! Thank you so much for your donation. Darren Rowland Chairman for S.O.U.P

Without specialist support at this critical time, many of these young people can face emotional problems later in life.

SeeSaw's aim is to give children in difficulty the support they need to face the future with hope.

Available 365 days of the year, the team can deploy anywhere in the county within 90 minutes of being called upon. Called into action via Dorset Police,  are able to offer considerable resources to support the county's Emergency Services. With over 100 specialised search & rescue volunteers, In 2018 we spent a total of 2476 hours on live callouts, 2111 on training and 987 hours raising funds to keep our organisation going.
description: DorSAR rely purely on donations and funding to support our ongoing Volunteer Service.

To date 100% of our students have graduated having secured independent agent representation. 74% of our graduates are still in the industry. We are the only MT college to do a 50/50 stage/screen split.

We intend to be fully hands on with working exhibits that people can operate, not just static objects in glass cases.

Find out more at www.comms.org.uk

our website address is www.honeyrosefoundation.org.uk on here you can find lots of information about the charity
Charity No1109867

Counselling

Volunteering

Training

Youth Support

missionStatement: A Christian church serving the people of Dereham in Norfolk, UK>

1. To raise awareness of Kabuki Syndrome.

missionStatement: Al Sunnah mosque Manchester is a hub for the local community

We are a small Registered rescue Charity in the UK and we help  grass roots rescuers in Romania, Cyprus and the UK.
We strongly believe in matching the right dog to the right home, and we are always here to offer help and advise and a full Rescue Back Up for the lifetime of the dog.
Our Charity Registration number is 1182875, and the Trustees believes and Ethos, is embedded in everything we do on a daily basis.
www.freedomangelsrescue.com
description: Every dog matters - Rescue Rehibilitate and Rehome

name: Shetland Film Archive
missionStatement:
The Shetland Film Archive is a volunteer led charity which has established a moving image record of the Shetland Islands, going back to the 1930s. We digitise vulnerable film and tapes, preserving them for future generations and made publicly available whenever possible. We want everyone to enjoy our diverse archive of Shetland's history and culture. 

We encourage and celebrate us of archive in a variety of settings including: education, research, tourism, health & wellbeing and creative projects.

name: Nene Valley Christian Family Refuge (known as eve)
missionStatement:
Eve exists to help women and families caught up in domestic violence and abuse. 
Domestic abuse is still an issue in 21st Century Britain, and we are here to help. 
From raising awareness of domestic abuse and how to spot it, to running a women and family refuge in Northamptonshire or training professionals to spot the signs, we are a multifaceted organisation determined to make a difference in the lives of thousands of women and children.
description: Eve exists to help women and families caught up in domestic violence and abuse.

name: Ground Level Ministry Team
missionStatement:
The Ground Level network exists to support and care for local churches and ministries. We are seeking to have a growing influence that the church is to be a prophetic voice that models Word and Sprit along with relationship and Kingdom. 

Ground Level is the host of The ONE Event, a Christian Family Festival held on the Lincolnshire Showground. 

It also hosts monthly, quarterly and annual leaders gatherings along with relational support for church leaders throughout the year.
description: Support us to support the local church

name: Yorkshire Dales Society
missionStatement:
We are the only membership charity dedicated to protecting and enhancing the Dales and helping everyone value and enjoy this special area. We have a good track record in campaigning to protect Dales landscapes and communities. We raise awareness and enjoyment of the landscape, biodiversity and cultural heritage of the Yorkshire Dales. 
We are an independent charity with a growing membership in the UK and around the world. Please support by donating or joining as a member today!
description: Please support us to help keep the amazing Dales special and vibrant for years to come

name: Techniquest
missionStatement: Thank you for choosing to support science education in Wales. Techniquest is a Science & Discovery Centre based in Cardiff Bay. We reach over 80,000 individuals in disadvantaged communities in Wales. There are a high proportion of disadvantaged areas in Wales, where communities cannot afford additional STEM engagement.  Without public support we will not be able to deliver programmes necessary to inspire young people's curiosity for STEM and boost their aspirations to put them on a level playing field.
description: Support Techniquest, support education, support disadvantaged communities.

name: Tullochan
missionStatement: Tullochan is a Youth Development Charity in West Dunbartonshire, we provide a range of programmes designed to support young people to overcome disadvantage and achieve their potential.   Each year we work with over 500 young people through the delivery of programmes in school and within the local community.   In school we support young people to overcome challenges and remain engaged, while our community based programmes support young people to make a positive transition into employment or training.
description: All profits from our eBay store will support young people to achieve their potential!

name: SL CREATIVES PROJECT
missionStatement:
SL Creatives Project is a Social Enterprise aimed at empowering women in South London to secure jobs  and succeed in their careers.
We offer a 2 hour coaching service for Women with confirmed interviews for Employment and Apprenticeships.
Our coaching service ensures the client is equipped and fully prepared for their interview.
We also provide a brand new quality workwear outfit for each client to feel fully prepared and confident, when  taking positive steps into Employment.
description: Supporting us to reduce unemployment and empower women taking positive st

name: The Charleston Trust (Bloomsbury in Sussex)
missionStatement: Charleston is a charity which receives no public funding. It costs over one million a year to conserve the house and garden, to give a platform to important conversations, art and ideas through our festivals, events and exhibition programmes, and to open and share Charleston with our visitors. Every penny we need to do this, we have to raise ourselves through ticket sales, spend in our shop and cafe and other fundraising activities. This has stopped -overnight.
description: Please donate to Charleston's Emergency Appeal

name: Happy Days Children's Charity
missionStatement: Every year, Happy Days Children's Charity supports over 20,000 children in the UK living with mental, physical and emotional challenges with special days such as trips to the seaside, theatres, zoos, museums, outdoor activity centres, sporting events and other educational and cultural activities. We're a vital support to children with additional needs, helping them get out, make new friends, develop skills and build confidence in the face of adversity. Together we're making a difference, one day at a time.

name: Noor Foundation Somalia
missionStatement: Noor foundation Somalia is a UK registered charity organization.  Founded for providing primary educational programs that will support the growth, development of schools and creation of opportunities for children in both rural and urban areas of Somalia and across the horn of Africa as a whole.
description: Knowledge is light

name: Lewisham Islamic Centre
missionStatement: A fully fledged charity committed to educating both the muslim and non-muslim communities about the true Islamic Message of peace and tolerance. It also provides spiritual and social guidance to the multi national community through a variety of social services, to persons of all ages.
description: Support the Centre so we can continue to provide as many services locally & nationally.

name: TEACH Sri Lanka
missionStatement:
Our mission is to advance educational opportunities to children and young adults in predominantly deprived areas of Sri Lanka by funding projects that will provide greater access to educational facilities.

Since inception we have helped fund an orphanage, a pre-school and a special needs school.
description: Donate to Educate!

name: The Arab-British Centre
missionStatement: The Arab British Centre is a charitable organisation working to further understanding of the Arab world by promoting its culture, sharing its knowledge and supporting a community of individuals and organisations that work to enhance friendship and collaboration between people of the UK and the Arab world.
description: Support the work we do!

name: The Florence Nightingale Museum Trust
missionStatement: The Florence Nightingale Museum celebrates the life and work of the most famous nurse. The museum attracts visitors from all over the world who want to learn more about the Lady with the Lamp and her Victorian world. We explore her legacy, her influence on nursing today and the continuing relevance of her work. We are a small charity without financial support from the government.
description: All donations support the museum to keep its door open and celebrate Florence's legacy

name: New Sight Eye Care
missionStatement: 4 in 5 people who are blind or visually impaired are suffering needlessly because we can prevent or treat their eye condition.  New Sight is a pioneer in the Republic of Congo, delivering comprehensive non-profit eye services to some of the most impoverished and underserved areas of the world.  By restoring sight, we bring hope and transform the lives of patients and their families.
description: When sight is restored, lives are transformed.

name: Friends of the Eastbourne Hospital
missionStatement: The Friends of the Eastbourne Hospital (FoEH) was formed in 1948 just before the launch of the NHS. The charity raises money to provide funds for extra services, equipment and amenities for patients staff and visitors to the Eastbourne DGH and local community services supporting the people of Eastbourne and the surrounding area. The FoEH encourages voluntary work in the hospital and provides a link between the hospital and the community.
description: Help us, help them, help you!

name: CRPS UK
missionStatement:
CRPS UK is a patient led organisation for people with Complex Regional Pain Syndrome, their family and friends and anyone working within the healthcare system.  We offer support, education, assist with research and raise awareness of CRPS. 

We became a registered charity in February 2016, we have been working hard ever since.
description: Raise money to help support people with Complex Regional Pain Syndrome

name: Maidstone Mencap Charitable Trust Ltd.
missionStatement:
Mission Statement

Enabling and empowering all children & adults with a learning disability and their families & carers to achieve their full potential.

Providing the best possible start and support through care, education and therapy from early years onwards.

Providing quality social & leisure activities and opportunities for self-fulfilment within a safe and caring environment.
description: Please, support us to help support some of the most vulnerable members of our community.

name: The Better Days for Men Foundation
missionStatement:
The Better Days for Men Foundation is a Scottish registered charity that aims to provide information, advice, support and ultimately hope to men who have fallen on hard times and are suffering hardship.

We provide a broad platform of support and help afflicted men overcome their adversity and hardship and find better days.
description: Support and Hope for Men

name: Care Merseyside
missionStatement: Care Merseyside is the UK's first GP-funded social prescribing organisation set up by Dr Maassarani & Partners based within the Knowsley area of Merseyside. We offer a holistic and whole person approach to social prescribing offering a range of social activities and interventions for people within the community to compliment NHS care.
description: Donate Now

name: The Asswin Project
missionStatement: The Asswin Project For Donkeys And Other Animals In India is a UK registered charity which finances a healthcare programme in and around the outskirts of New Delhi. It rescues and provides medical treatment to injured and sick working donkeys and horses as well as street dogs and other animals in need.
description: To provide medical treatment and sanctuary to working donkeys and horses in India

name: Manavata
missionStatement: Manvata runs several social initiatives in health, education, environment and humanitation aid worldwide. Apart from implementing initiatives on its own, Manavata provides a platform for individuals and organisations to take the 3H initiaitives forward. With over 8000 volunteers and growing, 57 chapters in 10 countries, registered charity in India, UK and USA, activities that encompass Tree Plantation,Natural Farming,Humanitarian Aid,Value Based Education,Child care,Blood donation,Healthy Living activities
description: Support orphan kids, poor and needy people, plantation, Yoga, Cycling and natural farming

name: Olive Tree Primary School
missionStatement: Olive Tree Primary School is an independent Islamic Primary School within the heart of the Luton Community. For nearly 20 years OTPS has been nurturing and teaching the youth of Luton, embedding values and education that will see them go forward as confident young people. We deliver a curriculum based on the National Curriculum, supplemented with Islamic education (Quran, Islamic studies, Arabic), taught with Islamic manners and etiquette.
description: Help us to nurture and educate future generations of muslims.

name: Hope Community Church
missionStatement: We are a community who shape our lives around Jesus. We are passionate and authentic in our faith and relaxed in our style. Sunday services are our main gathering as a whole church starting with breakfast at 10am and then the service at 10.30am every Sunday. You would be very welcome.
description: Thank you for your gift to Hope Community Church.

name: Hogar de Ninas Madre Albertina
missionStatement: We support a girls home in Nicaragua run by the order of nuns, Madre Albertina. The girls are social orphans, unable to live with family members due to abuse and poverty related issues. We provide a safe haven and home for 30 girls, where they receive schooling, good nutrition and therapy.
description: We need to build more secure buildings and ensure the annual expenses continue to be met.

name: Sudan Medical Care Foundation (SMCF)
missionStatement: Sudan Medical Care Foundation (SMCF) is a UK based registered charity aiming to support health and patients care in Sudan through education & knowledge transfer and reacting to humanitarian crisis. Through a rolling fundraising projects SMCF focuses on the advancement of health and saving of lives by supporting several lifesaving projects.
description: SMCF projects focus on the advancement of health and saving of lives

name: Imagine Independence
missionStatement: Imagine Independence is a registered charity supporting people who experience challenges in life such as mental health issues, learning disability and older age to achieve independence and wellbeing in their lives.  We provide supported accommodation, employment support, social inclusion and wellbeing services, peer mentor and befriending support.  We also provide Mental Health First Aid and Youth Mental Health First Aid training courses which are Mental Health First Aid England-accredited
description: Enabling vulnerable adults to overcome challenges and lead independent lives

name: Independent Food Aid Network UK
missionStatement: The Independent Food Aid Network (IFAN) connects and supports grassroots independent food aid providers including over 400 independent food banks operating across the UK. IFAN advocates on behalf its member organisations at a national and local level and campaigns for food security for all - and the end for the need of charitable food aid. IFAN also publishes critical reports on data collated from independent food banks operating across the UK.
description: Support the Independent Food Aid Network and UK independent food aid providers.

name: CAMBRIDGESHIRE POLICE SHRIEVALTY TRUST
missionStatement: The home is where people should expect to feel safe and secure, it is the one place where they have a right to feel safe. By visiting and securing the homes, the Bobby Scheme helps victims of burglary, theft and of domestic abuse and their children to remain in their home, to recover from the trauma and to begin the journey of moving forward, rebuild and take control of their lives.
description: KEEPING OLDER AND VULNERABLE PEOPLE SAFE IN THEIR OWN HOMES

name: The Disabilities Trust
missionStatement:
The Disabilities Trust is a leading national charity providing specialist community-based and residential support for adults with acquired brain injury, complex physical or learning disabilities and for people with autism, including education.

People are at the heart of everything we do and our services across the country include purpose-built residential accommodation, community-based housing, respite care, special education and community enabling services to maximise each individual's independence.
description: Support people with disabilities now

name: Inspire Movement
missionStatement: The Inspire Movement is an international ecumenical network of Christians who are committed to developing mission-shaped discipleship in the leadership and life of the church. Our vision is to help people become everyday missionaries, who abide deeply with God and live missionally in the world. In short, we seek a life of 'mission spirituality', that is filled, transformed and overflowing with the love of God and neighbour.
description: Growing Communities of Discipleship on Mission with God

name: Nature Vibezzz
missionStatement: Charity providing Environmental Education, Forest School, Practical Nature Conservation programs & community projects. Projects are run at various sites & include activities with pre-school centres, primary & secondary schools, childcare professionals / teachers, youth groups & general public. We run healthy activities that build community spirit & give participants a sense of pride in their local green spaces. Nature Vibezzz regular activities are aimed at families & young children 2 to 13 years old.
description: Your help will fund activities for children from deprived urban areas gain new skills

name: Sights and Sounds Ministry
missionStatement: Sights and Sounds Ministry is a registered charity (Regd.1177644) in London UK committed for the advancement of the Christian religion in London and elsewhere for the benefit of the public through the holding of prayer meetings, crusades, lectures, quizzes, competitions, seminars, public celebration of Christian festivals, producing and/or distributing literature on Christianity and the broadcasting of such events and Christian messages of evangelistic and teaching nature.
description: Help us make disciples of Jesus the living God who lives and reigns forever. and rei

name: The Joseph Storehouse Trust
missionStatement: Vision for Israel is a charitable, non-profit organization founded by Barry and Batya Segal who devoted their lives to help build and restore Israel. The Millennium Centre is our international humanitarian aid centre that operates in Modi'in, 30 minutes west of Jerusalem. With the help from volunteers and generous donations, we can provide aid to the poor and needy people living in Israel and the Middle East.
description: Rebuilding Israel and the Middle East by providing basic necessities.

name: Grampian Childrens Respite Care
missionStatement:
Charlie House is an Aberdeen-based children's charity which supports babies, children and young people with complex disabilities and life-limiting conditions in the North-east of Scotland, and their families.

Current services include activity clubs, support from our Community Nurse, one-to-one support from our Children & Family Support Manager.  

Our dream is to have a purpose-built support centre right here in Aberdeen.

For further information please visit www.charliehouse.org.uk

name: SafetyCurtain
missionStatement: Since its inception in 1999, SafetyCurtain, (formerly IPAT) has provided financial support to performers in need in over twenty countries spanning five continents. Creativity, humanity and community are the precepts that inform our grant giving and bond all performers worldwide. Many of our beneficiaries, who face poverty and conflict, use their creative practice for the greater good of their communities. SafetyCurtain helps them achieve this by providing financial support on a non-partisan basis.
description: Help us help performers, whose livelihood and cultural legacy is under threat.

name: Innercycle
missionStatement:
Bringing purpose, meaning and direction to people with mental health concerns through individual cycling plans, access to accredited therapists and practical help with career choices. 

Our unique combined model has won support from Public Health England and Accredited Registers. 

Only 23% of people enjoy their work. Working to reduce 53% relapsing within a year, our local community projects can help those on the cusp of recovery or verge of concerns sustain fulfilling lives.
description: 80p spent on mental healthcare saves four pounds in absenteeism: your help reduces relapse

name: The Cerebral Visual Impairment Society
missionStatement:
Cerebral Visual Impairment is a form of visual impairment caused by the brain not being able to process information from the eyes passing along the visual pathways in the brain. It is the commonest cause of visual impairment in children in the developed world.

The CVI Society raises awareness, provides expert advice and trains families, individuals and professionals in all aspects of CVI through individual contact, group training events and an annual conference.
description: Help us to help people with Cerebral Visual Impairments.

name: Connexions Community Hub
missionStatement: A community hub that provides activities to the most vulnerable in our community. Such as: Parent/Toddler Groups, Arts and Crafts Workshops, Self Defence Classes, First Aid Training,Music Therapy and Coffee Mornings. We are the only community centre in our town, based in the Town Centre, providing a safe, secure and welcoming environment to all.
description: Connexions relies solely upon donations, fundraising activities and grant funding.

name: The Blue Lamp Trust
missionStatement: The Blue Lamp Trust is a non-profit organisation dedicated to promoting and enhancing community safety throughout Hampshire and the Isle of Wight. All our profits support the work of the Bobby Scheme, a free service which provides practical home security and safety assistance to the elderly and vulnerable, helping them to feel safe in their homes
description: We provide free home security and fire prevention support to the vulnerable and elderly

name: Sky High Trampoline Gymnastics Academy
missionStatement: The aim of Sky High Trampoline Gymnastics Academy is to provide a high quality training facility using the best training methods to help every person who comes through our doors, regardless of age, background or disability achieve their dreams and goals as a gymnast and reach their ability level in the arena of sport and life.
description: To help the in the cause to build an active and healthy nation

name: Foundation for Community Dance
missionStatement: People Dancing (formerly the Foundation for Community Dance)is the UK development organisation for participatory dance.  We create and develop opportunities for people to experience dance in all its diversity. Our vision is a world where dance makes a positive difference. Our mission is to make engagement with dance important and relevant to individuals, communities and society.
description: Help support access to dance opportunities for more people

name: 1st Fareham Scout Group
missionStatement: Scouting exists to actively engage and support young people in their personal development, empowering them to make a positive contribution to society.
description: Support Scouting today.

name: Crawley District Scout Council
missionStatement: Scouting exists to actively engage and support young people in their personal development, empowering them to make a positive contribution to society.

description: More funds means more support for LGBTIQ+ Scottish youths.

name: Gorkha Learning for Life
missionStatement: Gorkha Learning for Life is a charity dedicated to helping the people of Gorkha, Nepal, bring education and health to their children.
description: Due to the devastating earthquake in 2015, we desperately need any donations you can give.

name: 19TH THORNHILL (ITCHEN NORTH DIVISION) - GROUP OF BOY SCOUTS
missionStatement: Scouting exists to actively engage and support young people in their personal development, empowering them to make a positive contribution to society.

THE CHURCH RUNS GROUPS FOR WORSHIP, PRAYER AND BIBLE STUDY, A YOUTH GROUP, COFFEE MORNINGS, AND HOLDS SERVICES IN A LOCAL RETIREMENT HOME. VARIOUS TRAINING COURSES ARE RUN PERIODICALLY. THE CHURCH IS ALSO INVOLVED IN THE STREETLIFE PROJECT.

name: GARBO'S GERMAN SHEPHERD DOG RESCUE
missionStatement: To relieve the suffering of German Shepherd Dogs in need of care and attention and treatment of such animals. To make the public aware of the responsibilities of adopting a dog and the need for properly socialised dogs in our community. Removing and assessing dogs from situations which could be a danger to the public and where children may be at risk.

name: The Switchback Initiative
missionStatement: Switchback is an award-winning charity helping young Londoners to find a way out of the justice system and make real-lasting change in their lives. We provide intensive one-to-one support either side of the prison gate alongside real-work training after release, supporting 18-30 year-old men (Trainees) to build a stable life they can be proud of.
description: We support young prison leavers to make real lasting change after release

name: Children's Helpers Worldwide
missionStatement: Children's Helpers Worldwide (CHW) is a small, volunteer-run charity based in London. CHW works directly with organisations around the world, which support children and young people living in difficult circumstances due to poverty, disability, ill health or other issues. The people running the local organisations work with the children every day and are best-placed to understand the children's needs. Our partner projects include schools, shelters and health, rehabilitation and educational programmes.

Spectrum Cambridge work to provide a broad range of services, events and support for families of children with Autism, additional needs, learning difficulties and disabilities. 

Inclusion and our local area are our passion, supporting children to be themselves without judgement to improve their social development and wellbeing. 

Our events, days out and sessions for the children and families that we support that focus around social gains, sport, technology, the Arts, entertainment and interaction
description: It's good to be different.

Our Widening Participation/Outreach Co-Ordinator travels to venues around the UK to deliver careers advice and mentoring sessions, practical skills workshops and training sessions. We support talented young people from underrepresented backgrounds, to enable them to get a foot on the training ladder.
description: Access to The Arts provides support for young people who most need assistance.

name: Headway Milton Keynes
missionStatement:
Headway Milton Keynes works to improve lives of those affected by Brain Injury in Milton Keynes and the surrounding area.

We offer a range of services which promote rehabilitation/enablement to help our clients to build on their existing skills (cognitive, physical, social and emotional) and in turn increase their confidence and self-esteem. We also work with our clients to access their local community and return to work/education where appropriate.
description: Help us to continue providing valuable support to brain injury survivors

name: School of Sufi Teaching
missionStatement: The school strives to understand the essential nature of humans, the universe and humanity's relation to it in a way relevant to the contemporary world.
description: Support the Sufi School Zawiya

name: Corpal
missionStatement: Corpal is a not-for-profit support group and charity run by parents, families, adults and carers of children who have ACC or Aicardi Syndrome.
description: Supports families affected by Agenesis of the Corpus Callosum or Aicardi Syndrome.

name: Campden Home Nursing
missionStatement: Campden Home Nursing offers palliative nursing care, a 'hospice at home' service, giving people the choice to remain at home at the end of life.

name: Aryana Aid
missionStatement: We are a volunteer led charity registered in the UK (1130232),working to improve the lives of orphan children ordinary men and women in Afghanistan.
description: Small donation make huge difference, Join us to combat poverty in Afghanistan.

missionStatement: The Maldives Whale Shark Research Programme (MWSRP) is a charity that carries out whale shark research and fosters community focused conservation initiatives in the Maldives.

name: Bishop's Stortford Food Bank
missionStatement: The Bishop's Stortford Food Bank first opened in February 2013 and continues to offer a valuable service to individuals and families in need of assistance.

missionStatement: Hostage International provides practical and emotional support to families during and after the kidnap of a loved one, and to hostages after they return home.
description: Support people affected by hostage-taking

name: TALK THRU
missionStatement: Talkthru is a charity run by local volunteers based in Huddersfield, offering men and women confidential counselling for baby loss, miscarriage and pregnancy related issues.
