name: Islamic Da'awah Academy
missionStatement: The Islamic Dawah Academy (IDA) renders a wide range of services and undertakes many activities to support the community both in the UK and internationally.
description: To educate people from all walks of life in all aspects of their religious development.

name: FRIENDS OF ROCK SCHOOL
missionStatement:
Friends of Rock School introducing young people to performing music within a live and studio environment Building confidence and friendships
Full inclusive music projects
description: supporting local young people to achievr and build confidence and self esteem

name: The Diversity Ball
missionStatement: The Diversity Ball will create a culture of diversity, in which we are as different as we are similar. In an exciting evening, we will set a new standard for the openness of our society, for tolerance, inclusiveness, accessibility and mutual respect. The ball itself will act as an awareness raising opportunity and event, and will raise the issues of inclusivity and lowering barriers that separate us.
description: The first Diversity Ball in the UK, needs your help to launch itself in to action.

name: Kings Hill Rotary Club Charitable Trust
missionStatement: We are a Rotary Club in Kings Hill, Kent, raising money for Local, National and International charities.  We also carry out charitable services in our community.
description: Help us to help others!

name: Rotherham Parents Forum Limited
missionStatement:
Set up in 2009 by parents who had children with Special Educational Needs and/or Disabilities (SEND). 

Feeling isolated and struggling to navigate the world of SEND, they came together to offer each other mutual support and share experiences. As numbers grew they realised that parents had a vital role in shaping and developing local services available to our children. 

Reducing isolation and influencing services are still our aims today with 100's of families accessing our support and social events
description: Your donation will allow us to continue to support families who have children with SEND

name: Glasgow's No1 Baby and Family Support Service
missionStatement: Glasgow's No.1 Baby & Family Support Service provides relief to people in poverty and hardship in Glasgow and surrounding areas. We have an open-door policy, allowing people without representation to self-refer. We help those in working poverty who are struggling and need a hand. We collect donations and redistribute them to those in need.  We also offer volunteering opportunities, advice and support. We welcome them into an environment where they can feel safe, useful and take pride in their efforts.
description: Poverty does not discriminate; it can happen to anyone. Help someone in their time of need

name: SAHODAR UK
missionStatement:
SAHODAR UK exists to support projects undertaken by our sister charity, in a poor, remote area of Lamjung, Nepal. 
The focus is on providing 
medical provision for those who would have to walk great distances, or for whom it would be unaffordable,
health and dental education,
clean drinking water,
opportunities to develop skills in order to generate an income,
improvements to the very basic level of education,
poverty relief,
opportunities for people to hear the Gospel and to worship God.
description: Urgent need of 23,000 to match fund towards critical new hospital building.

name: Nottingham Roosevelt Memorial Travelling Scholarship
missionStatement: We send young people from Notts to the US to study a project of their choice to promote better relations between the UK and the US
description: Enable us to send more scholars to the US to develop leaders and improve UK/US relations

name: Free Range
missionStatement: FREE RANGE PRESENTS HIGH-QUALITY AND INNOVATIVE MUSIC, FILM AND POETRY EVENTS WITH A POLICY OF FREE ENTRY FOR THE BENEFIT OF PEOPLE IN EAST KENT.
description: Help us present independent cultural events with playfulness, provocation and purpose.

name: Horsley, Bookham and Leatherhead RDA
missionStatement:
We provide riding sessions to children as young as four through to young adults with disabilities including Autism, Downs Syndrome, ADHD, Cerebral Palsy, Dyspraxia and more.
Fundraising and donations are a crucial part of our charity to provide rides and cover the care and feeding costs of our ponies and upkeep of safety equipment for riders, insurance and training costs for our volunteers.
Our horses and ponies provide therapy, achievement and enjoyment to our riders living in or near Surrey.
description: We are 100% voluntary led and funded. Your support is so valuable to us. Thank you

name: Narconon
missionStatement: The goal of Narconon Drug Education is a UK youth disabused of false data about drugs and empowered to make the right choices about them. We seek to encourage students to achieve their goals in life and avoid the pitfalls of substance abuse. We also seek to promote general awareness in the arena of drug prevention and to emphasize the point that there are solutions to substance abuse.  Last school year we reached over 26,000 students and teachers with "The Truth About Drugs."
description: Highest Ever Death toll from Drug Abuse in 2019. Up 16%!  Prevention IS better than Cure!

name: Ava’s Angels
missionStatement: Ava's Angels, established in March 2018, in memory of Ava Akers, who lost her life in 2017 aged just 3 years old. Inspired by Ava and seeing the importance of support whilst caring for a poorly child, Ava's Angels was established with the following mission statement: Providing relief of sickness and suffering among children being cared for in hospital by providing items, services and emotional support for families to enable them to visit, spend quality time with and care for such children.
description: Supporting families of sick children in hospital, helping them care for their child.

name: SEN Family Saturdays
missionStatement: We run a weekly family centred support group with children activities and outings. Children with Special Educational Needs (SEN) often miss out on social activities, events and play groups because of several difficulties that cause them to be isolated. SEN Family Saturdays is a parent run registered charity for families of children with special educational needs, where we aim for families to meet other parents and specialists for practical and emotional support and feel understood.
description: Support families of children with special educational needs

name: Manor After School Kids & Klubs
missionStatement: Our mission is to work to enhance the lives of all children growing up in estates in Sheffield classed as deprived regardless of wealth, religion, gender, race, background or ability. MASKK aim to provide affordable After School and Holiday Childcare, Short Breaks for children with disabilities, a variety of Kids Clubs, Open access Activities, Family Stay and Plays, and other activities the community require or request through regular consultation. MASKK also deliver a volunteer programme.
description: MASKK continue to seek support so that we can continue to support over 200 each week

name: East Kent Baby Memorial Gardens Group Charity
missionStatement: We are a very small volunteer run charity maintaining the unique and fully accessible Ashford Baby Memorial Garden in the town centre, and raising awareness of baby loss, as well as arranging events and activities.  We get no funding whatsoever and have no staff, so you really would be supporting a small, local charity, in the knowledge that every penny donated will be spent wisely!  And do look out for our unique Smiley Face Tombolas!
description: The pandemic has meant we have not been able to do any real fundraising for the past year!

name: Margaret Carey Foundation Ltd
missionStatement: The Margaret Carey Foundation recycle scrapped bicycles and wheelchairs and set up workshops where prisoners clean and repair them to a high standard. We then give the refurbished bikes and wheelchairs to communities in need throughout England and developing countries. In this way, prisoners work to make lives easier and better for disadvantaged people. Offenders learn to develop a positive work ethic, gain useful skills and become better prepared for employment after release.
description: Recycle, repair and rehabilitate.

name: YOGA IN DAILY LIFE SCOTLAND
missionStatement: Yoga in Daily Life Scotland is a registered Scottish charity (SC049297) run by volunteers for the benefit of individuals and the community. We provide classes, courses, workshops, retreats and volunteering opportunities to enhance physical, mental, social and spiritual health. We represent the international system YOGA IN DAILY LIFE in Scotland as a member association of the International Fellowship of Yoga in Daily Life, which operates in more than 30 countries around the world.
description: Supporting the wellbeing of people, animals and the environment in Scotland and beyond.

name: SIRI GURU NANAK DARBAR (SIKH TEMPLE)
missionStatement: Siri Guru Nanak Darbar Gurdwara is situated in the town of Gravesend, UK and is one of the largest Gurdwara outside of India. The Gurdwara provides hundreds of free meals on a daily basis which is open to all. The Gurdwara also has vast sporting facilities providing hundreds of members with free access, an education centre where Punjabi classes are provided free of charge and a day care centre for the elderly.
description: Donate now

name: ORGANISATION FOR ANTI-CONVULSANT SYNDROME
missionStatement:
We are here to support all families touched by Fetal Anti-Convulsant Syndromes. OACS is the only patient led registered charity for Fetal Anti-Convulsant Syndrome in the UK and Ireland. 

 

Fetal Anti-Convulsant Syndrome is caused when the anti-convulsant medicine a woman takes during pregnancy affects the foetus.  It is not yet understood why this affects some children and not others, but it is believed may be due to a genetic disposition.
description: Help us raise funds to support family days out & Charity running costs

name: Time & Talents Association
missionStatement: Founded in 1887 to support the people of Rotherhithe and Bermondsey, today Time & Talents runs social, art and learning-based activities for all ages, targeted activities working with people with high levels of need such as isolated elderly people and disabled groups, and universal wider projects and events designed to create a happy, healthy, connected community. We believe that fun, friendships, and mutual support make a happier, healthier community where everyone is included.
description: Help us increase the happiness and wellbeing of everyone in our community!

name: The Forgotten Angels
missionStatement: At the Forgotten Angels we believe that every disadvantaged child should have a fair chance at a good life, our charity's mission is to give every street child the opportunity, welfare and love they deserve. We achieve this by working with our implementation partners where necessary through sponsoring various developmental, educational and welfare programmes. These programmes have elevated children out of poverty and equipped them given them the opportunity to pursue higher education and beyond.
description: To eradicate poverty for children through various educational and developmental projects.

name: The Stephen Lyon Organisation
missionStatement: The Stephen Lyon Organisation aims to provide a support service for individuals suffering from mental health problems and/or having suicidal thoughts. The charity provide a free and confidential support service that allows individual's to speak openly and honestly about anything impacting their life. The Stephen Lyon Organisation also provides educational workshops to young people, employers and other organisations to help raise awareness or suicide and how to support individuals with suicidal thuoghts.

name: The Counselling and Family Centre
missionStatement: The Counselling and Family Centre is a charity at the heart of the community for over 40 years. We are there For Whatever Life Throws at You. From the age of 5 up through the teens and into adulthood and on through maturity we will be there for you whatever the problem. We offer counselling to adult individuals, couples, families, and to children and young people from 5 years old. Additionally we provide support for families affected by addiction and parents affected by pregnancy and birth issues.
description: For every pound you donate we deliver 15 pounds worth of services to those in need.

name: Yorkshire Film Archive
missionStatement: Yorkshire Film Archive finds, preserves, and provides access to Yorkshire and NE England's moving image heritage, caring for the collections of both the North East Film Archive and the Yorkshire Film Archive. Our first priority is to ensure the preservation of the films; both archives have specialist facilities and expert staff. But that's just the first step: these films were made to be seen, not simply locked away in a vault. We want everyone to be able to access our collections, on screens and online.
description: Help us to preserve and digitise your regional film heritage, for all to see and enjoy.

name: Home-Start Havering
missionStatement: Home-Start Havering provides a vital lifeline to vulnerable families living in the borough of Havering. We deliver friendship and support to families in their homes using locally trained volunteers who are carefully matched to the families they help. We help families cope with the challenges they face by building resilience and support them to provide good early parenting until they are ready to go it alone. This service is available to families who have at least one child under the age of five.
description: Home-Start Havering supports families to cope through challenging times.

name: St Faith's Havant
missionStatement: As we begin to emerge, like butterflies from the shell of the Covid lockdowns, we're turning our attention towards upgrading our building so that the WHOLE Havant community can use it for concerts, exhibitions, theatre, seminars, education and fayres - AND we want to help everyone enjoy 'God's Acre' in the centre of our town.  Please think about whether you could help with the costs of making St Faith's Accessible to All.  What a gift to your neighbours that would be! Canon Tom Kennar, Rector.
description: Help us to make St Faiths accessible to all!

name: Cambridge Islamic College
missionStatement: Cambridge Islamic College's mission is to produce a generation of independent Islamic scholars and thinkers who are at the same time working professionals contributing to the wider British society.
description: Please support the College with your zakat, sadaqah and donations.

name: Wisbech Theatre Trust
missionStatement: To advance the arts for the public benefit in Fenland and the surrounding areas by the provision of a theatre, currently known as the Angles Theatre, Alexandra Road, Wisbech
description: Help us to keep Fenland's only theatre alive

name: The Dominion House Church
missionStatement: The Dominion House Church is a family Church with the aim of impacting lives and building family. TDH is strong in God's word, consistent in prayers and agape love
description: TDH aims at impacting community we take care of the elderly, lonely and widows. Support us

name: AlderleyEdge Festival
missionStatement: TO PROVIDE A CONDUIT THROUGH PUBLIC PERFORMANCES, FOR YOUNG CHILDREN TO EXPRESS THEMSELVES THROUGH MUSIC, SPEECH AND DRAMA AND TO SHOWCASE AND NURTURE THIS TALENT IN THE PERFORMING ARTS.
description: To give over 2700 children the opportunity to sing, play and act in front of an audience

name: Jordan's Weeones
missionStatement: Jordan's Weeones Charity 1182548 Is a children's cancer charity that aims to offer financial assistance to families in need who have children diagnosed with cancer or life limiting illness.
description: Supporting families in need who are supporting their children through cancer treatment

name: Motherwell Football Club Community Trust
missionStatement: We are a Scottish Charity based in Lanarkshire. We use the brand name of Motherwell Football Club and the power of football to change people's lives for the better.
description: We support families and individuals in Lanarkshire through the power of sport.

name: matchmothers.org
missionStatement:
We are Matchmothers and we began in February 1979 when a mother who was living apart from her children wrote a letter to the Guardian newspaper asking other Women in her position to get in touch.
We support Mother's who live apart from their children due to Parental alienation, forced adoption and family breakdown. We offer support via our telephone helpline, Matchline, on our secret facebook group and face to face at our local, member run support groups.
description: Because Mothers are forever.

name: the national flood forum
missionStatement:
The National Flood Forum is a charity dedicated to supporting and representing communities and individuals at risk of flooding.  We do this by: 
1. Helping people to prepare for flooding in order to prevent it or mitigate its impact
2. Helping people to recover their lives if they have been flooded
3. Campaigning on behalf of flood risk communities and working with government and agencies to ensure they develop a community perspective to managing flood risk
description: Supporting and representing flood risk communities

name: South West Blood Bikes
missionStatement:
Providing a free Blood Bike service to the county of Devon.  

We move blood, donor baby milk, medicines, medical records, pathology, microbiology and haemotology samples - amongst other things, when required urgently by the NHS and Hospices, using a fleet of liveried motorcycles and cars.  

We are 100% crewed by volunteers and have no paid staff.  Members of the Nationwide Association of Blood Bikes, the only charity in Devon who are members.

All riders are IAM or ROSPA Advanced Trained
description: Help us continue to save lives and improve patient outcomes for the people of Devon

name: KIDS
missionStatement:
KIDS is a national charity, founded in 1970, that provides a wide range of services to disabled children, young people and their families in England. Last year, 13,700 disabled children from birth to 25 years benefitted from our work. Our services include: drop-in creches and nurseries for the under 5s to youth clubs, short breaks and residential stays for young adults. 

We aim to empower disabled children and young people to develop their skills and achieve their aspirations.
description: To support and empower disabled children and young people to have fun, learn and grow.

name: The Seaview Project
missionStatement: Seaview is a local charity whose range of support services help marginalised people with addiction problems, mental health issues, ex- and at-risk offenders and rough sleepers achieve personal growth and fulfilment.
description: Local charity helping marginalised people achieve personal growth and fulfilment

name: 7thA Rochdale Scout Group
missionStatement: Wee are a long time established Scout Group, based at Spotland Bridge in Rochdale. We support the development of youn people from the ages of 6 to 18,giving Skills for Life.
description: Supporting Scouting in the Spotland Area of Rochdale

name: Kreslu Police Charity
missionStatement: Keslu is a Cornish charity that provides support to injured or seriously ill Police officers, staff or volunteers.  We especially focus on staff who were injured on duty, keeping the Duchy safe.
description: Please support Police Officers & Staff seriously  injured keeping Cornwall safe

name: Centre Stage London
missionStatement:
Centre Stage London are a performing arts charity, celebrating their 50th anniversary in 2016.

Their goal is to provide low cost, high quality musical theatre to the public in the City of London. Members have the opportunity to develop their performance skills and theatre arts, whilst making new friends and becoming part of a thriving community of like-minded people.

In celebration of the 50th anniversary, the 2016 season includes five shows including Evita, Ragtime, 9 to 5 and Pirates of Penzance.
description: We have recently lost our home and are facing significant costs while we are homeless!

name: Taraloka
missionStatement: Taraloka is a women's Buddhist retreat centre set in beautiful Welsh Borders countryside. We are part of the Triratna Buddhist Community. Taraloka offers a breadth and depth of Buddhist and meditation retreats for all levels of experience. Each of us who comes on retreat at Taraloka has the opportunity to touch something deep within ourselves - something indescribable, loving and free.  And when we go back to our familiar lives, the effects of this ripple out into the world.  This is why Taraloka exists.
description: Taraloka needs donations to keep providing opportunities to change minds and lives

name: The Muscle Help Foundation
missionStatement: The Muscle Help Foundation is a small multi-award winning family-centred charity delivering transformational experiences in the UK called Muscle Dreams for children and young people (8-28yrs) with the muscle wasting disease, Muscular Dystrophy (MD). The charity desperately needs support (time, skills and money) to make more of these highly personalized experiences a reality. Find out about the purity of our impact and discover how you can help us change lives and give hope to those most in need - thank you
description: Help change lives and give hope via our transformational Muscle Dream interventions

name: moxafrica
missionStatement: Moxafrica is a UK-registered charity set up in 2008 to investigate the use of moxibustion therapy for the treatment of tuberculosis, particularly drug-resistant TB, in resource-poor environments. Moxibustion is a traditional East Asian treatment method and is documented as having been successfully used to treat TB in Japan in the 1930s. Moxa is low tech, cheap and unpatentable. We have funded scientific research in Uganda, but much more is needed. The poor and the powerless need and deserve our support.
description: TB and poverty go hand in hand, please help us to support the poor and the powerless

name: Trust Your Breath
missionStatement: Trust Your Breath is a Community Based Health and Well-being Trust dedicated to the Teaching of Complete Natural Breathing for the relief of Stress and Promotion of Health. Our work is based on 30 years experience teaching and helping people rediscover their natural correct breathing pattern.  We are based in Scotland but our reach is Global, heal your breathing and you heal the world.  We run courses, workshops, do 1-to-1 sessions.  Better breathing for a better life and better health.
description: Improve Your Breathing, Better Breathing builds Health, Confidence & Creativity.

name: Euan's Guide
missionStatement: Euan's Guide is the disabled access review website and app where disabled people, their friends and families can review, share and discover accessible places to go. The charity was created in 2013 by Euan MacDonald, himself a powerchair user and his sister Kiki. Euan's Guide aims to be a friendly, honest and empowering alternative to hours of web searching and phone calls before visiting somewhere new. The site now has thousands of disabled access reviews for places in the UK and beyond.
description: Help us share accessible places with disabled people, their friends and families

name: Woolston Eyes Conservation Group
missionStatement: The Woolston Eyes Conservation Group is a voluntary organisation formed in 1979 which manages the rich and varied wildlife of the Manchester Ship Canal Company's deposit grounds. The aim is to promote the study and conservation of the wildlife and habitat of the area. In 1985 the Reserve (over 200 hectares) was designated a SSSI in order to protect its wintering wildfowl. In 2004 the SSSI was revised to include the national important breeding populations of Black-necked Grebe, Pochard and Gadwall.
description: Help protect Woolston Eye's unique habit and enhance our visitor faclities

name: Friends of Lytham Hall
missionStatement: We raise money and run events to support the restoration and ongoing maintenance of Lytham Hall, a Grade 1 listed Georgian Hall in Lancashire, and its Parkland for the enjoyment of all.
description: Keep Lytham Hall and its beautiful parkland open for all to enjoy.

name: York City Knights Foundation
missionStatement: We are the community arm of the York City Knights and are a registered charity (1112571). We work across York and North Yorkshire with the aim of inspiring communities and changing lives.
description: Help is do more across York and North Yorkshire.

name: British Enhancement Centre
missionStatement: Finding that "hidden nugget" - finding meaningful engagement and employment for those in the autistic spectrum.  Making a dent in the claimed 95% unemployment in those in the autistic spectrum and SEND
description: Finding menaingful engagement & employment for those in the autistic spectrum

name: The Gatton Trust
missionStatement: Restoration has been ongoing at Gatton Park since volunteers began to rediscover the gardens which had been left unmanaged for many years. The park is a haven for wildlife as well as a place for the local community to enjoy the outdoors. The parkland is also the inspiration and location for our education programme working with individuals of all ages, families and school groups. Within our park and education teams we offer volunteering opportunities for the whole community including vulnerable adults.
description: Support our education programme, community outreach & management of our beautiful parkland

name: Horton Chapel Arts & Heritage Society
missionStatement:
The Horton Chapel Project is the restoration and refurbishment of Epsom's Grade II listed Horton Chapel to be run as a not-for-profit arts centre.
The project to convert the building, which has stood empty for nearly 30 years, is managed and led by volunteer-led charity Horton Chapel Arts & Heritage Society, set up by a group of Epsom residents.
The vision has been developed in consultation with the community and local partners, and is supported by the National Lottery Heritage Fund.
description: Help us bring Epsom's forgotten heritage back to life for the good of the whole community.

name: ActionPlus Foundation
missionStatement: The UK branch of our charity was opened in London in 1997 and in 2007, we opened the Africa branch based in Ghana. Our vision is a world where people affected by HIV do not experience poverty, ill health and prejudice. We support people living with HIV/AIDS so they can play a central role in improving their own lives leading to permanent and lasting solutions. In Ghana and in the UK, we lead in HIV education including support and empowerment programmes.
description: Your kind donations will help us set up more HIV Testing clinics in London, Luton & Ghana.

name: Annie's Trust
missionStatement: Annie's Trust is a UK Registered Charity, established to relieve the suffering of stray dogs in Romania or dogs in Public Dog Shelters which are in need of care and attention by by reason of sickness, neglect or maltreatment.
description: relieve the suffering of stray dogs

name: CTG-UK (COMMUNITY OF TIGRAYAN IN THE UNITED KINGDOM)
missionStatement:
https://apps.charitycommission.gov.uk/Showcharity/RegisterOfCharities/CharityFramework.aspx?RegisteredCharityNumber=1158762&SubsidiaryNumber=0

http://www.ctguk.org/about-as

The Community of Tigrayan in the United Kingdom (CTG-UK) is a registered charity (charity no 1158762) based at 13 -15 Stockwell Road, London SW9 7AU.
description: we are charity based in the UK

name: SteppingStones Charity
missionStatement: SteppingStones Charity is a group of dedicated volunteers whose prime concern is to promote and improve education and alleviate poverty and suffering of the poorest of people in Central and South America, regardless of their ethnicity, gender or beliefs.
description: Donate to help alleviate poverty and suffering of the poorest people

name: Trinity Scout Group
missionStatement: We are a town based scout group working with about 80 children in Taunton. Our scout hut is coming to the end of its life and we are trying to raise funds to rebuild it for the future generations.

name: Maccabi GB
missionStatement: To support the long term future of British Jewry by engaging and developing the entire Jewish Community with a broad range of sporting, educational, social and health and wellbeing activities, whilst promoting Jewish Identity and the centrality of Israel
description: Education through sport

name: League of Friends Sheffield Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust
missionStatement:
League of Friends Sheffield (charity Number 259596) Established in 1969 by a dedicated group of  volunteers who devote their time to raise funds for the hospitals.

We fund projects which improve patient and visitor experiences at Sheffield Teaching Hospitals.
description: Supporting Sheffield Teaching Hospitals since 1969

name: LIA Relief Trust
missionStatement: We are delivering your donations to some of the most impoverished and disadvantaged communities across the globe. We believe in making a difference to those most in need, wiping calamity through charity and working locally as well as globally.
description: Changing the lives of those most vulnerable is at the heart of what we do.

name: Suited for Success
missionStatement: Suited for Success helps unemployed men and women to regain the dignity of employment by providing 'FREE' interview coaching, employability skills and interview clothing to make sure that first impression counts in a job interview and gain successful employment.

name: The Quiet Garden Trust
missionStatement: The Quiet Garden Movement nurtures access to outdoor space for prayer, reflection and rest in a variety of settings, such as private homes, churches, schools and hospitals, and creates opportunities for people to experience silence, restfulness and contemplative practices.
description: Help us share outdoor space for wellbeing and the inner journey

name: Fresh Hope Ministries International
missionStatement: We are a UK Christian Charity working to support Fresh Hope Churches and ministries in Sierra Leone, West Africa. Ministry areas include caring for abandoned babies and children, Outreach to Street Girls and church planting. CCNI No. 101883
description: Rescue abandoned babies, sex-workers and help plant churches in Sierra Leone, West Africa

name: Sunny Days Children's Fund
missionStatement: Our aim is to give support to children under the age of 18 years with a wide range of adverse medical conditions. Including Leukaemia, Cerebral Palsy, the Deaf and Blind, Terminal Illnesses, and all other life hindering conditions.
description: Help top support our holiday homes allowing the families to have much needed crisis breaks

name: Dash Of Silver
missionStatement: Charity named after its Founder, Dan Silver whom bravely battled Testicular Cancer back in 2009. We are a Male Cancer awareness charity that is based here in Plymouth Devon. We support males affected directly or indirectly by Cancer.
description: every penny donated goes to creating gift packs for Testicular Cancer patients

name: Middlesbrough &Teesside Philanthropic Foundation
missionStatement: The Foundation is a registered charity, set up by Teessiders for Teessiders. The Foundation's purpose is to raise funds which are then distributed across Teesside to help groups, charities and schools continue their great work in the community.
description: Supporting community groups, schools & charities on Teesside

name: North Staffs Accordion Club
missionStatement: The North Staffs Accordion Club's objectives include establishing a friendly and welcoming club environment for accordion enthusiasts, playing or non-playing. Our charity status enables us to promote local community music through concerts and recitals including charity events.
description: Please help us entertain local community groups and to support deserving charities.

name: OperaUpClose
missionStatement: OperaUpClose (registered charity 1153307) is a small, ambitious OIivier Award-winning touring opera company. We produce innovatively staged, accessible, affordable and high-quality productions and deliver pioneering education and participation programmes to engage diverse young people, particularly those from disadvantaged backgrounds.
description: Help fund free tickets for Under 5s from low income areas with new children's opera

name: Worshipful Livery Company of Wales
missionStatement:
We promote education, arts, science,technology, vocational skills and associated professional activities through a programme of awards and scholarships to young people, usually under the age of 30, throughout Wales.

We enjoy fellowship amongst Liverymen through social and educational activities.
description: Nurturing Welsh Talent - Meithrin Dawn Cymru

name: Islamic Unity Society
missionStatement: We are empowering young British Muslims to develop, grow and engage in a multicultural Britain through the universal principles of Islam. Events & activities in London and Manchester. National projects like residential trips. International campaigns to tackle education, poverty and deprivation.
description: Help us empower, develop and support our youth and communities

name: Safe Passage International
missionStatement: We help refugee children and adults in vulnerable situations to reach a safe place without risking their lives, through using the law. We strive to make the system fairer for more children and families who are in such dangerous situations.
description: Delivering safe passage for refugees, especially children who are alone in Europe

name: The Josh Hanson Trust
missionStatement: The Josh Hanson Charitable Trust exists to make a difference by giving youngsters opportunities, resources and the support they need to see their own potential, celebrate who they are and feel inspired to be the person they want to be.
description: Providing support to those affected by crime and their families.

name: Russell Lower School PTA
missionStatement: A PTA run by parents to give our children the best education he or she deserves. Due to government cuts in schools, our PTA is vital for basic resources for our children. Like text books, reading books and writing equipment.
description: After our PTA meeting last Tuesday, we found out, funds from the PTA are more vital than e

name: Just Caring Midlands
missionStatement: Just Caring Midlands is a Christian Charity seeking to help and support young adults in the Birmingham area. We aim to reach out to those who have fallen through the gaps in the official system; befriending and mentoring them for as long as they need us.
description: Help us support vulnerable adults in the West Midlands

name: South West Youth Games Trust
missionStatement:
Our mission is to create a happier, healthier South West by engaging more young people from Devon and Cornwall into community sport and regular physical activity.
  
We do this by delivering innovative, accessible and inspirational sport and physical activity experiences for young people across Devon and Cornwall.
description: Help us make young people in Devon and Cornwall happier and healthier

name: The Hunter Centre
missionStatement: The object of The Hunter Centre is to relieve the needs of all affected by Dementia and related conditions, in Haslemere and the surrounding areas. This is primarily done by operating a day centre providing care for those with Dementia and support for their families and carers.
description: Help us support dementia in Surrey, please donate.

name: Kashmir Development Foundation
missionStatement: Kashmir Development Foundation (KDF) is a civil society organisation working for community development and empowering the voices of the underrepresented people and communities to help create the conditions for an open, peaceful, inclusive and prosperous society by supporting communities to engage in collective action for transformative change.
description: Help us in rebuilding lives and livelihoods in all the regions of Jammu and Kashmir

name: Wiltshire Treehouse
missionStatement: Wiltshire Treehouse wants to see a world where every bereaved child and young person can receive guidance and support to help them through their grieving process. We will enable those in our local communities to develop the coping strategies, skills and confidence they need to thrive.
description: Grief support for Children and Young People within Swindon and Wiltshire

name: Coventry Rape and Sexual Abuse Centre
missionStatement: CRASAC has been supporting victims and survivors of sexual violence and abuse in Coventry for almost 40 years through a range of services aimed at enabling and empowering individuals to move forward and reclaim power and control in their lives as they work through their experiences.
description: Committed to ensuring people are heard, safe, believed, accepted?  Every donation helps.

name: S.T.A.N.D - RECOVERY CENTRE
missionStatement:
Striving Towards A New Direction.

STAND Recovery Centre provides safe and secure supported housing for people suffering from drug and alcohol addiction in the Clacton on Sea area. Residents in our service are supported by staff to become abstinent from drugs and alcohol and rebuild their lives.

name: CITIZENS ADVICE NORTH OXFORDSHIRE
missionStatement: We're Citizens Advice North Oxon & South Northants. We're a local charity and our advice is always free, impartial and confidential. People have trusted us to advise them for over 50 years, and supporting us will mean we will always be there for people, when they need it most.
description: Your support will mean we can be there for people when they need us

name: Chester Pride
missionStatement: Chester Pride works to support the LGBT+ community of Chester and Cheshire West, through events, outreach, and education. We campaign for better LGBT+ rights, an end to discrimination, and equality for all. We work with the local authorities, businesses and other third sector organisations to make this a reality.
description: Donating help us deliver our free annual event, and support our work throughout the year

name: The Spitfire Society
missionStatement:
A) TO ADVANCE THE EDUCATION OF THE PUBLIC AND CONDUCT RESEARCH INTO ALL MATTERS RELATING TO THE VICKERS SUPERMARINE SPITFIRE AND SEAFIRE AND THE DESIGNER THEREOF, R.J.MITCHELL, AND TO PUBLISH THE USEFUL RESULTS OF SUCH RESEARCH.
B) TO ADVANCE EDUCATION IN THE FIELD OF AERONAUTICS, ASTRONAUTICS, AND ASSOCIATED SUBJECTS.
description: The Spitfire Society promotes the most iconic aircraft in history to the public.

name: The Popli Khalatbari Charitable Foundation
missionStatement: The Popli Khalatbari Charitable Foundation (PKCF) supports charitable causes worldwide with a particular focus on the welfare and education of children. Founded in 1998, PKCF strives to bring hope and opportunity to the disadvantaged through the establishment and ongoing support of orphanages, vocational schools, hospitals, and medical funding.
description: For needy children

name: Rotary Club of Mid Wirral Trust Fund
missionStatement: Rotary Club of Mid Wirral Trust Fund is a charity registered with the Charity Commission for England & Wales . All funds go to organisations supporting aims to Fight disease, providing clean water, Saving Mothers and Children, Supplying education and growing local economies in line with the Rotary International Charter.
description: To fight disease, support Mothers & Children, Supply Education & Provide Clean Water

name: Triratna Buddhist Community (York)
missionStatement: We are here to share the Buddha's teachings and to help everyone lead happier, more fulfilled lives, in this often turbulent world. We do this through teaching meditation an Buddhism. All over eighteen are welcome, there is no requirement to become a Buddhist and all classes are free.
description: Please support us and help us to offer free classes to all.

name: Inspire Suffolk
missionStatement:
Inspire Suffolk is a charity recognised and valued for the work undertaken with young people who need opportunities for purposeful reintegration into society.

They work at the forefront of helping young people to overcome challenges and achieve their potential in positive paths onto employment, training and further training.
description: Donate today to support young people on to positive next steps in their lives.

name: Radstock Museum
missionStatement: Somerset Coalfield Life at Radstock Museum is an independent museum housed in a Grade 2 listed old Market Hall, which receives no funding from local or national government. We rely on the income from visitors and the hard work of volunteers who raise funds to keep us going.
description: Help keep the memories of Victorian Somerset alive for future generations

name: LEICESTER TRANSPORT HERITAGE TRUST LIMITED
missionStatement: The purpose of the Leicester Transport Heritage Trust is to encourage interest in the history of road transport in Leicestershire by setting up a museum and heritage centre for the display of vehicles, artefacts, archive material and for the public to travel on heritage buses from our collection.
description: Any donations will help the LTHT towards its Aims and Objectives.

name: SOUTHEND-ON-SEA BLIND WELFARE ORGANISATION
missionStatement: We are Southend in Sight, the Community Services Division of Southend Blind Welfare Organisation.  As a local sight loss charity, we offer friendly support, practical advice and fun social events and activities to ensure that those living with sight loss can continue to lead independent, fulfilling and active lives.

name: Farset Labs
missionStatement: Farset Labs is a place for creativity and technological tinkering. We’re open to everyone, no matter what you want to do, and we welcome people from all walks of life to use our space, come to our events, and get involved with the maker community in Northern Ireland.
description: Support us now!

name: Muslim Welfare Trust
missionStatement:
Tawhiyd Community Trust is a non-profit, non-political, religious organization. We are dedicated to providing help and support to as many lives as possible.

Our aim is to work towards the prevention and relief of poverty, homelessness and  helping, supporting and educating as many lives as we can reach.
description: We connect Community and individuals.

name: Headway Portsmouth and South-East Hampshire
missionStatement: We work with individuals who have a brain injury and their families and carers. We provide opportunities to meet together, as well as training to help each individual live their new normal to the best of their ability. The bulk of our income comes from donations and grants towards our work.
description: Support those with brain injuries. They are like snowflakes. each one is different.

name: Vindolanda Trust
missionStatement:
The Vindolanda Charitable Trust's vision is to excavate and preserve the Roman remains in the Trust's ownership in the central sector of the Hadrian's Wall World Heritage Site. 
The Trust is committed to a twinned robust scholastic and visitor programme encompassing:
Research
Education 
Public display and enjoyment of its monuments and finds from the Vindolanda excavations
description: Our vision is to inspire all through the preservation of history.

name: Hitchin District Scout Council
missionStatement:
We change lives by offering 6 to 25 year olds in Hitchin and surrounding villages, fun and challenging activities, unique experiences, everyday adventure and the chance to help others so that we make a positive impact in communities.
We help provide young people with skills for life and encourage them to do more, learn more and be more.
description: Do more, learn more, be more - building skills for life.

name: Africa Inland Mission International
missionStatement: Africa Inland Mission is an evangelical Christian mission agency serving in over 20 African nations. Our passion is to see Christ-centred churches established and thriving among all of Africa's peoples. We have our roots in a small band of faithful men and women who in 1895 ventured inland to reach Africans untouched by the gospel of Jesus.
description: Find out at eu.aimint.org how to support AIM in sending missionaries to serve in Africa

name: Wat Phra Singh UK
missionStatement: A Buddhist Temple and Meditation Centre based in Runcorn, Cheshire. Everyone is welcome regardless of faith or beliefs. Our Monks and Nuns offer Buddhist services, teaching the Dhamma and guided meditation classes. We welcome visits from schools and interested groups. Please see our website at www.watphrasinghuk.org. Our parent temple is Wat Phra Singh, Chiang Mai, Thailand.
description: We only ask that you give freely that which you can easily afford

name: The Primrose Foundation
missionStatement: The Primrose Foundation is a well-established Breast Care charity, based at the Primrose breast care centre, University Hospitals Plymouth. If you or I were to be referred for any form of breast disease, including cancer then the Primrose Foundation will help to fund the all-important services you and your family may require whilst receiving treatment.
description: Your local breast care charity, supported by local people, for local people.

name: Wirral Churches' Ark Project
missionStatement: Fighting homelessness in Wirral. We run a 27 bed hostel and have 20 move on rooms in houses and studio flats. We provide support and advice to those who are homeless and those in danger of becoming homeless. We help those less fortunate in our society, suffering mental health issues, drug and alcohol problems, showing compassion and practical help.
description: Help us fight homelessness in Wirral and change someone's life for the better.

name: Sylva Foundation
missionStatement: Sylva Foundation is a small UK environmental charity with big ideas. We work to help British woodlands thrive for both people and nature. Healthy trees mean cleaner air, less flooding, jobs in forestry and woodworking, sustainable fuel and building products, habitats for wildlife, living classrooms for children and beautiful places for everyone to visit. Help us get woodland working
description: Help British woodlands thrive for people and nature.

name: Helping Jonah - Helping Others
missionStatement:
Helping Jonah - Helping Others was officially registered in January 2016 to raise funds for life saving medication which our son Jonah required following diagnosis of aHUS in 2015 following a bone marrow transplant in 2014.

Thankfully Jonah is now off the medication and continues to have regular check ups to monitor his progress.  

The charity now continues to focus on helping others.
description: We continue to raise funds to help others who find themselves in similar situations

name: The Nick Jones Foundation for Bereaved Children
missionStatement: The Nick Jones Foundation for Bereaved Children has been set up to provide support to children and young people, up to the age of 18 who have either experienced or are being faced with the death of a significant person in their lives. By providing grants, enabling them to obtain professional help, to allow then to move on with their lives.
description: Providing professional help or grants to children or young people suffering bereavement

name: The Tumaini Fund (Scotland)
missionStatement: The Tumaini Fund (Scotland) seek to bring hope to widows and orphans affected by HIV in Kagera, NW Tanzania. We do this through partnership with The Tumaini Fund (Tanzania) who care for over 50,000 orphans in the region through a team of dedicated parish workers. Our vision is to help resource them and to raise awareness and support from Scotland.
description: Tumaini is Swahili for hope. Partner with us to bring hope to widows & orphans in Kagera.

name: Street Child United
missionStatement:
Street Child United is a UK charity using the power of sport, specifically international sports events, to change the negative perceptions and treatment of street-connected children everywhere.

Our mission is to tackle the widespread stigma street-connected children face and raise awareness and understanding of their situation, so they are protected, respected and supported to realise their fullest potential.
description: Our vision- where every child can access their rights, no matter their background.

name: Hastings Advice and Representation Centre
missionStatement:
Hastings Advice & Representation Centre (HARC) provides free confidential advice, information and representation to thousands people in a typical year, raising millions in unclaimed benefits. 

Our specialist Benefit Advisers can offer the help and support you need to resolve your problems. They will work out what financial help you are entitled to and assist you in claiming any relevant benefits or tax credits.

name: The Story Museum
missionStatement:
The Story Museum highlights the human need for stories and celebrates the many ways that people benefit from engaging with great stories and creating stories of their own

Our vision is to enrich lives, especially young lives, through story.

Our mission is to achieve this by developing a most unusual museum that collects and shares great ways of engaging with great stories.
description: Help us provide great ways to engage with great stories for all ages

name: Apedale Heritage Centre
missionStatement: Our team of enthusiastic volunteers aim to preserve and record the history and industries of the Apedale Valley and the surrounding communities. Based at the site of a former coal mine, we offer authentic underground tours, complemented by our museum and cafe. our educational programme offers visits to schools, colleges and universities.  group visits by organisations of all types are welcomed.
description: Help preserve the industrial Heritage of North Staffordshire

name: Cycle for Africa
missionStatement: Cycle for Africa seeks to PROMOTE cycling for a healthy mind, body and environment and SUPPORT health, education and environmental projects in Africa. At its heart Cycle for Africa educates people about our interconnected world and the consequences upon Africa when we release too much carbon into the atmosphere. Therefore, we must must leave our cars at home and CYCLE FOR AFRICA.
description: The Revolution is Here - Cycle for Africa

name: Cumbrian Railways Association
missionStatement: The Cumbrian Railways Association was founded in 1976 with the aim of providing a common forum for the discussion and open exchange of information between those interested in the history of the railways and related industries of Cumbria, and also for those interested in recreating those railways in model form. In the 21st century this remains the principle aim of the Association.
description: The Cumbrian Railways Association is concerned to see the wider preservation of recor

name: Arkbound Foundation
missionStatement: We are a small charity that aims to empower people through writing, supporting those from diverse and disadvantaged backgrounds in getting their voices heard. We provide 1-1 mentoring, workshops and sponsored book publishing for titles that cover important social and environmental themes - breaking down stereotyping and stigma, whilst ensuring future generations have the tools to navigate an ever changing world.
description: Support us in reaching diverse and disadvantaged writers

name: Kensington Olympia Festival of Music & the Arts
missionStatement: Our aim is to promote music and the arts, by providing a platform for young, emerging artists to perform in this series of concerts and events. We aim to provide affordable performances of exceptional quality with  both experienced and young artists. We want our diverse community to come together in their love for the arts and to introduce them to new experiences.
description: Support young artists and local community

name: Empowerment Charity Lancashire
missionStatement: Empowerment is an innovative charity based in Blackpool, which has made a long term commitment to supporting our local communities and improving lives. We support people to have their voice heard, improve resilience and reduce social isolation. Our projects include the Blackpool Advocacy Hub, The Den, Healthwatch Blackpool, Peer4U and the Lived Experience Team, MOTIVATE2 and the Blackpool Time to Change Hub.
description: We would love you to donate so that we can carry on our great work to help those in need.

name: Sarajia Islamic Studies and Community Centre
missionStatement:
We are currently raising funds during the month of Ramadan to support the poor and needy in Pakistan.
We are helping the poor and needy with shelter and food. During this month of Ramadan we should all get together and help the poor as much as possible. We are taking Zakat, Sadaqa, Fitrana & Lillah. Our organisation works as a 100% donation policy.
description: Sadaqah to help the needy and poor in Pakistan during the holy month of Ramadan.

name: Association of Northern Trails Scotland
missionStatement: The Association of Northern Trails Scotland is a Scottish registered charity that develops walking trails and related projects in the northern Highlands.  Our premier project is the 147-mile/235-km John o' Groats Trail from Inverness to John o' Groats.  It mostly passes along the stunning east Highland coast, providing community access to the significant cultural and natural heritage of the cliffs and seashore, while also developing walking tourism in the region.
description: Help complete the missing link in the trail to the far north of Scotland!

name: Beltane Fire Society
missionStatement:
Established in 1988, the Beltane Fire Society is an Edinburgh (UK) based charity which organises the annual Beltane and Samhuinn Fire Festivals. Each year hundreds of volunteers come together, giving hundreds of hours of their time and energy to create a unique celebration with costumes, storytelling, pageantry and fire! 

BFS also provides opportunities for street theatre, cultural development and community outreach; connecting people with nature, cultural heritage and art.

Charity Number: SC040137
description: BFS runs the annual Beltane and Samhuinn Fire Festivals

name: Age UK West Sussex, Brighton & Hove
missionStatement:
Our purpose is to improve the lives of older people through 4 key pillars:

INFORMED - Our services help people, including carers to know their rights and make informed choices.

CONNECTED - Our community and building based social activities provide opportunities to build friendships.

HEALTHY - Our wide range of wellbeing activities enable people to keep active.

INDEPENDENCE - Our home based services support people to stay within their own home, including preventing a hospital admission.
description: We're an independent local charity working in our community to support people over 50.

name: DIY Wild
missionStatement:
DIY Wild is a wildlife rescue and rehabilitation centre close to Kruger Park in South Africa.

We take in injured, orphaned and displaced animals and rehabilitate them with the aim of releasing them back into protected areas of the wild.

We are the only primate centre in the province and as such our work mainly focuses on vervet monkeys who often come into the centre as tiny traumatised orphans whos mothers have been killed.

name: Teen Yoga Foundation
missionStatement:
We train teachers to deliver specific yoga techniques to teenagers who need help with their anxiety and depression. The course is completely evidence based. The teachers then receive ongoing support as do the teenagers through our app and online resources as well as our mentor scheme.

We also work with the EU to create a solid research base for the work we do and also with the UK government in bringing more yoga to schools.
description: Your money will be used to bring yoga to schools who cannot afford it.

name: Silver Rock Foundation
missionStatement: Silver Rock Foundation is a charity which aims to benefit young people in the Scottish Highlands with funding and experiences to enable talent to flourish. The Foundation's intention is to develop self-confidence and creativity in young people in the fields of Arts, Music and Sport through workshops and one to one sessions with experts in their field, broadening the horizons of our youngsters and opening their minds to their own talents.
description: Developing self-confidence and creativity in young people.

name: Imagine The Day Limited
missionStatement: Provide grants to vulnerable groups to access singing safely regardless of their age/sex/religion/disability & background. Use the power of singing to motivate them to believe they can make changes in their life, improve their health & wellbeing & have a positive impact in society. Schools, hospitals, prisons, care homes & those marginalised in society, struggling from neglect/emotional/mental/physical health, those who may have past/present Housing issues or sensory/learning/physical disabilities.
description: The power of everyone in the community singing

name: Beyond the Streets
missionStatement: Beyond the Streets partner with women on their journey out of sexual exploitation. We want to see a world where people are free from sexual exploitation, and where those in prostitution have the option to pursue genuine alternatives, free from constraints such as poverty, drug dependency, and abuses of vulnerability. We work directly with women selling sex to support them to find routes out of prostitution as well as equipping and supporting other projects.
description: With support we ensure women are not alone. Will you join this community of support?

name: Seaton & District Hospital League of Friends
missionStatement:
Seaton & District Hospital League of Friends provides much needed equipment for Seaton Hospital.

Seaton & District Hospital League of Friends also funds Seaton Hospiscare@Home (formerly the Home Nursing Service), which provides expert nursing care to adults registered with a Beer, Colyton or Seaton GP who wish to remain at home at the end of life. The service also provides advice and support to carers and families of people with end of life care needs.
description: Our charity relies on fundraising & donations to fund the Seaton Hospiscare@Home service

name: Suffolk Sight
description: Help support visually impaired people in Suffolk to live full, active, independent lives

name: Aphasia Re-Connect
missionStatement:
Aphasia Re-Connect transforms lives by bringing people with aphasia together. Aphasia is a life changing communication disability, occurring after stroke or brain injury. Every 15 minutes, somebody acquires aphasia. Robbed of that most precious human faculty, it is difficult to find or follow the words, in speech, reading or writing.
Aphasia Re-Connect counteracts isolation by bringing people together in peer groups through peer befriending, following our values: inclusion, participation and community.

name: Hertfordshire Domestic Abuse Helpline
missionStatement:
We are a confidential, free, support and signposting service for anyone affected by Domestic Abuse. Our aim is to improve the lives of those affected by domestic abuse including those seeking help to change their behaviour. 
When you call us, our well-trained call takers will listen carefully and non-judgmentally to what you say before providing information appropriate to your particular situation.  The decision as to what to do next remains with you.
description: Help us to help all those in Herts affected by Domestic Abuse!!

name: Friends of Appleton School Association
missionStatement: The aim of the Friends is to fundraise for the school and to foster a community amongst parents/carers, and indeed those from the wider community who wish to support the school. The funds we raise are used to purchase resources that the school might not otherwise be able provide, within the government set budget. This could be anything from books, maths equipment and computers to school trip transport and outdoor play equipment.
description: Every penny we raise directly benefits the pupils at our wonderful school!

name: The Inner Yoga Trust
missionStatement: Founded in 1993 by Jenny Beeken, Pauline Sawyer and Jane Malcomson, the Inner Yoga Trust is a charity aiming to advance education and relieve disease through the teaching of yoga postures, breathing, relaxation, meditation and to advance the public education and health through the provision of teacher training courses, bursaries and research. The IYT is governed by our Board of Trustees and the teacher training courses are led by our School Board.
description: Inner Yoga Trust - financial assistance towards new yoga teachers training costs

name: AgileVentures Charity
missionStatement:
We bring teams of developers together from around the world to work on charity IT projects.  Developers operate in distributed teams following Agile development principles to maximise the development of working systems that meet the real needs of the charities and non-profits we work with.

Our big focus is on accessible in-context learning for everyone, everywhere and making the world a better place in the process by helping deserving causes around the world.
description: CodeForGood

name: Men Walk Talk
missionStatement: MenWalkTalk is a registered charity in England which aims to support an imporvement of mental health in men of all ages by engaging them in walking groups which is proven to be beneficial to their mental and physical wellbeing. The stigma around Men's mental health needs to be broken. We aim to reduce social isolation by facilitating inclusive walks for all guys and provide signposting to specialist support for those whom may benefit.
description: MenWalkTalk rely on funding and support from grants to grow and develop.

name: N-Gage
missionStatement:
N-Gage is a Manchester based charity that gives young people at risk of educational or social exclusion opportunities and skills to achieve their full potential.

Working in partnership with schools, Greater Manchester Police, Manchester City Council and other partners we provide highly successful, flexible and targeted approaches to anti-social behaviour and educational exclusion.

The charity was founded by Christie Spurling MBE in 2006 in response to his own experiences of educational exclusion.

name: Oily Cart
missionStatement: Oily Cart creates theatre for children under 6 and for children and young people with Profound and Multiple Learning Disabilities and / or an Autistic Spectrum Condition. Challenging accepted definitions of theatre and audience, we create innovative, multi-sensory and highly interactive productions which we tour to special schools and arts venues across the UK. By transforming everyday environments into colourful, tactile wonderlands we invite our audience to join us in a world of the imagination.
description: Oily Cart creates theatre specifcally for children and young people with PMLD and/or ASC

name: Birchwood Highland
missionStatement:
Birchwood Highland was established over 30 years ago as a charity working with people with mental ill-health, supporting them in their journey to recovery. 

Throughout the 30 years we have maintained our position at the cutting edge of mental health recovery, leading on excellence and advancing innovation in the sector. 

We exists to improve the quality of life of people with mental health issues and/or other complex needs by promoting Independence, Inclusion & Recovery.
description: Independence, Inclusion and Recovery. Ensuring no one faces mental ill-health alone.

name: AIKIKAI AIKIDO DULWICH
missionStatement: Aikikai Aikido Dulwich is a Private Limited Company by guarantee without share capital use of 'Limited' exemption. The objects of the Ltd. by guarantee are for the public benefit, the education of people in the martial arts, more specifically in aikido, regardless of age, gender, race and financial background. We are located in London United Kingdom. We are raising money for venue hiring, equipment, annual insurance and licence for martial arts, inviting teachers from abroad.
description: We need to raise awareness for physical and mental well-being.

name: Brushford Parish Hall CIO
missionStatement:
We are Brushford Parish Hall 
Welcome to our village
Suggested donation for using our electric car charging point: 2 Pounds per hour you are connected. This covers the costs of our maintenance and insurance as well as the electricity you use. Thank you!
We provide a safe, warm, welcoming place for people in and around Brushford to meet, exercise, learn, enjoy music and plays, celebrate. We are open for everyone to use and we help people to organise new activities and groups so that everyone can benefit.

name: North of Tyne Mountain Rescue Team
missionStatement: The team was first formed back in the 1970s as a North of Tyne Local Education Authority team in response to an increase in the number of incidents occurring on the hills and fells of Northumbria. We became the North of Tyne Search and Rescue Team in the early 80s and more recently the North of Tyne Mountain Rescue team. Staffed solely by volunteers and funded entirely by donations, the team continues to provide this service over 40 years after its inception due to your unwavering support.
description: Sustain our mission of providing search and rescue services to Northumberland. Donate now!

name: Ronald McDonald House Glasgow
missionStatement: Ronald McDonald House Glasgow keeps families together when it matters most. It provides a safe, warm, welcoming, cost-free 'home away from home' for families whose child is being treated at the Royal Hospital for Children, Glasgow and other hospitals in the West of Scotland. This allows parents to remain close to their child without having to travel long distances or having the financial burden of where to stay. This is their place to focus on the most important thing - the health of their child.
description: Keeping families together when it matters most.

name: North Wootton Village Hall
missionStatement: North Wootton Village Hall was built in 1937 and has played host to birthday parties, wedding receptions, classes and clubs, exhibitions, sales, theatre, and more in its time. Situated in the heart of the village, just off The Green in Priory Lane, the Village Hall has its own management committee, but it is YOURS. We receive no funding from the Parish Council, the Borough Council, or the County Council. Our income comes from our letting charges and our own fund raising activities as a registered charity.
description: Support from the public allows us to maintain and update the hall for future use

name: Isle of Man Pony Club
missionStatement:
The Pony Club is a voluntary youth organisation which is open to all young people under the age of 25 throughout the UK.  The aims of The Pony Club are:

To encourage young people to ride & to learn to enjoy all kinds of sport connected with ponies and riding.
To give instruction in riding and horsemastership & to educate Members to look after & to take proper care of animals.
To promote the highest ideals of sportsmanship, citizenship and loyalty to create strength of character & self-discipline.
description: The Isle of Man branch of the Pony Club needs you

name: The Fife Agricultural Association
missionStatement: We are an agricultural charity with an educational remit enshrined in our constitution. We see the principal aim of our Show is giving the general public an opportunity to find out more about agriculture in Fife. We have specifically designed the show layout to facilitate this, giving them an opportunity to get a close look at the farm animals on show, and agricultural machinery. Over the last few years, we have extended this into the realms of the wider environment and related countryside issues.
description: Help keep the public informed with local agricultural issues

name: Gathimba Edwards Foundation
missionStatement: We are proud to support the education, shelter and clothing of over 250 children in Kenya.  We also provide seminars, counselling, business start ups and sustainable food solutions to families across various regions of Kenya.  Since 2014 we have been able to build 25 homes for over 100 children - many of which would have not been possible without our volunteers who travel to Kenya with us twice a year from all over the world.  We also support children in Scotland through the Neil Jaffrey Award.
description: Hundreds of kids in Kenya stay at home as others go to school.  You can change this.

name: Gratitude
missionStatement:
Gratitude UK is a charity based in Borehamwood that's been running for it's 6th year. Our main aim is to relieve food poverty and reduce food waste in Borehamwood and surrounding areas. We rescue good quality surplus food and non food items from various supermarkets and shops that would otherwise end up in landfill and redistribute it to the community.

Gratitude has been awarded the Hertsmere Civic Award for 2019 for the services they've undertaken for the benefit of the residents of the borough.
description: Help us relieve food poverty and reduce food waste.

name: The Brockley Jack Theatre
missionStatement:
Jack Studio Theatre Appeal

The Jack Studio Theatre is a registered charity in the UK. It is an award winning venue that has been providing theatre and other arts events for over 25 years, and is committed to presenting affordable and accessible theatre, and to supporting new companies and theatre artists.

Like many venues, the Jack Studio receives no public funding and relies on the support of its audience and friends, most of which comes from people like you coming to see our performances
description: We are now facing very difficult times during this period of closure

name: Dwarf Sports Association uk
missionStatement: The DSAuk promotes grass roots participation starting young athletes from the age of two. We use sport as a tool to break down the barriers of difference within society and to encourage confidence and empower our members. It is so important that the our members feel valued and that they can do anything in life. We empower people to go on to enjoy all kinds of sport, in which they can compete equally and should they wish to go further we guide them on to the correct pathway.
description: Please help us change peoples lives for the better.

name: The Swallows Head & Neck Cancer Charity
missionStatement: The Swallows Charity supports all people affected by head and neck cancers, patients, carers friends or relatives. The patient is the focus for support, help and signposting, however the role of carers and others is vital too, with their own support needs often overlooked. It is our intention for every person affected by head and neck cancer to have access to support at the point they need it and by the method off their choice on a 24/7 basis. This could be by telephone, email or social media.
description: Support our Patients & Caregivers in difficult times dealing with Head & Neck cancer

name: The King's Arms (Petersfield)
missionStatement: The Kings Arms works to meet the needs of the young people in Petersfield, Alton and the surrounding area. We run a range of different clubs and activities for different age groups which include mentoring, arts and crafts, cooking or just having space to chill. The aim is for young people to fulfil their potential and know their worth. Our hope is that the young people will take ownership of their club and help us to turn it into something that inspires them to get the best out of life.
description: Please assist us in helping support young people to fulfil their potential.

name: Senior Solutions
missionStatement:
Every person regardless of age, needs to feel valued, respected and that they have a place in their community. However, as people grow older, their health and confidence may deteriorate, and they then find it harder to go out, meet with friends, and enjoy life as they once did.

At Senior Solutions we believe that as people age, they should be enabled, as far as possible, to live life to the full. If you are an older person, you may not be as active as you once were.
description: We work to prevent the damaging effects of loneliness and social isolation.

name: KIELDER OBSERVATORY
missionStatement: Kielder Observatory is a charity that exists to inspire, enthuse and educate the public about the wonders of the universe. One of three observatories in the UK in true dark skies, as certified by the International Dark Sky Association. Donating to us will help us reach more people and support their interest in astronomy. Your gift will help fund our work in schools, in the arts, our citizen science projects, getting out and about in the community and, of course, the work we do at the Observatory itself.
description: Enable everyone to experience the life-changing moment of seeing the stars

name: Alexander Jansons Myocarditis Uk
missionStatement: Alexander Jansons was a fun-loving, football mad young man who died suddenly and unexpectedly from myocarditis. He was 18. At the time, there was no where for his family to get information so the charity was  founded to raise awareness and fund research so that we can save lives and stop any family from experiencing what the Jansons family had to endure with no answers and no information. We are committed to raising funds but having fun along the way to pay tribute to fine young man who was taken too soon.
description: Understanding, preventing and treating  Myocarditis saves lives

name: Kohima Educational Trust
missionStatement:
The Kohima Educational Trust was founded in 2003 by veterans of 2 Division who wanted to remember the Nagas and to give something back to those who helped  them in thr WW2 battle of Kohima. 
The money we raise goes to providing scholarships for children aged 14 to 18 to assist them with their school fees. We run Mind Your Health programmes to bring basic health care to remote villages. We have built a hostel in remote Pangsha for children to have somewhere to stay when attending school far from home.
description: Using the past to benefit the future
